original: gang rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas zhi ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub dang nam mkha' la spyod pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub gzhan rnams la yang ster bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gang rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas zhi ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub dang nam mkha' la spyod pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub gzhan rnams la yang ster bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase whatever and so forth indicates that [the deity] will also grant other powers, such as the powers of pacification and so forth, and the power of moving through space and so forth.

original: da bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ral gri'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
analyzed: da bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ral gri'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase all tathāgatas and so forth indicates the summary of the absorption of the awareness holder of the sword.

original: rin chen rig pa 'dzin ba'i dngos grub ma bstan pa yar don gyis go bar bya ste /
analyzed: rin chen rig pa 'dzin ba'i dngos grub ma bstan pa yar don gyis go bar bya ste /
translated: The power of the awareness holder of the jewel is understood by implication.

original: rigs ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The family is the nature of the five tathāgatas.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub bshad nas ri lu'i sgo nas rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa so sor bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub bshad nas ri lu'i sgo nas rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa so sor bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
translated: Having explained the powers of the wheel awareness holder and so forth with the words thus and so forth, in order to individually demonstrate the stage of vajra repetition through the medium of the pill, [the Bhagavān] declares, one should practice the stage of vajra repetition.

original: yi ge aom nyid tsa na ka'i 'bras bu'i tshad tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyag rgya chen pho mngon du bya ba sngon du 'gro bas mgo bo dang lkog ma dang snying gar yi ge gsum bsams la de nyid yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas ba'i
analyzed: yi ge aom nyid tsa na ka'i 'bras bu'i tshad tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyag rgya chen pho mngon du bya ba sngon du 'gro bas mgo bo dang lkog ma dang snying gar yi ge gsum bsams la de nyid yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas ba'i
translated: The syllable OṀ is the size of a jujube fruit, etc.

original: rim pas ji srid sems rtse gcig par gyur pa de srid du bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rim pas ji srid sems rtse gcig par gyur pa de srid du bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Having first visualized the three syllables at the head, throat, and heart, one should meditate on them with the method of recitation without defecting the limbs, until the mind becomes one-pointed.

original: sa bon gyis bdag po'i gzugs su zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: sa bon gyis bdag po'i gzugs su zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
translated: The phrase “the form of the lord by the seed” is merely an illustration.

original: lha gsum dang khams gsum dang sku gsum dang ye shes gsum la sogs pa lhag par mos pa'i rnal 'byor gyis bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: lha gsum dang khams gsum dang sku gsum dang ye shes gsum la sogs pa lhag par mos pa'i rnal 'byor gyis bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should contemplate with the yoga of imagination of the three deities, the three realms, the three bodies, the three knowledges, etc.

original: gang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bzlas pa'i mthar phyag rgya chen po'i 'bras bu thob par bstan to //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bzlas pa'i mthar phyag rgya chen po'i 'bras bu thob par bstan to //
translated: The phrase “whatever” etc. teaches the attainment of the result of the Great Seal at the end of the recitation.

original: 'dir sa bon gyi yi ge phra ba yin pas na ri lu dang 'dra bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir sa bon gyi yi ge phra ba yin pas na ri lu dang 'dra bar bstan to //
translated: Here, the seed syllable is subtle, so it is taught to be like a pill.

original: de ni / phyag rgya chen po gzugs kyis kyang //
analyzed: de ni / phyag rgya chen po gzugs kyis kyang //
translated: That is, by the form of the great seal.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i phyag mtshan bstan nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i phyag mtshan bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the hand implements of the wheel holder and so forth, as previously explained, by the words “and so forth,”

original: de 'dzin par byed pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su gyur pa las 'byung ba'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: de 'dzin par byed pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su gyur pa las 'byung ba'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: he teaches the process of arising from the transformation of Vairocana and so forth, the body vajra holders of great vajradhara.

original: de bzhin nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pas snga ma bzhin du @47a * //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pas snga ma bzhin du @47a * //
translated: In reality and so forth, as before,

original: khyad par gyi gnas gzung ba sngon du 'gro bar yan lag bcu pa'i rnal 'byor gyi ting nge 'dzin gyis rdzogs pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su gyur pa las 'byung ba rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bsgoms te /
analyzed: khyad par gyi gnas gzung ba sngon du 'gro bar yan lag bcu pa'i rnal 'byor gyi ting nge 'dzin gyis rdzogs pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su gyur pa las 'byung ba rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bsgoms te /
translated: having first taken the special place, by the samadhi yoga of the ten branches, he meditates on Vairocana and so forth arising from the transformation of the perfect great vajradhara,

original: snga ma bzhin du mdun du bsgoms pa'i 'khor lo la sogs gzung bas 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i gzugs can du 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du mdun du bsgoms pa'i 'khor lo la sogs gzung bas 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i gzugs can du 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: and by taking the wheel and so forth that are meditated in front, as before, he becomes the form of the wheel holder and so forth.

original: ting nge 'dzin lnga po ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin lnga po ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: The five samadhis are easy to understand, so they are not explained.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bskyed pa rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i mi bskyod pa'i gzugs dmigs la /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bskyed pa rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i mi bskyod pa'i gzugs dmigs la /
translated: Thus, etc. indicates that one visualizes Akshobhya's form arisen from the transformation of Great Vajradhara generated by the first preparation samadhi.

original: khro bo'i rgyal po'i yig 'bru yongs su gyur pa las rtse gsum pa la sogs pa mdun du bskyed nas de'i rtags mthong ba sngon du 'gro bar 'dzin pas de'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po'i yig 'bru yongs su gyur pa las rtse gsum pa la sogs pa mdun du bskyed nas de'i rtags mthong ba sngon du 'gro bar 'dzin pas de'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Having generated the three-pronged vajra, etc. from the transformation of the syllable of the King of Wrath in front, one becomes a knowledge-holder of that by means of retention preceded by seeing its signs.

original: gang tha mal pa'i dngos po spangs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rim pa mthar phyin pas phyag rgya chen po yongs su 'gyur ba slob bzhin pas 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gang tha mal pa'i dngos po spangs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rim pa mthar phyin pas phyag rgya chen po yongs su 'gyur ba slob bzhin pas 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Having abandoned ordinary things, etc. indicates that one will accomplish the transformation of the great seal by one who is training in the perfection stage that has completed the generation stage.

original: theg pa chen po'i zhes pa ni sngags kyi theg pa chen po de'i dngos grub ni bshad ma thag pa ste zhes pa ni 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i zhes pa ni sngags kyi theg pa chen po de'i dngos grub ni bshad ma thag pa ste zhes pa ni 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The “mastery of the Great Vehicle” is the previously mentioned mastery of the Great Vehicle of Mantra, which is characterized by the wheel-holder’s awareness-holder, etc.

original: dngos grub sgrub pa'i thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnal 'byor pa'i bram ze'i rigs dang rgyal rigs dang rje'u rigs dang dmangs rigs las 'byung ba'i phyag rgya bzhi dang lhan cig spyod par bstan to //
analyzed: dngos grub sgrub pa'i thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnal 'byor pa'i bram ze'i rigs dang rgyal rigs dang rje'u rigs dang dmangs rigs las 'byung ba'i phyag rgya bzhi dang lhan cig spyod par bstan to //
translated: The “means of achieving mastery” and so on teach that the practitioner of Great Vajradhara Yoga should practice with the four mudras born from the brahmin, kṣatriya, vaiśya, and śūdra castes.

original: gcig pu nyid ni khyos ma blangs pa gzhon nu ma 'am smad 'tshod ma ste /
analyzed: gcig pu nyid ni khyos ma blangs pa gzhon nu ma 'am smad 'tshod ma ste /
translated: The “single” is a virgin or a prostitute who has not been taken by another.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnal 'byor pa la rjes su gnang ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnal 'byor pa la rjes su gnang ba'o //
translated: This is the permission for the practitioner of Great Vajradhara Yoga.

original: rab tu mnyam pa'i cha lugs 'dzin pa zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyang mthun pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rab tu mnyam pa'i cha lugs 'dzin pa zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyang mthun pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: “Having the same attire” means that the practitioners of Vairocana, etc., also have a compatible mudrā.

original: de rnams gdol pa la sogs pa'i bud med rnams zhes pa la sogs pa'i khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: de rnams gdol pa la sogs pa'i bud med rnams zhes pa la sogs pa'i khyad par bstan to //
translated: Those are the women of the candala class, etc.

original: rjes su myong ba zhes pa ni phyag rgya'i skye bo de rnams la rang gi rig pa yin pas 'od gsal bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su myong ba zhes pa ni phyag rgya'i skye bo de rnams la rang gi rig pa yin pas 'od gsal bar bya ba'o //
translated: The experience is the clear light, since it is one's own awareness with respect to those beings who are the seals.

original: snyoms par zhugs pa zhes pa ni rdo rje dang padma sbyor bas mtshon par 'gyur bas na snyoms par zhugs pa'i mtshan @47b nyid ni 'od gsal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa zhes pa ni rdo rje dang padma sbyor bas mtshon par 'gyur bas na snyoms par zhugs pa'i mtshan @47b nyid ni 'od gsal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of the union is the clear light, since it is indicated by the union of the vajra and lotus.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sgyu ma dag ni thams cad las //
analyzed: sgyu ma dag ni thams cad las //
translated: Among all the illusions,

original: bud med sgyu ma khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: bud med sgyu ma khyad par 'phags //
translated: the illusion of a woman is the best.

original: snang ba gsum gyis dbye ba ni //
analyzed: snang ba gsum gyis dbye ba ni //
translated: The division into three appearances

original: 'di nyid las ni mtshon par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di nyid las ni mtshon par 'gyur //
translated: is indicated just by this.

original: gang zhig rdo rje pad sbyor ba //
analyzed: gang zhig rdo rje pad sbyor ba //
translated: That which is the union of the vajra and lotus

original: kun rdzob kyis ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyis ni yod ma yin //
translated: does not exist by way of the conventional.

original: lhan cig tu yang nyams myong bas //
analyzed: lhan cig tu yang nyams myong bas //
translated: The experience of the union

original: rnal 'byor stobs kyis 'grub par 'gyur //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor stobs kyis 'grub par 'gyur //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: is accomplished by the power of yoga.

original: yul gzhan dag ces bya ba 'dis gdol ba la sogs pa'i bud med kyi yul du de kho na nyid sgrub par rigs so //
analyzed: yul gzhan dag ces bya ba 'dis gdol ba la sogs pa'i bud med kyi yul du de kho na nyid sgrub par rigs so //
translated: The phrase other objects indicates that it is appropriate to practice reality with the objects of outcaste women and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de rnams rigs ngan yin pas rtog pa med par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de rnams rigs ngan yin pas rtog pa med par 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because they are of low caste, they are without concepts.

original: gzhan ma rnams ni rtog pa dang ldan pa'i phyir de dang 'brel bas ye shes bskyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pas so //
analyzed: gzhan ma rnams ni rtog pa dang ldan pa'i phyir de dang 'brel bas ye shes bskyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pas so //
translated: The others, because they are conceptual, do not generate gnosis through their connection with that.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i sgra'i sgo nas de kho na nyid kyi don bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i sgra'i sgo nas de kho na nyid kyi don bstan pas so //
translated: The phrase intentional explanation is because the meaning of reality is taught through contradictory words.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnal 'byor pa'i rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa grub nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub par bstan par bya ba'i phyir sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid can no zhes pa la sogs pa ni mdor bstan to
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnal 'byor pa'i rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa grub nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub par bstan par bya ba'i phyir sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid can no zhes pa la sogs pa ni mdor bstan to
translated: Thus, having accomplished the perfection of one's own purpose as a yogin, in order to demonstrate the accomplishment of the perfection of others' purposes, the phrase the nature of the three beings and so on is a brief explanation.

original: // de nyid kyi sbyor ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni rgyas par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: // de nyid kyi sbyor ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni rgyas par bstan pa'o //
translated: In order to teach just that application, “one should summon” and so on is the extensive teaching.

original: yi ge yam las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas snod du rung ba'i skye ba'i skye bo bkug nas gdul bar bya zhes bstan pa dang / dbang gi skabs su yang bud med rnams dgug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: yi ge yam las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas snod du rung ba'i skye ba'i skye bo bkug nas gdul bar bya zhes bstan pa dang / dbang gi skabs su yang bud med rnams dgug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: By “arisen from the syllable yaṃ” and so on, having summoned the person to be born into a suitable birth, one should tame him, and also in the context of the rite of subjugation, one should summon the women, and so on.

original: lha mo rnams so zhes pa ni rgyal po'i btsun mo dang lha la sogs pa'i bu mo rnams so //
analyzed: lha mo rnams so zhes pa ni rgyal po'i btsun mo dang lha la sogs pa'i bu mo rnams so //
translated: The goddesses are the queens of kings and the daughters of gods and so on.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyis mtshan par gyur pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i gzugs dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas 'khor lo'i lcags kyu la sogs pa'i sgo nas bsgrub bya dgug pa bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyis mtshan par gyur pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i gzugs dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas 'khor lo'i lcags kyu la sogs pa'i sgo nas bsgrub bya dgug pa bstan to //
translated: By “marked with Vairocana” and so on, having visualized the form of Vairocana and so on, one should summon the victim by means of the wheel hook and so on.

original: gnod sbyin mo la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: gnod sbyin mo la sogs pa ste //
translated: The yakṣiṇī and so on are the yakṣiṇī and so on who are the wives of the yakṣa and so on.

original: zhes pa ni khams gsum pa za ba'i dam tshig gang la yod pa de ni gnod sbyin mo dang klu mo dang lha ma yin mo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni khams gsum pa za ba'i dam tshig gang la yod pa de ni gnod sbyin mo dang klu mo dang lha ma yin mo la sogs pa'o //
translated: That which has the pledge of eating the three realms is the Yakshini, the Nagini, the Asura woman, and so on.

original: de rnams kyi dgug pa ni zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i rim pas dgug pa zhes nye bar bsdus pa'o //🔽rnam pa thams cad ces pa la sogs @48a * //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dgug pa ni zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i rim pas dgug pa zhes nye bar bsdus pa'o // rnam pa thams cad ces pa la sogs @48a * //
translated: The summoning of those is the summary of the summoning by the previously explained process.

original: pas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bsgom pa mngon du bya ba sngon du 'gro bar bsgribs pa la sogs pa'i phyogs na gnas pa'i bsgrub bya lcags kyu dang zhags pa dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis gam du bkug nas dbang du bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: pas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bsgom pa mngon du bya ba sngon du 'gro bar bsgribs pa la sogs pa'i phyogs na gnas pa'i bsgrub bya lcags kyu dang zhags pa dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis gam du bkug nas dbang du bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The in all ways and so on indicates that one should summon the victim who is in the direction of the obstruction and so on, by the hook, the noose, and the wind mandala, and bring him into one's presence, having made the Great Vajradhara's meditation precede.

original: kyo ba la sogs pa rnams kyis blang bar bya ste zhes pa ni sogs pa'i sgras zhags pa dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor shes par bya'o //
analyzed: kyo ba la sogs pa rnams kyis blang bar bya ste zhes pa ni sogs pa'i sgras zhags pa dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor shes par bya'o //
translated: The one should take with the hook and so on is to be understood as the noose and the wind mandala by the word and so on.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir lcags kyus drangs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir lcags kyus drangs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: To indicate just that, it is taught having drawn with the hook and so on.

original: rgyas btab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'dra ba'i sgrub pa po la bya ba thams cad byed mi nus pa nyid bstan to //🔽bshad ma thag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyis bdag nyid du bsams la /
analyzed: rgyas btab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'dra ba'i sgrub pa po la bya ba thams cad byed mi nus pa nyid bstan to // bshad ma thag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyis bdag nyid du bsams la /
translated: The phrase seals and so forth teaches that one is unable to perform all actions as Vajrasattva.

original: 'od zer spro ba dang sngags bzlas pa dang ting nge 'dzin mngon du bya ba'i sgo nas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'od zer spro ba dang sngags bzlas pa dang ting nge 'dzin mngon du bya ba'i sgo nas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase the previously explained and so forth teaches that one should imagine oneself to be the nature of the three Tathagatas, Vairochana and so forth, by the stage of self-consecration, and that one becomes like Vairochana and so forth by means of the emanation of light rays, the recitation of mantras, and the realization of samadhi.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan par bsgom pa zhes pa ni mtshan dang dpe byad rnams kyis rnam par spras pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan par bsgom pa zhes pa ni mtshan dang dpe byad rnams kyis rnam par spras pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase one should meditate with the characteristics as taught means adorned with the major and minor marks.

original: sngags 'don pa'o zhes pa ni khro bo'i ngag gam rdo rje'i ngag gis sngags brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sngags 'don pa'o zhes pa ni khro bo'i ngag gam rdo rje'i ngag gis sngags brjod pa'o //
translated: The mantra is the recitation of the mantra with the wrathful voice, or the vajra voice.

original: lag par gnas pa'i zhes pa ni gam du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: lag par gnas pa'i zhes pa ni gam du gnas pa'o //
translated: The hand is the proximity.

original: bsgrub par bya ste zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin mo la sogs pa'o //🔽bzlas par bya ba sngags kyi don //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ste zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin mo la sogs pa'o // bzlas par bya ba sngags kyi don //
translated: The to be accomplished is the yakṣiṇī, etc.

original: zhes pa ni rang gi sngags dang yi ge las mthun pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang gi sngags dang yi ge las mthun pa'o //
translated: The mantra meaning is the mantra and the syllable that is in accord with the rite.

original: bsams na ni yid kyis bsams pa'o //
analyzed: bsams na ni yid kyis bsams pa'o //
translated: The thought is the mental thought.

original: rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yongs su shes nas 'di dag thams cad bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yongs su shes nas 'di dag thams cad bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The form and so forth indicate that having understood the nature of Vairocana, etc., all of this should be accomplished.

original: sku'i rang bzhin mi shes pas rang gi don yang 'grub par mi 'gyur gyi 'jig rten pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes smos ci dgos /
analyzed: sku'i rang bzhin mi shes pas rang gi don yang 'grub par mi 'gyur gyi 'jig rten pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes smos ci dgos /
translated: Since one does not know the nature of the body, one will not accomplish even one's own aim, let alone the mundane and supramundane accomplishments.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin yongs su shes pa nyid kyi mchod pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin yongs su shes pa nyid kyi mchod pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that the offering is the thorough knowledge of reality itself, and not anything else.

original: mchod pas mchod nas zhes pa ni //🔽dngos med go 'phang la goms pas //
analyzed: mchod pas mchod nas zhes pa ni // dngos med go 'phang la goms pas //
translated: Having worshipped with offerings,

original: lha yi gzugs ni bsgom pa ste //🔽sangs rgyas @48b thams cad rab mnyes pa //
analyzed: lha yi gzugs ni bsgom pa ste // sangs rgyas @48b thams cad rab mnyes pa //
translated: one should meditate on the deity’s form🔽through familiarity with the state of non-entityness.

original: des ni mchod pa chen por 'dod //
analyzed: des ni mchod pa chen por 'dod //
translated: That is considered the great offering

original: ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo //
translated: to all the Buddhas.

original: de lta bu'i rnal 'byor pas bshad ma thag du sbyor ba'i zhes pa ni dgug pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnal 'byor pas bshad ma thag du sbyor ba'i zhes pa ni dgug pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The yogī/nī who is like that, as just explained, should accomplish the summoning, which is the application.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang 'brel ba zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang chen pos gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang 'brel ba zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang chen pos gsungs pa'o //
translated: The one connected with all the Tathāgatas is the one who is the nature of all the Tathāgatas, Great Vajradhara.

original: sba bar bya ba dang zhes pa ni bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul la brten pa'o //
analyzed: sba bar bya ba dang zhes pa ni bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul la brten pa'o //
translated: The one to be concealed is the one who is based on the mode of action, and so on.

original: mchog tu gyur pa ni sbyor ba gzhan la ltos nas khyad par ro //
analyzed: mchog tu gyur pa ni sbyor ba gzhan la ltos nas khyad par ro //
translated: The supreme one is the special one in dependence on other applications.

original: bsdus par gyur pa zhes pa ni lha la sogs pa 'gugs par byed pas so //
analyzed: bsdus par gyur pa zhes pa ni lha la sogs pa 'gugs par byed pas so //
translated: The phrase having been gathered means that the gods and so forth are summoned.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa zhes pa ni nges par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa zhes pa ni nges par bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the phrase not to be transgressed by the yogī of Vairochana and so forth means that it is to be ascertained.

original: sdud pa po'i tshig ces bya ba la sogs pas dgug pa'i rab tu byed pa nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
analyzed: sdud pa po'i tshig ces bya ba la sogs pas dgug pa'i rab tu byed pa nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase the words of the compiler and so forth teach the summary of the chapter on summoning.

original: mi ste ni srog chags thams cad kyi mchog yin pas so //
analyzed: mi ste ni srog chags thams cad kyi mchog yin pas so //
translated: A human is the best of all living beings.

original: de rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni dpal rdo rje bdud rtsi las gsungs pa'i ro langs kyi cho ga'i sgo nas de nyid kyi rang gi lag pas sbyin par zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni dpal rdo rje bdud rtsi las gsungs pa'i ro langs kyi cho ga'i sgo nas de nyid kyi rang gi lag pas sbyin par zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase of them means that one should give with one's own hand, by means of the rite of the zombie taught in the glorious Vajra Amṛta.

original: de yang mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas sngar bshad pa'i khro bo'i rgyal po'i gtor ma'i cho gas khro bo rnams la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas sngar bshad pa'i khro bo'i rgyal po'i gtor ma'i cho gas khro bo rnams la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the yogī of Akṣhobhya should give to the wrathful ones by means of the rite of the bali offering of the King of Wrath, as previously explained.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that, it is said:

original: shi ba'i ro las byung bas na //
analyzed: shi ba'i ro las byung bas na //
translated: Because it arises from a dead body,

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //
translated: it is called 'zombie.'

original: gtor ma'i cho ga 'dis mkha' la spyod pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtor ma'i cho ga 'dis mkha' la spyod pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this rite of the sacrificial offering, one attains the power of moving through space.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that,

original: rang gi lus bsgrub par byas nas nam mkha' la gnas par thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rang gi lus bsgrub par byas nas nam mkha' la gnas par thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: having accomplished one's own body, one attains the power of moving through space.

original: de yang kha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtor ma'i cho ga bstan te de yang sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de yang kha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtor ma'i cho ga bstan te de yang sngar bshad zin to //
translated: And that is taught by without fault, etc., demonstrating the rite of the sacrificial offering, which has already been explained.

original: sha chen zhes bya ba la sogs pas lcags kyu lnga dang bdud rtsi lnga 'dres par byas nas sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs la khro bo'i rgyal po rnams la gtor ma byin na rig pa 'dzin pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sha chen zhes bya ba la sogs pas lcags kyu lnga dang bdud rtsi lnga 'dres par byas nas sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs la khro bo'i rgyal po rnams la gtor ma byin na rig pa 'dzin pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Great meat, etc., demonstrates that having mixed the five hooks with the five ambrosias, having empowered them with the mantra, and having offered the sacrificial offering to the kings of wrathful ones, one attains the power of the knowledge-holders.

original: glang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas glang po dang rta dang ba lang dang khyi'i sha sngar bshad pa'i rim pas blangs la sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas sbyang zhing rigs pa dang mthun pa'i khro bo'i rgyal po rnams la gtor ma byin nas mngon par shes
analyzed: glang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas glang po dang rta dang ba lang dang khyi'i sha sngar bshad pa'i rim pas blangs la sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas sbyang zhing rigs pa dang mthun pa'i khro bo'i rgyal po rnams la gtor ma byin nas mngon par shes
translated: Having taken the flesh of the elephant, horse, cow, and dog, as explained previously, with the mantra and mudra sequence, one should purify them, and having offered the sacrificial cake to the wrathful kings in accordance with their type, one will attain the five superknowledges, invisibility, the summoning of kings, and so on, and the power of space-traveling.

original: @49a * // pa lnga dang mi snang ba dang rgyal po la sogs pa dgug pa dang mkha' spyod kyi dngos grub rnams thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @49a * // pa lnga dang mi snang ba dang rgyal po la sogs pa dgug pa dang mkha' spyod kyi dngos grub rnams thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having taken the flesh of the elephant, horse, cow, and dog, as explained previously, with the mantra and mudra sequence, one should purify them, and having offered the sacrificial cake to the wrathful kings in accordance with their type, one will attain the five superknowledges, invisibility, the summoning of kings, and so on, and the power of space-traveling.

original: kha na ma tho ba'i sha med na zhes bya ba la sogs pas cho ga gzhan yang bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba'i sha med na zhes bya ba la sogs pas cho ga gzhan yang bstan par bya ste /
translated: If there is no flesh free from fault, one should perform another rite, as stated by one should perform another rite, etc.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis de ma thag tu bshad pa'i bag phye la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis mi la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan byas la mdun du gzhag ste /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis de ma thag tu bshad pa'i bag phye la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis mi la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan byas la mdun du gzhag ste /
translated: Yogis of Vairocana and so on should make an image of a human, etc., with the nature of flour, etc., as just explained, and place it in front of them.

original: ro langs kyi cho gas blangs te de rnams kyi srog dang bsgrub bya'i srog gcig tu byas te /
analyzed: ro langs kyi cho gas blangs te de rnams kyi srog dang bsgrub bya'i srog gcig tu byas te /
translated: Having taken them with the rite of the zombie, one makes their life and the life of the victim into one.

original: rang 'pho ba'i rim pas srog dang bral bar gyur par bsams la /
analyzed: rang 'pho ba'i rim pas srog dang bral bar gyur par bsams la /
translated: Having imagined that they are deprived of life by the process of one's own transference,

original: de'i yan lag gis sngar bshad pa'i khro bo la dbul ba'i cho gas khro bo'i rgyal po la gtor ma byin nas mkha' spyod la sogs pa'i dngos grub bsgrub par bya ba'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i yan lag gis sngar bshad pa'i khro bo la dbul ba'i cho gas khro bo'i rgyal po la gtor ma byin nas mkha' spyod la sogs pa'i dngos grub bsgrub par bya ba'o zhes bstan to //
translated: one should offer the victim to the wrathful king by the rite of offering explained above, and should accomplish the powers of the sky-farer, etc.

original: rdo rje sbyor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub thob par bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje sbyor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub thob par bstan to //
translated: By the vajra union, etc., one should attain the powers as desired.

original: lus rgyas par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa bskyed pa'i rim pas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bsgom pa mngon du byas la rang gi spyi bor yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje sems dpa'i sku rang gi phyag rgya dang snyoms par
analyzed: lus rgyas par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa bskyed pa'i rim pas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bsgom pa mngon du byas la rang gi spyi bor yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje sems dpa'i sku rang gi phyag rgya dang snyoms par
translated: For the sake of increasing the body, etc., one should manifest the meditation of Great Vajradhara by the creation stage, and on one's head, from the transformation of the syllable hūṃ, the body of Vajrasattva, in union with one's own consort,

original: zhugs pa'i dbang gis bdud rtsi'i rgyun 'dzag par byed par bsams la /
analyzed: zhugs pa'i dbang gis bdud rtsi'i rgyun 'dzag par byed par bsams la /
translated: Imagine that the stream of elixir descends through the force of your supplication.

original: de'i rgyun rgyu bas sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi rang gi lus rtsa kun la spyod pa'i rim pas tshim par gyur par bsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i rgyun rgyu bas sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi rang gi lus rtsa kun la spyod pa'i rim pas tshim par gyur par bsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The stream of nectar is caused to flow by the power of the descent, and is imagined to flow through the channels of one's own body, which is the nature of the three beings, and to satisfy it in stages.

original: ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin pas ye shes kyang de yin la mi phyed pas rdo rje yang yin te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin pas ye shes kyang de yin la mi phyed pas rdo rje yang yin te /
translated: It is the vajra of intuition because it is intuition and indivisible.

original: ye shes rdo rje ni byang chub kyi sems te khams mtha' ma'o //
analyzed: ye shes rdo rje ni byang chub kyi sems te khams mtha' ma'o //
translated: The vajra of intuition is the bodhicitta, the final element.

original: tshim par ni spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshim par ni spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
translated: The summary is stated by satisfaction and so forth.

original: de ni las kyi rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: de ni las kyi rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: That is one part of the samadhi of the supreme king of actions.

original: rigs kyi dbye bas zhes bya ba la sogs pas bza' ba'i bya ba bstan pas las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi phyogs gcig bstan to //
analyzed: rigs kyi dbye bas zhes bya ba la sogs pas bza' ba'i bya ba bstan pas las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi phyogs gcig bstan to //
translated: The one part of the supreme king of actions is taught by the statement of the action of eating, which begins by the division of the families and so forth.

original: rigs lnga'i rnal 'byor pa rnams so zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sgrub pa po rnams so //
analyzed: rigs lnga'i rnal 'byor pa rnams so zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sgrub pa po rnams so //
translated: The yogis of the five clans means the adepts of Vairochana and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi nang na thugs kyi rigs mchog yin pas mchog ni mi bskyod pa'i rigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi nang na thugs kyi rigs mchog yin pas mchog ni mi bskyod pa'i rigs zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, the clan of Akshobhya is supreme, since it is the supreme clan of mind.

original: der gnas @49b nas zhes pa ni rnal 'byor de la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: der gnas @49b nas zhes pa ni rnal 'byor de la gnas pa'o //
translated: Having dwelt there means having dwelt in that yoga.

original: h'um zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa las lcer bsgoms la /
analyzed: h'um zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa las lcer bsgoms la /
translated: With the words “hum” and so forth, the yogi of Akshobhya should meditate on the letter hum on his tongue,🔽and on top of that, he should visualize a subtle vajra, which is the transformation of the white-colored letter hum.

original: de'i steng du kha dog dkar po'i yi ge h'um yongs su gyur ba las phra mo'i rdo rje rnam par bsams la sgrub thabs las bshad pa'i rim pas lag pa la dgod pa lkog ma dag pa sngon du 'gro bar bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa
analyzed: de'i steng du kha dog dkar po'i yi ge h'um yongs su gyur ba las phra mo'i rdo rje rnam par bsams la sgrub thabs las bshad pa'i rim pas lag pa la dgod pa lkog ma dag pa sngon du 'gro bar bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa
translated: Then, following the procedure explained in the sadhana, he should place it on his hand, and with the purification of the throat, he should eat and drink and so forth.

original: khyad par bya'o zhes nang gi bdag nyid kyi sbyin sreg gi cho ga bstan pa dang / de bzhin du 'od dpag tu med pa'i dang rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pa dag gis rang rang gi yig 'bru yongs su gyur pa las bskyed pa'i lce la yi ge a'a: dang /
analyzed: khyad par bya'o zhes nang gi bdag nyid kyi sbyin sreg gi cho ga bstan pa dang / de bzhin du 'od dpag tu med pa'i dang rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pa dag gis rang rang gi yig 'bru yongs su gyur pa las bskyed pa'i lce la yi ge a'a: dang /
translated: Likewise, the yogis of Amitābha and Vairocana, having transformed their own seed syllables, generate the letter Aḥ and Oṃ on the tongue,

original: aom yongs su gyur pa las padma dang 'khor lo snga ma bzhin du bkod la /
analyzed: aom yongs su gyur pa las padma dang 'khor lo snga ma bzhin du bkod la /
translated: as before, and arrange the lotus and wheel as before.

original: bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin spyod par bshad do //
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin spyod par bshad do //
translated: It is explained that one should enjoy food and drink, etc., as before.

original: zas su byas pa'i sbyor bas ni //
analyzed: zas su byas pa'i sbyor bas ni //
translated: By the yoga of making that one's food,

original: zhes bya ba la nang gi bdag nyid kyi sbyin sreg cho ga'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la nang gi bdag nyid kyi sbyin sreg cho ga'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: by the characteristics of the inner fire sacrifice.

original: lus la sogs pa'i shin tu sbyangs pa thob nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas lus dang ngag dang sems kyi bde ba thob nas rim gyis rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom pas /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i shin tu sbyangs pa thob nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas lus dang ngag dang sems kyi bde ba thob nas rim gyis rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom pas /
translated: Having attained the pliancy of body, etc., having attained the bliss of body, speech, and mind, one should gradually cultivate the stage of completion.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'o zhes ston to //
translated: One becomes like Great Vajradhara.

original: bdud rtsir byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshim par bya ba dang bza' ba'i cho ga nye bar bsdu pa bstan to //
analyzed: bdud rtsir byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshim par bya ba dang bza' ba'i cho ga nye bar bsdu pa bstan to //
translated: Having made it nectar, etc. , teaches the ritual of satisfaction and eating.

original: 'di yang las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs gcig bstan to //
analyzed: 'di yang las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs gcig bstan to //
translated: This also teaches a part of the karma-aja-raja-agra-samadhi.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs gcig tu gyur pa las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin so sor bstan pas so //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs gcig tu gyur pa las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin so sor bstan pas so //
translated: The phrase just as the words means that by teaching the karma-aja-raja-agra-samadhi as a part of the creation stage, it is taught individually.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i bya ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas zhi ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub bstan nas //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i bya ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas zhi ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub bstan nas //
translated: The phrase the yogi's activity, etc. , teaches the powers of pacification, etc. , through the wheel-vidyadhara, etc.

original: gang gi tshe go rims dang de rnams kyis rdzogs pa'i rim pa rtogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe go rims dang de rnams kyis rdzogs pa'i rim pa rtogs par 'gyur na /
translated: When one understands the sequence and those,

original: de'i tshe rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa de rnams kyis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub sgrub pa'i phyir thabs ni rgyu ste lam du bstan to //
analyzed: de'i tshe rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa de rnams kyis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub sgrub pa'i phyir thabs ni rgyu ste lam du bstan to //
translated: At that time, for those abiding in the completion stage, the method is taught as the cause, i.e., the path, for the sake of accomplishing the Great Seal.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs te zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum mo //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs te zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum mo //
translated: Body, speech, and mind are the three intuitions of appearance, etc.

original: de gang du mnyam par thim par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma @50a * //
analyzed: de gang du mnyam par thim par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma @50a * //
translated: Where they become equally dissolved is in the single moment

original: gcig gis mi snang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gcig gis mi snang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: of invisibility.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba ste rim pa gnyis pa dang bzhi bdag gis thob par bya ba'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba ste rim pa gnyis pa dang bzhi bdag gis thob par bya ba'o //
translated: Ultimate reality is clearlight transparency, to be attained by the second and fourth stages.

original: de nyid 'jig rten gyi dngos grub la ltos pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rang bzhin te grub mchog go zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'jig rten gyi dngos grub la ltos pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rang bzhin te grub mchog go zhes pa'o //
translated: That itself is of a supramundane nature, i.e., the supreme feat, in view of its being the mundane feat.

original: der ni mtshon pa'i bdun pa'o //
analyzed: der ni mtshon pa'i bdun pa'o //
translated: There is the seventh case ending.

original: des na 'od gsal ba thob par gyur nas snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pa 'am ci gcar du rdo rje'i sku'am ye shes kyi sku byung ba gang yin pa de ni chos dang longs spyod dang sprul pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: des na 'od gsal ba thob par gyur nas snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pa 'am ci gcar du rdo rje'i sku'am ye shes kyi sku byung ba gang yin pa de ni chos dang longs spyod dang sprul pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, having attained the clear light, whatever arises as the vajra body or gnosis body in the process of attaining the radiant light and so forth, that is called the characteristic of the dharmakāya, the saṃbhogakāya, and the nirmāṇakāya.

original: de nyid mi phyed pas na rdo rje ste rnal 'byor pa gang gis bsgom pa de ni rdo rje 'chang chen por 'gyur ro zhes phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid mi phyed pas na rdo rje ste rnal 'byor pa gang gis bsgom pa de ni rdo rje 'chang chen por 'gyur ro zhes phan yon bstan to //
translated: Since that is indivisible, it is the vajra. The yogin who meditates on that becomes Mahāvajradhara. Thus the benefits are taught.

original: des sems la dmigs pa dang bdag la byin gyis brlab pa dang mngon par byang chub pa dang zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa rnams bstan to //
analyzed: des sems la dmigs pa dang bdag la byin gyis brlab pa dang mngon par byang chub pa dang zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa rnams bstan to //
translated: By that, the mental focus, the self-consecration, the manifest enlightenment, and the stage of union are taught.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa de kho na nyid thob pa'i rnal 'byor pas cho 'phrul thob par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa de kho na nyid thob pa'i rnal 'byor pas cho 'phrul thob par bstan to //
translated: Thus, etc. teaches that the yogin who has attained reality attains the magical powers.

original: phyogs bcu na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad ces pa ni dngos grub thob pa'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i nang na'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad ces pa ni dngos grub thob pa'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i nang na'o //
translated: All sentient beings dwelling in the ten directions refers to the inner circle of the adepts who have attained powers.

original: yid bzhin nor bu rgyal mtshan 'gyur bas na zhes pa ni bsam pa thams cad rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid bzhin nor bu rgyal mtshan 'gyur bas na zhes pa ni bsam pa thams cad rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The wish-fulfilling gem is the victory banner, since it fulfills all wishes.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par smin pa'i sku dang ldan pas rdo rje'i sku zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par smin pa'i sku dang ldan pas rdo rje'i sku zhes pa'o //
translated: Similarly, since he possesses the supramundane body of maturation, he is the vajra body.

original: snang bar byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas zla ba dang nyi ma'i 'od las lhag par gzi brjid dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: snang bar byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas zla ba dang nyi ma'i 'od las lhag par gzi brjid dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: By “illuminator” and so forth, it is taught that he becomes endowed with splendor surpassing the light of the moon and sun.

original: de ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i dngos grub yin no //
analyzed: de ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i dngos grub yin no //
translated: This is the attainment of Great Vajradhara.

original: rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pas de kho na nyid thob pa'i bdag nyid kyi che ba bstan pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub thob nas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i sku gsung thugs dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pas de kho na nyid thob pa'i bdag nyid kyi che ba bstan pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub thob nas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i sku gsung thugs dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: By “Vairochana” and so forth, it is taught that the greatness of attaining reality itself is taught, and that having attained the attainments of the wheel-holders such as Vairochana and so forth, one becomes endowed with a body, speech, and mind similar to Vairochana and so forth.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i dngos po thams cad ni rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i sku rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgom pa gang yin pa rgyu de rnams kyis bsgrubs pa ni rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i dngos po thams cad ni rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i sku rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgom pa gang yin pa rgyu de rnams kyis bsgrubs pa ni rdzogs pa'o //
translated: All the things just mentioned are the accomplishment of the perfection of the body of the knowledge-holder, etc.

original: gang+g'a'i klung gi bya ba la sogs pas cho 'phrul gyi dbang gis khams gsum pa mnan par bstan to //
analyzed: gang+g'a'i klung gi bya ba la sogs pas cho 'phrul gyi dbang gis khams gsum pa mnan par bstan to //
translated: The subjugation of the three worlds by the power of the miracle of the Ganges-river sand, etc., is shown.

original: mkha' 'gro ma @50b dang mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa'i dam tshig ces pa ni phyi rol gyi mu stegs pa la sogs pa'i dam tshig rnams so //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma @50b dang mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa'i dam tshig ces pa ni phyi rol gyi mu stegs pa la sogs pa'i dam tshig rnams so //
translated: The commitments of the dakinis, dakas, etc., are the commitments of the outsiders, the tirthikas, etc.🔽Since they do not have the view of self, etc., they are their commitments.

original: de rnams kyis bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir de rnams kyi dam ba'o zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam tshig ste bsrung bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir de rnams kyi dam ba'o zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam tshig ste bsrung bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of those is the commitment of the Tathagatas, which is to be guarded, eaten, etc.

original: de rnams kyi sgrub pa'i zhes pa ni de rnams sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sgrub pa'i zhes pa ni de rnams sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of those is the accomplishment of those.

original: sngags zhes pa ni yig 'bru 'am phyung ba'i sngags rnams so //
analyzed: sngags zhes pa ni yig 'bru 'am phyung ba'i sngags rnams so //
translated: The “mantras” are the seed syllables or the mantras that are uttered.🔽“

original: de 'dzin par byed pas ni rig pa 'dzin pa ste zhes pa 'dis so sor rig pa thob pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de 'dzin par byed pas ni rig pa 'dzin pa ste zhes pa 'dis so sor rig pa thob pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: By holding them” means “by the knowledge holders.” This teaches the attainment of the state of an awareness holder.🔽“

original: de rnams kyi yang gtso bor 'gyur ba'o zhes pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mkha' 'gro dang mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi bdag por 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi yang gtso bor 'gyur ba'o zhes pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mkha' 'gro dang mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi bdag por 'gyur te /
translated: And becomes the chief of them” means that one becomes the lord of the ḍākas and ḍākinīs, both mundane and supramundane.

original: ston pa yin pa dang sprul par mdzad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa yin pa dang sprul par mdzad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one becomes the teacher and the emanator.

original: rdo rje'i sku ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyi dang nang gi mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur na phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ba dang / de thob pas lus la sogs pa mi snang bas mi mngon pa'i mtshan nyid kyi cho 'phrul 'byung ba dang rang gi 'od kyis stong gsum la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar 'gyur ba dang ji srid de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yang phun sum
analyzed: rdo rje'i sku ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyi dang nang gi mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur na phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ba dang / de thob pas lus la sogs pa mi snang bas mi mngon pa'i mtshan nyid kyi cho 'phrul 'byung ba dang rang gi 'od kyis stong gsum la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar 'gyur ba dang ji srid de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yang phun sum
translated: The vajra body and so on refers to the attainment of the spiritual powers of the dakinis and so on of the outer and inner mandalas, the attainment of the spiritual powers of the great seal, the arising of the magical display of the nature of invisibility through the nonappearance of the body and so on, the illumination of the trichiliocosm and so on by one's light, and the perfection of all tathagatas.

original: tshogs pa ni bdag nyid che ba'i nus pa le'u bcu pa nas gsungs pa'i snying po bskul ba'i rim pas 'phrog par byed pa dang / de bzhin du brgya byin la sogs pa lha'i mchog gdul bar bya ba'i phyir de rnams kyi btsun mo stobs kyis bkug nas spyod pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i rim pas rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i ngo bor byed pa'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: tshogs pa ni bdag nyid che ba'i nus pa le'u bcu pa nas gsungs pa'i snying po bskul ba'i rim pas 'phrog par byed pa dang / de bzhin du brgya byin la sogs pa lha'i mchog gdul bar bya ba'i phyir de rnams kyi btsun mo stobs kyis bkug nas spyod pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i rim pas rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i ngo bor byed pa'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The assembly is the great self-power, which is the process of summoning the essence taught in the tenth chapter, and likewise, in order to tame the supreme gods such as Indra, having summoned their queens by force, one engages in conduct and through the process of meditative equipoise, one makes them into the essence of Vajrayoginī.

original: gang+g'a'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lha'i mig gis yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal ba'i dngos po mthong bar bstan to //
analyzed: gang+g'a'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lha'i mig gis yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal ba'i dngos po mthong bar bstan to //
translated: The divine eye is taught by “Gaṅgā” and so on, seeing objects, time, and things that are obscured by nature.

original: gang+g'a'i klung gi zhes bya ba la sogs pas lha'i rna ba'i dngos grub thob pa bstan to //
analyzed: gang+g'a'i klung gi zhes bya ba la sogs pas lha'i rna ba'i dngos grub thob pa bstan to //
translated: The divine ear is taught by “Gaṅgā’s sands” and so on.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ba la sogs pas pha rol gyi sems shes pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ba la sogs pas pha rol gyi sems shes pa nyid bstan to //
translated: The knowledge of the minds of others is taught by “world systems” and so on.

original: rang bzhin brgya drug cu'i rgyur gyur pa zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sems las byung ba dang ldan ba pha rol gyi rnam par shes pa gsum shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin brgya drug cu'i rgyur gyur pa zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sems las byung ba dang ldan ba pha rol gyi rnam par shes pa gsum shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: The statement “the cause of the one hundred and sixty natural instincts” means that one comes to know the three consciousnesses of the other person, who possesses the mental factors of attachment and so on.

original: @51a * // dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'jig rten sna tshogs las byung zhes bya ba'i rigs pas bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro'i rang bzhin gyi 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba dang 'chi 'pho dang skye ba la sogs pa 'das pa'i
analyzed: @51a * // dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'jig rten sna tshogs las byung zhes bya ba'i rigs pas bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro'i rang bzhin gyi 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba dang 'chi 'pho dang skye ba la sogs pa 'das pa'i
translated: The statement “by the power of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma” and so on explains the reasoning of the origin of the variety of worlds, which is the arising of cyclic existence, which has the nature of the five transmigrations of the happy and miserable destinies, and birth and death and so on.

original: zhag gsum dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba'i shin tu nye ba'i dus kyi dpes sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhag gsum dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba'i shin tu nye ba'i dus kyi dpes sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa bstan to //
translated: The statement “like three days” explains the recollection of past lives by means of the example of a very short period of time.

original: gang+g'a'i klung zhes bya ba la sogs pas rigs lnga'i rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa spros pas tshad med cing grangs med pa'i bskal pa la gnas te 'gro ba'i don byed pa zhes bya ba 'dis cho 'phrul bstan to //
analyzed: gang+g'a'i klung zhes bya ba la sogs pas rigs lnga'i rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa spros pas tshad med cing grangs med pa'i bskal pa la gnas te 'gro ba'i don byed pa zhes bya ba 'dis cho 'phrul bstan to //
translated: By the Ganges river and so forth, he emits the Tathagatas, which are the nature of the five clans, and abides for immeasurable and countless eons, performing the welfare of transmigrators. This is called the miracle.

original: 'od gsal ba'i 'brel pa dang ldan pas rdo rje cho 'phrul mchog dang ldan no zhes bya ba 'dis zag pa zad pa zhes bya ba mngon par shes pa drug pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i 'brel pa dang ldan pas rdo rje cho 'phrul mchog dang ldan no zhes bya ba 'dis zag pa zad pa zhes bya ba mngon par shes pa drug pa bstan to //
translated: By endowed with the supreme miracle of the vajra, he is endowed with the connection to clear light. This is called the extinction of defilements, and it teaches the sixth superknowledge.

original: rdo rje spyan zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur na lha'i mig la sogs pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje spyan zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur na lha'i mig la sogs pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: By the vajra eye and so forth, it teaches that if one realizes the reality of clear light, one will attain the divine eye and so forth.

original: 'di dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtsis med cing tshad med pa'i sems can gyi las la rtsol ba dang ldan pas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to /
analyzed: 'di dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtsis med cing tshad med pa'i sems can gyi las la rtsol ba dang ldan pas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to /
translated: By these and so forth, it teaches the perfection of the welfare of others, by being endowed with the effort of immeasurable and incalculable sentient beings' karma.

original: gang+g'a zhes bya ba la sogs pas grangs las 'das pa pho nya dang pho nya mo dang bran dang bran mo dang bka' nyan dang bka' nyan mo la sogs pa mchod pa'i yo byad du ma dang ldan pas yongs su bskor zhing mdun du byas pas chos bstan
analyzed: gang+g'a zhes bya ba la sogs pas grangs las 'das pa pho nya dang pho nya mo dang bran dang bran mo dang bka' nyan dang bka' nyan mo la sogs pa mchod pa'i yo byad du ma dang ldan pas yongs su bskor zhing mdun du byas pas chos bstan
translated: The words “Ganges” and so on indicate that he is surrounded and attended by countless messengers, male and female, and servants, male and female, and obedient ones, male and female, and so on, who are endowed with many articles of worship.

original: pa'i sgo nas mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: pa'i sgo nas mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: He is said to dwell in infinite world systems by means of teaching the Dharma.

original: 'bras bu'i phyogs gcig ces pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /🔽gzhan dag kyang gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i mkhyen pa'i stobs la sogs pa'i stobs bcu dang sa bcu dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang dbang dang so so yang dag par rig pa dang gzugs dang rnam par thar pa dang mi 'jigs pa dang ma 'dres pa'i
analyzed: 'bras bu'i phyogs gcig ces pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te / gzhan dag kyang gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i mkhyen pa'i stobs la sogs pa'i stobs bcu dang sa bcu dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang dbang dang so so yang dag par rig pa dang gzugs dang rnam par thar pa dang mi 'jigs pa dang ma 'dres pa'i
translated: One part of the result is mentioned here only as an illustration.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that he is endowed with the other parts of the result, such as the ten powers, the ten masteries, the ten levels, the perfections, the controlling powers, the correct understandings, the forms, the liberations, the fearlessnesses, the unentangled qualities, and the major and minor marks of a buddha.

original: bzhugs pa'i tshig ces bya ba la sogs pas gleng gzhi'i tshig nas brtsams te le'u bcu gnyis pa'i tha mal pa'i bsgrub pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa dang mchog gi rdzogs pa'i rim pa so sor bstan pa ni ji ltar 'byung ba bshad nas bskyed pa'i rim pa
analyzed: bzhugs pa'i tshig ces bya ba la sogs pas gleng gzhi'i tshig nas brtsams te le'u bcu gnyis pa'i tha mal pa'i bsgrub pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa dang mchog gi rdzogs pa'i rim pa so sor bstan pa ni ji ltar 'byung ba bshad nas bskyed pa'i rim pa
translated: The words abiding and so forth, beginning from the nidana, up to the end of the twelfth chapter, explain the arising of the teachings on the ordinary and supreme siddhis, which are taught as the generation and perfection stages, respectively.🔽 The generation stage

original: ni ting nge 'dzin gsum gtso @51b bor gyur pa bsgrub pa ni sku bsgrub pa'i don du yan lag ni bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yan lag bzhi yang gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ni rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: ni ting nge 'dzin gsum gtso @51b bor gyur pa bsgrub pa ni sku bsgrub pa'i don du yan lag ni bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yan lag bzhi yang gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ni rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir bstan par bya ste /
translated: is taught in order to clarify the four branches of the approach and so forth, which are the means of accomplishing the body, the main practice of the three samadhis.

original: bsnyen cing dmigs par bya ba yin pas na zhes pa ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen cing dmigs par bya ba yin pas na zhes pa ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The approach is so called because it is to be approached and visualized. This is the brief explanation.

original: de la bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te ;
analyzed: de la bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te ;
translated: The summarized meaning of this is as follows.

original: snying rje chen po bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bar gnas gzung ba dang bgegs bskrad pa dang / stong pa nyid bsgom pa dang ye shes kyi sa gzhi bsgom pa dang gzhal yas khang pa bskyed pa dang lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa dang /
analyzed: snying rje chen po bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bar gnas gzung ba dang bgegs bskrad pa dang / stong pa nyid bsgom pa dang ye shes kyi sa gzhi bsgom pa dang gzhal yas khang pa bskyed pa dang lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa dang /
translated: The approach is the meditation on great compassion, the preliminary; the retention of the site, the expulsion of obstructors, the meditation on emptiness, the meditation on the ground of pristine consciousness, the generation of the immeasurable palace, and the meditation on the mandala of resolute interest.

original: don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa ste bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa ste bsnyen pa'o //
translated: The ultimate mandala is the approach.

original: de nas yig 'bru dgod pa dang de yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma dang zla ba dang padma bsgom pa dang yi ge gsum dgod pa dang / de yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / de la nyi ma la sogs pa zhugs pa dang de'i steng du yig 'bru dgod pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de nas yig 'bru dgod pa dang de yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma dang zla ba dang padma bsgom pa dang yi ge gsum dgod pa dang / de yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / de la nyi ma la sogs pa zhugs pa dang de'i steng du yig 'bru dgod pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Then, the placement of the seed syllable, the meditation on the sun, moon, and lotus from the complete transformation of that, the placement of the three syllables, and the complete transformation of that into the moon mandala, the entry of the sun, and so on, into that, and the placement of the seed syllable upon that are called the near accomplishment.

original: sa bon yongs su gyur pa las phyag mtshan bsgom pa dang / de yongs su gyur pa las sku rdzogs pa dang / ye shes sems dpa' dang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' bsgom pa dang phung po dang khams dang skye mched byin gyis brlab pa sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa zhes pa ni bsgrub pa ste dang po sbyor ba'o //🔽phyag rgya legs par sbyangs pa dang rdo rje dang padma snyoms par zhugs pa dang / rjes su chags pa dang mchod pa dang badzra dhrika ces bya ba la sogs pas phyung ba'i sngags kyis mi bskyod pa la sogs pa spro ba dang de rnams kyis kyang 'gro ba'i don bya ba dang /
analyzed: sa bon yongs su gyur pa las phyag mtshan bsgom pa dang / de yongs su gyur pa las sku rdzogs pa dang / ye shes sems dpa' dang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' bsgom pa dang phung po dang khams dang skye mched byin gyis brlab pa sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa zhes pa ni bsgrub pa ste dang po sbyor ba'o // phyag rgya legs par sbyangs pa dang rdo rje dang padma snyoms par zhugs pa dang / rjes su chags pa dang mchod pa dang badzra dhrika ces bya ba la sogs pas phyung ba'i sngags kyis mi bskyod pa la sogs pa spro ba dang de rnams kyis kyang 'gro ba'i don bya ba dang /
translated: The accomplishment of the first yoga, the first union, is the meditation on the seed-syllable, the meditation on the insignia from the transformation of the seed-syllable, the complete body from the transformation of the insignia, the meditation on the gnosis-being and concentration-being, and the consecration of the aggregates, elements, and sense-spheres, which is called the consecration of the body, and so on.🔽The mandala of the supreme victors is the training in the consort, the union of the vajra and lotus, the passion, the worship, the emanation of Akshobhya and so on by the mantra uttered with vajradhrk and so on, the performance of the welfare of beings by those emanations,

original: dbang bskur ba dang rgyas btab pa ste dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog go //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba dang rgyas btab pa ste dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog go //
translated: the consecration, and the sealing.

original: phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang bzlas pa'i cho ga dang bya ba byas nas 'od du zhu ba dang lha mo rnams kyis bskul ba dang langs pa de la de bzhin gshegs pa lngas bstod pa dang tshim pa'i cho ga dang nang gi sbyin sreg dang gtor ma dang
analyzed: phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang bzlas pa'i cho ga dang bya ba byas nas 'od du zhu ba dang lha mo rnams kyis bskul ba dang langs pa de la de bzhin gshegs pa lngas bstod pa dang tshim pa'i cho ga dang nang gi sbyin sreg dang gtor ma dang
translated: The great practice is the supreme Victorious Action, which includes the subtle yoga, the rite of repetition, the performance of the rite, the melting through the flame, the urging by the goddesses, the arising, the praise by the five Tathagatas, the rite of satisfaction, the inner fire sacrifice, the sacrificial cake,

original: / mchod pa dag dang gshegs su gsol ba dang nyal ba ste bsgrub pa chen po ni las kyi rgyal ba mchog go //
analyzed: / mchod pa dag dang gshegs su gsol ba dang nyal ba ste bsgrub pa chen po ni las kyi rgyal ba mchog go //
translated: the offerings, the request for departure, and the going to sleep.

original: de ltar bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhi ting nge 'dzin gsum gyis bsdus so //
analyzed: de ltar bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhi ting nge 'dzin gsum gyis bsdus so //
translated: Thus, the four branches of the service and so forth are included in the three meditative stabilizations.

original: dang po sbyor ba yan lag bzhi'i bdag nyid kyis bsnyen pa dang nye bar bsnyen pa dang sgrub pa gsum bsdus pas so //🔽dkyil @52a * //
analyzed: dang po sbyor ba yan lag bzhi'i bdag nyid kyis bsnyen pa dang nye bar bsnyen pa dang sgrub pa gsum bsdus pas so // dkyil @52a * //
translated: The three, the service, the near-service, and the achievement, are included in the first union, which has the nature of the four branches.

original: 'khor rgyal ba mchog dang las kyi rgyal ba mchog dag gis sgrub pa chen po gcig bsdus so //
analyzed: 'khor rgyal ba mchog dang las kyi rgyal ba mchog dag gis sgrub pa chen po gcig bsdus so //
translated: The great practice is included in the Mandala Supreme Victorious Action and the Action Supreme Victorious Action.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid ni snying rje chen po mngon du 'gyur ba sngon du 'gro bas bgegs bskrad pa'i 'og tu stong pa nyid bsgom pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid ni snying rje chen po mngon du 'gyur ba sngon du 'gro bas bgegs bskrad pa'i 'og tu stong pa nyid bsgom pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it is said that “suchness is the meditation on emptiness, which is preceded by the manifestation of great compassion, after the obstructors have been expelled.”

original: de nas sa'i cha la sogs pa yang dag par sbyangs shing zhes pa ni ye shes kyi sa gzhi bskyed pa dang gzhal yas khang pa dbyung pa dang lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor dang don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de nas sa'i cha la sogs pa yang dag par sbyangs shing zhes pa ni ye shes kyi sa gzhi bskyed pa dang gzhal yas khang pa dbyung pa dang lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor dang don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa'o //
translated: Then, “having purified the ground and so forth” means generating the ground of wisdom, erecting the celestial mansion, and meditating on the mandala of imagination and the ultimate mandala.

original: nye bar bsdu ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: The summary will now be explained.

original: stong pa nyid dmigs pa zhes pa ni don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa'i bar du yan lag dang po ste bsnyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dmigs pa zhes pa ni don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa'i bar du yan lag dang po ste bsnyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The observation of emptiness is the first branch, up to the meditation on the ultimate mandala, which is called “approach.”

original: nyi ma la sogs pa dmigs pa zhes pa ni don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa'i 'og tu yig 'bru dgod pa dang de yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma dang zla ba dang padma bsgom pa dang / de'i steng du yi ge gsum yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa dang de la nyi ma la sogs pa 'jug pa dang chos kyi dbyings kyi sngags kyis rang gi sems so sor rtog pa dang /
analyzed: nyi ma la sogs pa dmigs pa zhes pa ni don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa'i 'og tu yig 'bru dgod pa dang de yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma dang zla ba dang padma bsgom pa dang / de'i steng du yi ge gsum yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa dang de la nyi ma la sogs pa 'jug pa dang chos kyi dbyings kyi sngags kyis rang gi sems so sor rtog pa dang /
translated: The phrase “the sun and so on are the object” refers to the following: after the meditation on the ultimate maṇḍala, the syllables are arranged, and from their complete transformation, the sun, moon, and lotus are meditated upon.

original: de'i steng du yig 'bru dgod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du yig 'bru dgod pa'o //
translated: On top of that, the moon maṇḍala is meditated upon from the complete transformation of the three syllables.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that,

original: de nyid sngags rnam par dgod pa'i mthar thug pa 'byung ba ni zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid sngags rnam par dgod pa'i mthar thug pa 'byung ba ni zhes bstan to //
translated: it is taught that “the ultimate arising of the arrangement of the mantra” is the second branch.

original: nye bar bsgrub pa 'byung ba ste gnyis pa ni yan lag gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar bsgrub pa 'byung ba ste gnyis pa ni yan lag gnyis pa'o //
translated: The arising of the near accomplishment is the second branch.

original: sgrub pa ni sku bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni sku bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment is the accomplishment of the body.

original: nye bar gzhag pa ni dmigs pa'i don du yig 'bru yongs su gyur pa nas phyag mtshan bsgom pa dang sku bsgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: nye bar gzhag pa ni dmigs pa'i don du yig 'bru yongs su gyur pa nas phyag mtshan bsgom pa dang sku bsgrub pa bstan to //
translated: The placement is the meaning of the meditative object, and is taught as the transformation of the seed-syllable, the meditation on the insignia, and the accomplishment of the body.

original: gsol ba 'debs pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched byin gyis brlab pa dang sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: gsol ba 'debs pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched byin gyis brlab pa dang sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: The supplication is the consecration of the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields, and the consecration of the body, etc.

original: mnyam par gyur pa ni mi 'da' ba'i phyir ye shes sems dpa' dang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'i bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gyur pa ni mi 'da' ba'i phyir ye shes sems dpa' dang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'i bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The equality is the meditation of the gnosis-being and the concentration-being, because they do not pass beyond.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that,

original: bsgrub pa'i don ni dbus kyi gtso bo bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i don ni dbus kyi gtso bo bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnal 'byor ro //
translated: the meaning of the accomplishment is the yoga characterized by the generation of the central principal.

original: dam tshig ni ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' dang ye shes sems dpa' bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid de rjes su rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: dam tshig ni ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' dang ye shes sems dpa' bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid de rjes su rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The pledge is the characteristic of the meditation of the concentration-being and the gnosis-being, and is the subsequent yoga.

original: sngar bshad pa'i gsol ba btab pa yang phung po la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa shin tu rnal 'byor dang / sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa ni rnal 'byor chen po zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i gsol ba btab pa yang phung po la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa shin tu rnal 'byor dang / sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa ni rnal 'byor chen po zhes bstan to //
translated: The supplication explained above is the extremely une practice of the consecration of the aggregates, etc., and the consecration of the body, etc. is the great yoga.

original: de ltar @52b rnal 'byor bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi dang po sbyor bas bsnyen pa dang nye bar bsnyen pa dang sgrub pa gsum bsdus so //
analyzed: de ltar @52b rnal 'byor bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi dang po sbyor bas bsnyen pa dang nye bar bsnyen pa dang sgrub pa gsum bsdus so //
translated: Thus, the first yoga, which has the nature of the four yogas, includes the three: approach, near-attainment, and accomplishment.

original: de ni gsum pa ste sgrub pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: de ni gsum pa ste sgrub pa'i yan lag go //
translated: That is the third, the branch of accomplishment.

original: lhag ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang po sbyor ba la ltos nas ting nge 'dzin gnyis po gang yin pa de gnyis kyis sems can gyi khams la don 'grub pas na sgrub pa chen po zhes bya ba yan lag bzhi pa bstan to //
analyzed: lhag ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang po sbyor ba la ltos nas ting nge 'dzin gnyis po gang yin pa de gnyis kyis sems can gyi khams la don 'grub pas na sgrub pa chen po zhes bya ba yan lag bzhi pa bstan to //
translated: The two meditative stabilizations that depend on the first yoga, which are called “the rest,” accomplish the aims of the realm of sentient beings by the two, and thus the fourth branch, called “great accomplishment,” is taught.

original: de ltar yan lag bzhi po zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa rigs lnga'i dbye ba bsgoms pas yongs su shes te 'chad par 'gyur ba ni le'u bcu gsum pa la sogs pa las zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs dang sngar bshad pa
analyzed: de ltar yan lag bzhi po zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa rigs lnga'i dbye ba bsgoms pas yongs su shes te 'chad par 'gyur ba ni le'u bcu gsum pa la sogs pa las zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs dang sngar bshad pa
translated: Thus, “the four limbs” and so forth, having meditated on the divisions of the five families of Tathagatas, one should understand them.

original: ni le'u dgu pa la sogs pa las dam tshig lnga'i sgom pa la sogs pa rnal 'byor pas bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ni le'u dgu pa la sogs pa las dam tshig lnga'i sgom pa la sogs pa rnal 'byor pas bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The thirteen chapters and so forth explain the collection of pacifying and so forth, and the previously explained [topics] are the meditation on the five commitments and so forth in the ninth chapter and so forth.🔽The practitioner should accomplish them.

original: mdor bstan pa'o zhes pa ni bsnyen pa la sogs pa mdor bsdus pa bshad pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa'o zhes pa ni bsnyen pa la sogs pa mdor bsdus pa bshad pa'o //
translated: “The brief explanation” is the explanation of the brief summary of the approach and so forth.

original: mdor bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de rnams rgyas par bshad pa bstan to //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de rnams rgyas par bshad pa bstan to //
translated: “The brief explanation” and so forth teaches the extensive explanation of those.

original: byang chub kyi sems la dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba nas bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa'i mtha'i bar bsnyen pa rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba nas bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa'i mtha'i bar bsnyen pa rab tu bstan to //
translated: “The observation of the mind of enlightenment” up to “one should meditate” teaches the approach, up to the meditation on the ultimate maṇḍala.

original: nyi ma zhes pa nas phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs su bskyed pa nas zhes pa ni nye bar bsgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: nyi ma zhes pa nas phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs su bskyed pa nas zhes pa ni nye bar bsgrub pa bstan to //
translated: From the sun up to generated in the form of the Great Seal indicates the near-accomplishment.

original: phyag rgya chen po grub pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po grub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the Great Seal is the accomplishment.

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: Up to

original: sngags kyi bdag po bsgoms pa yis //
analyzed: sngags kyi bdag po bsgoms pa yis //
translated: by the meditation on the Lord of Mantra

original: zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i yan lag gsum pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i yan lag gsum pa bstan to //
