translated: indicates the third branch called the accomplishment.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that, it says:

original: sngags kyi yi ge ma lus par bkod la zhes smos te /
analyzed: sngags kyi yi ge ma lus par bkod la zhes smos te /
translated: Having arranged all the syllables of the mantra

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams la sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i yig 'bru'i tshogs rnam par bkod nas so //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams la sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i yig 'bru'i tshogs rnam par bkod nas so //
translated: means having arranged the collection of syllables such as Kṣhitigarbha in the aggregates, constituents, and sense-fields.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa nas gnod mdzes kyi bar zhes pa ni sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa nas gnod mdzes kyi bar zhes pa ni sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: From Vairochana up to Sumbha refers to the nature of the body mandala.

original: de rnams kyi skye mched de zhes pa ni gnas te gzhi'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi skye mched de zhes pa ni gnas te gzhi'o //
translated: The sense-fields of those refers to the abode, the basis.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de la phung po rnams la aom la sogs pa yi ge lnga dang skye mched la lha thams cad la sogs pa yi ge brgyad pa dang / khams la sogs pa'i yi ge bzhi dang yan lag dang nying lag thams cad la gshin rje mthar byed la sogs @53a * //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de la phung po rnams la aom la sogs pa yi ge lnga dang skye mched la lha thams cad la sogs pa yi ge brgyad pa dang / khams la sogs pa'i yi ge bzhi dang yan lag dang nying lag thams cad la gshin rje mthar byed la sogs @53a * //
translated: The so-called aggregates such as form are the five syllables such as om, the sense bases are the eight syllables such as all gods, the four syllables such as the elements and all major and minor body parts are Yamantaka and so on.🔽

original: pa'i yig 'bru rnams dgod do //
analyzed: pa'i yig 'bru rnams dgod do //
translated: The aggregates, etc. are as follows: the five syllables Om, etc. are placed on the aggregates, etc. ; the eight syllables, etc. are placed on the sense-fields, etc. ; the four syllables, etc. are placed on the elements, etc. ; and the syllables of Yamantaka, etc. are placed on all the limbs and minor parts.

original: rim pa gsum gyi go rims kyis zhes pa ni shin tu rnal 'byor gyi rim pas so //🔽rgyu dang 'bras bu yongs su shes nas zhes pa ni rgyu ni yig 'bru rnams so //
analyzed: rim pa gsum gyi go rims kyis zhes pa ni shin tu rnal 'byor gyi rim pas so // rgyu dang 'bras bu yongs su shes nas zhes pa ni rgyu ni yig 'bru rnams so //
translated: In the order of the three stages means by the stage of the supernal yoga.

original: 'bras bu ni de las byung ba'i sku rnams so //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni de las byung ba'i sku rnams so //
translated: Having understood cause and effect means that the causes are the syllables, and the effects are the Bodies that arise from them.

original: yongs su shes pa zhes pa ni de yongs su gyur pa las mig la sogs pa de rnams kyis mtshan par shes nas so //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa zhes pa ni de yongs su gyur pa las mig la sogs pa de rnams kyis mtshan par shes nas so //
translated: Having understood means that, having understood the signs of those eyes, etc. by their complete transformation from those, one should visualize the Bodies of the Buddhas.

original: shin tu rnal 'byor gyi 'og tu sangs rgyas sku 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad ba'i sgo nas spyan ma la sogs pas bkug pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dang ro gcig par gyur pas sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa
analyzed: shin tu rnal 'byor gyi 'og tu sangs rgyas sku 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad ba'i sgo nas spyan ma la sogs pas bkug pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dang ro gcig par gyur pas sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa
translated: After the very unelaborate yoga, by means of the verse beginning “The Buddha holding the body,” and so on, the consecration of the body, and so on, is taught.

original: ste rnal 'byor chen po bstan to //
analyzed: ste rnal 'byor chen po bstan to //
translated: This is the great yoga.

original: des ni yan lag bzhi pa dang po sbyor ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni yan lag bzhi pa dang po sbyor ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the first application, which has four branches.

original: sgrub pa chen po zhes bya ba nas sgra ji bzhin pa'i bar du dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog dang las kyi rgyal ba mchog ste sgrub pa chen po bstan to ;
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po zhes bya ba nas sgra ji bzhin pa'i bar du dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog dang las kyi rgyal ba mchog ste sgrub pa chen po bstan to ;
translated: The great accomplishment, from “the supreme victors of the maṇḍala” up to “just as it is,” teaches the great accomplishment, which is the supreme victor of the maṇḍala and the supreme victor of activity.

original: ; rang gi lhag pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji ltar 'dod pa'i lha bsgoms pas yan lag gsum pa'i 'og tu sgrub thabs las gsungs pa'i rim pas phyag rgya legs par sbyangs te rdo rje dang padma byin gyis brlabs nas snyoms
analyzed: ; rang gi lhag pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji ltar 'dod pa'i lha bsgoms pas yan lag gsum pa'i 'og tu sgrub thabs las gsungs pa'i rim pas phyag rgya legs par sbyangs te rdo rje dang padma byin gyis brlabs nas snyoms
translated: Having meditated on the chosen deity, one should train in the consort as taught in the sādhana, and having blessed the vajra and lotus, one should enter into union.

original: par 'jug pa'i gong du rjes su chags pa'i sngags dang mchod pa'i sngags brjod la snyoms par zhugs par bya ste /
analyzed: par 'jug pa'i gong du rjes su chags pa'i sngags dang mchod pa'i sngags brjod la snyoms par zhugs par bya ste /
translated: Prior to that, one should recite the mantra of passion and the mantra of offering.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'jug pa sngon du 'gro ba badzra dhrika ces bya ba la sogs ba'i phyung ba'i sngags kyis dkyil 'khor pa rnams sprul la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'jug pa sngon du 'gro ba badzra dhrika ces bya ba la sogs ba'i phyung ba'i sngags kyis dkyil 'khor pa rnams sprul la /
translated: One should emanate the maṇḍala with the mantra of emission, “vajra-dhṛk,” and so on, preceded by the entry of all tathāgatas.

original: dbang bskur ba dang rgyas gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba dang rgyas gdab par bya ste /
translated: One should confer empowerment and seal.

original: dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis phra mo'i rnal 'byor bzlas pa dang 'od du zhu ba dang lha mo rnams kyis bskul ba dang ldang ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bstod pa dang tshim pa dang nang gi sbyin sreg dang mchod pa dang gtor ma dang gshegs su gsol ba dang nyal bar byas nas rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis ting nge 'dzin gnyis kyi
analyzed: dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis phra mo'i rnal 'byor bzlas pa dang 'od du zhu ba dang lha mo rnams kyis bskul ba dang ldang ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bstod pa dang tshim pa dang nang gi sbyin sreg dang mchod pa dang gtor ma dang gshegs su gsol ba dang nyal bar byas nas rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis ting nge 'dzin gnyis kyi
translated: This is the explanation of the great achievement of the nature of the two meditative stabilizations.🔽One will attain power explains the subtle yoga, repetition, melting into light, urging by the goddesses, rising, praise by the Tathagatas, satisfaction, inner fire sacrifice, worship, bali offering, requesting departure, and going to sleep.

original: bdag nyid kyi sgrub pa chen po bstan to //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sgrub pa chen po bstan to //
translated: One will attain the state of Great Vajradhara explains the great achievement of the nature of the two meditative stabilizations.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi yan lag bzhi bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi yan lag bzhi bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase just as it is refers to the explanation of the four branches of the nature of the three meditative stabilizations.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rim pas rdo rje 'chang chen @53b po'i sku bskyed pa bstan nas rdzogs pa'i rim pas kyang bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rim pas rdo rje 'chang chen @53b po'i sku bskyed pa bstan nas rdzogs pa'i rim pas kyang bstan par bya ste /
translated: Having thus explained the generation of the body of Great Vajradhara by means of the stage of generation, he will now explain it by means of the stage of completion.

original: gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud phyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa gnyis kyi dbye ba bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud phyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa gnyis kyi dbye ba bstan par bya ste /
translated: The Subsequent Tantra of the Guhyasamaja and so forth teach the division into two stages.

original: thun mong mchog gi dbye ba yis //
analyzed: thun mong mchog gi dbye ba yis //
translated: By the division of common and supreme

original: zhes pa ni bsnyen pa rnam pa gnyis te //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bsnyen pa rnam pa gnyis te //
translated: there are two kinds of approach.

original: thun mong gi bsnyen pa dang // mchog gi bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong gi bsnyen pa dang // mchog gi bsnyen pa'o //
translated: There is the common approach and the supreme approach.

original: de la thun mong gi bsnyen pa ni rdo rje bzhi po de sngar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de la thun mong gi bsnyen pa ni rdo rje bzhi po de sngar bshad pa'o //
translated: The common approach is the four vajras explained above.

original: mchog gi bsnyen pa ni yan lag drug pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: mchog gi bsnyen pa ni yan lag drug pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The supreme approach is the characteristic of the six-branched yoga,

original: yan lag drug gi la brten nas rdo rje 'chang chen po rdzogs par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: yan lag drug gi la brten nas rdo rje 'chang chen po rdzogs par 'gyur bas so //
translated: because by relying on the six branches, one becomes perfected as Great Vajradhara.

original: bsnyen cing thar 'dod pa zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thar pa 'dod pas slob pas na bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen cing thar 'dod pa zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thar pa 'dod pas slob pas na bsnyen pa'o //
translated: One who wishes to approach and attain liberation is a trainee who wishes to attain liberation, which is the characteristic of perfection as Great Vajradhara.

original: yongs su dag pa'i lha'i sku zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku ste ye shes kyi sku'am rdo rje'i sku'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i lha'i sku zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku ste ye shes kyi sku'am rdo rje'i sku'o //
translated: The completely pure divine body is the body of Great Vajradhara, the body of wisdom or the vajra body.

original: ye shes ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the perfection stage.

original: de nyid bdud rtsi ste bcud kyis len te yan lag drug gi sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid de'i rgyur gyur par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid bdud rtsi ste bcud kyis len te yan lag drug gi sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid de'i rgyur gyur par bya'o //
translated: That itself is the elixir, the elixir of life, which should be made into the cause of the characteristics of the practice of the six-limbed yoga.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid ni lus ngag yid kyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid ni lus ngag yid kyis so //
translated: The nature of all aspects is by means of body, speech, and mind.

original: dus thams cad dang zhes pa ni thun thams cad dang nyin mo dang mtshan mo la'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad dang zhes pa ni thun thams cad dang nyin mo dang mtshan mo la'o //
translated: All times means all sessions, day and night.

original: spyod lam thams cad du'o zhes pa ni ldang ba 'dug pa dang nyal ba'i ste 'chag pa zhes bya ba ste bzhi la'o //
analyzed: spyod lam thams cad du'o zhes pa ni ldang ba 'dug pa dang nyal ba'i ste 'chag pa zhes bya ba ste bzhi la'o //
translated: All modes of conduct means in the four modes of conduct: standing, sitting, sleeping, and walking.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gcer bu'am ni gcer bu min //
analyzed: gcer bu'am ni gcer bu min //
translated: Naked or not naked,

original: gang dang gang du ji bzhin pas //
analyzed: gang dang gang du ji bzhin pas //
translated: Wherever and however,

original: rang gi lhag pa'i lha dmigs nas //
analyzed: rang gi lhag pa'i lha dmigs nas //
translated: Visualizing one’s own deity,

original: de nyid gcig pu bsam par bya //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid gcig pu bsam par bya // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: One should contemplate that alone.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnal 'byor drug po de nyid kyis bsnyen pa bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnal 'byor drug po de nyid kyis bsnyen pa bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase “this very” and so forth teaches that one should practice the approach with just those six yogas.

original: sbrul zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni sbrul dang mgo med dang mtha' med dang / bsdu ba la sogs pa ste ming bstan to //
analyzed: sbrul zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni sbrul dang mgo med dang mtha' med dang / bsdu ba la sogs pa ste ming bstan to //
translated: The snake and so forth are the snake, the headless, the endless, the collection, and so forth, which are the names.

original: lha'i de kho na nyid do zhes pa ni sngags kyi brjod bya lha rnams te don to //
analyzed: lha'i de kho na nyid do zhes pa ni sngags kyi brjod bya lha rnams te don to //
translated: The reality of the deity is the deity that is the subject matter of the mantra, which is the meaning.

original: de bas na yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ste gang gi phyir sngags dang lha'i de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin de bas na des ni yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor gyi rim pas bsnyen pa bya'o zhes pa ni mchog gi bsnyen pa bsgom
analyzed: de bas na yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ste gang gi phyir sngags dang lha'i de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin de bas na des ni yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor gyi rim pas bsnyen pa bya'o zhes pa ni mchog gi bsnyen pa bsgom
translated: Therefore, it is called the yoga of six limbs, because it is the nature of the reality of the mantra and the deity. Therefore, by that, one should perform the approach through the process of the yoga of six limbs, which is the meditation on the supreme approach.

original: par bya'o // de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyud phyi ma las tshad ma nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: par bya'o // de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyud phyi ma las tshad ma nyid du bstan to //
translated: By his and so forth, it is taught in the continuation of the tantra that it is valid.

original: yan lag drug ni sngar bshad pas so //
analyzed: yan lag drug ni sngar bshad pas so //
translated: The six limbs are explained above.

original: bsnyen pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsnyen pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom par bya ba'o //
translated: The approach is the meditation on the stage of completion.

original: @54a * // mchog tu sgrub ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: @54a * // mchog tu sgrub ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: Supreme accomplishment is the accomplishment of the state of Great Vajradhara.

original: gzhan dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gal te de ltar mi phyed na de'i tshe dngos grub mchog ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gal te de ltar mi phyed na de'i tshe dngos grub mchog ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one does not do it that way, then one will not attain the supreme power, the power of Great Vajradhara,

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i thabs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i thabs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other method of the completion stage.

original: so sor sdud ces bya ba la sogs pas mdor bstan pa ste /
analyzed: so sor sdud ces bya ba la sogs pas mdor bstan pa ste /
translated: The brief explanation is with “withdrawal” and so forth.

original: yan lag drug po ni dang po mdor bsdus pa'i sgo nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag drug po ni dang po mdor bsdus pa'i sgo nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The six branches are first taught in brief.

original: bshad par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyud phyi ma'i tshad mas tshigs su bcad pa bcu gnyis kyis de rnams rgyas par bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyud phyi ma'i tshad mas tshigs su bcad pa bcu gnyis kyis de rnams rgyas par bstan par bya ste /
translated: In order to explain them, and so forth, the twelve verses of the later tantra are the extensive teaching of them.

original: bshad par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pas yan lag drug po de rnams spros nas bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pas yan lag drug po de rnams spros nas bshad par bya ste /
translated: In order to explain them, and so forth, the six branches are elaborated and explained.

original: dbang po don bcu rnams kyi yang //
analyzed: dbang po don bcu rnams kyi yang //
translated: The ten objects of the senses

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid du ston par byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid du ston par byed de /
translated: and so forth show that.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor bas phyag rgya chen po'i sku cig car du dmigs la mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i sgo nas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga ngan pa dang 'bring mchog gi dbye bas gcig tu brtags la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor bas phyag rgya chen po'i sku cig car du dmigs la mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i sgo nas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga ngan pa dang 'bring mchog gi dbye bas gcig tu brtags la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin
translated: The yogi/nī of the stage of completion visualizes the body of Mahāmudrā all at once, and through the doors of the sense organs, such as the eyes, he/she should imagine the five sense objects, such as form, as being of three types: bad, middling, and supreme.

original: gshegs pa'i tshogs rang gi lus kyi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa mchod par bya zhes mos pa byas te /
analyzed: gshegs pa'i tshogs rang gi lus kyi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa mchod par bya zhes mos pa byas te /
translated: He/she should imagine that the hosts of tathāgatas, such as Vairocana, who reside in the body maṇḍala, are worshipped.

original: dbang po gnyis sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis nye bar spyod pa gang yin pa de ni so sor sdud pa zhes bya ba yan lag dang po yin te gzugs la sogs pa re re spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po gnyis sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis nye bar spyod pa gang yin pa de ni so sor sdud pa zhes bya ba yan lag dang po yin te gzugs la sogs pa re re spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is enjoyed by the samādhi of the union of the two organs is called “withdrawal,” the first branch, because it enjoys each of the sense objects, such as form.

original: gang gi phyir nyan thos pa rnams kyis yul rnams la sems bzlog cing nang du chud pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyan thos pa rnams kyis yul rnams la sems bzlog cing nang du chud pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de /
translated: Because the śrāvakas turn the mind away from objects and withdraw it inward, etc.,

original: de rnams kyi so sor sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi so sor sdud pa yin no //
translated: that is their withdrawal.

original: de'i 'og tu yul dang dbang po'i tshogs de rnams gcig tu byas te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yul dang dbang po'i tshogs de rnams gcig tu byas te /
translated: Then, having combined the collection of objects and faculties into one,

original: lnga nyid du rnam par bzhag nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin 'di dag yin no zhes rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan zhes bya ba yan lag gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: lnga nyid du rnam par bzhag nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin 'di dag yin no zhes rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan zhes bya ba yan lag gnyis pa'o //
translated: having established them as five, the realization that they are the nature of the five exalted wisdoms of the Tathagata is the second branch called “meditation.”

original: de'i dbye ba lnga ste /
analyzed: de'i dbye ba lnga ste /
translated: Its divisions are five:

original: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: thought, investigation, joy, bliss, and one-pointed mind.

original: de la yul nye bar spyod pa'i dus su dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid yin no zhes rtog pa ni rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de la yul nye bar spyod pa'i dus su dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid yin no zhes rtog pa ni rtog pa ste /
translated: Among them, thought is the thought that at the time of experiencing objects, the faculties, objects, and consciousnesses are all the nature of the five Tathagatas.

original: mngon du rgyu ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon du rgyu ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called “thought” because it is manifest movement.

original: de rnams @54b ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin yin no zhes rtog pa ni dpyod pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams @54b ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin yin no zhes rtog pa ni dpyod pa ste /
translated: Investigation is the investigation that they are the nature of the five exalted wisdoms.

original: rags pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs nas phra ba yin pas so //
analyzed: rags pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs nas phra ba yin pas so //
translated: It is called “investigation” because it is subtle, having abandoned coarse conceptuality.🔽Joy is the joy of realizing that the five faculties are the nature of the five Tathagatas.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis mchog tu 'dzin pas de kho na nyid la mngon du gyur pa ni bdag yin no zhes bsams nas dga' ba'i khyad par skyes pa gang yin pa de ni dga' ba zhes bya ba ste gsum pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis mchog tu 'dzin pas de kho na nyid la mngon du gyur pa ni bdag yin no zhes bsams nas dga' ba'i khyad par skyes pa gang yin pa de ni dga' ba zhes bya ba ste gsum pa ste /
translated: The fifth is called equanimity, because it is the first to be accompanied by the faculty of equanimity.

original: sems dang par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sixth is called special concentration, because it is the first to be accompanied by the faculty of supe rior mental application.🔽The seventh is called the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, because it is the first to be accompanied by that faculty.🔽The eighth is called the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, because it is the first to be accompanied by that faculty.🔽The ninth is called the sphere of non-perception, because it is the first to be accompanied by that faculty.🔽The tenth is called the sphere of infinite consciousness, because it is the first to be accompanied by that faculty.🔽The eleventh is called the sphere of infinite space, because it is the first to be accompanied by that faculty.🔽The twelfth is called the sphere of nothingness, because it is the first to be accompanied by that faculty.🔽The thirteenth is called the sphere of infinite consciousness, because it is the first to be accompanied by that faculty.

original: sems kyi bde ba de thob nas lus kyang shin tu sbyang bar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi bde ba de thob nas lus kyang shin tu sbyang bar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni bde ba'o //
translated: The fourteenth is called the sphere of infinite space, because it is the first to be accompanied by that faculty.

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba yang spangs nas mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa de dang sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba yang spangs nas mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa de dang sbyor ba ste /
translated: The fifteenth is called the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, because it is the first to be accompanied by that faculty.🔽The sixteenth is called the sphere of nothing ness, because it is the first to be accompanied by that faculty.🔽The seventeenth is called the sphere of infinite consciousness, because it is the first to be accompanied by that faculty.🔽The eighteenth is called the sphere of infinite space, because it is the first to be accompanied by that faculty.🔽The nineteenth is called the sphere of nothingness, because it is the first to be accompanied by that faculty.🔽The twentieth is called the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, because it is the first to be accompanied by that faculty.🔽The twenty-first is called the sphere of infinite consciousness, because it is the first to be accompanied by that faculty.🔽The twenty-second is called the sphere of infinite space, because it is the first to be accompanied by that faculty.

original: shes pa dang shes bya'i rang bzhin ldog pa rab tu zhi ba nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa 'od gsal ba la gnas pa tsam du 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni sems rtse gcig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya'i rang bzhin ldog pa rab tu zhi ba nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa 'od gsal ba la gnas pa tsam du 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni sems rtse gcig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The twenty-third is called the sphere of nothingness, because it is the first to be accompanied by that faculty.🔽The twenty-fourth is called the sphere of neither

original: de la bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te rtog pa dang dpyod pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa yin par snang ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de la bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te rtog pa dang dpyod pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa yin par snang ba'i ye shes so //
translated: The condensed meaning of that is as follows: Conception and analysis are the wisdom that appears as having conception.

original: dga' ba ni snang ba mched pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: dga' ba ni snang ba mched pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Joy is the wisdom of the increase of appearance.

original: bde ba ni snang ba thob pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: bde ba ni snang ba thob pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Bliss is the wisdom of the attainment of appearance.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni 'od gsal ba ste thams cad stong pa zhes bya ba ste de kho na nyid do zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni 'od gsal ba ste thams cad stong pa zhes bya ba ste de kho na nyid do zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: One-pointed mind is clear light, which is called “the emptiness of all,” and is the reality.

original: de yang dam tshig gi phyag rgya la sogs pa dang 'brel bas byung ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //🔽tha mal pa'i yul du nye bar spyod na de mi skyo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang dam tshig gi phyag rgya la sogs pa dang 'brel bas byung ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no // tha mal pa'i yul du nye bar spyod na de mi skyo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That also arises in connection with the pledge seal, etc., and not otherwise.🔽If one enjoys an ordinary object, that does not arise, because one does not tire of it.

original: yul gyi khyad par nye bar spyod par 'gyur pa de 'byung bas so //
analyzed: yul gyi khyad par nye bar spyod par 'gyur pa de 'byung bas so //
translated: It arises from enjoying the special object.

original: de ni yan lag lnga dang ldan pa yan lag gnyis pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni yan lag lnga dang ldan pa yan lag gnyis pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the second stage, endowed with five branches.

original: de'i 'og tu thabs dang shes rab snyoms par zhugs pas yan lag thams cad kyi tshigs las byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le spros te snying ga la sogs pa sngags kyi thig le de nyid dmigs la sna'i rtse mor dkyil 'khor bzhi 'char ba'i dus su g-yas
analyzed: de'i 'og tu thabs dang shes rab snyoms par zhugs pas yan lag thams cad kyi tshigs las byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le spros te snying ga la sogs pa sngags kyi thig le de nyid dmigs la sna'i rtse mor dkyil 'khor bzhi 'char ba'i dus su g-yas
translated: Then, by the union of method and wisdom, the bindu of bodhicitta is emitted from all the joints of the limbs.

original: pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas 'byung bar bsams te /
analyzed: pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas 'byung bar bsams te /
translated: The mantra bindu is visualized in the heart, and so on. When the four maṇḍalas arise at the tip of the nose, one should imagine that they emerge through the right and left nostrils.

original: dmar po la sogs pa'i kha dog dang ldan pa rgyun mi 'chad pa /
analyzed: dmar po la sogs pa'i kha dog dang ldan pa rgyun mi 'chad pa /
translated: They are endowed with the colors of red and so on, and they are uninterrupted.

original: 'khrul 'khor bzhin du 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba'i bdag nyid yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni srog dang rtsol ba zhes bya ba yan lag gsum pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor bzhin du 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba'i bdag nyid yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni srog dang rtsol ba zhes bya ba yan lag gsum pa ste /
translated: Whatever is done with the recitation, and so on, of the undamaged limbs of the nature of entering, abiding, and rising, like a machine, is the third limb, called “prāṇa and āyāma,”

original: rlung gi de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: rlung gi de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: because it is the essence of the reality of the vāyu.

original: padma'i sna rtse zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste rdo rje'i sna rtse yang gzung bar @55a * //
analyzed: padma'i sna rtse zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste rdo rje'i sna rtse yang gzung bar @55a * //
translated: “The tip of the lotus” is a synecdoche; the tip of the vajra is also meant.

original: bya ste / sgom pa po rnams ni bud med dang skyes pa'i dbye ba dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: bya ste / sgom pa po rnams ni bud med dang skyes pa'i dbye ba dang ldan pas so //
translated: The meditators are those who are endowed with the distinction of being female or male.

original: de'i 'og tu thig le de nyid kyi gzugs srog dang rtsol ba'i rim pa nye bar bsdus pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu thig le de nyid kyi gzugs srog dang rtsol ba'i rim pa nye bar bsdus pa /
translated: Then, that very drop, the form of which is the process of the life-force and the exertion, is subsumed

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba thams cad med pa sgo 'gags pa dbus ma la sems tsam zhugs pa de tsam gyi gnas skabs kyis bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gags pa 'dzin pas ni zhes bya ba yan lag
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba thams cad med pa sgo 'gags pa dbus ma la sems tsam zhugs pa de tsam gyi gnas skabs kyis bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gags pa 'dzin pas ni zhes bya ba yan lag
translated: without all the comings and goings, the blocked door, the mind alone entering the middle. The meditation that is in that situation is the cessation of the conceptual mind.

original: bzhi pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The fourth branch is called the retention of the mind.

original: 'dzin pa la sems 'jug na phyi rol gyi 'byung ba chen po lnga'i rnam par rtog pa spong bas de kho na nyid las mi slu ba'i rtags lnga 'byung bar 'gyur te me'i du bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa la sems 'jug na phyi rol gyi 'byung ba chen po lnga'i rnam par rtog pa spong bas de kho na nyid las mi slu ba'i rtags lnga 'byung bar 'gyur te me'i du bzhin no //
translated: When the mind enters into retention, the five signs of nondeception with respect to reality arise, as if smoke and so on were to arise, because external conceptuality of the five great elements is abandoned.

original: de la sa chu la thim par 'gyur na smig rgyu'i rtags 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la sa chu la thim par 'gyur na smig rgyu'i rtags 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therein, when earth dissolves into water, the sign of a mirage arises.

original: chu las thim pa smig rgyu 'byung ba ste dngos po'i chos yin no //
analyzed: chu las thim pa smig rgyu 'byung ba ste dngos po'i chos yin no //
translated: The dissolution of water into fire produces a mirage, which is a phenomenon of substance.

original: me la chu thim pas du ba 'byung ba ste dngos po'i chos yin pas so //
analyzed: me la chu thim pas du ba 'byung ba ste dngos po'i chos yin pas so //
translated: The dissolution of fire into water produces smoke, which is a phenomenon of substance.

original: rlung la me thim pas srin bu me khyer dang 'dra ba'i snang ba'i rtags 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rlung la me thim pas srin bu me khyer dang 'dra ba'i snang ba'i rtags 'byung ba'o //
translated: The dissolution of air into fire produces a sign of light resembling a firefly.

original: rlung dang me phrad bar 'bar ba 'byung ba zhes dngos po'i chos yin no //
analyzed: rlung dang me phrad bar 'bar ba 'byung ba zhes dngos po'i chos yin no //
translated: The union of air and fire produces a flame, which is a phenomenon of substance.

original: srin bu me khyer ni 'bar bas gsal ba'i gzugs can srin bu dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: srin bu me khyer ni 'bar bas gsal ba'i gzugs can srin bu dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The firefly is a luminous form with an insect.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlung thim na mar me lta bu'i rtags 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlung thim na mar me lta bu'i rtags 'byung ba ste /
translated: When the element of consciousness dissolves into air, a sign like a lamp arises.

original: snang ba gsum ni gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: snang ba gsum ni gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: The three lights have a nature of clarity.

original: rang bzhin dang snang ba 'od gsal ba la thim na 'ba' zhig dri ma med pa mtha' yas pa sprin med pa'i nam mkha' dang 'dra ba thams cad stong pa'i de kho na nyid 'byung ngo zhes rtags lngas mya ngan las 'das pa 'od gsal ba'i go 'phang🔽thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang snang ba 'od gsal ba la thim na 'ba' zhig dri ma med pa mtha' yas pa sprin med pa'i nam mkha' dang 'dra ba thams cad stong pa'i de kho na nyid 'byung ngo zhes rtags lngas mya ngan las 'das pa 'od gsal ba'i go 'phang thob par byed pa'o //
translated: If the nature dissolves into the clear light of appearance, the five signs arise, and the state of nirvana, the clear light, is attained.🔽This is established by the authority of the Mahayanasutralankara, which distinguishes the stages of the path and the result.

original: 'di las dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i theg pa chen po'i mdo'i tshad mas /
analyzed: 'di las dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i theg pa chen po'i mdo'i tshad mas /
translated: It says:

original: dang po sa ni chur thim zhing //
analyzed: dang po sa ni chur thim zhing //
translated: The first dissolves into the second,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar byas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar byas so //
translated: and so on.🔽After that, when the five signs are manifested, one enters the clear light.

original: de'i 'og tu rtags lnga mtshon par gyur na 'od gsal ba la 'jug pas chad pa'i phyogs 'di yin zhes shes nas de spong ba'i phyir rim pa 'di nyid kyis thig le de las mtha' yas ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa spros shing mtha' yas pa'i nam mkha'i khams
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rtags lnga mtshon par gyur na 'od gsal ba la 'jug pas chad pa'i phyogs 'di yin zhes shes nas de spong ba'i phyir rim pa 'di nyid kyis thig le de las mtha' yas ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa spros shing mtha' yas pa'i nam mkha'i khams
translated: Then, knowing that this is the extreme of nihilism, in order to abandon it, one emanates limitless tathagatas from that drop and fills the limitless realms of space with them.

original: khyab pa gang yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba rjes su dran pa yan lag lnga pa ste 'od @55b gsal ba'i rjes la dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab pa gang yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba rjes su dran pa yan lag lnga pa ste 'od @55b gsal ba'i rjes la dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is pervasion is the fifth limb called “recollection of samādhi,” because of recollecting the clear light.

original: rtag pa'i phyogs 'di yin no zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo sku 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba yan lag drug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyogs 'di yin no zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo sku 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba yan lag drug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is the side of permanence is the sixth limb called “samādhi,” because of holding the body, which is the nature of all tathāgatas, the entity of nonabiding nirvāṇa.

original: des na bsdus pa'i don 'di lta ste /
analyzed: des na bsdus pa'i don 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus the summarized meaning is as follows:

original: so sor bsdus pa dang bsam gtan dag ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas bsdus so //
analyzed: so sor bsdus pa dang bsam gtan dag ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas bsdus so //
translated: The individual summaries and the dhyānas are summarized by the stage of the pure mind.

original: srog dang rtsol ba ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pas so //🔽'dzin pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: srog dang rtsol ba ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pas so // 'dzin pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas so //
translated: Prāṇa and āyāma are summarized by the stage of vajra recitation.🔽Uṣṇīṣa is summarized by the stage of clear light.

original: rjes su dran ba ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: rjes su dran ba ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas so //
translated: Recollection is summarized by the stage of self-consecration.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bsdus so zhes yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor ni rim pa lnga'i bdag nyid yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bsdus so zhes yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor ni rim pa lnga'i bdag nyid yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the yoga of the six limbs is the very essence of the five stages, as it is said in the Heruka Galpo: The six limbs are the stages of generation and perfection.

original: dpal sgyu 'phrul dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas lung tshad ma nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: dpal sgyu 'phrul dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas lung tshad ma nyid du bstan to //
translated: The statement the glorious Net of Illusion... and so forth teaches the validity of the scriptures.

original: rnal 'byor rnams zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rnams zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
translated: The statement the yogis... is the thesis.

original: byin gyis rlab  dang / zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdor bstan to //🔽byin rlabs tsam gyis nga rgyal bskyed //
analyzed: byin gyis rlab  dang / zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdor bstan to // byin rlabs tsam gyis nga rgyal bskyed //
translated: The statement the consecration... and so forth is the brief explanation.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas rgyas par bshad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas rgyas par bshad par bya ba'o //
translated: The statement by the mere consecration... and so forth is the extensive explanation.

original: de la lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor du lha'i nga rgyal gyi sgo nas rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni byin gyis brlab pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: de la lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor du lha'i nga rgyal gyi sgo nas rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni byin gyis brlab pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: Therein, the yoga of consecration is the meditation on Vajradhara and so forth, from the perspective of the pride of the deity in the mandala of imagination.

original: zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i mngon par byang chub ba lnga'i rim pas sku bskyed pa ni rtag pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i mngon par byang chub ba lnga'i rim pas sku bskyed pa ni rtag pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The yoga of constancy is the generation of the body by the process of the five manifest enlightenments of the moon, vajra and so forth.🔽 The yoga of recitation is the repetition of the mantra of the deity in the heart of the body generated by the process of the five manifest enlightenments.

original: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa 'am zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas sku byung ba gang yin pa de ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa 'am zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas sku byung ba gang yin pa de ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor zhes bya'o //
translated: That which arises as the body by the stage of self-consecration or the stage of union is called the “perfected yoga.”

original: de bas na rnal 'byor gnyis ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag dang gcig ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rnal 'byor gnyis ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag dang gcig ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, two yogas are branches of the stage of generation, and one is a branch of the stage of completion.

original: de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa zhes bya ba'i tshad mas brtags pa dang yongs su dag pa'i dbye bas lha'i sku rnam pa gnyis su bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa zhes bya ba'i tshad mas brtags pa dang yongs su dag pa'i dbye bas lha'i sku rnam pa gnyis su bstan to //
translated: Similarly, the Tantra called Vairochanabhisambodhi teaches two kinds of divine bodies, by the analysis of the authentic and the inauthentic.

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ye shes kyi sku dang rdo rje'i sku sgyu ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i ngo bo yongs su dag pa'i bdag nyid rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ye shes kyi sku dang rdo rje'i sku sgyu ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i ngo bo yongs su dag pa'i bdag nyid rgyas par bstan to //
translated: The passage beginning with “That” extensively teaches the nature of the authentic body of gnosis and the vajra body, which is the nature of illusion, etc., and is the identity of the inseparability of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: yongs su ma dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan ma dang bcas pa sa bon yongs @56a * //
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan ma dang bcas pa sa bon yongs @56a * //
translated: The passage beginning with “The inauthentic” teaches the inauthentic body of form, which is the seed of the body of form, and which is the cause of the authentic body of form.

original: su gyur pa las skyes pa dbyibs dang kha dog la sogs pa dang ldan pa brtags pa'i rnal 'byor rgyas pa bstan to //
analyzed: su gyur pa las skyes pa dbyibs dang kha dog la sogs pa dang ldan pa brtags pa'i rnal 'byor rgyas pa bstan to //
translated: The extensive teaching of the yoga of examination is the arising from the transformation of the form endowed with color, shape, and so on.

original: de la zhes pa ni nges par gzung ba la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes pa ni nges par gzung ba la'o //
translated: There, in that is a specification.

original: rnam pa gnyis ni dbye ba gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ni dbye ba gnyis kyis so //
translated: Two kinds is a twofold division.

original: lha'i gzugs ni rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: lha'i gzugs ni rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i gzugs so //
translated: The form of the deity is the form of Vajradhara and so on.

original: bya ba gnyis ni 'bras bu gnyis 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba gnyis ni 'bras bu gnyis 'grub pa'o //
translated: The two actions are the accomplishment of the two results.

original: mtshan ma bcas pas zhes pa ni rdo rje dang zla ba la sogs pa las skyes pa'i gzugs kyis so //
analyzed: mtshan ma bcas pas zhes pa ni rdo rje dang zla ba la sogs pa las skyes pa'i gzugs kyis so //
translated: The one with signs is the form arisen from the vajra, moon, and so on.

original: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'o zhes pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa ste zhi ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos grub skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'o zhes pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa ste zhi ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos grub skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The one with signs is the one with concepts, and the siddhis having the characteristics of pacification and so on will arise.

original: mtshan ma med pa zhes pa ni ye shes kyi sku'i mtshan nyid dam rdo rje'i sku'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa zhes pa ni ye shes kyi sku'i mtshan nyid dam rdo rje'i sku'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The signless is the characteristic of the jñānakāya or the characteristic of the vajrakāya.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni sgyu ma lta bu dang 'od gsal ba so sor rtog pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos grub 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni sgyu ma lta bu dang 'od gsal ba so sor rtog pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos grub 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The accomplishment of the nature of the illusion-like and the clear light discriminative insight arises from the signless.

original: de bas mtshan ma med pas zhes pa ni 'od gsal pa'i ting nge 'dzin la dmigs nas so //🔽mtshan ma dang bcas pas ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas mtshan ma med pas zhes pa ni 'od gsal pa'i ting nge 'dzin la dmigs nas so // mtshan ma dang bcas pas ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, by the signless means by the clear light samadhi.🔽 The accomplishment of pacification, etc. arises from the signless.

original: de kho na nyid la 'jug pa'i 'bad rtsol med pas zhi ba la sogs pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la 'jug pa'i 'bad rtsol med pas zhi ba la sogs pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the effortless engagement in reality, pacification, etc. are accomplished.

original: brtags pa'i rnal 'byor gyis 'bad rtsol gyis 'grub po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brtags pa'i rnal 'byor gyis 'bad rtsol gyis 'grub po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the investigative yoga is by effort.

original: de bas na rnam pa thams cad du ni rtsol ba thams cad kyis mtshan ma med pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsten par bya ba ni bslab par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na rnam pa thams cad du ni rtsol ba thams cad kyis mtshan ma med pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsten par bya ba ni bslab par bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, in every way, the signless is to be relied upon by all efforts, and the samadhi of the completion stage is to be trained in.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa zhes pa ni ye shes bdud rtsi la sogs pa 'gal ba'i sgra'i sgo nas yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor gyi mtshan nyid can gyi de kho na nyid so sor bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa zhes pa ni ye shes bdud rtsi la sogs pa 'gal ba'i sgra'i sgo nas yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor gyi mtshan nyid can gyi de kho na nyid so sor bstan pas so //
translated: The explanation by the intention is the individual teaching of reality, which has the characteristic of the yoga of the six-branched yoga, by means of the words of contradiction such as the nectar of intuition, and so on.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa gnyis sgom par byed pa'i gnas kyi phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa gnyis sgom par byed pa'i gnas kyi phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, etc. teaches the perfection of the place of the one who meditates on the two stages.

original: drang ba'i don to zhes pa ni skye bos dben pa'i gnas tsam bstan pas so //
analyzed: drang ba'i don to zhes pa ni skye bos dben pa'i gnas tsam bstan pas so //
translated: The interpretable meaning is so because it teaches only the place isolated from people.

original: me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i dgon pa chen po la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i dgon pa chen po la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The great forest is the five intuitions, such as the mirror-intuition, etc.

original: de la gnas nas de thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas nas de thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: One should practice in that place in order to attain that.

original: des pa'i don to zhes pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan pas so //
analyzed: des pa'i don to zhes pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan pas so //
translated: The definitive meaning is so because it teaches the completion stage.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnas bstan par byas nas rim pa gnyis sgom par byed pa'i sgrub pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnas bstan par byas nas rim pa gnyis sgom par byed pa'i sgrub pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: Having taught the place in that way, etc. teaches the practice of the one who meditates on the two stages.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs gang @56b gis sgrub pa de ni sgrub pa ste bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhi dang stong pa bzhi'i bdag nyid can gyi sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs gang @56b gis sgrub pa de ni sgrub pa ste bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhi dang stong pa bzhi'i bdag nyid can gyi sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The practice is that by which the form of the Great Seal is accomplished, which is to say, the stage of the purification of the mind that consists of the four branches of service and so forth and the four emptinesses, which is to say, the meditative concentration called the “stage of purification.”

original: 'dus pa'i rgyud phyi ma la zhes bya ba la sogs pas lung tshad ma nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'dus pa'i rgyud phyi ma la zhes bya ba la sogs pas lung tshad ma nyid bstan to //
translated: The statement “in the Continuation of the Guhyasamaja Tantra” and so forth teaches the validity of the scriptural source.

original: dang po stong pa nyid byang chub ste zhes bya ba ni gnas bzung ba nas don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa'i bar du stong pa zhes bya ba'i yan lag dang po ste bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: dang po stong pa nyid byang chub ste zhes bya ba ni gnas bzung ba nas don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa'i bar du stong pa zhes bya ba'i yan lag dang po ste bsnyen pa'o //
translated: The first is emptiness enlightenment, which is to say, the first branch called “emptiness,” which is to say, the service, from the assumption of the posture up to the meditation on the ultimate mandala.

original: gnyis pa sa bon bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa sa bon bsdus pa'o //
translated: The second is the gathering of the seed.

original: zhes pa ni de'i 'og tu sa bon yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma la sogs pa zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la 'jug ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de'i 'og tu sa bon yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma la sogs pa zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la 'jug ste /
translated: This is to say, after that, the transformation of the seed into the sun and so forth enters the moon mandala,

original: yang yi ge gsum dgod pa'i mtha'i bar du gnyis pa ste nye bar sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: yang yi ge gsum dgod pa'i mtha'i bar du gnyis pa ste nye bar sgrub pa'o //
translated: up to the placement of the three syllables, which is the second, which is to say, the near-accomplishment.

original: yig 'bru las byung ba'i phyag mtshan las skyes pa'i rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes sems dpa' dang / ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' dgod pa dang mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa dang / sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i bar du sku bsgrub pa zhes bya ba yan lag gsum pa de sgrub pa'o //🔽de'i 'og tu phyag rgya legs par sbyangs pa sngon du 'gro bas badzra dhrika ces bya ba la sogs pas phyung ba'i sngags kyis bskyed pa thugs rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa spro ba phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang bzlas pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid lhag ma dkyil
analyzed: yig 'bru las byung ba'i phyag mtshan las skyes pa'i rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes sems dpa' dang / ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' dgod pa dang mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa dang / sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i bar du sku bsgrub pa zhes bya ba yan lag gsum pa de sgrub pa'o // de'i 'og tu phyag rgya legs par sbyangs pa sngon du 'gro bas badzra dhrika ces bya ba la sogs pas phyung ba'i sngags kyis bskyed pa thugs rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa spro ba phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang bzlas pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid lhag ma dkyil
translated: The third branch is the accomplishment of the body, which is the establishment of the gnosis being and the concentration being of Vajradhara born from the insignia arisen from the seed syllable, the consecration of the eyes, and so on, and the consecration of the body, and so on.

original: 'khor rgyal ba mchog dang las kyi rgyal ba mchog ces bya ba /
analyzed: 'khor rgyal ba mchog dang las kyi rgyal ba mchog ces bya ba /
translated: After that, the fourth branch is explained as the great accomplishment, which is the yoga of subtle emanation of Vajradhara and so on, generated by the mantra uttered by vajradhrīka and so on, preceded by the training in the seal, and the remaining characteristics of the mandala of the supreme victor and the supreme victor of action, which are the characteristics of the recitation and so on.

original: yi ge dgod pa ste yan lag bzhi pa sgrub pa chen po zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yi ge dgod pa ste yan lag bzhi pa sgrub pa chen po zhes bshad do //
translated: The fourth branch is the arrangement of the syllables.

original: drang ba'i don to zhes pa ni rdo rje bzhi'i rim pas dang po sbyor ba la sogs pa dang ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi bskyed pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: drang ba'i don to zhes pa ni rdo rje bzhi'i rim pas dang po sbyor ba la sogs pa dang ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi bskyed pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement “interpretable meaning” is because the four vajra stages are taught, such as the first yoga, etc., and the creation stage which is the nature of the three meditative stabilizations.

original: mchog gi sgrub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis stong pa bzhi la dmigs nas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mchog gi sgrub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis stong pa bzhi la dmigs nas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The statement “the supreme accomplishment” and so forth teaches that yogins of the perfection stage, having observed the four emptinesses, will attain the state of Great Vajradhara.

original: brtul zhugs brtan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mchog gi sgrub pa'i rim pas rdo rje bzhi bsgom zhing phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: brtul zhugs brtan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mchog gi sgrub pa'i rim pas rdo rje bzhi bsgom zhing phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The statement “firm observance” and so forth teaches that by meditating on the four vajras through the stages of the supreme accomplishment, one will attain the spiritual power of the great seal.

original: nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba ni sems rnam par dag ba'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba ni sems rnam par dag ba'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: The statement “definitive meaning” is because the stage of the thoroughly pure mind is taught.

original: dus bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pas spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa dang ldan ba'i rnal 'byor @57a * //
analyzed: dus bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pas spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa dang ldan ba'i rnal 'byor @57a * //
translated: The statement “four times” and so forth teaches that yogins who possess elaborate conduct

original: pas lha'i khang pa sum brtsegs kyi 'og tu rnam pa sna tshogs kyi kha zas la sogs pa bzhag ste /
analyzed: pas lha'i khang pa sum brtsegs kyi 'og tu rnam pa sna tshogs kyi kha zas la sogs pa bzhag ste /
translated: Having placed various foods and so forth in the lower story of the celestial mansion,

original: bar khang la rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rol mo mkhan la sogs pa bzhag nas steng khang la stan 'jam po'i 'dug la rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa dam tshig gi phyag rgya dgu spyan ma la sogs pa dang gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i ngang tshul🔽can du byas nas shar la sogs pa'i phyogs bzhi dang mtshams rnams su go rims kyis bkod la reg bya rdo rje ma'i rang bzhin gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya rang gis 'khyud cing rdo rje dang padma legs par sbyangs pa sngon du 'gro bas 'dod pa'i yon
analyzed: bar khang la rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rol mo mkhan la sogs pa bzhag nas steng khang la stan 'jam po'i 'dug la rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa dam tshig gi phyag rgya dgu spyan ma la sogs pa dang gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i ngang tshul can du byas nas shar la sogs pa'i phyogs bzhi dang mtshams rnams su go rims kyis bkod la reg bya rdo rje ma'i rang bzhin gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya rang gis 'khyud cing rdo rje dang padma legs par sbyangs pa sngon du 'gro bas 'dod pa'i yon
translated: having placed various musicians and so forth in the middle story, and having placed the seat in the upper story, one should be adorned with all ornaments, and having made oneself into the nature of Locanā and so forth, the nine pledge seals, and Rūpavajrā and so forth,

original: tan lnga myong zhing snyoms par 'jug pa'i dbang gis bde ba chen po mngon du byas la /
analyzed: tan lnga myong zhing snyoms par 'jug pa'i dbang gis bde ba chen po mngon du byas la /
translated: one should arrange them in the four directions and the four intermediate directions beginning with the east, and having embraced with the pledge seal that is the nature of Sparśavajrā, and having purified the vajra and lotus, one should experience the five sensual qualities and actualize great bliss through the power of meditative concentration.

original: ji srid tshe 'di nyid du yun ring ma yin pas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ba de srid du gnas par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ji srid tshe 'di nyid du yun ring ma yin pas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ba de srid du gnas par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: One should remain for as long as it takes to attain the power of Great Vajradhara, since this life is not long.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas yo byad phun sum tshogs pa dang bcas pa'i lha mo dgu legs par bslabs pa dang lhan cig tu spyod pa brtson pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas dus kyi dbye bas dngos grub thob pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas yo byad phun sum tshogs pa dang bcas pa'i lha mo dgu legs par bslabs pa dang lhan cig tu spyod pa brtson pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas dus kyi dbye bas dngos grub thob pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, etc. shows that the adept who is diligent in practice, together with nine well-trained goddesses who have the perfect requisites, will attain power according to the division of time.

original: dbang po rab kyis zhes pa ni rin po che lta bu'i gang zag gis zhag bdun gyis dngos grub thob par bstan to //🔽dbang po 'bring ni padma lta bu ste des zla phyed kyis so //
analyzed: dbang po rab kyis zhes pa ni rin po che lta bu'i gang zag gis zhag bdun gyis dngos grub thob par bstan to // dbang po 'bring ni padma lta bu ste des zla phyed kyis so //
translated: The best faculties are the person who is like a jewel, who is shown to attain power in seven days.🔽The middling faculties are like a lotus, who attains in a fortnight.

original: dbang po tha ma ni padma dkar po dang autpala lta bu ste de dag gis zla ba 'am zla ba phyed dang gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: dbang po tha ma ni padma dkar po dang autpala lta bu ste de dag gis zla ba 'am zla ba phyed dang gnyis kyis so //
translated: The lowest faculties are like a white lotus or a blue lotus, who attain in a month or a month and a half.

original: bems po'i rigs can gyi tsandan gang yin pa des dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa'am sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pas dngos grub lo gcig la sogs pas thob pa yin gyi de med pas 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bems po'i rigs can gyi tsandan gang yin pa des dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa'am sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pas dngos grub lo gcig la sogs pas thob pa yin gyi de med pas 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The sandalwood type who is an inanimate being will attain power in a year, etc. by meeting a spiritual friend or by the Buddha's blessing, but not without that.🔽The person called sandalwood

original: thos pa nyung ba nga rgyal can //
analyzed: thos pa nyung ba nga rgyal can //
translated: is one who has little learning and pride,

original: rtsa ba med par mang po smra //
analyzed: rtsa ba med par mang po smra //
translated: who speaks much without a basis,

original: rjes su gzung bar mi nus pa //🔽tsandan zhes bya'i gang zag go //
analyzed: rjes su gzung bar mi nus pa // tsandan zhes bya'i gang zag go //
translated: and who cannot be guided.🔽The phrase in a year, etc. means in a year, two years, three years, four years, or five years.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The phrase in a year, etc. means in a year, two years, three years, four years, or five years.🔽The phrase in a year, etc. means in a year, two years, three years, four years, or five years.🔽The phrase in a year, etc. means in a year, two years, three years, four years, or five years.🔽The phrase in a year, etc. means in a year, two years, three years, four years, or five years.

original: 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i dus kyi dbye bas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //🔽rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la dus kyi nges pa med do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i dus kyi dbye bas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //🔽rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la dus kyi nges pa med do zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase in a year, etc. means in a year, two years, three years, four years, or five years.🔽The phrase in a year, etc. means in a year, two years, three years, four years, or five years.🔽The phrase in a year, etc. means in a year, two years, three years, four years, or five years.🔽The phrase in a year, etc. means in a year, two years, three years, four years, or five years.🔽The phrase in a year, etc. means in a year, two years, three years, four years, or five years.🔽The phrase in a year, etc. means in a year, two years, three years, four years, or five years.🔽The phrase in a year, etc. means in a year, two years, three years, four years, or five years.🔽The phrase in a year, etc. means in a year, two years, three years, four years, or five years.🔽The phrase in a year, etc. means in a year, two years, three years, four years, or five years.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni dus @57b kyi dbye bas dngos grub tsam bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni dus @57b kyi dbye bas dngos grub tsam bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Just as the words” means that the mere power is taught by the division of time.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i zhes pa ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i zhes pa ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: “Conventional and ultimate” means the characteristics of eternalism and nihilism.

original: de gnyis kyi nang ni bar te zhes pa ni de dag gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi nang ni bar te zhes pa ni de dag gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: “The middle between those two” means the samādhi of union, which has the characteristic of the nonduality of those two.

original: de dag la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the yogin who abides in those will attain the power of the great seal.

original: de yang dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pas ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pas ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pas gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, that is taught by Akṣhobhya and so on, the tathāgatas of the three times.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i sgra'i sgo nas de kho na nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i sgra'i sgo nas de kho na nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: “Explained with an intention” means that reality is taught by means of contradictory words.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i rim pas zhes bya ba ni bsnyen pa la sogs pa yan lag bzhi'i bsgom pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i rim pas zhes bya ba ni bsnyen pa la sogs pa yan lag bzhi'i bsgom pa'i rim pas so //
translated: “By the just-mentioned process” means by the process of cultivating the four branches, such as the approach.

original: sgrub par 'dod pa'i rtsol ba byed pas so //
analyzed: sgrub par 'dod pa'i rtsol ba byed pas so //
translated: because of the effort to accomplish it.

original: sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa la brten pa'o //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa la brten pa'o //
translated: The consecration of the body, etc. is based on Vairochana, etc.

original: sngon du 'gro ba ni sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa sngon du 'gro bas so //
analyzed: sngon du 'gro ba ni sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa sngon du 'gro bas so //
translated: The preliminary is the consecration of the body, etc. as a preliminary.

original: 'jug pa ni rnal 'byor chen po'i mthar dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog dang las kyi rgyal ba mchog bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni rnal 'byor chen po'i mthar dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog dang las kyi rgyal ba mchog bsgom pa'o //
translated: The entrance is the meditation on the mandala of the supreme victor and the mandala of the supreme victor of action at the end of the great yoga.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: sgrub pa po sku zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor dang shin tu rnal 'byor gyi mthar le'u drug pa nas gsungs pa'i yi ge gsum mgo bo dang lkog ma dang snying ga'i phyogs su zla ba dang padma dang
analyzed: sgrub pa po sku zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor dang shin tu rnal 'byor gyi mthar le'u drug pa nas gsungs pa'i yi ge gsum mgo bo dang lkog ma dang snying ga'i phyogs su zla ba dang padma dang
translated: The practitioner, having consecrated the body, etc., etc.🔽 The yogis of Great Vajradhara, etc. having arranged the three syllables taught in the sixth chapter at the head, throat, and heart, in the places of the moon, lotus, and vajra, respectively,

original: rdo rje'i stang du rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bkod nas /
analyzed: rdo rje'i stang du rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bkod nas /
translated: at the end of the yoga, subsequent yoga, and true yoga, should meditate on the supreme mandala of the supreme victor and the supreme mandala of the supreme victor of action.🔽 🔽The supreme mandala of the supreme victor is the mandala of the supreme victor of the great yoga.

original: de las byung ba'i 'od zer yongs su gyur pa las spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo'i tshogs spros la /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i 'od zer yongs su gyur pa las spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo'i tshogs spros la /
translated: The light rays that emerge from that completely transform into a host of goddesses such as Locanā and so forth.

original: 'og min gyi gnas la sogs pa na bzhugs pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs tshogs pa'i tshig snyan pas mgu bar byas la des kyang lag pa'i zhags pas dgug cing /
analyzed: 'og min gyi gnas la sogs pa na bzhugs pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs tshogs pa'i tshig snyan pas mgu bar byas la des kyang lag pa'i zhags pas dgug cing /
translated: They are pleased by the sweet words of the assembly of Vairocana and so forth who reside in the Akaniṣṭha realm and so forth. They also summon them with the noose in their hands.

original: gzhal yas khang pa'i shar phyogs kyi sgo'i mdun du padma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bzhugs su gsol la /🔽tshigs su bcad pa drug po 'dis gsol ba 'debs shing mchod par byas la spyan ma la sogs pa dang de dang lhan cig tu aom la sogs pa la 'jug cing /
analyzed: gzhal yas khang pa'i shar phyogs kyi sgo'i mdun du padma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bzhugs su gsol la / tshigs su bcad pa drug po 'dis gsol ba 'debs shing mchod par byas la spyan ma la sogs pa dang de dang lhan cig tu aom la sogs pa la 'jug cing /
translated: They are invited to reside on a lotus and moon seat in front of the eastern door of the celestial mansion.🔽One should supplicate and make offerings with these six verses. Locanā and so forth enter into the oṃ and so forth.

original: le'u bdun pa las gsungs pa'i //
analyzed: le'u bdun pa las gsungs pa'i //
translated: One should perform the pride with these three verses from the seventh chapter:

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku gang yin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku gang yin //
translated: “That which is the body of all buddhas🔽is the nature of Vajrasattva.”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs @58a * //🔽pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis nga rgyal byas la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs @58a * //🔽pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis nga rgyal byas la /
translated: and so forth.

original: le'u drug pa nas gsungs pa'i aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: le'u drug pa nas gsungs pa'i aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
translated: One should stabilize with the three mantras beginning with “Oṃ sarvatathāgata kāya vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ,” as taught in chapter six.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngags gsum gyis brtan par bya'o zhes dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag tu gyur pas rnal 'byor chen po bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngags gsum gyis brtan par bya'o zhes dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag tu gyur pas rnal 'byor chen po bstan to //
translated: Thus, the great yoga is taught as a branch of the first yoga samādhi.

original: tshigs su bcad pa dang pos dbus kyi gtso bo la gsol ba 'debs pa dang / gnyis pas de'i 'khor du gyur pa zhes sprul pa'i sku la khyad par ro //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa dang pos dbus kyi gtso bo la gsol ba 'debs pa dang / gnyis pas de'i 'khor du gyur pa zhes sprul pa'i sku la khyad par ro //
translated: The first verse is a supplication to the central principal, and the second is to the retinue surrounding him. Thus, there is a distinction in the nirmāṇakāya.

original: de bzhin du gzhan ma gnyis po la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan ma gnyis po la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand the other two.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa nges par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa nges par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, etc. teaches that one should definitely perform the consecration of the body, etc.

original: dbyer med pa zhes pa ni bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa dag dbyer med pas so //
analyzed: dbyer med pa zhes pa ni bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa dag dbyer med pas so //
translated: “Inseparable” means that the object of meditation and the meditator are inseparable.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnal 'byor pa gnyis po'i yang dbyer med pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnal 'byor pa gnyis po'i yang dbyer med pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, etc. shows the inseparability of the two yogis.

original: man ngag ma thob pas zhes pa ni bla ma'i zhal gyi lung ma rnyed pas so //
analyzed: man ngag ma thob pas zhes pa ni bla ma'i zhal gyi lung ma rnyed pas so //
translated: Not having obtained the esoteric instructions means not having obtained the guru's oral instructions.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs byin gyis brlab pa dang tha dad par rtog na zhes bya ba 'di sku rdo rje la sogs pa 'di dag tha dad pa yin la bdag kyang tha dad pa yin no zhes rtog pa ni bsam par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs byin gyis brlab pa dang tha dad par rtog na zhes bya ba 'di sku rdo rje la sogs pa 'di dag tha dad pa yin la bdag kyang tha dad pa yin no zhes rtog pa ni bsam par byed pa'o //
translated: If one conceives the consecration of body, speech, and mind as separate, this means that one thinks, These vajra body, etc. are separate, and I am also separate.

original: bdag ni de'i rang bzhin yin no zhes mi rtog na de'i tshe rdzogs pa'i rim pa las ring du 'gyur ba zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgom pas dus zad cing nam yang rdzogs pa'i rim pa thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: bdag ni de'i rang bzhin yin no zhes mi rtog na de'i tshe rdzogs pa'i rim pa las ring du 'gyur ba zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgom pas dus zad cing nam yang rdzogs pa'i rim pa thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: If one does not conceive I am of their nature, then at that time one is far from the completion stage, meaning that one's time is spent meditating on the generation stage, and one will never attain the completion stage.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: This is because the completion stage is the nature of nonduality.

original: don 'di la som nyi ma byed cig ces bya ba 'dis yang dag par bsgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: don 'di la som nyi ma byed cig ces bya ba 'dis yang dag par bsgrub pa bstan to //
translated: In this matter, do not have doubt - by this he teaches the accomplishment.

original: gsungs pa'o zhes bya bas nye bar bsdus ba bstan to //
analyzed: gsungs pa'o zhes bya bas nye bar bsdus ba bstan to //
translated: The word says teaches the summary.

original: le'u'i don gyi nges pa'i tshig bstan pa'i phyir sku rdo rje la sogs pa'o zhes smos te rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: le'u'i don gyi nges pa'i tshig bstan pa'i phyir sku rdo rje la sogs pa'o zhes smos te rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the chapter, he says Vajra Body, etc. - Vairochana, etc.

original: de rnams kyis mi phyed pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis mi phyed pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: Their indivisible nature is the cause of generation.

original: sbyor ba bzhi ni zhes pa la dang po sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sbyor ba bzhi ni zhes pa la dang po sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The four yogas - the characteristic of the first yoga.

original: sbyor ba bzhi po de nyid ting nge 'dzin gang gis mnyam par byas pas na zhes pa ni rtogs par 'gyur zhing nges par byas pa ste gzhung gi tshogs so //
analyzed: sbyor ba bzhi po de nyid ting nge 'dzin gang gis mnyam par byas pas na zhes pa ni rtogs par 'gyur zhing nges par byas pa ste gzhung gi tshogs so //
translated: By which samādhi those four yogas are made equal, he says realized and ascertained - the collection of texts.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na zhes pa la rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis nges par bsgrub par byas pas so //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na zhes pa la rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis nges par bsgrub par byas pas so //
translated: Because it is the nature of what is to be accomplished, he says definitely accomplished by the yogis.

original: des ni bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i @58b mtshan nyid can le'u'i brjod par bya ba'i don bstan to //
analyzed: des ni bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i @58b mtshan nyid can le'u'i brjod par bya ba'i don bstan to //
translated: This indicates the topic of the chapter, which is characterized by the approach, and so forth.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa theb par byed pas na zhes bya ba 'dis phyag rgya chen po yongs su 'gyur ba dang yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor yang bstan to //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa theb par byed pas na zhes bya ba 'dis phyag rgya chen po yongs su 'gyur ba dang yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor yang bstan to //
translated: Since it causes the attainment of the completion stage, this also indicates the transformation of the great seal and the yoga of the six-branched yoga.

original: rab tu bshad pa'o zhes pa ni gsal bar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu bshad pa'o zhes pa ni gsal bar bshad pa'o //
translated: The thorough explanation is the clear explanation.

original: gzhung gi tshogs ni tshig gi tshogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhung gi tshogs ni tshig gi tshogs zhes bya'o //
translated: The collection of texts is called the collection of words.

original: 'o na brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i le'u yin na ji ltar gzhung gi tshogs su bshad ces smras pa /
analyzed: 'o na brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i le'u yin na ji ltar gzhung gi tshogs su bshad ces smras pa /
translated: If it is a chapter of the expressed and the expresser, then how is it explained as the collection of texts? It is said:

original: so so'i ming la ltos pas na //
analyzed: so so'i ming la ltos pas na //
translated: Since it depends on individual names,

original: zhes pa ni rjod par byed pa las brjod par bya ba logs su brtags te gzhung gi tshogs ni le'u zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rjod par byed pa las brjod par bya ba logs su brtags te gzhung gi tshogs ni le'u zhes bya'o //
translated: The collection of texts is called a chapter, since the expressed is distinguished from the expresser.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i bdag nyid kyi dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs gcig rnal 'byor chen po so sor bstan pas so //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i bdag nyid kyi dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs gcig rnal 'byor chen po so sor bstan pas so //
translated: The just as the words is the great yoga, which is one part of the first concentration, the consecration of the body, etc. , and is taught separately.

original: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa'i 'grel ba'i t'i k'a las le'u bcu gnyis pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /🔽// / rim pa gnyis la bslab pa la //
