analyzed: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa'i 'grel ba'i t'i k'a las le'u bcu gnyis pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o / // / rim pa gnyis la bslab pa la //
translated: This concludes the commentary on the twelfth chapter of the Illuminating Lamp commentary.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u bcu gsum pa'i bshad pa brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u bcu gsum pa'i bshad pa brtsam par bya ste /
translated: The thirteenth chapter is begun with the words In the training in the two stages, etc.

original: de'i don re zhig rim pa gnyis po le'u bcu gnyis kyis khong du chud par byas so //
analyzed: de'i don re zhig rim pa gnyis po le'u bcu gnyis kyis khong du chud par byas so //
translated: The meaning of that is that the two stages are understood by the twelfth chapter.

original: de rtogs pas rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i gtso bor rnal 'byor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rtogs pas rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i gtso bor rnal 'byor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By understanding that, one becomes a yogi, the principal one for the perfection of one's own aim.

original: de grub pas gzhan gyi don nges par bya'o zhes de'i don du zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs sgrub pa'i don dang ldan pa'i le'u bcu gsum pa bstan to //
analyzed: de grub pas gzhan gyi don nges par bya'o zhes de'i don du zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs sgrub pa'i don dang ldan pa'i le'u bcu gsum pa bstan to //
translated: By accomplishing that, one should definitely accomplish the aim of others. For that purpose, the thirteenth chapter is taught, which has the meaning of accomplishing the collection of pacifying, etc. rites.

original: gdul bya'i skye bo rnams zhes pa ni nad pa dang dbul po dang chags pa 'dod pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la gnod pa byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo rnams zhes pa ni nad pa dang dbul po dang chags pa 'dod pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la gnod pa byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The beings to be tamed are the sick, the poor, the lustful, and those who harm the Three Jewels, and so on.

original: de rnams mos par byed pa'i phyir ni de rnams la zhi ba la sogs pa byed pas 'dul ba grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams mos par byed pa'i phyir ni de rnams la zhi ba la sogs pa byed pas 'dul ba grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to inspire them means in order to tame them by means of pacifying, and so on, for the sake of accomplishing their aims.

original: bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i cho ga'i 'og tu'o zhes pa ni bsnyen pa la sogs pa yan lag bzhi ni bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / so sor sdud pa la sogs pa yan lag drug ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i cho ga'i 'og tu'o zhes pa ni bsnyen pa la sogs pa yan lag bzhi ni bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / so sor sdud pa la sogs pa yan lag drug ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: After the rites of approach and so on means that the four branches of approach and so on are the stage of development, and the six branches of withdrawal and so on are the stage of completion.

original: de rnams kyi cho ga ni ji lta ba bzhin du bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi cho ga ni ji lta ba bzhin du bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Their rites are their proper practices.

original: de'i 'og tu ni so sor bstan pa'i 'og tu'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni so sor bstan pa'i 'og tu'o //
translated: After that means after the individual explanations.

original: 'dod pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa zhes pa ni brgyad de sngar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa zhes pa ni brgyad de sngar bshad pa'o //
translated: The eight, such as the lord of desire, and so on, are as previously explained.

original: ldan pa ni de'i 'brel pa dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: ldan pa ni de'i 'brel pa dang ldan pas so //
translated: Endowed means connected with them.

original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa zhes pa ni dri ba po @59a * //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa zhes pa ni dri ba po @59a * //
translated: Akshobhya and so on are the questioners.

original: rnams so // gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: rnams so // gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: Nondual intuition is the reality called “union.”

original: gtso bo yin pas na zhes pa ni rim pa thams cad kyi 'bras bu yin pa ste de thob pa 'am 'dzin pas de skad ces bya'o //🔽zhi ba la sogs pa zhes pa nad pa la sogs pa'i sems can rnams la de dag bsgrub pa'i don du brtson pa'o zhes pa ni rtsol ba dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gtso bo yin pas na zhes pa ni rim pa thams cad kyi 'bras bu yin pa ste de thob pa 'am 'dzin pas de skad ces bya'o // zhi ba la sogs pa zhes pa nad pa la sogs pa'i sems can rnams la de dag bsgrub pa'i don du brtson pa'o zhes pa ni rtsol ba dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Since it is primary, it is the result of all the stages. It is so called because it is attained or held.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnams thugs rje chen po'i ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnams thugs rje chen po'i ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: “ Striving for the sake of sentient beings who are to be trained in peace, etc.,” means that the Blessed Ones are endowed with striving, since they are the essence of great compassion.

original: sa'i snying po zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa rang rang gi phyag rgya dang ldan pa sa'i snying po la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang la mchod pa'i tshogs kyis mchod cing 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bstan to
analyzed: sa'i snying po zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa rang rang gi phyag rgya dang ldan pa sa'i snying po la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang la mchod pa'i tshogs kyis mchod cing 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bstan to
translated: The passage beginning with “the heart of the earth” and ending with “the Blessed Vajradhara” shows that the Blessed Ones are worshipped with the host of offerings by the heart of the earth, etc., who are endowed with their own seals, such as Rūpavajrā, etc., and that they are addressed with the words “Thus have I heard.”

original: // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs la bzhugs pas ni zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin sems can thams cad kyi yid la zhugs pas so //
analyzed: // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs la bzhugs pas ni zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin sems can thams cad kyi yid la zhugs pas so //
translated: The phrase because it resides in the mind of all tathāgatas means that it is the nature of all tathāgatas, which is present in the minds of all sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa dang mkha' spyod la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa dang mkha' spyod la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase mundane and supramundane refers to the peaceful and so forth and the celestial and so forth.

original: yang dag par sbyin pa zhes pa ni de rnams ster ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sbyin pa zhes pa ni de rnams ster ba'o //
translated: The phrase it is the perfect bestower means that it bestows those.

original: thogs pa med pa'i nus pa dang ldan pas zhes pa ni nus pa ma nyams pas so //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i nus pa dang ldan pas zhes pa ni nus pa ma nyams pas so //
translated: The phrase it is endowed with unimpeded power means that it is not deficient in power.

original: bden pa gnyis yongs su mkhyen pas na zhes pa ni bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can gyi zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa mngon du mdzad pas so //🔽phyi'i ni mchod pa rnam pa lnga la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis yongs su mkhyen pas na zhes pa ni bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can gyi zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa mngon du mdzad pas so // phyi'i ni mchod pa rnam pa lnga la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase because it thoroughly knows the two truths means that it actualizes the stage of union, which is the nature of the two truths.🔽The external is the five types of offerings and so forth.

original: nang gi ni bdud rtsi lnga dang lcags kyu la sogs pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi ni bdud rtsi lnga dang lcags kyu la sogs pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The internal is the five nectars, the hook and so forth, and the meditative equipoise and so forth.

original: de rnams kyis mchod nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de rnams kyis mchod nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of having made offerings to them is that.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni gsol ba gang gdab pa tsam bstan pas so //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni gsol ba gang gdab pa tsam bstan pas so //
translated: The phrase in accordance with the words is because [the chapter] teaches only the supplication.

original: so sor sdud pa la sogs pa yan lag drug gi sbyor ba'o zhes pa ni le'u bcu gnyis pa las mtshan nyid bshad ba'o //
analyzed: so sor sdud pa la sogs pa yan lag drug gi sbyor ba'o zhes pa ni le'u bcu gnyis pa las mtshan nyid bshad ba'o //
translated: The phrase the yoga of the six-branched yoga of withdrawal, and so on is the explanation of the characteristics in chapter 12.

original: rdo rje bzhi las 'das pas na //
analyzed: rdo rje bzhi las 'das pas na //
translated: Because it is beyond the four vajras,

original: zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa rdo rje bzhi brtags pa yin pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa rdo rje bzhi brtags pa yin pas so //
translated: the yoga of the six-branched yoga is the investigation of the four vajras, which are branches of the stage of generation.

original: yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor ni de las 'das pa ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i yan lag yin pas so //
analyzed: yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor ni de las 'das pa ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i yan lag yin pas so //
translated: The yoga of the six-branched yoga is beyond that, because it is a branch of the stage of completion.

original: bden pa gnyis bsres pa la zhes pa ni de'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba yan lag drug pa zung du 'jug @59b pa'i rang bzhin la'o //🔽yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis bsres pa la zhes pa ni de'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba yan lag drug pa zung du 'jug @59b pa'i rang bzhin la'o // yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The phrase in the mixture of the two truths is in the concentration called the result of that, which is the nature of the union of the six-branched yoga.

original: zhes pa ni byang chub thob par byed pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni byang chub thob par byed pas so //
translated: The phrase the yoga of the six-branched yoga is because it causes the attainment of enlightenment.

original: bden pa gnyis nges par sbyar ro zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa lnga ste rim pa thams cad de nyid 'dus pas so //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis nges par sbyar ro zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa lnga ste rim pa thams cad de nyid 'dus pas so //
translated: The phrase the two truths are definitely joined refers to the fivefold union, since all the stages are included in that.

original: phul du byung ba ni 'bras bur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: phul du byung ba ni 'bras bur gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase the best means the result.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung zhes pa ni drang ba dang nges pa'i don la sogs pa'i dbye bas gnas pa de rnams kyi don bsdus pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa yin pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung zhes pa ni drang ba dang nges pa'i don la sogs pa'i dbye bas gnas pa de rnams kyi don bsdus pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa yin pas so //
translated: The phrase of all the tathagatas refers to the speech of all the tathagatas, which is the collection of the meanings of those that abide by way of the divisions of interpretable meaning and definitive meaning, since the stage of union is their collection.

original: rgyu'i zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan nas 'bras bu'i zung du 'jug pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu'i zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan nas 'bras bu'i zung du 'jug pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having explained the causal stage of union, in order to explain the resultant stage of union,

original: bden pa gnyis zhes smos te ;
analyzed: bden pa gnyis zhes smos te ;
translated: he says, the two truths,

original: chos can dang chos nyid kyi dbye bas gnas pas so //
analyzed: chos can dang chos nyid kyi dbye bas gnas pas so //
translated: which abide by way of the divisions of the basis of imputation and the imputed,🔽are made one,

original: gcig tu byas pa'o zhes pa ni 'bras bu'i tshul du dbyer med pa yongs su shes pas so //
analyzed: gcig tu byas pa'o zhes pa ni 'bras bu'i tshul du dbyer med pa yongs su shes pas so //
translated: since they are completely known as inseparable in the manner of the result.

original: de bas na mi slob pa'i lam gyi ngo bo yin pas na spros pa rnams dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na mi slob pa'i lam gyi ngo bo yin pas na spros pa rnams dang bral ba'o //
translated: Therefore, since it is the entity of the path of no learning, it is free from elaborations.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so zhes pa ni sngags kyi sku yin pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so zhes pa ni sngags kyi sku yin pas so //
translated: The Tathagatas are the mantra body.

original: de bzhin du de ltar gyur na yang rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas byang chub ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa'i thabs ni rgyur gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du de ltar gyur na yang rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas byang chub ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa'i thabs ni rgyur gyur pa ste /
translated: Similarly, even though it is so, the means for attaining the state of Great Vajradhara is the cause, from the point of view of purification.

original: yan lag drug pa'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag drug pa'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa'o //
translated: The six-limbed yoga, etc.

original: nyan thos pa la sogs pas mi shigs pa'i phyir te zhes pa ni mi brtan pa'i phyir de nyid mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos pa la sogs pas mi shigs pa'i phyir te zhes pa ni mi brtan pa'i phyir de nyid mi phyed pa'o //
translated: It is indivisible because it cannot be destroyed by the Sravakas, etc.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i sgra'i sgo nas de kho na nyid so sor bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i sgra'i sgo nas de kho na nyid so sor bstan pas so //
translated: It is taught with a hidden meaning, because the reality is taught individually by means of contradictory words.

original: dbyangs de nyid bstan pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas gzod ma nas zhi ba zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dbyangs de nyid bstan pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas gzod ma nas zhi ba zhes bstan to //
translated: In order to teach that very sound, it is taught that it is primordially peaceful, because it has the nature of emptiness.

original: phung po la sogs pa zhes pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams la'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa zhes pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams la'o //
translated: The aggregates, etc. are the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields.

original: de ltar 'gyur na yang rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas byang chub thob par byed pa ni rdo rje 'chang thob pa'i rgyur gyur pas so //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur na yang rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas byang chub thob par byed pa ni rdo rje 'chang thob pa'i rgyur gyur pas so //
translated: Even though it is so, it is the cause of attaining Vajradhara because it causes the attainment of enlightenment by way of the pure.

original: phul du byung zhing khyad par du 'phags par zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: phul du byung zhing khyad par du 'phags par zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: Excellent and exalted means by the nature of the pure self.

original: brtag pa dang bral ba zhes pa ni phung po la sogs pa 'di yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa'i blo dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: brtag pa dang bral ba zhes pa ni phung po la sogs pa 'di yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa'i blo dang bral ba'o //
translated: Free from conceptualization means free from the conceptual mind that thinks this is the aggregates, etc.,.

original: ma brtags na nyams dga' ba tsam du yod pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin yongs su ma dpyad par brtag pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma brtags na nyams dga' ba tsam du yod pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin yongs su ma dpyad par brtag pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said to be merely existing as delightful when not examined because it exists as a conceptualization when the nature of things is not analyzed.

original: yan lag drug gi sbyor ba'i thabs kyis ni mchog gi bsnyen pa'i mtshan @60a * //
analyzed: yan lag drug gi sbyor ba'i thabs kyis ni mchog gi bsnyen pa'i mtshan @60a * //
translated: By the method of the yoga of the six limbs, the nature of the supreme service is

original: nyid kyis so //
analyzed: nyid kyis so //
translated: the supreme service.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i skye bar zhes pa ni dpal rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang de'i dus su thob par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i skye bar zhes pa ni dpal rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang de'i dus su thob par gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is said that the birth of Vajrasattva is the attainment of the state of glorious Vajradhara at that time.

original: ngo mtshar che'o zhes pa ni spros pa med pa'i de kho na nyid las kyang rdo rje 'chang gi sku bskyed pa'i phyir ro //🔽de'ang / ji ltar chu klung dang ba las //
analyzed: ngo mtshar che'o zhes pa ni spros pa med pa'i de kho na nyid las kyang rdo rje 'chang gi sku bskyed pa'i phyir ro // de'ang / ji ltar chu klung dang ba las //
translated: The words how wonderful! are because the body of Vajradhara is generated from the reality free from conceptual elaboration.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas gtan la phab pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas gtan la phab pa'o //
translated: And that is determined by just as from clear water... and so forth.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni shin tu gsang ba'i de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni shin tu gsang ba'i de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
translated: The words non-intentional explanation are because the extremely secret reality is taught.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstod pa'i 'og tu gsol ba gdab pa bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstod pa'i 'og tu gsol ba gdab pa bstan te /
translated: Thus, etc. indicates the supplication after the praise.

original: a'a li k'a li las byung ba rnams so zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i rim pas dbyangs dang gsal byed las 'byung ba ste snying po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li las byung ba rnams so zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i rim pas dbyangs dang gsal byed las 'byung ba ste snying po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Arisen from the vowels and consonants means arisen from the vowels and consonants in the sequence explained above, i.e., the essence mantras, etc.

original: de gang du bsags shing bsdus pa ni zhes pa la bud med la sogs pa'i dbye bas a'a li k'a li'i yi ge gsum la bsdus par gyur pa la'o //
analyzed: de gang du bsags shing bsdus pa ni zhes pa la bud med la sogs pa'i dbye bas a'a li k'a li'i yi ge gsum la bsdus par gyur pa la'o //
translated: Where they are collected and gathered, etc. means that they are collected in the three syllables of the vowels and consonants by the division of women, etc.

original: don yod grub pa'i bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: don yod grub pa'i bzlas pa'o //
translated: It is the recitation of Amoghasiddhi.

original: zhes pa ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rdo rje bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rdo rje bzlas pa'o //
translated: This is the vajra repetition of the characteristics of entering and so forth.

original: bla na med pa'i ye shes zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i ye shes zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: The unsurpassed intuition is clearlight transparency.

original: de ma ning gi bzlas pa'i dus su thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ma ning gi bzlas pa'i dus su thob par byed pa'o //
translated: It is to be attained at the time of the neuter repetition.

original: de yi ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i'o //
analyzed: de yi ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i'o //
translated: That is of Great Vajradhara.

original: 'jug pa la sogs pa ldang ba dang 'jug pa dang gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa la sogs pa ldang ba dang 'jug pa dang gnas pa'o //
translated: Entering and so forth are the arising, entering, and abiding.

original: tshul gyis ni 'jug pa'i gnas dang rgyu ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: tshul gyis ni 'jug pa'i gnas dang rgyu ba'i gnas so //
translated: By the method is the abiding of entering and the abiding of moving.

original: gang gi phyir 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pas sems rtse gcig pa nyid thob pas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang mngon du byed par 'gyur ro //🔽de nyid kyi khyad par bstan pa ni zhes pa nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pas sems rtse gcig pa nyid thob pas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang mngon du byed par 'gyur ro // de nyid kyi khyad par bstan pa ni zhes pa nas /
translated: Because by the process of entering and so forth, one attains the one-pointed mind and realizes the state of Great Vajradhara.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa yongs su shes //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa yongs su shes //
translated: The distinctive feature of that is taught beginning with “The vajra repetition is known” and ending with “The vajra repetition is known.”

original: zhes pa'i bar du stobs bcu la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dang ldan pa sgrub pa po rnams 'gyur ba dang de bzhin du 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlab pa dang sbrul la sogs pa'i sngags
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du stobs bcu la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dang ldan pa sgrub pa po rnams 'gyur ba dang de bzhin du 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlab pa dang sbrul la sogs pa'i sngags
translated: Up to this point, the practitioner who possesses the qualities of the Buddha, such as the ten powers, is transformed.🔽Likewise, through the stages of engaging and so on, all tathāgatas bless the practitioner, and the mantras of emanation and so on are recited.🔽

original: kyi tshogs kyis brjod par bya ba sku rdo rje la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang / de slob par byed pa rnams kyis kyang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes thob pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: kyi tshogs kyis brjod par bya ba sku rdo rje la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang / de slob par byed pa rnams kyis kyang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes thob pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Up to this point, the practitioner who is endowed with the qualities of the Buddha, such as the ten powers, is transformed. And likewise, by the stages of engagement and so forth, he is blessed by all the Tathagatas. And the assembly of mantras, such as the mantra of the emanation and so forth, which are to be recited, are the nature of the Tathagatas, such as Vajra Body and so forth. And those who train in them are shown to attain nondual gnosis.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes pa ni nam mkha'i khams dang 'dra bsgrib pa med pas so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes pa ni nam mkha'i khams dang 'dra bsgrib pa med pas so //
translated: The ultimate truth is like the element of space, because it is free from obscuration.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o zhes pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o zhes pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The conventional truth is conceptual.

original: gnyi ga de dag gis rdzogs pa ni bcom @60b ldan 'das zung du 'jug pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga de dag gis rdzogs pa ni bcom @60b ldan 'das zung du 'jug pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: The perfection of both of those is the Bhagavat, who is called the Vajrasattva of union.

original: zhi ba la sogs pa'i bya ba zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis kyis bshad par 'gyur ba bskyed pa ni de mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa'i bya ba zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis kyis bshad par 'gyur ba bskyed pa ni de mdzad pa'o //
translated: The performance of pacifying and so on is the performance of the two stages, which will be explained.

original: dban du gyur pa ma yin pa'i zhes pa ni dkon mchog gsum la gnod par byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dban du gyur pa ma yin pa'i zhes pa ni dkon mchog gsum la gnod par byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The not-to-be-done is the harm to the Three Jewels and so on.

original: mngon spyod la sogs pa'i las kyi spyod pa ni thugs rje chen pos gsod pa gang yin pa de sprul par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: mngon spyod la sogs pa'i las kyi spyod pa ni thugs rje chen pos gsod pa gang yin pa de sprul par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The performance of the action of killing and so on is the performance of the emanation of the great compassion that kills.

original: tshangs pa la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje 'chang chen po thams cad kyi mchog nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: tshangs pa la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje 'chang chen po thams cad kyi mchog nyid du bstan to //
translated: The Brahma and so on indicates that Great Vajradhara is the supreme of all.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal to zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal to zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, the Blessed One spoke.

original: sbrul la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags thams cad kyi snying por gyur pa'i yi ge gsum 'jug pa la sogs pa gsum gyi rim pas bzlas pa'i cho ga gsungs so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sbrul la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags thams cad kyi snying por gyur pa'i yi ge gsum 'jug pa la sogs pa gsum gyi rim pas bzlas pa'i cho ga gsungs so zhes bstan to //
translated: The snake and so on indicates that the three-syllable mantra, which is the essence of all mantras, is taught as the rite of recitation by the process of the three, the entry and so on.

original: de rnam par dbye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas dgongs pas bshad pa'i bar du rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bzlas pa dang / sku'i bzlas pa dang / gsung gi bzlas pa dang / thugs kyi bzlas pa dang / rin po che'i bzlas pa dang /
analyzed: de rnam par dbye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas dgongs pas bshad pa'i bar du rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bzlas pa dang / sku'i bzlas pa dang / gsung gi bzlas pa dang / thugs kyi bzlas pa dang / rin po che'i bzlas pa dang /
translated: In order to analyze that, from “the repetition of the great vajra holder” up to “the explanation of the intention” are the eleven divisions of vajra repetition: the repetition of the great vajra holder, the repetition of the body, the repetition of speech, the repetition of mind, the repetition of the jewel,

original: don yod pa'i bzlas pa dang / 'dod chags kyi bzlas pa dang / zhe sdang gi bzlas pa dang / gti mug gi bzlas pa dang / khro bo'i bzlas pa dang / ma ning gi bzlas pa de bcu gcig gi dbye bas rdo rje bzlas pa bstan to //
analyzed: don yod pa'i bzlas pa dang / 'dod chags kyi bzlas pa dang / zhe sdang gi bzlas pa dang / gti mug gi bzlas pa dang / khro bo'i bzlas pa dang / ma ning gi bzlas pa de bcu gcig gi dbye bas rdo rje bzlas pa bstan to //
translated: the repetition of Amoghasiddhi, the repetition of passion, the repetition of aggression, the repetition of delusion, the repetition of wrath, and the repetition of the neuter.

original: de'i rim pas ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnal 'byor pas phyag rgya chen po'i sku la dmigs te /
analyzed: de'i rim pas ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnal 'byor pas phyag rgya chen po'i sku la dmigs te /
translated: By this process, the practitioner of the great vajra holder visualizes the body of the great seal.

original: lte ba la gnas pa'i rtsi bas brgyad pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lo dang por mar me dang 'dra ba yi ge aa bsam zhing de las 'od zer gyi sbyor ba yi ge gsum mgo bo la sogs par spos la /
analyzed: lte ba la gnas pa'i rtsi bas brgyad pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lo dang por mar me dang 'dra ba yi ge aa bsam zhing de las 'od zer gyi sbyor ba yi ge gsum mgo bo la sogs par spos la /
translated: The practitioner of Vajradhara should visualize the letter A, which is like a lamp, on the wheel of the realm of phenomena at the navel, which is the first of the eight channel petals there, and should visualize the three letters on the head, etc., by means of light rays emanating from that A.

original: de 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pas bzlas shing yang yi ge gsum po de dag aa la thi ma zhing de gcig pu la sems gnas par bya ba ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: de 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pas bzlas shing yang yi ge gsum po de dag aa la thi ma zhing de gcig pu la sems gnas par bya ba ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bzlas pa'o //
translated: He should recite the mantra while inhaling, etc., and then the three letters dissolve into the A, and he should focus his mind on just that A.

original: de'i 'og tu rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas snga ma bzhin du phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs dmigs la mgo bo la sogs pa la yi ge gsum bkod cing /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas snga ma bzhin du phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs dmigs la mgo bo la sogs pa la yi ge gsum bkod cing /
translated: Then, the practitioner of Vairocana should visualize the form of the great seal as before, and should arrange the three letters on the head, etc.,

original: yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pa byas la yi ge gnyis aom la thim zhing yi ge aom tsam la dmigs nas lus ni gcig pu dang du ma dang yod pa dang med pa ma @61a * //
analyzed: yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pa byas la yi ge gnyis aom la thim zhing yi ge aom tsam la dmigs nas lus ni gcig pu dang du ma dang yod pa dang med pa ma @61a * //
translated: and should recite the mantra without error. The two letters dissolve into the Om, and he should focus his mind on just the letter Om, which is one, many, existent, and nonexistent, and is the nature of the body, speech, and mind of all Ones-Gone-Thus.

original: yin no zhes dpyad nas sems rtse gcig ba nyid gang yin pa de ni sku'i bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: yin no zhes dpyad nas sems rtse gcig ba nyid gang yin pa de ni sku'i bzlas pa'o //
translated: The one-pointed mind that is ascertained by the analysis, It is! is the recitation of the body.

original: de bzhin du 'od dpag tu med pa'i rnal 'byor pas snga ma bzhin du phyag rgya chen por bsgoms pa la mgo bo la sogs par yi ge gsum po bkod la yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pa bya ste yi ge gnyis a'a:la thim zhing ngag ni gcig
analyzed: de bzhin du 'od dpag tu med pa'i rnal 'byor pas snga ma bzhin du phyag rgya chen por bsgoms pa la mgo bo la sogs par yi ge gsum po bkod la yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pa bya ste yi ge gnyis a'a:la thim zhing ngag ni gcig
translated: Similarly, the practitioner of Amitābha, having meditated on the great seal as before, should arrange the three syllables on the head, etc., and perform the recitation without loss of the limbs.🔽The two syllables dissolve into the A, and the speech is neither one nor many, existent nor non-existent.

original: dang du ma dang yod pa dang med pa ma yin no zhes nges par byas nas sems rtse gcig pa gang yin pa de ni gsung gi bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: dang du ma dang yod pa dang med pa ma yin no zhes nges par byas nas sems rtse gcig pa gang yin pa de ni gsung gi bzlas pa'o //
translated: Having ascertained that, the one-pointed mind is the recitation of speech.

original: de bzhin du mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas snga ma bzhin phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs bsams la /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas snga ma bzhin phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs bsams la /
translated: Similarly, the practitioner of Akṣobhya, having imagined the form of the great seal as before,

original: mgo po la sogs par yi ge gsum dmigs nas yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pa byas te /
analyzed: mgo po la sogs par yi ge gsum dmigs nas yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pa byas te /
translated: should visualize the three syllables on the head, etc., and perform the recitation without loss of the limbs.

original: yi ge gnyis h'um la thim nas sems ni gcig dang du ma dang yod pa dang med pa ma yin no zhes dmigs la sems rtse gcig pa nyid gang yin pa de ni thugs kyi bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge gnyis h'um la thim nas sems ni gcig dang du ma dang yod pa dang med pa ma yin no zhes dmigs la sems rtse gcig pa nyid gang yin pa de ni thugs kyi bzlas pa'o //
translated: The mental recitation is the one-pointed mind.

original: de bzhin du rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rnal 'byor pas mgo bo la sogs pa yi ge gsum dmigs la yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pa byas la 'od zer gyi tshogs spro zhing //
analyzed: de bzhin du rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rnal 'byor pas mgo bo la sogs pa yi ge gsum dmigs la yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pa byas la 'od zer gyi tshogs spro zhing //
translated: Similarly, a practitioner of Ratnasaṃbhava should visualize the three syllables on the head, etc., and perform the recitation without any faults in the limbs, and should emit a mass of light rays.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa dang 'dra ba des sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa dang 'dra ba des sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas te /
translated: With that, which is similar to the form of the Tathāgata, all the wishes of all sentient beings are fulfilled.

original: sems rtse gcig pa de nyid gang yin pa de ni rin po che'i bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa de nyid gang yin pa de ni rin po che'i bzlas pa'o //
translated: The mental recitation is the one-pointed mind.

original: de bzhin du don yod grub pa'i rnal 'byor pas snga ma bzhin du phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs bsams la mgo bo la sogs par yi ge gsum dmigs la yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pa byas nas de la 'od zer gyi sbyor bas gzhal yas khang pa
analyzed: de bzhin du don yod grub pa'i rnal 'byor pas snga ma bzhin du phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs bsams la mgo bo la sogs par yi ge gsum dmigs la yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pa byas nas de la 'od zer gyi sbyor bas gzhal yas khang pa
translated: Likewise, the yogi/nī of Amoghasiddhi, having visualized the form of the great seal as before, focuses on the three syllables on the head, and so on, and having performed the recitation without degeneration of the limbs, through the yoga of light rays, the celestial mansion is generated from the syllable tām.🔽

original: dang bcas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs spros la /🔽de rnams kyis bstan pa dang smin pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas 'gro ba sangs rgyas su byas la /🔽slar yang bsdus te de nyid du thim zhing sems rtse gcig pa nyid gang yin pa de ni bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin don yod pa'i bzlas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang bcas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs spros la / de rnams kyis bstan pa dang smin pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas 'gro ba sangs rgyas su byas la / slar yang bsdus te de nyid du thim zhing sems rtse gcig pa nyid gang yin pa de ni bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin don yod pa'i bzlas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the yoga of Amoghasiddhi is the mantra repetition of the nature of the gnosis of successful action, which is the single-pointed mind that emanates the assembly of the tathāgatas together with the celestial mansion by the method of light rays from the form of the great seal imagined on the head and so on, and then reabsorbs them into that form.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor bas snga ma bzhin du phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs dmigs la /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor bas snga ma bzhin du phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs dmigs la /
translated: The yoga of Vairocana is the mantra repetition of the nature of the gnosis of the Dharma, which is the single-pointed mind that emanates the assembly of the tathāgatas together with the celestial mansion by the method of light rays from the form of the great seal imagined on the head and so on, and then reabsorbs them into that form.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ngas brjod @61b pa'i sngags kyi yi ge'i tshig gson cig / gsan nas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bdag la stsol cig ces pa'i bsams pas /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ngas brjod @61b pa'i sngags kyi yi ge'i tshig gson cig / gsan nas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bdag la stsol cig ces pa'i bsams pas /
translated: Having listened, grant me the power of the Great Seal!

original: shin tu gsal ba'i yi ge brjod pa 'am gzhan gyis thos pa gang yin pa de ni khro bo'i bzlas pa zhes bya'o //🔽rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas sku'i bzlas pa bzhin du thams cad byas la gti mug gi rigs can gyi sems can gti mug rnam par dag pa'i gnas la gzhag par bya'o zhes bsams pas yi ge aom la zhugs pa gang yin pa de ni gti
analyzed: shin tu gsal ba'i yi ge brjod pa 'am gzhan gyis thos pa gang yin pa de ni khro bo'i bzlas pa zhes bya'o // rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas sku'i bzlas pa bzhin du thams cad byas la gti mug gi rigs can gyi sems can gti mug rnam par dag pa'i gnas la gzhag par bya'o zhes bsams pas yi ge aom la zhugs pa gang yin pa de ni gti
translated: The recitation of the wrathful one is the recitation of the very clear syllables, whether uttered by oneself or heard by another.

original: mug gi bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: mug gi bzlas pa'o //
translated: The recitation of delusion is the recitation of the syllable om, which is the entry into the syllable om, with the thought, I, a practitioner of Vairocana, having done everything like the recitation of the body, will establish sentient beings of the type of delusion in the state of the purification of delusion.

original: de bzhin du 'od dpag tu med pa'i rnal 'byor pas snga ma bzhin du thams cad byas la 'dod chags kyi rigs can gyi sems can rnams yi ge a'a:la 'jug cing 'dod chags rnam par dag pa'i gnas la gzhag par bya'o zhes pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa
analyzed: de bzhin du 'od dpag tu med pa'i rnal 'byor pas snga ma bzhin du thams cad byas la 'dod chags kyi rigs can gyi sems can rnams yi ge a'a:la 'jug cing 'dod chags rnam par dag pa'i gnas la gzhag par bya'o zhes pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa
translated: Likewise, a practitioner of Amitābha should do everything as before, and with the thought, “I will cause sentient beings of the type of passion to enter the letter Aḥ and will establish them in the state of the purification of passion,”

original: de ni 'dod chags kyi bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dod chags kyi bzlas pa'o //
translated: that is the recitation of passion.

original: de bzhin du mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas snga ma bzhin du thams cad byas la zhe sdang gi rigs can yi ge h'um la zhugs shing zhe sdang rnam par dag pa'i gnas la gzhag par bya'o zhes bsam pa gang yin pa de ni zhe sdang gi bzlas
analyzed: de bzhin du mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas snga ma bzhin du thams cad byas la zhe sdang gi rigs can yi ge h'um la zhugs shing zhe sdang rnam par dag pa'i gnas la gzhag par bya'o zhes bsam pa gang yin pa de ni zhe sdang gi bzlas
translated: Likewise, a practitioner of Akṣobhya should do everything as before, and with the thought, “I will cause sentient beings of the type of aggression to enter the letter Hūṃ and will establish them in the state of the purification of aggression,” that is the recitation of aggression.

original: ba'o // bzlas pa gsum po de dag gti mug dang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang yod ba dang med pa ma yin no zhes rnam par dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: ba'o // bzlas pa gsum po de dag gti mug dang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang yod ba dang med pa ma yin no zhes rnam par dpyad par bya'o //
translated: These three recitations should be analyzed as follows: “They are not passion, aggression, and delusion that exist or do not exist.”

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas snga ma bzhin du thams cad byas la /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas snga ma bzhin du thams cad byas la /
translated: The yogi/nī of Great Vajradhara, etc. , does everything as before.

original: yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pa'i mthar yi ge gsum aa la aa chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lo la de yang stong pa la thim zhing rnam bar mi rtog par gnas pa gang yin pa de ni ma ning gi bzlas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pa'i mthar yi ge gsum aa la aa chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lo la de yang stong pa la thim zhing rnam bar mi rtog par gnas pa gang yin pa de ni ma ning gi bzlas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: At the end of the recitation without loss of limbs, the three syllables dissolve into the a of the wheel of the sphere of phenomena, and that also dissolves into emptiness, abiding in non-conceptuality. That is called the recitation of the neuter.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa rnam pa bcu gcig po de dag dbye ba rjod par byed pa'i gzhung gi tshogs ni gos la'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa rnam pa bcu gcig po de dag dbye ba rjod par byed pa'i gzhung gi tshogs ni gos la'o //
translated: The collection of texts that express the divisions of those eleven types of vajra recitation are in the clothing.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i tshig gi sbyor bas rdzogs pa'i rim pas so sor bstan pas so //🔽chags pas ma yin zhes pa ni snang ba'i ye shes ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i tshig gi sbyor bas rdzogs pa'i rim pas so sor bstan pas so // chags pas ma yin zhes pa ni snang ba'i ye shes ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: “Explained by intention” is by the application of contradictory words, explained by the stage of completion.🔽“Not by passion” is not by the pristine wisdom of appearance.

original: chags bral ma yin zhes pa ni snang ba thob pa'i ye shes ma yin no //
analyzed: chags bral ma yin zhes pa ni snang ba thob pa'i ye shes ma yin no //
translated: “Not by non-passion” is not by the pristine wisdom of attaining appearance.

original: dbu ma ni snang ba mched pa'i ye shes te de yang gang du dmigs par mi 'gyur ba ni mngon du mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dbu ma ni snang ba mched pa'i ye shes te de yang gang du dmigs par mi 'gyur ba ni mngon du mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The Middle is the pristine wisdom of the spreading appearance, and that also is not an object of observation, that is, it is not manifest.

original: de ni 'od gsal bzhes @62a * //
analyzed: de ni 'od gsal bzhes @62a * //
translated: That is called the “luminosity,”🔽and is called the “reality of passion,” because it purifies the three voids.🔽The “suchness” is the nature of the three voids, and the “knowledge” is the knowledge of that suchness, which is the knowledge of the three voids.

original: bya ba 'dod chags kyi de kho na nyid ces bya ste stong pa gsum dag par byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽ji lta bu yongs su shes pa ni rang bzhin dang snang ba bral bas mngon du bya ba'o //
