analyzed: de shes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The “knowledge of suchness” is the knowledge of the nature of the three voids, which is the knowledge of the three voids.🔽The “knowledge of suchness” is the knowledge of the nature of the three voids, which is the knowledge of the three voids.🔽The “knowledge of suchness” is the knowledge of the nature of the three voids, which is the knowledge of the three voids.🔽The “knowledge of suchness” is the knowledge of the nature of the three voids, which is the knowledge of the three voids.🔽The “knowledge of suchness” is the knowledge of the nature of the three voids, which is the knowledge of the three voids.🔽The “knowledge of suchness” is the knowledge of the nature of the three voids, which is the knowledge of the three voids.🔽The “knowledge of suchness” is the knowledge of the nature of the three voids, which is the knowledge of the three voids.🔽The “knowledge of suchness” is the knowledge of the nature of the three voids, which is the knowledge of the three voids.🔽The “knowledge of suchness” is the knowledge of the nature of the three voids, which is the knowledge of the three voids.🔽The “knowledge of suchness” is the knowledge of the nature of the three voids, which is the knowledge of the three voids.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba nas sgra ji bzhin gyi bar du bud med dang / skyes pa'i dbye bas phye ba rnam pa gnyis kyi sgrub pa pos snyoms par zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa'i sgo nas rdo rje 'chang nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba nas sgra ji bzhin gyi bar du bud med dang / skyes pa'i dbye bas phye ba rnam pa gnyis kyi sgrub pa pos snyoms par zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa'i sgo nas rdo rje 'chang nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The “knowledge of suchness” is the knowledge of the nature of the three voids, which is the knowledge of the three voids

original: de bdag por gyur pa gang yin pa bsten par bya ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de bdag por gyur pa gang yin pa bsten par bya ba nyid kyis so //
translated: The one who is the master of that is the one who is to be relied upon.

original: sgrub pa po rnam pa gnyis ni skyes pa dang bud med kyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: sgrub pa po rnam pa gnyis ni skyes pa dang bud med kyi dbye bas so //
translated: The two kinds of adepts are distinguished as male and female.

original: sems can thams cad la bsam pa thams cad rdzogs par byed pas so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la bsam pa thams cad rdzogs par byed pas so //
translated: It is the one who fulfills all the wishes of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad la phan par byed pa'i byang chub rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan par byed pa'i byang chub rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is the one who benefits all sentient beings, characterized by the state of Great Vajradhara.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan rnam pa lnga zhes pa ni spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan rnam pa lnga zhes pa ni spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga las 'byung ba'o //
translated: The five kinds of sense objects are the five sense objects that arise from the five sense objects with elaborate practice.

original: mthar phyin par mdzad ba'o zhes pa ni mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: mthar phyin par mdzad ba'o zhes pa ni mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: It is the one who causes them to be perfected, who makes them manifest.

original: skye ba 'ba' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas rnam pa gcig bshad nas rnam pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir bud med kyang sgrub par byed do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: skye ba 'ba' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas rnam pa gcig bshad nas rnam pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir bud med kyang sgrub par byed do zhes bstan to //
translated: Having explained one kind with “only birth,” etc., in order to teach a second kind, it is said, “The female also accomplishes.”

original: de rnams kyi khyad par ni padma can la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni sngar nges pa'i tshig bshad zin pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi khyad par ni padma can la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni sngar nges pa'i tshig bshad zin pa'o //
translated: The difference between them is that the lotus-born and so on, the etymology of which has already been explained.

original: legs par slob pa'i phyag rgya rnams //
analyzed: legs par slob pa'i phyag rgya rnams //
translated: The mudra-consorts who are well trained

original: zhes pa ni thos pa la sogs pa'i rim pas slob par byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni thos pa la sogs pa'i rim pas slob par byas pa'o //
translated: means that they are trained by the stages of hearing and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de rnams kyang rjes su mthun pa'i thabs bsten pas 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par dag par byed pa 'od gsal ba thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de rnams kyang rjes su mthun pa'i thabs bsten pas 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par dag par byed pa 'od gsal ba thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The words form and so on indicate that they will attain the clear light which purifies desire and so on by relying on the appropriate means.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni spyod pa ji ltar gyi bzhin no zhes bshad pas spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni spyod pa ji ltar gyi bzhin no zhes bshad pas spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words just as the words are indicate that the conduct is just as the words are, because it has been explained that the conduct is just as the words are.

original: rnam par snang mdzad do zhes pa nas drang ba'i don gyi bar du yi ge aom dang h'um gi sa bon dag las bskyed pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs can dang mi bskyod pa'i rigs can gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad do zhes pa nas drang ba'i don gyi bar du yi ge aom dang h'um gi sa bon dag las bskyed pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs can dang mi bskyod pa'i rigs can gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams
translated: From the seed syllables of the letter oṃ and hūṃ up to the interpretable meaning, those who are generated from the seed syllables of the letter oṃ and hūṃ are the family of Vairocana and the family of Akṣobhya, such as Yamāntaka.

original: kyis zhi ba dang mngon spyod kyi phrin las byed pas sgrub @62b pa po'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub par byed do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: kyis zhi ba dang mngon spyod kyi phrin las byed pas sgrub @62b pa po'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub par byed do zhes bstan to //
translated: They perform the activities of pacifying and destroying, and thus they accomplish the aims that are desired by the practitioner.

original: de ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: de ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
translated: This is merely an illustration,

original: gzhan dag kyang rjes su mthun pa'i sa bon las byung ba 'od dpag tu med pa dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang rjes su mthun pa'i sa bon las byung ba 'od dpag tu med pa dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub pa rnams so //
translated: because others also arise from the seed syllables of the corresponding families of Amitābha, Ratnasaṃbhava, and Amoghasiddhi.

original: dbang dang rgyas pa dang dgug par mdzad pas sgrub pa po'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dbang dang rgyas pa dang dgug par mdzad pas sgrub pa po'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: They accomplish the aims that are desired by the practitioner through the activities of controlling, increasing, and summoning.

original: des ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams kyi gleng gzhi bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams kyi gleng gzhi bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the introduction to the rites of pacification and so forth, which will be explained.

original: drang ba'i don zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa zhi ba la sogs pa bstan pas so //
analyzed: drang ba'i don zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa zhi ba la sogs pa bstan pas so //
translated: The interpretable meaning is the teaching of the creation stage, pacification and so forth.

original: ma rig pa nas brtsams te nges pa'i don gyi bar du sems rnam par dag pa dang bdag la byin gyis brlab pa dang mngon par byang chub pa dang zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ba rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: ma rig pa nas brtsams te nges pa'i don gyi bar du sems rnam par dag pa dang bdag la byin gyis brlab pa dang mngon par byang chub pa dang zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ba rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: The definitive meaning is the teaching of the perfection stage, which is called purification of the mind, self-consecration, manifest enlightenment, and union, beginning with ignorance and ending with enlightenment.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir ma rig pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir ma rig pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags so //
translated: In order to teach just that, it says, Ignorance is the instinct for the fundamental consciousness.

original: de las byung ba ni de'i dbang gis skyes pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po blangs pa skyes pa dang bud med kyi rnam pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa de rnams ma rig pa ni ma ning gi rang bzhin snang ba nye bar
analyzed: de las byung ba ni de'i dbang gis skyes pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po blangs pa skyes pa dang bud med kyi rnam pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa de rnams ma rig pa ni ma ning gi rang bzhin snang ba nye bar
translated: That which arises from that is the two kinds of yogis, male and female, who have taken birth, who have taken up the five appropriated aggregates, which are born by the power of that. Ignorance is the appearance of the nature of the neuter.

original: thob pa'i rang bzhin myong zhing de nas 'od gsal ba mngon du byas nas /
analyzed: thob pa'i rang bzhin myong zhing de nas 'od gsal ba mngon du byas nas /
translated: Having experienced the nature of attainment, then, having manifested the clear light,

original: de la cig car ram snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rdzogs pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i sku spros nas sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir gzhan rnams la yang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la cig car ram snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rdzogs pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i sku spros nas sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir gzhan rnams la yang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: having perfected the great seal of the Great Seal, having emanated the body of the Great Seal, in order to perform the welfare of sentient beings, one bestows the Great Seal siddhi upon others.

original: des ni sems la dmigs pa dang / bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni sems la dmigs pa dang / bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the stage of observing the mind and the stage of self-consecration.

original: thabs kyi rang bzhin no zhes pa ni bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi rang bzhin no zhes pa ni bcu bzhi'o //
translated: The nature of method is the fourteenth.

original: shes rab po zhes pa ni rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: shes rab po zhes pa ni rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum mo //
translated: Wisdom is the thirty-third nature.

original: che ba'i bdag nyid can no zhes pa ni sems can rnams la gnod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: che ba'i bdag nyid can no zhes pa ni sems can rnams la gnod pa byed pa'o //
translated: The great nature is the harm to sentient beings.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin te zhes pa ni rdo rje'i sku rdzogs par byas te rang bzhin rnams dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin te zhes pa ni rdo rje'i sku rdzogs par byas te rang bzhin rnams dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The vajra-like samadhi is the vajra body, having perfected the natures, one brings them under control.

original: phung po la sogs pa'i dbang po med par byas pa'o zhes pa ni phung po la sogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i rang bzhin rnams mi snang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i dbang po med par byas pa'o zhes pa ni phung po la sogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i rang bzhin rnams mi snang bar byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase having made the aggregates and so forth devoid of faculties means that the natures that serve as the causes of the aggregates and so forth are made to disappear.

original: des ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: bden pa gnyis gnyis su med par gyur pa la sogs pas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis gnyis su med par gyur pa la sogs pas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase the two truths become nondual and so forth teaches the stage of union.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po ste zhes bya ba la @63a * //🔽sogs pas sdud pa po'i tshig gis nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po ste zhes bya ba la @63a * // sogs pas sdud pa po'i tshig gis nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase the great Vajradhara and so forth are the words of the compiler.

original: des pa'i don to zhes pa ni rim pa bzhi so sor bstan pas so //
analyzed: des pa'i don to zhes pa ni rim pa bzhi so sor bstan pas so //
translated: The phrase the meaning of the four stages refers to the individual teachings of the four stages.🔽 The phrase and so forth and so on are explained in order to teach the samādhi of the extensive activities of pacifying and so on, which were previously taught in brief.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar mdor bstan pa'i zhi ba la sogs pas phrin las rgyas pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad par bya ste ye shes sems dpa'i zhes pa nas 'dod pa ni 'bras bu 'grub pa thob par 'gyur ro
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar mdor bstan pa'i zhi ba la sogs pas phrin las rgyas pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad par bya ste ye shes sems dpa'i zhes pa nas 'dod pa ni 'bras bu 'grub pa thob par 'gyur ro
translated: The phrase the wisdom being and so forth up to the result is attained is the explanation.

original: zhes pa'i bar du rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bskyed pa'i rim pas rang rang gi phyag rgya chen po'i sku bsgoms la /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bskyed pa'i rim pas rang rang gi phyag rgya chen po'i sku bsgoms la /
translated: Up to this point, the yogins of Vairocana and so forth meditate on the body of their respective great seal.

original: ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar zla ba dang nyi ma dang nor bu dang padma dang sna tshogs rdo rje'i steng du 'khor lo dang / rdo rje dang rin po che dang padma dang ral gri rnams bsams la /🔽rang rang gi sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis nad pa la sogs pa'i bsgrub bya rnams de rnams su bcug la shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams la bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis sdig pa sbyangs shing bsal bar byas te de nas spros
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar zla ba dang nyi ma dang nor bu dang padma dang sna tshogs rdo rje'i steng du 'khor lo dang / rdo rje dang rin po che dang padma dang ral gri rnams bsams la / rang rang gi sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis nad pa la sogs pa'i bsgrub bya rnams de rnams su bcug la shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams la bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis sdig pa sbyangs shing bsal bar byas te de nas spros
translated: In the heart of the awareness beings, one should imagine a wheel, a vajra, a jewel, a lotus, and a sword upon a moon, sun, jewel, lotus, and variegated vajra, respectively.🔽The light rays of their respective seed syllables draw in the recipients of the rite, such as the sick person, and so forth, and they are placed on the seats explained previously outside.

original: la phyi rol gyi sngar bshad pa'i gdan rnams la bzhag ste /
analyzed: la phyi rol gyi sngar bshad pa'i gdan rnams la bzhag ste /
translated: The light rays of the tathāgatas dwelling in the east and so forth purify and remove their negativities.

original: de rnams la spros pa'i spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyi rang rang gi kha dog dang mthun pa'i bum pa'i chus dbang bskur bar byas te /
analyzed: de rnams la spros pa'i spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyi rang rang gi kha dog dang mthun pa'i bum pa'i chus dbang bskur bar byas te /
translated: For them, the goddesses such as Pratiṣṭhā, who are the elaborations of those, confer initiation with the water of the respective-colored vases,

original: zhi ba la sogs pa dang ldan par bya'o zhes rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa dang ldan par bya'o zhes rab tu bstan to //
translated: and they are endowed with peace, etc.

original: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas phra mo'i rnal 'byor yongs su rdzogs nas sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir spros par bstan to //
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas phra mo'i rnal 'byor yongs su rdzogs nas sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir spros par bstan to //
translated: Now, having completed the subtle yoga, in order to benefit sentient beings, the elaboration is taught, beginning with “now,” etc.

original: de la bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas phra mo'i rnal 'byor byas la /
analyzed: de la bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas phra mo'i rnal 'byor byas la /
translated: There, the yoga practitioner of the creation stage should perform the subtle yoga.

original: rigs kyi dbye bas dang po'i 'od zer gyi tshogs spro zhing de nas phyag mtshan dang de nas rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag rgya chen po yang spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi dbye bas dang po'i 'od zer gyi tshogs spro zhing de nas phyag mtshan dang de nas rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag rgya chen po yang spro bar bya'o //
translated: By the division of the families, he should first emanate the mass of light rays, then the insignia, and then the great seal of Vairocana.

original: des ni sems can gyi don byas la yang de nyid du bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: des ni sems can gyi don byas la yang de nyid du bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Having thus benefited sentient beings, he should again gather them into himself.

original: las kyi rgyal ba'i mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: las kyi rgyal ba'i mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the samadhi of Karmavajravara.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas kyang cig car du phyag rgya chen po'i sku bsams la /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas kyang cig car du phyag rgya chen po'i sku bsams la /
translated: Also, a yogin of the stage of completion should imagine the body of the great seal all at once,

original: ba spu'i bu ga thams cad las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spros la de rnams kyis 'gro ba'i don byas la yang de nyid du bsdu bar bya'o //🔽dkyil 'khor chen po ni zhes bya ba nas gsang ba'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni @63b cig car du bskyed pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid la dmigs te de'i lkog ma dang snying ga dang lte
analyzed: ba spu'i bu ga thams cad las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spros la de rnams kyis 'gro ba'i don byas la yang de nyid du bsdu bar bya'o // dkyil 'khor chen po ni zhes bya ba nas gsang ba'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni @63b cig car du bskyed pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid la dmigs te de'i lkog ma dang snying ga dang lte
translated: and emanate all the transcendent lords from all the pores of his body. He should have them perform the welfare of living beings and again gather them into that body.

original: ba dang / gsang ba'i gnas su me dang chu dang rlung dang dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor bzhi gru gsum dang zlum po dang gzhu'i dbyibs can dang gru bzhi dmar po dang dkar po dang sngon po dang ser po dang de bzhin gshegs pa dang /
analyzed: ba dang / gsang ba'i gnas su me dang chu dang rlung dang dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor bzhi gru gsum dang zlum po dang gzhu'i dbyibs can dang gru bzhi dmar po dang dkar po dang sngon po dang ser po dang de bzhin gshegs pa dang /
translated: The great mandala, etc., up to the secret place, is the four mandala of fire, water, wind, and earth, in the shape of a triangle, a circle, a bow, and a square, red, white, blue, and yellow, in the throat, heart, navel, and secret place of the body of the great Vajradhara, who is generated all at once and visualized as the nature of the three beings.

original: lha mo bzhi'i rang bzhin du rnam par bsams la /🔽'jug pa la sogs pa'i yi ge gsum po re re dgod cing g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dang gnyi ga dang dal bus dman par rgyu ba'i dbye bas dmar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs spros la thun phyed phyed kyi dus su bzung nas zhi ba
analyzed: lha mo bzhi'i rang bzhin du rnam par bsams la / 'jug pa la sogs pa'i yi ge gsum po re re dgod cing g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dang gnyi ga dang dal bus dman par rgyu ba'i dbye bas dmar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs spros la thun phyed phyed kyi dus su bzung nas zhi ba
translated: One should imagine the nature of the four goddesses.

original: la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs bya'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs bya'o //
translated: One should visualize each of the three syllables, a, va, and ra, and emit a mass of light rays, red and so forth, by the division of moving to the right, to the left, to both, and slowly and weakly. Having held them at the time of each half-period, one should perform the collection of actions, such as pacifying.

original: ya yi don gyis gang ci 'ang rung //
analyzed: ya yi don gyis gang ci 'ang rung //
translated: Whatever is the meaning of ya,

original: dngos grub 'dod pas bya ba ste //
analyzed: dngos grub 'dod pas bya ba ste //
translated: one should perform it, desiring power.

original: ra la sogs pa gsum nyid kyis //
analyzed: ra la sogs pa gsum nyid kyis //
translated: By the three of ra and so forth,🔽one engages in the benefit of beings.🔽On each of the maṇḍalas of fire, wind, earth,

original: 'gro ba'i don la rab tu 'jug / me dang rlung dang dbang chen dang // chu yi dkyil 'khor re re la //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don la rab tu 'jug / me dang rlung dang dbang chen dang // chu yi dkyil 'khor re re la //
translated: and water,

original: thun ni phyed phyed dus su yang //
analyzed: thun ni phyed phyed dus su yang //
translated: at the time of each half-period,

original: las ni gnyis gnyis 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: las ni gnyis gnyis 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: two actions are accomplished.

original: g-yas pa la ni 'od 'byung ba //
analyzed: g-yas pa la ni 'od 'byung ba //
translated: Light arises on the right;

original: me yi dkyil 'khor de yin no //
analyzed: me yi dkyil 'khor de yin no //
translated: that is the maṇḍala of fire.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: And so forth.

original: 'dir las dang po pa rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i de kho na nyid do zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir las dang po pa rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i de kho na nyid do zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: Here, the uncommon reality of beginners should not be taught to those who are yogis of the creation stage.

original: las rnam pa bzhi'i nang nas zhes pa nas de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin 'di la zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: las rnam pa bzhi'i nang nas zhes pa nas de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin 'di la zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: From among the four kinds of actions, up to “therefore, in this meditative stabilization,”

original: dpal mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas bdag nyid zhes sdang rdo rje bsgoms la /
analyzed: dpal mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas bdag nyid zhes sdang rdo rje bsgoms la /
translated: the yogi of glorious Akṣhobhya should meditate on himself as Hatred Vajra.

original: de'i g-yas phyogs su de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' khro bo rnams bsams la /
analyzed: de'i g-yas phyogs su de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' khro bo rnams bsams la /
translated: To his right, he should imagine the wrathful ones, the tathāgatas and bodhisattvas,🔽and to his left, Locanā and so forth, Rūpavajrā and so forth, and Vajra Vetālī and so forth.

original: g-yon phyogs su spyan ma la sogs pa'i gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa dang / rdo rje ro langs ma la sogs pa bsams te ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i 'od kyis bkug pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rang gi snying ga la 'jug cing /
analyzed: g-yon phyogs su spyan ma la sogs pa'i gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa dang / rdo rje ro langs ma la sogs pa bsams te ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i 'od kyis bkug pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rang gi snying ga la 'jug cing /
translated: Having summoned all the tathāgatas with the light from the heart of the gnosis being, they enter his heart.

original: yang gshin rje'i gshed la sogs pa khro bo'i rnam pa shin tu khros pa 'jigs pa'i cha lugs dang ldan pa de rnams spros la /🔽de rnams kyis kyang bsgrub bya rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du gnas pa gcer bu til mar gyis lus byugs pa skyabs med pa mkha' spyod dang sa spyod dang thad @64a * //
analyzed: yang gshin rje'i gshed la sogs pa khro bo'i rnam pa shin tu khros pa 'jigs pa'i cha lugs dang ldan pa de rnams spros la / de rnams kyis kyang bsgrub bya rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du gnas pa gcer bu til mar gyis lus byugs pa skyabs med pa mkha' spyod dang sa spyod dang thad @64a * //
translated: Again, emanate the wrathful forms such as Yamantaka, who have a very wrathful and terrifying appearance.

original: spyod dang phyogs spyod la sogs pa srog chags kyi khyad par gyis skrag par byed la /
analyzed: spyod dang phyogs spyod la sogs pa srog chags kyi khyad par gyis skrag par byed la /
translated: Those also terrify the victim, who is naked and smeared with oil, standing on the maṇḍala of air and fire, without refuge, and frightened by the distinctions of the various creatures of the sky, earth, and water.

original: kha sbyor dbye ba bsams te de rnams kyis brdeg cing ji srid mtshon cha sna tshogs pas til tsam dum bur bcad par byas la /
analyzed: kha sbyor dbye ba bsams te de rnams kyis brdeg cing ji srid mtshon cha sna tshogs pas til tsam dum bur bcad par byas la /
translated: Imagine that they separate the body and the mind, and beat the victim with various weapons until he is cut into pieces the size of sesame seeds.

original: srog dbyung ba bsgoms te de'i rnam par shes pa yang dri ma med pa rlung med pa'i mar me dang 'dra ba bsams la /
analyzed: srog dbyung ba bsgoms te de'i rnam par shes pa yang dri ma med pa rlung med pa'i mar me dang 'dra ba bsams la /
translated: Imagine that his consciousness is like a butter lamp without wind, free of stains.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa zhal gsum la sogs pa'i rnam pa de lta bu 'od zer gyis sbyor bas sangs rgyas kyi zhing la gnas pa chos ston pa la brtson pa /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa zhal gsum la sogs pa'i rnam pa de lta bu 'od zer gyis sbyor bas sangs rgyas kyi zhing la gnas pa chos ston pa la brtson pa /
translated: That completely transforms into Bhagavat Akshobhya with three faces and so forth, with the light rays of the yoga of the field of the buddhas, striving in the teaching of the doctrine,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bskor ba bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bskor ba bsgom par bya'o //
translated: surrounded by the tathagatas.

original: 'dir dkon mchog gsum zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste bla ma la smod par byed pa la sogs pa rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'dir dkon mchog gsum zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste bla ma la smod par byed pa la sogs pa rnams kyang ngo //
translated: Here, the three jewels are a synecdoche for the guru and so forth.

original: bla ma ni dbang gi bla ma'o //
analyzed: bla ma ni dbang gi bla ma'o //
translated: The guru is the empowerment guru.

original: rdo rje slob dpon ni gang zhig chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon ni gang zhig chos ston pa'o //
translated: The vajra master is the one who teaches the doctrine.

original: ma gsod pa la sogs pa mtshams med pa lnga po byed pa'o //
analyzed: ma gsod pa la sogs pa mtshams med pa lnga po byed pa'o //
translated: The five heinous acts are killing one’s mother and so forth.

original: che ge mo sod cig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni snying rje sngon du 'gro ba'i bskul ba'i tshig go /'dod pa la sogs pas skye ba bzhi dang ldan pa'i sems can gyi khams de bzhin gshegs pa dang 'dra bar bsams te 'dug pa de gsod par🔽bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis de shin tu nongs par byas pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: che ge mo sod cig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni snying rje sngon du 'gro ba'i bskul ba'i tshig go /'dod pa la sogs pas skye ba bzhi dang ldan pa'i sems can gyi khams de bzhin gshegs pa dang 'dra bar bsams te 'dug pa de gsod par bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis de shin tu nongs par byas pa nyid bstan to //
translated: The thought I will meditate on killing that sentient being who is endowed with the four kinds of birth, such as from an egg, and who is like the Tathagata shows that he has committed a great sin.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnod pa byas pa'i sdig pa chen po dang ldan ba de rtogs shing de nas drag po'i las bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnod pa byas pa'i sdig pa chen po dang ldan ba de rtogs shing de nas drag po'i las bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Then, and so on. Having understood that he is endowed with a great sin of injury, then one should perform the rite of Rudra, which is to say, then one should perform the rite of Rudra.

original: sdig pa nye bar bsgrags pa zhes pa ni kha na ma tho ba bsags pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa nye bar bsgrags pa zhes pa ni kha na ma tho ba bsags pa'o //
translated: The words the sin of announcing the sin means the accumulation of misdeeds.

original: kha sbyor dbye ba ni kha dang bshad sgo ni kha sbyor ro ;
analyzed: kha sbyor dbye ba ni kha dang bshad sgo ni kha sbyor ro ;
translated: The separation of the mouth is the mouth and the anus.

original: ; yang tshangs pa'i sgo dang / lte ba ni kha sbyor ro //
analyzed: ; yang tshangs pa'i sgo dang / lte ba ni kha sbyor ro //
translated: The navel and the mouth of Brahma are joined together.

original: de dag dbye ba ni gsang ba'o //
analyzed: de dag dbye ba ni gsang ba'o //
translated: The separation of those is the secret place.

original: yang na snying ga nyid kha sbyor te steng dang 'og gi padma dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na snying ga nyid kha sbyor te steng dang 'og gi padma dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, the heart itself is conjoined, because it is connected with the upper and lower lotuses.

original: de'i phye ba ni dbye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phye ba ni dbye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Its division is called the division.

original: chad pas gcad par bya ba ni tshar gcod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chad pas gcad par bya ba ni tshar gcod par byed pa'o //
translated: That which is to be cut off is the one who cuts off.

original: de nyid nam mkha'i khams zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid nam mkha'i khams zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: That itself is taught by the element of space, etc.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' ni mi bskyod pa ste /🔽khro bo zhe sdang gnas las skyes //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' ni mi bskyod pa ste / khro bo zhe sdang gnas las skyes //
translated: Vajrasattva is Akshobhya,

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that he is born from the abode of wrathful hatred.

original: drag shul gyi las kyang mi bskyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bya ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: drag shul gyi las kyang mi bskyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bya ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: The wrathful action is also the activity of the samadhi of Akshobhya, not of any other.

original: g-yas dang g-yon gyi phyogs su sangs rgyas kyi tshogs dang lha @64b mo'i tshogs bsgom par bya ba 'dis thabs dang shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon gyi phyogs su sangs rgyas kyi tshogs dang lha @64b mo'i tshogs bsgom par bya ba 'dis thabs dang shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the nature of method and wisdom by this meditation on the assembly of Buddhas and the assembly of goddesses on the right and left sides,

original: g-yas phyogs su zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: g-yas phyogs su zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: he teaches the right side, etc.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: skye gnas dbus su rtsa gnyis te //
analyzed: skye gnas dbus su rtsa gnyis te //
translated: In the middle of the birthplace are two channels,

original: g-yon pa dang ni g-yas pa gnyis //
analyzed: g-yon pa dang ni g-yas pa gnyis //
translated: The left and right

original: g-yon pa khu ba zhes bya ba //
analyzed: g-yon pa khu ba zhes bya ba //
translated: are said to be semen.

original: g-yas pa la ni khrag nyid de //
analyzed: g-yas pa la ni khrag nyid de //
translated: The right is blood.🔽They are united by one,

original: de dag sdud par byed pa gcig / de ni chos kyi dbyings bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de dag sdud par byed pa gcig / de ni chos kyi dbyings bsdu ba'o //
translated: which is the union of the dharmadhātu.

original: de nyid kyi phyir man ngag go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir man ngag go //
translated: Therefore, it is the oral instruction.

original: bla ma'i bka' lung ngo //
analyzed: bla ma'i bka' lung ngo //
translated: It is the guru’s oral instruction.

original: phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa zhes pa ni khams gsum na bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa zhes pa ni khams gsum na bzhugs pa'o //
translated: “Residing in the ten directions” means residing in the three realms.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs kyi bye brag gis so zhes pa ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i bye brag gis so //🔽rang gi phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs kyi bye brag gis so zhes pa ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i bye brag gis so // rang gi phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs //
translated: “By the specific types of families, such as Vairocana” means by the specific types of body vajra and so on.

original: zhes pa ni rang gi rigs kyi sku dang ldan pa byas nas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang gi rigs kyi sku dang ldan pa byas nas so //
translated: “The form of one’s own mahāmudrā” means having made the form of one’s own family.

original: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'i tshul gyis zhes pa ni rdo rje phreng ba las gsungs pa'i don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rim pas so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'i tshul gyis zhes pa ni rdo rje phreng ba las gsungs pa'i don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rim pas so //
translated: “By the method of the aggregate of form and so on” means by the stages of the ultimate maṇḍala, as taught in the Vajra Pañjarā.

original: gzung bar bya ba ni kha sbyar bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba ni kha sbyar bar bya ba'o //
translated: “To be held” means to be united.

original: yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas de rnams spro bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas de rnams spro bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Again and so forth teaches that they should be emanated.

original: khros pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas spro ba'i khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: khros pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas spro ba'i khyad par bstan to //
translated: Angry and so forth teaches the special emanation.

original: yid dang lus kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas de rnams 'jigs su rung ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: yid dang lus kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas de rnams 'jigs su rung ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: Mind and body and so forth teaches that they are terrifying.

original: sbrul ske rags su bcings pa la sogs pas brgyan pas zhes pa ni rigs kyi klu brgyad kyis rgyan byas pa'o //
analyzed: sbrul ske rags su bcings pa la sogs pas brgyan pas zhes pa ni rigs kyi klu brgyad kyis rgyan byas pa'o //
translated: Adorned with snakes as a belt and so forth means that they are adorned with the eight nāga clans.

original: dgra sta dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshon cha'i khyad par dang ldan pa nyid du bstan to //🔽rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dgra sta dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshon cha'i khyad par dang ldan pa nyid du bstan to // rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes pa ni /
translated: Axe and so forth teaches that they are endowed with special weapons.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su gyur pa'i mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su gyur pa'i mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Great Vajradhara means Akṣobhya, who is the transformation of Great Vajradhara.

original: che ge mo sod cig ces bya ba ni bka'i bye brag go //
analyzed: che ge mo sod cig ces bya ba ni bka'i bye brag go //
translated: Kill so-and-so is a specific command.

original: 'joms pa'o zhes pa ni gsod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'joms pa'o zhes pa ni gsod par byed pa'o //
translated: Destroy means to kill.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas phal cher gyi tshig gi sgo nas yid ches pa bstan to //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas phal cher gyi tshig gi sgo nas yid ches pa bstan to //
translated: If and so forth teaches the reliability by way of the word 'mostly'.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i nus pa ston pa yin no zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i nus pa ston pa yin no zhes pa ni /
translated: The statement he displays the power of illusion

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i rnam pas rdo rje sems dpa' yang gsod par 'gyur ro zhes sgyu ma'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i rnam pas rdo rje sems dpa' yang gsod par 'gyur ro zhes sgyu ma'o //
translated: means that he is an illusionist, since he kills even Vajrasattva in the form of Vajrasattva.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pas las 'di nyid kyis the tshom med par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pas las 'di nyid kyis the tshom med par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The statement he becomes a buddha and so forth teaches that by this very rite one will become a buddha without doubt.

original: drag po'i tshig gi zhes bya ba la sogs pas zhag bdun gyis nyung ba'am lhag pa nyid bkag pa ste /
analyzed: drag po'i tshig gi zhes bya ba la sogs pas zhag bdun gyis nyung ba'am lhag pa nyid bkag pa ste /
translated: The statement by the words of fierce and so forth prohibits less than or more than seven days,

original: blo brtan pas dus de tsam gyis 'grub pa'i phyir ro //🔽de ltar sbyor ba 'di yin te //
analyzed: blo brtan pas dus de tsam gyis 'grub pa'i phyir ro // de ltar sbyor ba 'di yin te //
translated: since one who is firm in mind accomplishes it in just that time.

original: @65a * // zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: @65a * // zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyid du bstan to //
translated: The statement this is the application and so forth teaches the very meditative stabilization that was explained previously.

original: rdo rje dam tshig ni zhes pa la sogs pas ting nge 'dzin bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dam tshig ni zhes pa la sogs pas ting nge 'dzin bsdus pa'o //
translated: The statement the pledge of the vajra and so forth concludes the meditative stabilization.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis dang po bskyed pa'i rim pas bdag nyid rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku de bsgoms la de rnams yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje sems dpa' bsgom
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis dang po bskyed pa'i rim pas bdag nyid rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku de bsgoms la de rnams yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje sems dpa' bsgom
translated: with the creation stage, and then, from their transformation, meditate on Vajrasattva,🔽and visualize the fierce Vajra who abides like the fire at the end of the eon, and emanate the mandala from one's body in the form of wrathful ones, and with listen! etc.

original: zhing / bskal pa'i mtha'i me ltar spro ba rang gi lags pa gnas pa'i drag po'i rdo rje dmigs la rang gi lus las dkyil 'khor ba spro zhing khro bo'i rnam par byas la nyon cig ces bya ba la sogs pas de rnams la bka' sbyin te /
analyzed: zhing / bskal pa'i mtha'i me ltar spro ba rang gi lags pa gnas pa'i drag po'i rdo rje dmigs la rang gi lus las dkyil 'khor ba spro zhing khro bo'i rnam par byas la nyon cig ces bya ba la sogs pas de rnams la bka' sbyin te /
translated: give them the command.

original: bka' nyan pa de rnams kyis gdug pa gsad cing srog dang bral bar bsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bka' nyan pa de rnams kyis gdug pa gsad cing srog dang bral bar bsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Those who obey the command should be understood to kill the wicked and deprive them of life.🔽Similarly, Ratnasaṃbhava, etc.

original: de bzhin du rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa'i zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa'i zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang don yod grub pa'o //
translated: means Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, and Amoghasiddhi.

original: yongs su gyur par zhes pa ni rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs su 'gyur bar sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su gyur par zhes pa ni rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs su 'gyur bar sbyar ba'o //
translated: The phrase “completely transformed” is to be applied to the form of Vajrasattva.

original: de'i 'khor rnams kyis zhes pa nas ting nge 'dzin de la yang de skad ces bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni bskyed pa'i rim pas gshin rje mthar byed du bdag nyid bsams la /
analyzed: de'i 'khor rnams kyis zhes pa nas ting nge 'dzin de la yang de skad ces bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni bskyed pa'i rim pas gshin rje mthar byed du bdag nyid bsams la /
translated: The passage from “his retinue” up to “that samādhi is called that” teaches that one should imagine oneself as Yamāntaka by way of the creation stage,

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams rang gi lus la 'jug ste /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams rang gi lus la 'jug ste /
translated: and that the maṇḍala members such as Vairocana enter one’s body.

original: yang gshin rje mthar byed kyi rnam pa dang ldan pa spro zhing bka' nyan pa de rnams kyis dkon mchog gsum la sogs pas la gnod pa rnams gsod par byed pa bsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yang gshin rje mthar byed kyi rnam pa dang ldan pa spro zhing bka' nyan pa de rnams kyis dkon mchog gsum la sogs pas la gnod pa rnams gsod par byed pa bsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Then, one should imagine that those who have the form of Yamāntaka and who are obedient emanate and kill those who harm the Three Jewels and so forth.

original: de yang nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te 'phags pa rnams gzhan gyis mi thub pa dang rta mgrin dang bdud rtsi 'khyil pa la sogs pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: de yang nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te 'phags pa rnams gzhan gyis mi thub pa dang rta mgrin dang bdud rtsi 'khyil pa la sogs pas kyang ngo //
translated: Moreover, this is merely an illustration, because the āryas also emanate Aparājitā, Hayagrīva, Amṛtakuṇḍali, and so forth.

original: lha'i thams cad kyi thun mong gi zhes ba ni mos pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: lha'i thams cad kyi thun mong gi zhes ba ni mos pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: The phrase all the gods in common refers to the distinction of faith.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams kyis zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams kyis zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: The phrase by Vairochana and so forth refers to the Tathagatas.

original: de'i lha mo rnams kyis zhes pa ni spyan ma la sogs pa dang de'i rigs dang ldan pa gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: de'i lha mo rnams kyis zhes pa ni spyan ma la sogs pa dang de'i rigs dang ldan pa gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang ngo //
translated: The phrase by their goddesses refers to Lochana and so forth, and also to RupavajrI and so forth, who are of their family.

original: byams ba la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni byams pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' brgyad kyis so //
analyzed: byams ba la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni byams pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' brgyad kyis so //
translated: The phrase by Maitreya and so forth refers to the eight Bodhisattvas, such as Maitreya.

original: gtsug tor zhes bya ba la sogs pas khro bo'i rgyal po bcu pos kyang bka'i 'khor lo @65b sbyar bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gtsug tor zhes bya ba la sogs pas khro bo'i rgyal po bcu pos kyang bka'i 'khor lo @65b sbyar bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase by the ushnisha and so forth indicates that the ten kings of wrath also turn the wheel of the command.

original: de ltar sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bka'i 'khor lo'i dgos pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bka'i 'khor lo'i dgos pa bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the purpose of the wheel of the command of the thirty-two deities, which has a nature of thirty-two,

original: dgos pa gzhan dag ces pa ni phyogs bcu la gnas pa'i bgegs bskrad pa dang phur bus gdab pa dang brdung ba bstan pa'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: dgos pa gzhan dag ces pa ni phyogs bcu la gnas pa'i bgegs bskrad pa dang phur bus gdab pa dang brdung ba bstan pa'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
translated: The other purposes are explained in order to show the banishing of the obstructors dwelling in the ten directions, the nailing down, and the striking.

original: dbang po la sogs pa phyogs skyod rnams zhes pa ni sher la sogs par gnas pa'i lha'i dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa phyogs skyod rnams zhes pa ni sher la sogs par gnas pa'i lha'i dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The “wardens of the directions” are Indra and so on, dwelling in the east and so on.

original: bgegs byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bar chod byed pa'o //
analyzed: bgegs byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bar chod byed pa'o //
translated: “Obstructors” are those who create obstacles to meditative concentration.

original: sgrub pa pos bya'o zhes pa ni gnas gzung ba las 'og tu bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa pos bya'o zhes pa ni gnas gzung ba las 'og tu bya'o //
translated: “The practitioner should do” means that this should be done after the site has been taken possession of.

original: sems rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa zhes pa ni brgya byin la sogs pa las srung ba'i don du ni bzlog pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa zhes pa ni brgya byin la sogs pa las srung ba'i don du ni bzlog pa'i don du'o //
translated: “Distracting the mind” means that one should ward off Indra and so on for the sake of protection.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni /
translated: “The words are to be taken literally” means that

original: dang po sbyor ba'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phyogs gcig bgegs bskrad pa 'chad par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po sbyor ba'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phyogs gcig bgegs bskrad pa 'chad par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to explain the banishing of the obstructors, which is one part of the yoga that is a branch of the first application.

original: da ni zhes pa nas dgongs pas bshad pa'i bar du ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas bsgrub bya mi snang bar byas la nam mkha'i khams dang 'dra bar bsgom zhing de'i nam mkha' kha dog lnga'i 'od zer gyi tshogs
analyzed: da ni zhes pa nas dgongs pas bshad pa'i bar du ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas bsgrub bya mi snang bar byas la nam mkha'i khams dang 'dra bar bsgom zhing de'i nam mkha' kha dog lnga'i 'od zer gyi tshogs
translated: Now, up to the explanation by the intention, the practitioner of the completion stage, having made the object of attainment invisible by the process of purifying the mind, should meditate on it as like the realm of space, and that space should be pressed down by a mass of light rays of five colors.

original: kyis mnan par byas la de'i steng du cig car du sgyu ma lta bu'i skur bdag nyid dmigs la /
analyzed: kyis mnan par byas la de'i steng du cig car du sgyu ma lta bu'i skur bdag nyid dmigs la /
translated: On top of that, one should visualize oneself as the illusory body all at once.

original: rten du gyur pa'i bsgrub bya'i 'od zer gyi 'khor lo yang rang gi bdag nyid la 'jug ste /
analyzed: rten du gyur pa'i bsgrub bya'i 'od zer gyi 'khor lo yang rang gi bdag nyid la 'jug ste /
translated: Also, the wheel of light rays of the object of attainment, which is the basis, should enter into oneself.

original: sku gsung thugs ni sgyu ma'i ngo bor bsams la gdug pa gsad par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs ni sgyu ma'i ngo bor bsams la gdug pa gsad par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Thinking of the body, speech, and mind as having the nature of illusion, one should kill the wicked.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i sgra'i sgo nas rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i sgra'i sgo nas rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan pas so //
translated: The explanation by the intention is because the completion stage is taught by means of contradictory words.

original: rengs par bya ba'i zhes pa nas brtsams te sga ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa'i bar du chu rengs pa bstan to //
analyzed: rengs par bya ba'i zhes pa nas brtsams te sga ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa'i bar du chu rengs pa bstan to //
translated: Starting from “paralyze,” up to “just as before,” the paralyzing of water is taught.

original: de la nam mkha' ni gzhi'o //
analyzed: de la nam mkha' ni gzhi'o //
translated: Space is the basis there.

original: de nas rlung gis bus la mes chu rnams bskam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas rlung gis bus la mes chu rnams bskam par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having been fanned by wind, the fire dries up the waters.

original: de'i steng du sa bsgom zhing chu'i steng du 'gro ba dang 'ong ba byas pas nub par mi 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de'i steng du sa bsgom zhing chu'i steng du 'gro ba dang 'ong ba byas pas nub par mi 'gyur te ;

original: chu ni khams bzhi pos nus pa bcom pa'i phyir ro //🔽rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting 'dzin nas zhes pa nas dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas rdo rje'i sku spros la /
analyzed: chu ni khams bzhi pos nus pa bcom pa'i phyir ro // rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting 'dzin nas zhes pa nas dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas rdo rje'i sku spros la /
translated: Because the water is destroyed by the power of the four elements.

original: rnam par mi rtog par gyur cing chu'i steng du 'gro bar / bya'o zhes bstan to //🔽rdzogs pa'i rim pa la @66a * //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog par gyur cing chu'i steng du 'gro bar / bya'o zhes bstan to // rdzogs pa'i rim pa la @66a * //

original: gnas pas dngos grub thams cad mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pas dngos grub thams cad mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rdo rje'i rnam pa de yongs su gyur pas las bdud rtsi 'khyil pa stod zhal gsum phyag drug pa lta bu /

analyzed: aom gri hn'a pa ya gri hn'a pa ya h'um h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ, come, come, O Blessed Vajra, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom a'a na ya ho bha ga b'an badzra h'um h'um phat ces bya ba 'dis phyogs bcu la gnas pa brgya byin la sogs pa 'jig rten skyod ba rnams 'gugs pa'i don du bka' sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: aom a'a na ya ho bha ga b'an badzra h'um h'um phat ces bya ba 'dis phyogs bcu la gnas pa brgya byin la sogs pa 'jig rten skyod ba rnams 'gugs pa'i don du bka' sbyin par bya'o //
translated: By this, the guardians of the world such as Indra dwelling in the ten directions are commanded for the purpose of summoning.

original: de thos pas de ma thag tu gnod mdzes kyi rgyal pos lcags kyu dang zhags pa phyogs bcur spro zhing lha'i dbang po la sogs pa 'jig rten skyong ba rnams zhags pas mgul pa bcings shing /
analyzed: de thos pas de ma thag tu gnod mdzes kyi rgyal pos lcags kyu dang zhags pa phyogs bcur spro zhing lha'i dbang po la sogs pa 'jig rten skyong ba rnams zhags pas mgul pa bcings shing /
translated: Hearing that, immediately the King of Acalas radiates hooks and nooses in the ten directions, and the guardians of the world such as the lords of gods are bound around the neck with nooses,

original: lcags kyus spyi bor btab la shar la sogs pa'i phyogs dang mtshams rnams su 'god par byed par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: lcags kyus spyi bor btab la shar la sogs pa'i phyogs dang mtshams rnams su 'god par byed par bsam par bya'o //
translated: and imagining that hooks are placed on their crowns, they are made to stand in the east and other directions and in the intermediate directions.

original: de nas gnod mdzes kyi rgyal pos rdo rje'i phur bu de rnams kyis mgo bo nas rkang pa'i mthil gyi bar du 'jug par byed pa bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gnod mdzes kyi rgyal pos rdo rje'i phur bu de rnams kyis mgo bo nas rkang pa'i mthil gyi bar du 'jug par byed pa bsam par bya'o //
translated: Then one should imagine that the Vajra HÙM KARA Kings drive in those Vajra daggers from the head down to the soles of the feet.

original: aom gha gha zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyis phur bu btab cing brdungs la /
analyzed: aom gha gha zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyis phur bu btab cing brdungs la /
translated: With the mantra GHA GHA, etc., one should drive in the daggers and beat them down,

original: sa 'og chen po bdun gyi bar du son par bsgoms la khro bo'i rgyal po'i lus las 'byung ba'i 'bar ba'i tshogs kyis de'i 'khor mtha' yas pa thal bar 'gyur bar bsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sa 'og chen po bdun gyi bar du son par bsgoms la khro bo'i rgyal po'i lus las 'byung ba'i 'bar ba'i tshogs kyis de'i 'khor mtha' yas pa thal bar 'gyur bar bsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: and imagine that they reach down to the seven lower levels, and that the entire retinue of those (demons) is reduced to ashes by the mass of flames issuing from the body of the King of Wrath.

original: de ni dang po sbyor ba'i yan lag tu gyur pa rnal 'byor gyi phyogs gcig gi bgegs bskrad pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de ni dang po sbyor ba'i yan lag tu gyur pa rnal 'byor gyi phyogs gcig gi bgegs bskrad pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the samadhi called Expelling the Obstructors of One Part of the Yoga which is a branch of the First Yoga.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus te zhes bya ba nas ting nge 'dzin la yang de skad ces bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni stong pa nyid bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bar yi ge aom yongs su gyur pa'i 'khor lo las 'byung ba bdag @67b nyid rnam par snang
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus te zhes bya ba nas ting nge 'dzin la yang de skad ces bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni stong pa nyid bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bar yi ge aom yongs su gyur pa'i 'khor lo las 'byung ba bdag @67b nyid rnam par snang
translated: In the center of the realm of space,🔽up to “that is also called meditative stabilization.”

original: mdzad sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pa dang ldan par bsams te /
analyzed: mdzad sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pa dang ldan par bsams te /
translated: Having previously meditated on emptiness, one imagines oneself as Vairocana arisen from the wheel that is the transformation of the syllable oṃ, with the identity of the three beings, and endowed with union with the consort.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings kyang de bzhin du spyan ma dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi tshogs kyis til gyi gang bu dang 'dra bar yongs su rdzogs par bsgoms la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings kyang de bzhin du spyan ma dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi tshogs kyis til gyi gang bu dang 'dra bar yongs su rdzogs par bsgoms la /
translated: The realm of space is also in that way completely filled with a collection of Vairocanas in union with Locanā, like a filled sesame pod.

original: ye shes sems dpa'i snying ga'i 'od zer gyi sbyor bas bkug cing snyoms par zhugs pa'i bde bas thim par 'gyur bar zhugs shing ye shes sems dpa'i snying gar bsgrub bya bcug la /
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa'i snying ga'i 'od zer gyi sbyor bas bkug cing snyoms par zhugs pa'i bde bas thim par 'gyur bar zhugs shing ye shes sems dpa'i snying gar bsgrub bya bcug la /
translated: One should imagine that the object to be purified is placed in the heart of the gnosis being, and one should imagine that the object to be purified is drawn in by the rays of light from the heart of the gnosis being and dissolves into the bliss of union.

original: de la des dbang bskur byin te nad thams cad zad par byas la slar yang nad ba rang gi snying gnas spro zhing mdun du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzugs su rnam par bkod la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spyan
analyzed: de la des dbang bskur byin te nad thams cad zad par byas la slar yang nad ba rang gi snying gnas spro zhing mdun du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzugs su rnam par bkod la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spyan
translated: Again, the patient should imagine that the light rays emanate from his heart and are arranged in the form of Vairocana on a moon disc in front.

original: ma'i chos 'byung gi nang na sngar bcug pa yang rdo rje'i rtse mo nas phyung zhing phyi rol du spros la /
analyzed: ma'i chos 'byung gi nang na sngar bcug pa yang rdo rje'i rtse mo nas phyung zhing phyi rol du spros la /
translated: All the Tathagatas who were previously placed in the source of phenomena are drawn out from the tip of the vajra and emanated externally.🔽Those who abide in the realm of space confer empowerment with the waves of bodhicitta that arise from their union.

original: nam mkha'i khams la gnas pa de rnams kyis snyoms par zhugs pa las byung pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi dpa'i rlabs kyis dbang bskur bar bya bas lan lag rdzogs pa nor gyi phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur bar nad pa bsam par bya'o zhes bstan
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams la gnas pa de rnams kyis snyoms par zhugs pa las byung pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi dpa'i rlabs kyis dbang bskur bar bya bas lan lag rdzogs pa nor gyi phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur bar nad pa bsam par bya'o zhes bstan
translated: The patient should imagine that he becomes endowed with the perfection of wealth, the perfection of all desired goals.

original: to // de ni thabs dang shes rab snyoms par zhugs pa'i rim pas zhi ba'i las kyi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: to // de ni thabs dang shes rab snyoms par zhugs pa'i rim pas zhi ba'i las kyi sbyor ba'o //
translated: This is the application of the pacifying activity through the process of the union of method and wisdom.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba nas ting nge 'dzin gong du ston pa de la de skad ces bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'od dpag tu med pa dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub pa dang mi bskyod pa rnams kyis snga ma bzhin
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba nas ting nge 'dzin gong du ston pa de la de skad ces bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'od dpag tu med pa dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub pa dang mi bskyod pa rnams kyis snga ma bzhin
translated: The section from “the moon maṇḍala” up to “the samādhi is called that” is the meditation on the form of Amitābha, and so on, as before.

original: du 'od dpag tu med pa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis rang gi phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i bdag nyid bsgoms la /
analyzed: du 'od dpag tu med pa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis rang gi phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i bdag nyid bsgoms la /
translated: Meditate on oneself as the nature of the union with the consort in the form of Amitābha, and so on.🔽Meditate on the maṇḍalas of the earth, water, fire, and wind in the dharmodayas of the consorts.

original: rang gi phyag rgya'i chos 'byung gi nang na med dang dbang chen dang rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor bsgoms la de rnams su 'od dpag tu med pa la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan du bdag nyid bsams la /
analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya'i chos 'byung gi nang na med dang dbang chen dang rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor bsgoms la de rnams su 'od dpag tu med pa la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan du bdag nyid bsams la /
translated: Think that one’s form is reflected in those maṇḍalas of Amitābha, and so on.

original: rang gi snying gar bsgrub bya 'jug cing snga ma bzhin du nam mkha'i khams nas 'od dpag du med pa la sogs pa'i tshogs rang gi phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pa dgug cing /
analyzed: rang gi snying gar bsgrub bya 'jug cing snga ma bzhin du nam mkha'i khams nas 'od dpag du med pa la sogs pa'i tshogs rang gi phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pa dgug cing /
translated: Invite the assembly of Amitābha, and so on, with the consort into one’s heart, as before.

original: snyoms par zhugs pa'i dbang gis zhu ba snying gar bcug pa /
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa'i dbang gis zhu ba snying gar bcug pa /
translated: The melting is placed in the heart by the power of union.

original: des bsgrub bya dbang bskur zhing mdun du sngar bshad pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams la dgod cing snyoms par zhugs pa'i @68a * //
analyzed: des bsgrub bya dbang bskur zhing mdun du sngar bshad pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams la dgod cing snyoms par zhugs pa'i @68a * //
translated: By that, the one to be accomplished is empowered, and is placed in the maṇḍalas explained previously in front.

original: dbang gis rdo rje'i rtse mo nas spros pa'i nam mkha'i khams la gnas pa de rnams kyis snyoms par zhugs pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyi dpa' rlabs kyis dbang bskur bar bya ba bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang gis rdo rje'i rtse mo nas spros pa'i nam mkha'i khams la gnas pa de rnams kyis snyoms par zhugs pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyi dpa' rlabs kyis dbang bskur bar bya ba bsam par bya'o //
translated: The waves of bodhicitta arising from union are imagined to empower those abiding in the realm of space emanated from the tip of the vajra.

original: de'i tshe dbang dang rgyas pa dang mngon spyod 'grub bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i tshe dbang dang rgyas pa dang mngon spyod 'grub bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: At that time, the powers, increase, and wrathful activity are accomplished.

original: 'dir mi bskyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mngon par spyod pa'i khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir mi bskyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mngon par spyod pa'i khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain the special conduct of the Akṣobhya meditative concentration,

original: rdo rje nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: rdo rje nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares the vajra space, and so on.

original: mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas bskyed pa'i rim pa'i bdag nyid zhe sdang rdo rjer bsams la /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas bskyed pa'i rim pa'i bdag nyid zhe sdang rdo rjer bsams la /
translated: The practitioner of Akṣobhya, having contemplated the essence of the creation stage as Hatred Vajra,

original: rang gi snying ga las srin po la sogs pa spros pas nam mkha' gang bar byas la bsgrub bya yang me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa skyabs med pa bsgoms te /
analyzed: rang gi snying ga las srin po la sogs pa spros pas nam mkha' gang bar byas la bsgrub bya yang me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa skyabs med pa bsgoms te /
translated: Having emanated rakshasas and so forth from one's heart, one should fill the sky with them, and also visualize the victim standing in the middle of a fire-disk, without any protector.

original: srin po la sogs pa de rnams kyis za bar gyur pa srog dang bral ba de'i rnam par shes pa yang snga ma bzhin du mi bskyod pa'i gzugs can bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: srin po la sogs pa de rnams kyis za bar gyur pa srog dang bral ba de'i rnam par shes pa yang snga ma bzhin du mi bskyod pa'i gzugs can bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, those rakshasas and so forth should eat him, and his consciousness should be meditated upon as having the form of Akshobhya, as before.

original: de'i tshe mngon spyod 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i tshe mngon spyod 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: At that time, the abhicara rite will be accomplished.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas grangs med pa nyid du bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sngar bshad pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku mdog la gos pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas grangs med pa nyid du bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sngar bshad pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku mdog la gos pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, from and so forth up to explained as countless is explained in order to teach the color of the body of Vairochana and so forth, which was previously explained.

original: sprin dkar po ltar zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad zhi ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: sprin dkar po ltar zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad zhi ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: The white in like a white cloud is because Vairocana has the nature of peace and the nature of mirror-like primordial wisdom.

original: zhal bar ma ni dkar po zhes pa ni sku'i mdog kyang yin te /
analyzed: zhal bar ma ni dkar po zhes pa ni sku'i mdog kyang yin te /
translated: The middle in the middle face is white is the color of the body.

original: skyu'i rang bzhin pas so //
analyzed: skyu'i rang bzhin pas so //
translated: It is because of the nature of the body.

original: g-yas pa nag po'i zhes pa ni thugs kyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: g-yas pa nag po'i zhes pa ni thugs kyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: The right in the right face is black is because of the nature of mind.

original: me tog ku mu ta zhes pa ni padma'i me tog go //
analyzed: me tog ku mu ta zhes pa ni padma'i me tog go //
translated: The kumuda in like a kumuda flower is a lotus flower.

original: de dang 'dra ba g-yon pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba g-yon pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: The left in the left face is like that is because of the nature of Amitābha.

original: de bzhin du gzhan rnams kyi yang zhal gyi rnam par dag pa shes par bya'o //🔽de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi bskyod pa'i sku mdog la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan rnams kyi yang zhal gyi rnam par dag pa shes par bya'o // de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi bskyod pa'i sku mdog la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: In the same way, the purities of the faces of the others should be understood.🔽Thus, etc. teaches the color of Akṣobhya's body and so on.

original: de bzhin 'dod chags can zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin 'dod chags can zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: Thus, etc. teaches the color of Amitābha's body and so on.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas zhi ba la sogs pa las gang yin pa de la gsum bsgoms pas sgrub cing rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas zhi ba la sogs pa las gang yin pa de la gsum bsgoms pas sgrub cing rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, etc. shows that whatever the rite, pacifying, etc. , it is accomplished and perfected by the meditation on the three.

original: 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang padma zhes bya ba ni phyag mtshan gtso bor bstan to //
analyzed: 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang padma zhes bya ba ni phyag mtshan gtso bor bstan to //
translated: Wheel, vajra, and lotus are the principal emblems.

original: sgrub pa'i thabs las @68b bshad pa'i rim gyis zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i sgrub thabs kyi rim pas so //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i thabs las @68b bshad pa'i rim gyis zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i sgrub thabs kyi rim pas so //
translated: By the process explained in the means of achievement means by the process of the means of achievement explained above.

original: 'dod pa'i don zhes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don zhes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The desired aim is pacifying, etc.

original: de rdzogs pa ni sgrub par byed pas so //
analyzed: de rdzogs pa ni sgrub par byed pas so //
translated: Its perfection is its accomplishment.

original: de bzhin du rin chen la sogs pa rnams kyi yang zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub pa dang byams pa la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rin chen la sogs pa rnams kyi yang zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub pa dang byams pa la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Likewise, etc. refers to Ratnasaṃbhava, Amoghasiddhi, Maitreya, etc.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kye phyag rgya zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyan ma'i kha dog la sogs pa yang rnam par snang mdzad dang 'dra bar bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kye phyag rgya zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyan ma'i kha dog la sogs pa yang rnam par snang mdzad dang 'dra bar bstan to //
translated: The color, etc. of Locanā is taught as being like Vairocana, etc.

original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pas bdag po dang 'dra bar m'a ma k'i bstan to //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pas bdag po dang 'dra bar m'a ma k'i bstan to //
translated: Akṣobhya, etc., are like the master, and Māmakī is like the mistress.

original: gsung rdo rje ni 'od dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gos dkar mo dang sgrol ma ni bdag po dang 'dra bar bstan to //
analyzed: gsung rdo rje ni 'od dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gos dkar mo dang sgrol ma ni bdag po dang 'dra bar bstan to //
translated: Vāgvajra is Amitābha, etc., and Pāṇḍaravāsinī and Tārā are like the master and mistress.

original: de rnams kyang nad la sogs pa rab tu zhi ba'i ngo bo zhi ba la sogs pa'i las mdzad pa'i lha mo yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyang nad la sogs pa rab tu zhi ba'i ngo bo zhi ba la sogs pa'i las mdzad pa'i lha mo yin no //
translated: And they are goddesses who perform the functions of pacifying, etc., which have the nature of completely pacifying disease, etc.

original: go sla ste zhes pa ni khro bo'i rgyal po'i dkyil 'khor gyi ji ltar gsungs pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: go sla ste zhes pa ni khro bo'i rgyal po'i dkyil 'khor gyi ji ltar gsungs pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: “Easy to understand” means that the maṇḍala of the king of wrathful deities is not explained because the colors, shapes, etc., as stated are easy to understand.

original: de rnams kyang dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po bzhi dang rnam par shes pa tshogs drug gi ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyang dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po bzhi dang rnam par shes pa tshogs drug gi ngo bo yin no //
translated: And they are the nature of the four faculties of faith, etc., and the six collections of consciousness.

original: bka'i 'khor lo zhes pa ni bgegs bskrad pa'i don tu bskul bar byas pas so //
analyzed: bka'i 'khor lo zhes pa ni bgegs bskrad pa'i don tu bskul bar byas pas so //
translated: “Wheel of command” means that they are urged for the purpose of expelling obstructors.

original: gzi brjid phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzi brjid kyi phung po dang / rgyal pa'i gtsug tor dang rnam par rgyal ba'i gtsug tor dang bzhin mi bzang ba dang bzhin mi bzang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dpal de kho na nyid las bsdus pa dang sgyu 'phrul dra ba la sogs pa las gsungs pa'i khro bo rnams dang
analyzed: gzi brjid phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzi brjid kyi phung po dang / rgyal pa'i gtsug tor dang rnam par rgyal ba'i gtsug tor dang bzhin mi bzang ba dang bzhin mi bzang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dpal de kho na nyid las bsdus pa dang sgyu 'phrul dra ba la sogs pa las gsungs pa'i khro bo rnams dang
translated: The mass of splendor and so forth are the wrathful ones taught in the Shriparamādya Tantra and the Net of Illusory Manifestations and so forth, such as the mass of splendor, the crest of the conqueror, the crest of total victory, the one with an ugly face, the one with an ugly face and so forth.

original: / de bzhin du byams pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' brgyad dang / spos kyi glang po la sogs pa'i bskal pa bzang po'i byang chub sems dpa' bcu drug po de rnams rdo rje la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan rang rang gi rigs dang mthun pas so sor bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du byams pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' brgyad dang / spos kyi glang po la sogs pa'i bskal pa bzang po'i byang chub sems dpa' bcu drug po de rnams rdo rje la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan rang rang gi rigs dang mthun pas so sor bsgom par bya'o //
translated: And likewise, the eight bodhisattvas such as Maitreya and the sixteen bodhisattvas of the fortunate eon such as Gandhahastin should be meditated on with their individual hand implements such as the vajra that are in accordance with their individual families.

original: 'di nyid kyi gtan tshigs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi gtan tshigs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reason for this, it is said:

original: lha rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ting 'dzin ni dpag tu med pa yod de /
analyzed: lha rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ting 'dzin ni dpag tu med pa yod de /
translated: The buddhas, the transcendent lords, have immeasurable concentrations.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rigs dang bag chags kyi dbye bas sems can gyi khams kyang nam mkha' dang 'dra bar mtha' yas pa'o //🔽de rjes su gzung ba'i don du yang bcom @69a * //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rigs dang bag chags kyi dbye bas sems can gyi khams kyang nam mkha' dang 'dra bar mtha' yas pa'o // de rjes su gzung ba'i don du yang bcom @69a * //
translated: The realms of sentient beings are infinite like space, due to the diversity of their lineages and habitual tendencies.

original: ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis sprul pa'i sku yang mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis sprul pa'i sku yang mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: For the sake of guiding them, the transcendent lords, the tathagatas, have infinite emanation bodies.

original: de rnams kyang pho nya la sogs pa'i dbye bas dpag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyang pho nya la sogs pa'i dbye bas dpag tu med pa ste /
translated: Those are also immeasurable due to the diversity of messengers and so on.

original: gal te nam mkha'i khams la 'di tsam zhes tshad yod na de'i tshe de gang bar byas nas logs su de dmigs par 'gyur ba srid do //
analyzed: gal te nam mkha'i khams la 'di tsam zhes tshad yod na de'i tshe de gang bar byas nas logs su de dmigs par 'gyur ba srid do //
translated: If the space element had a finite measure, then it would be possible to fill it and to perceive it as separate.

original: de bas na de rnams ma gsungs pa yang rigs dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyag mtshan la sogs pa'i dbang gis rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de rnams ma gsungs pa yang rigs dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyag mtshan la sogs pa'i dbang gis rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that they are not mentioned, but they can be inferred from the hand implements and so on that are consistent with their lineages.

original: de ni zhes pa la sogs pa'i sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas 'od gsal ba la 'jug cing /
analyzed: de ni zhes pa la sogs pa'i sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas 'od gsal ba la 'jug cing /
translated: The that is the entry into clear light by the process of the purification of the mind, and the arising is the arising of the illusory body from that clear light.

original: de las byung ba'i sgyu ma lta bu'i sku dang ldan pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i bskyed pa bstan to //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i sgyu ma lta bu'i sku dang ldan pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i bskyed pa bstan to //
translated: The Vairochana and so on is the teaching of the creation stage endowed with the illusory body.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings ni 'od gsal ba'o zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob par bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings ni 'od gsal ba'o zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob par bya'o //
translated: The realm of space is clear light, and it is to be attained by the process of the purification of the mind.

original: snang ba gsum mo zhes pa ni snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa gsum mtshams dang nyi ma dang zla ba'i snang ba dang 'dra ba'o//
analyzed: snang ba gsum mo zhes pa ni snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa gsum mtshams dang nyi ma dang zla ba'i snang ba dang 'dra ba'o//
translated: The three appearances are the three appearances of the close-to-attainment and so on, which are like the appearances of the sun, moon, and the horizon.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag dang 'dra par zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rnam pa lnga ltos pa med pa ni mi brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag dang 'dra par zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rnam pa lnga ltos pa med pa ni mi brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the moon, vajra, and so on, which are like the branches of the creation stage, are the five manifest enlightenments, because they are not dependent on the creation stage, since they are not supported by it.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gzugs zhes pa ni dang po bdag nyid bsgoms la yang de nyid rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i gzugs su yongs su 'gyur ba spro bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis phyag rgya chen po yongs su 'gyur ba bstan to //🔽khug rnal sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad sku mdog dkar ba dang zhi ba dang 'od zer lngas mdzes pa dang me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi ngo bo dang rnam pa thams cad kyi
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gzugs zhes pa ni dang po bdag nyid bsgoms la yang de nyid rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i gzugs su yongs su 'gyur ba spro bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis phyag rgya chen po yongs su 'gyur ba bstan to // khug rnal sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad sku mdog dkar ba dang zhi ba dang 'od zer lngas mdzes pa dang me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi ngo bo dang rnam pa thams cad kyi
translated: The phrase “the form of Great Vajradhara” means that first one should meditate on oneself, and then emanate that very [form] in the form of Vairochana and so forth. This teaches the transformation of the great seal.

original: mchog dang ldan pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: mchog dang ldan pa nyid bstan to //
translated: The phrase “free from the faults of lethargy and so forth” teaches that the Bhagavat Vairochana has a white body, is peaceful, is beautified by the five lights, is the essence of mirror-like wisdom, and is endowed with the supreme of all aspects.
