original: bsgom pa'i rim pa 'dis mngon par byang chub bsgoms nas rim gyis mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin mthong ba ni thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rim pa 'dis mngon par byang chub bsgoms nas rim gyis mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin mthong ba ni thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By meditating on manifest enlightenment through this process of meditation, one gradually attains the non-abiding nirvana, which is the seeing of the samadhi of union. This is the meaning.

original: sangs rgyas kyi dbang phyug ces bya ba la sogs pas phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi dbang phyug ces bya ba la sogs pas phan yon bstan to //
translated: The phrase “the lord of the buddhas” and so on teaches the benefits.

original: sku'i dbang phyug la sogs pa brgyad po ni sangs rgyas rnams kye dbang phyug go //
analyzed: sku'i dbang phyug la sogs pa brgyad po ni sangs rgyas rnams kye dbang phyug go //
translated: The eight, beginning with the “lord of the body,” are the lords of the buddhas.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa 'dud par byed pa'o zhes pa ni 'dud pa'i ngo bor byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa 'dud par byed pa'o zhes pa ni 'dud pa'i ngo bor byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase “he causes the śrāvakas and so on to bow down” means that he causes them to bow down in essence.

original: gang gi phyir yang dag par rdzogs @69b pa'i sangs rgyas kyi cho 'phrul dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i cho 'phrul ni mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang dag par rdzogs @69b pa'i sangs rgyas kyi cho 'phrul dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i cho 'phrul ni mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the miracles of the perfect buddhas and the miracles of the śrāvakas and so on are not the same,

original: de rnams ma dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams ma dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are impure.

original: yang skra'i rtse mo'i bye ba 'bum gyi grangs kyis kyang mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang skra'i rtse mo'i bye ba 'bum gyi grangs kyis kyang mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, they are not the same even in terms of the number of hundreds of thousands of the tip of a hair.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba dang de bzhin gshegs pa dag gi mtshan dang dpe byad bzhin no //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba dang de bzhin gshegs pa dag gi mtshan dang dpe byad bzhin no //
translated: This is like the marks and signs of the cakravartins and the tathāgatas.

original: lus 'di nyid la ni mthong ba'i chos la'o //
analyzed: lus 'di nyid la ni mthong ba'i chos la'o //
translated: This very body is in the present life.

original: des ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pa las ldog pa bstan te /
analyzed: des ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pa las ldog pa bstan te /
translated: This teaches the reversal of the perfection yogas.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis byang chub thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis byang chub thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because enlightenment is attained in three incalculable aeons.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyis zhes pa la sogs pas ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyis zhes pa la sogs pas ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsdus pa'o //
translated: The summary of the samadhi is stated by Vairochana and so forth.

original: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba nas ting nge 'dzin de la de skad ces bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni mi bskyod pa dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub pa dang / spyan ma dang m'a ma k'i dang gos dkar mod dang dam tshig sgrol ma dang /
analyzed: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba nas ting nge 'dzin de la de skad ces bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni mi bskyod pa dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub pa dang / spyan ma dang m'a ma k'i dang gos dkar mod dang dam tshig sgrol ma dang /
translated: The vajra maṇḍala and so forth up to that samadhi is called that is Akṣhobhya, Amitābha, Ratnasambhava, Amoghasiddhi, Locanā, Māmakī, Pāṇḍaravāsinī, and Samayatārā.

original: gshin rje mthar byed dang shes rab mthar byed dang padma mthar byed dang bgegs pa mthar byed dang mi g-yo ba dang dbyug sngon can dang 'dod pa'i rgyal po dang stobs po che dang gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur pa dang / gnod mdzes kyir gyal po sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas 'od gsal ba la 'jug cing slar yang snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pas 'jug cing mngon par byang chub pa mngon du byas la zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob par
analyzed: gshin rje mthar byed dang shes rab mthar byed dang padma mthar byed dang bgegs pa mthar byed dang mi g-yo ba dang dbyug sngon can dang 'dod pa'i rgyal po dang stobs po che dang gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur pa dang / gnod mdzes kyir gyal po sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas 'od gsal ba la 'jug cing slar yang snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pas 'jug cing mngon par byang chub pa mngon du byas la zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob par
translated: Yamântaka, Prajñâ Yamântaka, Padma Yamântaka, Vetâla Yamântaka, Acala, Nîladanda, Kâmarâja, Mahâbala, Uṣṇîṣa Cakravartin, and Sumbha Râja, enter into clear light by the stage of the purification of the mind, and again enter by the stage of the attainment of light, and so forth, and manifest the state of manifest enlightenment, and attain the samâdhi of union.

original: 'gyur ro zhes bstan to /
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes bstan to /
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: 'dir ni drug pa rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: 'dir ni drug pa rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: Here, the sixth is Vajradhara.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las dkyil 'khor thams cad bsgom par bya'o zhes man ngag go //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las dkyil 'khor thams cad bsgom par bya'o zhes man ngag go //
translated: From his transformation, one should meditate on the entire mandala.

original: snang ba gsum zhes bya ba ni snang ba la sogs ba ye shes gsum mo //
analyzed: snang ba gsum zhes bya ba ni snang ba la sogs ba ye shes gsum mo //
translated: The three lights are the three intuitions of light, and so on.

original: stong pa nyid gsum mo zhes pa ni stong ba dang shin tu stong pa dang stong pa chen po'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gsum mo zhes pa ni stong ba dang shin tu stong pa dang stong pa chen po'o //
translated: The three emptinesses are emptiness, great emptiness, and ultimate emptiness.

original: rgyu ma'i mtshan ma'i phyir zhes pa ni bud med kyi sgyu mas thon par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu ma'i mtshan ma'i phyir zhes pa ni bud med kyi sgyu mas thon par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because of the sign of the womb, it is the emergence of the illusion of a woman.

original: sgyu ma dag ni thams cad las //
analyzed: sgyu ma dag ni thams cad las //
translated: All illusions

original: bud med sgyu ma khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: bud med sgyu ma khyad par 'phags //
translated: are surpassed by the illusion of a woman.

original: ye shes gsum gyi dbye ba ni ;
analyzed: ye shes gsum gyi dbye ba ni ;
translated: The division of the three intuitions

original: /'di nyid las ni mtshon par 'gyur //🔽zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: /'di nyid las ni mtshon par 'gyur // zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: is indicated just by this.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni 'od gsal ba'o /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni 'od gsal ba'o /
translated: The ultimate truth is clear light.

original: shes rab dang thabs nye bar thob pa zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum dang 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gsum spong bar byed pa'o //🔽snang ba @70a * //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs nye bar thob pa zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum dang 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gsum spong bar byed pa'o // snang ba @70a * //
translated: The attainment of wisdom and means is the abandonment of the three intuitions such as appearance and the three consciousnesses such as the engaged.

original: chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ni ye shes gsum nye bar sdud par bye dpa'i 'od gsal ba'o /
analyzed: chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ni ye shes gsum nye bar sdud par bye dpa'i 'od gsal ba'o /
translated: The great appearance and so forth is the clear light that is the basis of the withdrawal of the three intuitions.

original: bstan pa la gnod par byad pa zhes pa la sogs pa 'dis gshin rje mthar byed kyis gdul par dka' ba 'dul pa nyid bstan to /
analyzed: bstan pa la gnod par byad pa zhes pa la sogs pa 'dis gshin rje mthar byed kyis gdul par dka' ba 'dul pa nyid bstan to /
translated: The phrase those who harm the doctrine and so forth indicates that Yamantaka subdues those who are difficult to subdue.

original: rdo rje gsum gyi gnas ni 'od gsal pa'i zhes pa ni ye shes gsum nya bar sdud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyi gnas ni 'od gsal pa'i zhes pa ni ye shes gsum nya bar sdud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase the abode of the three vajras is clear light means that the three exalted wisdoms are gathered into the state of union.

original: rdo rje nam mkha' ni kun du snang ba gsum gyi zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rdo rje nam mkha' ni kun du snang ba gsum gyi zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa gsum mo //
translated: The phrase the vajra space is the three appearances means the three appearances of increase, etc.

original: de nye bar sdud pa'i bdag nyid 'dzin pa 'am thim pas na dbyibs ni 'od gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: de nye bar sdud pa'i bdag nyid 'dzin pa 'am thim pas na dbyibs ni 'od gsal ba nyid do //
translated: Since they are gathered into the state of union, or dissolved into it, the shape of the body is clear light.

original: nam mkha' la spyod pa rnam so zhes pa ni grub pa dang rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la spyod pa rnam so zhes pa ni grub pa dang rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those who move in space are the adepts, knowledge-bearers, etc.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'i zhes pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bstan pas so //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'i zhes pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bstan pas so //
translated: The phrase just as it is indicates the mandala circle.

original: 'gog pa ni gsod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas yan lag bzhi pa dang ro sbyor bsgom zhing /
analyzed: 'gog pa ni gsod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas yan lag bzhi pa dang ro sbyor bsgom zhing /
translated: The phrase the cessation of killing, etc. indicates that the practitioner of the stage of generation meditates on the four branches and the union of bliss and emptiness.

original: dbus kyi gtso bo'i gzugs kyis bka' sbyin te khro bo'i 'khor lo'i sgo nas gdug pa can tshar gcod pa'i thabs bstan to //
analyzed: dbus kyi gtso bo'i gzugs kyis bka' sbyin te khro bo'i 'khor lo'i sgo nas gdug pa can tshar gcod pa'i thabs bstan to //
translated: The central principal grants permission by means of the wheel of wrath, teaching the method of destroying the wicked.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas 'od gsal ba 'jug ste /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas 'od gsal ba 'jug ste /
translated: The practitioner of the stage of completion enters luminosity by the process of purifying the mind.

original: yang bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas langs la sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis phrin las thams cad 'grub par byed do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yang bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas langs la sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis phrin las thams cad 'grub par byed do zhes bstan to //
translated: Again, he arises by the process of self-consecration and accomplishes all activities by means of the illusion-like concentration.

original: gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis zhes pa ni khro bo'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis zhes pa ni khro bo'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: By means of the concentrations of Yamantaka, etc., means by means of the nature of wrath.

original: lha rnams kyi 'khor lo bsten cing dmigs pas so zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pas dkyil 'khor spro bar byas pas so //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi 'khor lo bsten cing dmigs pas so zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pas dkyil 'khor spro bar byas pas so //
translated: By means of the wheel of the deities, means by means of the visualization of the mandala.

original: de kho na nyid la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba zhes pa ni bgegs bskrad pa nas brtsams te chos kyi dbyings kyi sngags sngon du 'gro bas so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba zhes pa ni bgegs bskrad pa nas brtsams te chos kyi dbyings kyi sngags sngon du 'gro bas so //
translated: Preceded by the visualization of reality, means preceded by the mantra of the realm of reality, beginning with the expulsion of the obstructors.

original: sa bon dgod pa sngon du 'gro bas zhes pa ni yi ge sum dgod pa sngon du 'go ba'o //
analyzed: sa bon dgod pa sngon du 'gro bas zhes pa ni yi ge sum dgod pa sngon du 'go ba'o //
translated: The phrase preceded by the planting of the seed means preceded by the planting of the syllable SŪM.

original: rdo rje la sogs pa dmigs pa dang zhes pa ni yig 'bru yongs su gyur pa las mtshan ma la sogs pa dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs pa dmigs pa dang zhes pa ni yig 'bru yongs su gyur pa las mtshan ma la sogs pa dmigs pa'o //
translated: The phrase the observation of the vajra and so forth means the observation of the insignia and so forth that arise from the transformation of the seed syllable.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las zhes pa ni phyag mtshan yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i lha'i sku'o //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las zhes pa ni phyag mtshan yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i lha'i sku'o //
translated: The phrase from the transformation of that means the deity body of Vajradhara and so forth that arises from the transformation of the insignia.

original: de dag ni sku rnams so //🔽dka' ye 'khor lo la dmigs pa//
analyzed: de dag ni sku rnams so // dka' ye 'khor lo la dmigs pa//
translated: Those are the bodies.🔽 The phrase the observation of the wheel means the observation of the wheel of wrathful deities.

original: @70b zhes pa ni khro bo'i 'khor lo spro bas 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: @70b zhes pa ni khro bo'i 'khor lo spro bas 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: That is accomplished by the emanation of the wheel of wrathful deities,

original: des gdug pa rnams sel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des gdug pa rnams sel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that removes the wicked.

original: drang ba'i don to zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa bstan pas so //
analyzed: drang ba'i don to zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa bstan pas so //
translated: The phrase the provisional meaning means the teaching of the creation stage.

original: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni tha mal pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid po //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni tha mal pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid po //
translated: The phrase the aggregates of form and so forth means the five aggregates that are characterized by the ordinary appropriation.

original: de rnams sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas 'gugs pa ne don dam pa'i bden pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas 'gugs pa ne don dam pa'i bden pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The invocation of those by the stages of mantra and seal is the entry into ultimate reality.

original: rang bzhin gyi ni brgya drug cu'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi ni brgya drug cu'o //
translated: The natural one is the one of the sixty-four.

original: lus ltar snang ba'i ye shes gsum ni lus so //
analyzed: lus ltar snang ba'i ye shes gsum ni lus so //
translated: The three intuitions appearing as the body are the body.

original: rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o zhes pa ni de zlog par byed pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'o zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o zhes pa ni de zlog par byed pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'o zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: The turning away from that is the abiding in the concentration of the perfection stage, which is the entry into clearlight.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag nyid ces pa ni bde ba chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag nyid ces pa ni bde ba chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of concentration is the nature of the concentration of great bliss.

original: rdo rje ye shes ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams sa //
analyzed: rdo rje ye shes ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams sa //
translated: The vajra intuition is the bodies of the Ones-Gone-Thus.

original: don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor ni 'od gsal ba las ldang bar gyur pa la zhes pa ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas sprul pa'i sku blangs pas 'grub par 'gyur ba ni rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor ni 'od gsal ba las ldang bar gyur pa la zhes pa ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas sprul pa'i sku blangs pas 'grub par 'gyur ba ni rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The ultimate maṇḍala is the arising from clearlight, which is the accomplishment of the taking of the emanation body by the stage of self-consecration.

original: nges pa'i don to zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa dang bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i don to zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa dang bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase definitive meaning is because it teaches the stage of the pure mind and the self-consecration.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa gnyis kyis phyag rgya chen po'i sku bskyed pa las kyi tshogs bsgrub pa'i sgo nas le'u'i ming don dang ldan pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa gnyis kyis phyag rgya chen po'i sku bskyed pa las kyi tshogs bsgrub pa'i sgo nas le'u'i ming don dang ldan pa bstan to //
translated: By thus-gone and so forth, the name of the chapter is taught to be meaningful from the perspective of accomplishing the accumulation of karma from generating the body of the great seal by the two stages.

original: le'u'i don ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: le'u'i don ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the chapter has been explained above.

original: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa'i 'grel pa'i t'i k'a las le'u bcu gsum pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
analyzed: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa'i 'grel pa'i t'i k'a las le'u bcu gsum pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
translated: This completes the extensive explanation of the thirteenth chapter of the commentary that clarifies the Lamp.

original: // / da na zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u bcu bzhi pa'i bshad pa brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da na zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u bcu bzhi pa'i bshad pa brtsam par bya ste /
translated: Now, beginning with the line na and so forth, the explanation of the fourteenth chapter should be undertaken.

original: sngags smra ba rnam pa bzhin ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sngags smra ba rnam pa bzhin ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The four types of mantra speakers have the characteristics of pacifying and so forth.

original: rjes su 'brangs nas zhes pa ni de dang rjes su mthun pa'i sngags 'brangs nas so //
analyzed: rjes su 'brangs nas zhes pa ni de dang rjes su mthun pa'i sngags 'brangs nas so //
translated: Following means following the mantra that accords with that.

original: gang gi phyir sbrul la sogs pa'i sngags rnams ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i las byed pa yin no zhes rdo rje gtsug tor la sogs pa las bstan pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sbrul la sogs pa'i sngags rnams ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i las byed pa yin no zhes rdo rje gtsug tor la sogs pa las bstan pas so //
translated: Because the mantras of the snake and so on are taught in the Vajra-usnisa and so on to perform the actions of pacifying and so on.

original: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni sngags kyi sgo nas zhi ba la sogs pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //🔽dgongs pa ni 'di yin te le'u bcu gsum pa nas las kyi tshogs bstan mod kyi 'on kyang de @71a * //
analyzed: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni sngags kyi sgo nas zhi ba la sogs pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro // dgongs pa ni 'di yin te le'u bcu gsum pa nas las kyi tshogs bstan mod kyi 'on kyang de @71a * //
translated: For the sake of teaching that, means for the sake of accomplishing pacifying and so on by means of mantra.

original: rnams bsgom pa sngon du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: rnams bsgom pa sngon du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: The idea is this: although the collection of rites is taught in the thirteenth chapter, nevertheless, they are preceded by meditation.

original: le'u bcu bzhi pa las sngags dang bsgom pa dang rdzas kyis de rnams bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: le'u bcu bzhi pa las sngags dang bsgom pa dang rdzas kyis de rnams bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: In the fourteenth chapter, they are to be accomplished by means of mantra, meditation, and substances.

original: go rims zhes pa ni rim pa'o //
analyzed: go rims zhes pa ni rim pa'o //
translated: The order is the sequence.

original: bshad pa'i rgyud ni rdo rje phreng ba las so //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud ni rdo rje phreng ba las so //
translated: The explanatory tantra is the Vajra-vali.

original: zhi ba dang ni rgyas pa dag / zla ba yar gyi ngo la bya //
analyzed: zhi ba dang ni rgyas pa dag / zla ba yar gyi ngo la bya //
translated: Pacifying and enriching are done in the bright fortnight,🔽 and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zhi ba ni nad kyi zil gyis non pa la nad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zhi ba ni nad kyi zil gyis non pa la nad dang bral ba'o //
translated: Pacifying is the freedom from illness of one afflicted by illness.

original: rgyas pa ni nor med pa 'am nor chung ba'i 'bru dang gser la sogs pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa ni nor med pa 'am nor chung ba'i 'bru dang gser la sogs pa byed pa'o //
translated: The extensive one is for one who has no wealth or little wealth, with grains, gold, and so on.

original: de dag yar gyi ngo la zhes pa ni rim gyis zla ba 'phel ba'i bdag nyid kyi dus su bya'o //
analyzed: de dag yar gyi ngo la zhes pa ni rim gyis zla ba 'phel ba'i bdag nyid kyi dus su bya'o //
translated: Those are on the waxing side, which is the time of the nature of the gradually increasing moon.

original: zla ba ni gdung ba zhi pa dang 'phel bar 'gro bas so //
analyzed: zla ba ni gdung ba zhi pa dang 'phel bar 'gro bas so //
translated: The moon is the pacifier of torment and the increaser.

original: dbang ni bstan pa la mi 'jug pa 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dbang ni bstan pa la mi 'jug pa 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: The power one is for engaging in the teaching one who has not yet entered it.

original: mngon spyod ni snying rjes gdul dka' gsod pa'o //
analyzed: mngon spyod ni snying rjes gdul dka' gsod pa'o //
translated: The destruction one is for killing the difficult to tame with compassion.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni gzhan dag kyang rengs pa dang dgar ba dang dgug pa dang sdang ba la sogs pa drag shul gyi las rnams so //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni gzhan dag kyang rengs pa dang dgar ba dang dgug pa dang sdang ba la sogs pa drag shul gyi las rnams so //
translated: The words and so on include the other fierce actions such as paralyzing, dividing, summoning, and enraging.

original: mar gyi do ni go rims kyis zla ba nub pa'i dus su bya ba ste 'khrul pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang / rmongs par byed pa'i phyir dang / 'jigs par byed pa ste dus kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: mar gyi do ni go rims kyis zla ba nub pa'i dus su bya ba ste 'khrul pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang / rmongs par byed pa'i phyir dang / 'jigs par byed pa ste dus kyi nges pa'o //
translated: The waning side is the time of the setting moon, which is the time of error, delusion, and fear. This is the rule of time.

original: byang du kha bltas la zhi ba bya ste /
analyzed: byang du kha bltas la zhi ba bya ste /
translated: One should do the pacifying one facing north.

original: rnam thos sras kyis nad bcom par byed pas so //
analyzed: rnam thos sras kyis nad bcom par byed pas so //
translated: since Vaiśravaṇa is the one who destroys disease.

original: shar du kha blta ba ni rgyas par bya ste brgya byin gyis dus thams cad du rgyas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: shar du kha blta ba ni rgyas par bya ste brgya byin gyis dus thams cad du rgyas par byed pa'o //
translated: One should perform the rite of enriching in the east, since Śakra always enriches;

original: lho phyogs ni lho phyogs su drag po'i las byas te gshin rjes ni 'jig rten pa mthar byed pas so //
analyzed: lho phyogs ni lho phyogs su drag po'i las byas te gshin rjes ni 'jig rten pa mthar byed pas so //
translated: in the south, in the southern direction, one should perform the rite of destroying, since Yama destroys the world;

original: dbang dang dgug pa nub kyi phyogs su bya ste /
analyzed: dbang dang dgug pa nub kyi phyogs su bya ste /
translated: in the west, one should perform the rite of subjugation and summoning;

original: chu lhas ni sbrul gyi zhags pas dgug cing dbang byed pas so //
analyzed: chu lhas ni sbrul gyi zhags pas dgug cing dbang byed pas so //
translated: since Varuṇa summons and subjugates with a noose of snakes;

original: me'i phyogs ni shar lho'i mtshams su'o //
analyzed: me'i phyogs ni shar lho'i mtshams su'o //
translated: in the southeast, in the eastern south,

original: gsod pa ni srog dang bral bar bya ste mes bsreg pa nyid kyis gsod par byed pas so //
analyzed: gsod pa ni srog dang bral bar bya ste mes bsreg pa nyid kyis gsod par byed pas so //
translated: one should perform the rite of killing, of separating from life, since Agni kills by burning;

original: bden bral ni lho nub kyi mtshams su'o //
analyzed: bden bral ni lho nub kyi mtshams su'o //
translated: in the southwest, in the southern west,

original: sdang bar bya ba ni byams pa gnyi ga la dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: sdang bar bya ba ni byams pa gnyi ga la dbye bar bya ste /
translated: one should perform the rite of estranging, of separating the two through love;

original: bden bral ni zhe sdang gi rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: bden bral ni zhe sdang gi rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: since Nirṛti has the nature of hatred.

original: gnas las bskrad pa ni dgar ba ste de rlung gi phyogs su ni nub byang gi mtshams su bya ste /
analyzed: gnas las bskrad pa ni dgar ba ste de rlung gi phyogs su ni nub byang gi mtshams su bya ste /
translated: Banishment from a place is expulsion, which is done in the northwest, the direction of the wind,

original: rlung ni g-yo ba'i ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: rlung ni g-yo ba'i ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: because wind has the nature of movement.

original: de ni phyogs dang mtshams kyi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de ni phyogs dang mtshams kyi dbye ba'o //
translated: This is the analysis of directions and subdirections.

original: de bzhin du sgom pa'i gnas skabs su zhi pa'i las byed na kha dog dkar po'i bdag nyid du bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgom pa'i gnas skabs su zhi pa'i las byed na kha dog dkar po'i bdag nyid du bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Similarly, if one is performing the function of pacification in the context of meditation, one should meditate on the nature of white color.

original: zla ba'i kha dog ni tshim @71b par byed pa dang / tsha ba la sogs pa zhi bar byed pas so //
analyzed: zla ba'i kha dog ni tshim @71b par byed pa dang / tsha ba la sogs pa zhi bar byed pas so //
translated: The color of the moon pacifies heat and so on.

original: rgyas pa'i las byed na kha dog ser po'i bdag nyid bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyas pa'i las byed na kha dog ser po'i bdag nyid bsgom par bya ste /
translated: If one is performing the function of enriching, one should meditate on the nature of yellow color.

original: gser ni rgyas par byed pas so //
analyzed: gser ni rgyas par byed pas so //
translated: Gold enriches.

original: dbang dang 'gugs par byed na kha dog dmar po'i bdag nyid bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: dbang dang 'gugs par byed na kha dog dmar po'i bdag nyid bsgom par bya ste /
translated: If one is performing the function of controlling and summoning, one should meditate on the nature of red color.

original: padma la sogs pas snying 'phrog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: padma la sogs pas snying 'phrog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The lotus and so on captivate the heart.

original: gsod pa'i las la kha dog nag po bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: gsod pa'i las la kha dog nag po bsgom par bya ste /
translated: If one is performing the function of killing, one should meditate on black color.

original: mun pas 'jig rten pa thams cad sgrib par byed pas so //
analyzed: mun pas 'jig rten pa thams cad sgrib par byed pas so //
translated: Darkness obscures all worldly people.

original: de ni kha dog gi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de ni kha dog gi dbye ba'o //
translated: This is the classification of colors.

original: byams pa'i bde pa dang ldan pa ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa'i bde pa dang ldan pa ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: The mind endowed with the bliss of love is desire.🔽One should perform the action of expansion with a mind of joy.

original: de gtso bor gyur pa'i sems kyis zhi ba'i las bya ste gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: de gtso bor gyur pa'i sems kyis zhi ba'i las bya ste gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas so //
translated: Because joy is the nature of the desire for abundance in others.

original: de bzhin du dga' ba'i sems kyis rgyas pa'i las bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dga' ba'i sems kyis rgyas pa'i las bya ste /
translated: Similarly, one should perform the action of subjugation with a mind of passion.

original: dga' bas ni gzhan la phun sum tshogs pa'i 'dod pa'i bdag nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: dga' bas ni gzhan la phun sum tshogs pa'i 'dod pa'i bdag nyid yin pas so //
translated: Because one who is passionate has power over others, not one who is free from passion.

original: de bzhin du chags pa'i sems kyis dbang gi las bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du chags pa'i sems kyis dbang gi las bya ste /
translated: Similarly, one should perform the action of killing with a mind of anger.

original: chags pa dang bcas pas gzhan la dbang byed pa yin gyi chags pa dang bral bas ma yin pas so //
analyzed: chags pa dang bcas pas gzhan la dbang byed pa yin gyi chags pa dang bral bas ma yin pas so //
translated: Because one who is angry has the ability to harm others, not one who is free from anger.🔽The action of pacifying is performed with a mind of faith.🔽Because one who has faith is gentle, not one who lacks faith.🔽The action of increasing is performed with a mind of pride.🔽Because one who is proud is prosperous, not one who lacks pride.🔽The action of subjugation is performed with a mind of desire.🔽Because one who is desirous has power over others, not one who is free from desire.

original: de bzhin du khro bo'i sems ni zhe sdang dang ldan pa'i yid kyis gsod ba'i las bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du khro bo'i sems ni zhe sdang dang ldan pa'i yid kyis gsod ba'i las bya ste /
translated: The action of killing is performed with a mind of anger.

original: khros pas gzhan gyi gnod pa la nus pa dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: khros pas gzhan gyi gnod pa la nus pa dang ldan pas so //
translated: Because one who is angry has the ability to harm others, not one who lacks anger.

original: des ni sems kyi skabs kyi khyad par gyi dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: des ni sems kyi skabs kyi khyad par gyi dbye ba bstan to //
translated: This teaches the division of the occasion of the mind.

original: de bzhin du ni srod ni mtshams kyi dus su zhi ba'i las bya ste nyi ma nub nas zla ba shar bas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni srod ni mtshams kyi dus su zhi ba'i las bya ste nyi ma nub nas zla ba shar bas so //
translated: Likewise, in the evening, at the time of twilight, one should perform the pacifying rite, after the sun has set and the moon has risen.

original: gang gi phyir zla ba dang nyi ma ni zhi ba dang drag po ste de dag gi rjes su mthun pa'i las byed pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zla ba dang nyi ma ni zhi ba dang drag po ste de dag gi rjes su mthun pa'i las byed pas so //
translated: Because the moon and sun are peaceful and fierce, and one should perform the rite in accordance with them.

original: snga gro ni nang par de thams cad sad pa'i dus su rgyas pa'i las bya ste /
analyzed: snga gro ni nang par de thams cad sad pa'i dus su rgyas pa'i las bya ste /
translated: In the morning, at dawn, when all have awakened, one should perform the enriching rite,

original: nang bar gyi nyi ma 'phel bar byed pas so //
analyzed: nang bar gyi nyi ma 'phel bar byed pas so //
translated: because the sun increases in the morning.

original: dbang gi las dang mngon spyod kyi las ni nyi ma phyed dang mtshan phyed kyi dus su bya ste /
analyzed: dbang gi las dang mngon spyod kyi las ni nyi ma phyed dang mtshan phyed kyi dus su bya ste /
translated: The rite of power and the rite of assault should be performed at noon and midnight,

original: nyi ma phyed pa'i dus su ni rno ba yin pa dang / mtshan phyed kyi dus su thams cad gnyid log pas dran pa med pas so //
analyzed: nyi ma phyed pa'i dus su ni rno ba yin pa dang / mtshan phyed kyi dus su thams cad gnyid log pas dran pa med pas so //
translated: because at noon it is sharp, and at midnight it is without mindfulness because all are asleep.

original: de ni dus kyi khyad par gyi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de ni dus kyi khyad par gyi dbye ba'o //
translated: This is the division of the occasion.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa /
translated: One who abides in the stage of completion

original: zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe drag po'i las bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i gang yang rung pa'i rnal 'byor pas lkog ma la sogs pa'i gnas bzhi la me la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhi bsgoms la /🔽de rnams su yi ge gsum dmigs nas de la 'jug pa la @72a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe drag po'i las bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i gang yang rung pa'i rnal 'byor pas lkog ma la sogs pa'i gnas bzhi la me la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhi bsgoms la / de rnams su yi ge gsum dmigs nas de la 'jug pa la @72a * //
translated: This passage up to “at that time one should perform the fierce action” teaches that a yogin of any of the great vajradharas and so forth meditates on the four mandalas of fire and so forth at the four places of the throat and so forth.

original: sogs pa'i rim pas bzlas pa bya ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i rim pas bzlas pa bya ste /
translated: Visualizing the three syllables at those places, one should perform repetition by the process of entering and so forth.🔽One should emanate red and so forth light rays moving to the right, to the left, to both, and slowly and weakly, and again gather them at the tip of the nose at the time of each half-session, holding them there.

original: g-yas dang g-yon dang gnyis ka dang dal bus dman par rgyu ba'i dmar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer spro zhing sna'i rtse mor thun phyed phyed kyi dus su de nyid 'dzin pas slar yang bsdus la de'i tshe 'bad rtsol med pas zhi ba la sogs pa bya'o🔽zhes bstan to //
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon dang gnyis ka dang dal bus dman par rgyu ba'i dmar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer spro zhing sna'i rtse mor thun phyed phyed kyi dus su de nyid 'dzin pas slar yang bsdus la de'i tshe 'bad rtsol med pas zhi ba la sogs pa bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: At that time, one should perform pacifying and so forth without exertion.

original: bshad pa'i rgyud las zhes pa ni dgongs pa lung bstan pa las so //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud las zhes pa ni dgongs pa lung bstan pa las so //
translated: “In the explanatory tantra” refers to the Unraveling the Intent Tantra.

original: nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dus //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dus //
translated: “The inner nature of time”

original: zhes pa ni phyi ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyi ma yin pa'o //
translated: refers to the latter.

original: gsang ba chen po ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba chen po ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The great secret is the creation stage.

original: de las shin tu gsang ba ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de las shin tu gsang ba ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: More secret than that is the perfection stage.

original: shin tu phra ba ni rnal 'byor gyi mngon gsum gyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu phra ba ni rnal 'byor gyi mngon gsum gyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Very subtle is to be realized by the direct perception of yoga.

original: byang chub sems kyi byin gyis brlabs pa yin te zhes pa ni byang chub sems kyi ngo bo rdo rje 'chang chen pos byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi byin gyis brlabs pa yin te zhes pa ni byang chub sems kyi ngo bo rdo rje 'chang chen pos byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: It is the consecration of the bodhicitta, which is the essence of the great Vajradhara.

original: 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo yin pas na ye shes so //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo yin pas na ye shes so //
translated: It is wisdom because it is the essence of clear light.

original: de bzhin du rim pa 'di nyid kyis sems can grol bar 'gyur ba dang sngags rnams 'grub par 'gyur te rang bzhin yongs su shes pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rim pa 'di nyid kyis sems can grol bar 'gyur ba dang sngags rnams 'grub par 'gyur te rang bzhin yongs su shes pas so //
translated: In the same way, beings are liberated by this very process, and mantras are accomplished by knowing the nature.

original: de bzhin du zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams su de nyid sems kyi dbyings ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor gyi mtshan nyid rtog pa ma lus pa sreg par byed pas ni zhi ba /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams su de nyid sems kyi dbyings ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor gyi mtshan nyid rtog pa ma lus pa sreg par byed pas ni zhi ba /
translated: In the same way, by the yoga of the subtle essence of the mind, which is the nature of the clear light, all conceptual thoughts are burned up, and so it is peace.

original: gzung ba ni bsten par bya pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba ni bsten par bya pa'o //
translated: The object is that which is to be relied upon.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa ni gzung bar bya ba ma yin te spros pa dang bcas pas so //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa ni gzung bar bya ba ma yin te spros pa dang bcas pas so //
translated: The creation stage is not to be grasped, because it is associated with conceptual elaboration.

original: dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir me tog ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir me tog ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the example, he says, “like the fragrance of a flower,” and so on.

original: ji ltar me tog zang na yang de'i dri snod la sogs pa'am til la sogs pa las tshor bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du kho na nyid mngon du ma gyur na yang sems can so so'i skye bo rnams kyi snying gar gnas te /
analyzed: ji ltar me tog zang na yang de'i dri snod la sogs pa'am til la sogs pa las tshor bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du kho na nyid mngon du ma gyur na yang sems can so so'i skye bo rnams kyi snying gar gnas te /
translated: Just as the fragrance of a flower, even when broken, is experienced in a container, etc., or in sesame seeds, etc., in the same way, even when reality is not manifest, it abides in the hearts of sentient beings, of ordinary persons.

original: bsam gtan kha thon med pas kyang //
analyzed: bsam gtan kha thon med pas kyang //
translated: Even without the recitation of the mantra and the practice of concentration,

original: mi shes sngags kyi rgyal po bzla //🔽zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: mi shes sngags kyi rgyal po bzla // zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: one should recite the king of mantras, though ignorant.

original: dus kyi dbye ba bshad par bya ste nyin mo dang mtshan mo chu tshod drug cu rtsa bzhi'i tshad dang ldan pa'i thun ni brgyad de /
analyzed: dus kyi dbye ba bshad par bya ste nyin mo dang mtshan mo chu tshod drug cu rtsa bzhi'i tshad dang ldan pa'i thun ni brgyad de /
translated: The division of time should be explained. There are eight periods, each of which is of the measure of thirty-six hundredths of a day and night.

original: nyin mo bzhi dang mtshan mo bzhi'o //
analyzed: nyin mo bzhi dang mtshan mo bzhi'o //
translated: There are four periods during the day and four during the night.

original: de la chu tshod brgyad ni thun gcig go //
analyzed: de la chu tshod brgyad ni thun gcig go //
translated: Eight hundredths of a day and night constitute one period.

original: de'i phyed ni chu tshod bzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i phyed ni chu tshod bzhi'o //
translated: Four hundredths of a day and night constitute half a period.

original: de'i phyed ni chu tshod gnyis so //
analyzed: de'i phyed ni chu tshod gnyis so //
translated: half of that is two hours.

original: des na don 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te /
translated: Thus, the meaning is this:

original: nyin mor chu tshod gnyis gnyis dang // mtshan mor chu tshod gnyis gnyis su /
analyzed: nyin mor chu tshod gnyis gnyis dang // mtshan mor chu tshod gnyis gnyis su /
translated: two hours in the day and two hours in the night,

original: sna'i rtse mor thun brgyad kyi nang na thig @72b le bzung nas 'od gsal ba rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi sems rtse gcig pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sna'i rtse mor thun brgyad kyi nang na thig @72b le bzung nas 'od gsal ba rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi sems rtse gcig pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: in the eight periods, one should attain the one-pointed mind which is the nature of the clear light, having taken hold of the drop at the tip of the nose.

original: rim ni zhes bya ba g-yas pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: rim ni zhes bya ba g-yas pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: The stages are the divisions of the right and so forth.

original: go rims ji bzhin ni me'i dkyil 'khor la sogs ba'i dbye bas dmar po la sogs pa'i kha dog gi bye brag gis so //
analyzed: go rims ji bzhin ni me'i dkyil 'khor la sogs ba'i dbye bas dmar po la sogs pa'i kha dog gi bye brag gis so //
translated: The order is the divisions of the maṇḍala of fire and so forth, by the distinctions of the colors red and so forth.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that,

original: me la sogs pa ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: me la sogs pa ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: the maṇḍala of fire and so forth is the brief explanation.

original: chu'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par bstan pa ste go sla'o //
analyzed: chu'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par bstan pa ste go sla'o //
translated: The maṇḍala of water and so forth is the extensive explanation, which is easy to understand.

original: de rnams kyi bdag po ni gtso bo ste spro ba dang / bsdu bar byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bdag po ni gtso bo ste spro ba dang / bsdu bar byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pas so //
translated: The lord of those is the principal one, because he is the nature of the emanation and gathering.

original: rims la sogs pa nye bar zhi ba la sogs pa zhes pa ni rlung dang mkhris pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa las byung ba'i nad thams cad zhi bar byed pas so //
analyzed: rims la sogs pa nye bar zhi ba la sogs pa zhes pa ni rlung dang mkhris pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa las byung ba'i nad thams cad zhi bar byed pas so //
translated: The pacification of fevers and so forth means that all diseases arising from the humors of wind, bile, and so forth are pacified.

original: de zhi bar byad pas na zhes pa ni de 'joms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de zhi bar byad pas na zhes pa ni de 'joms par byed pa'o //
translated: The pacification of those means the destruction of those.

original: khyad par gyur pas na zhes pa ni nad bcom pa'i khyad par du gyur pas so //
analyzed: khyad par gyur pas na zhes pa ni nad bcom pa'i khyad par du gyur pas so //
translated: The special means the special destruction of the disease.

original: sgrub pa po ni rnal 'byor pa rnams te de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dngos grub 'dod pas so //
analyzed: sgrub pa po ni rnal 'byor pa rnams te de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dngos grub 'dod pas so //
translated: The practitioners are the yogis, who desire the powers of all the Tathagatas.

original: de rnams kyi gzung bar bya ba yin pas na zhes pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir yid kyis gzung bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gzung bar bya ba yin pas na zhes pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir yid kyis gzung bar bya ba'o //
translated: The to be held by them means to be held in the mind for the sake of benefiting sentient beings.

original: mnyam par byung ba las zhes pa ni lus la sogs pa phan tshun dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam par byung ba las zhes pa ni lus la sogs pa phan tshun dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The arising equally means that the body and so forth are inseparable from each other.

original: bka' stsal pa'o zhes pa ni gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bka' stsal pa'o zhes pa ni gsungs pa'o //
translated: The declaration means the statement.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sv'a h'a'i bar du'o //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sv'a h'a'i bar du'o //
translated: The Om and so forth up to the Svaha.

original: sbas nas brjod pas na sngags so //
analyzed: sbas nas brjod pas na sngags so //
translated: It is mantra because it is concealed and expressed.

original: sprul zhes bya ba ste zhes pa ni mgo po dang mjug ma dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: sprul zhes bya ba ste zhes pa ni mgo po dang mjug ma dang ldan pas so //
translated: It is called nāga because it has a head and a tail.

original: rdo rje gtsug tor zhes bya ba la sogs pas lung tshad ma nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje gtsug tor zhes bya ba la sogs pas lung tshad ma nyid du bstan to //
translated: The Vajra Uṣṇīṣa, etc. demonstrate the validity of the scriptures.

original: thog ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas aom dang sv'a h'a dag gis thog ma dang tha mar brgyan pa zhi ba'i don du sprul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas aom dang sv'a h'a dag gis thog ma dang tha mar brgyan pa zhi ba'i don du sprul zhes bya'o //
translated: By beginning and so on, the mantra is adorned with Oṃ and Svāhā at the beginning and end for the purpose of pacification, and is called nāga.

original: sngags kyi ming zhes bya ba 'dis sngags rnams kyi brda bstan to //
analyzed: sngags kyi ming zhes bya ba 'dis sngags rnams kyi brda bstan to //
translated: By the name of the mantra he teaches the symbolic meaning of the mantras.

original: sngags kyi don ni de'i brjod bya'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi don ni de'i brjod bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the mantra is its subject matter.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni tshig phrad sdud pas na sngags bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni tshig phrad sdud pas na sngags bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By such as he includes other mantras in order to teach them.

original: de la yi ge aa ni bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: de la yi ge aa ni bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: There, the letter A is Bhagavān Akṣobhya.

original: ao ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: ao ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: O is Amitābha.

original: ma ni rnam par snang mdzad chen po ste de nyid rjes su 'jug pa'i dbyangs so //
analyzed: ma ni rnam par snang mdzad chen po ste de nyid rjes su 'jug pa'i dbyangs so //
translated: Ma is Mahāvairocana, which is the vowel following.

original: de ltar thugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid ni yi ge aom mo //
analyzed: de ltar thugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid ni yi ge aom mo //
translated: Thus, the nature of the three syllables, such as the mind-vajra, is the syllable OṀ.

original: bsod @73a * //
analyzed: bsod @73a * //
translated: The merit-field is the field of merit.

original: nams len pa'o zhes pa ni bkra shis rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nams len pa'o zhes pa ni bkra shis rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The auspicious is the auspicious realization.

original: lhag ma ni 'grel pa mkhan pos legs par bshad pas ni 'dir ma bshad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni 'grel pa mkhan pos legs par bshad pas ni 'dir ma bshad do //
translated: The rest is well explained by the commentator, and so is not explained here.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dir bzlas pa'i dus su sngags kyi yi ge kha dog dkar po dang de'i mchod pa'i dus su me tog la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams kyang kha dog dkar por bsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dir bzlas pa'i dus su sngags kyi yi ge kha dog dkar po dang de'i mchod pa'i dus su me tog la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams kyang kha dog dkar por bsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Here, etc. means that at the time of the recitation, the color of the mantra syllables is white, and at the time of the offering, the flowers, etc. are also white.

original: gzungs 'dis zhes bya ba nas thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du gzungs 'di thos pa tsam gyis nad pa rnams dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / rnam par snang mdzad rjes su dran par 'gyur re zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzungs 'dis zhes bya ba nas thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du gzungs 'di thos pa tsam gyis nad pa rnams dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / rnam par snang mdzad rjes su dran par 'gyur re zhes bstan to //
translated: By merely hearing this dhāraṇī, etc. means that the sick become happy and remember Vairocana.

original: sgrub pa po mngon par 'dod pa rnams so zhes pa ni zhi ba'i don gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa po mngon par 'dod pa rnams so zhes pa ni zhi ba'i don gnyer ba'o //
translated: The practitioner’s desires are the desires for peace.

original: de rnams la rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs yin pas na re zhig zhib 'byung bar ma zad kyi 'on kyang bskul ba ni boo shata la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams la rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs yin pas na re zhig zhib 'byung bar ma zad kyi 'on kyang bskul ba ni boo shata la sogs pa'o //
translated: Since those are the family of Vairocana, they are yellow, etc.

original: kha dog ni ser po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog ni ser po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Color is yellow, etc.

original: bsam pa ni dga' ba dang chags pa dang khros pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni dga' ba dang chags pa dang khros pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thought is joy, passion, anger, etc.

original: de'i bye brag gis kyang las thams cad rgyas pa la sogs pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bye brag gis kyang las thams cad rgyas pa la sogs pa byed pa'o //
translated: By its distinction, all actions are performed, such as expansion, etc.

original: des ni sngags re res las thams cad byed pa yin na yang kha cig gtso bo yin no zhes bstan te rab tu grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ni sngags re res las thams cad byed pa yin na yang kha cig gtso bo yin no zhes bstan te rab tu grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although each mantra performs all actions, it is taught that some are principal, because they are well known.

original: las gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽shi ba slong par byed pas na //
analyzed: las gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir / shi ba slong par byed pas na //
translated: In order to teach other actions,

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //
translated: it is taught:🔽By raising the dead,

original: de dag ni de dang 'dra ba'i sngags ni spyan ma'i sngags te mthu ni de'i nus pa bstan to //
analyzed: de dag ni de dang 'dra ba'i sngags ni spyan ma'i sngags te mthu ni de'i nus pa bstan to //
translated: Those are the mantras of Locanā, and power is the teaching of its ability.

original: de bzhin du rdo rje dam tshig ces bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad la skul bar byed pa nyid kyang bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje dam tshig ces bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad la skul bar byed pa nyid kyang bstan to //
translated: Likewise, with “vajra samaya” and so forth, he teaches the summoning of Vairochana.🔽“

original: gsungs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdus pa'o //
translated: He said” and so forth concludes.

original: 'dir man ngag 'di yin te rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas mdun du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bsgrub bya nad pa bkod la de'i steng gi phyogs su yi ge h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi khro bo bsams la
analyzed: 'dir man ngag 'di yin te rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas mdun du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bsgrub bya nad pa bkod la de'i steng gi phyogs su yi ge h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi khro bo bsams la
translated: Here is the instruction: Endowed with the yoga of Vairochana, one should visualize the patient to be healed in front, upon a moon mandala. Above him, from the syllable hūṃ, one should visualize Vajrayakṣa, the wrathful one.

original: / lag par rdo rje thogs pa des yi ge kam yongs su gyur pa las /
analyzed: / lag par rdo rje thogs pa des yi ge kam yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: With his hand holding a vajra, he should transform into the syllable kaṃ.

original: sprel la sogs pa'i gzugs can nad pa'i snying ga nas ngag gi lam nas byung ba brlag par byas pa rang gi lag pa'i 'khor lo 'bar bas kyang bsregs par gyur bar bsams te /
analyzed: sprel la sogs pa'i gzugs can nad pa'i snying ga nas ngag gi lam nas byung ba brlag par byas pa rang gi lag pa'i 'khor lo 'bar bas kyang bsregs par gyur bar bsams te /
translated: From the heart of the patient, who has the form of a monkey and so forth, he should emerge from the path of speech, and be destroyed. He should be burned by the blazing wheel in his own hand.

original: rang gi snying ga las spyan ma'i tshogs spros la de rnams kyis kha @73b dog dkar po bum pa'i chus dbang bskur te me tog dang spos la sogs pa kha dog dkar pos mchod la rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzugs su bskyed cing spyi bo dang snying ga
analyzed: rang gi snying ga las spyan ma'i tshogs spros la de rnams kyis kha @73b dog dkar po bum pa'i chus dbang bskur te me tog dang spos la sogs pa kha dog dkar pos mchod la rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzugs su bskyed cing spyi bo dang snying ga
translated: One should touch the crown, heart,

original: dang lte ba dang gsang ba rnams la sngags 'dis reg cing sos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang lte ba dang gsang ba rnams la sngags 'dis reg cing sos par 'gyur ro //
translated: navel, and secret places with this mantra, and [the victim] will recover.

original: de'i 'og tu ni rig med pa'i gro ga 'am ta lar gur gum mam gi wang dag gis padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni rig med pa'i gro ga 'am ta lar gur gum mam gi wang dag gis padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris la /
translated: After that, on a piece of birch bark or palm leaf without worms, one should draw with saffron or bovine orpiment an eight-petaled lotus.

original: de'i phyi rol du rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'i 'khor lo bris te /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'i 'khor lo bris te /
translated: Outside of that, one should draw a wheel with twelve spokes.

original: dbus kyi lte ba la yi ge aom dang che ge mo la sh'antim ku ru sv'a h'a zhes bya ba bris nas lhag ma'i yi ge rnams 'dab ma re re la dgod cing rtsibs rnams kyi phyi rol yi ge has bskor zhing skud pa dkar pos bcing la
analyzed: dbus kyi lte ba la yi ge aom dang che ge mo la sh'antim ku ru sv'a h'a zhes bya ba bris nas lhag ma'i yi ge rnams 'dab ma re re la dgod cing rtsibs rnams kyi phyi rol yi ge has bskor zhing skud pa dkar pos bcing la
translated: In the center, one should write the syllable oṃ and “So-and-so, bring about peace! svāhā!” and the remaining syllables on each of the petals. The outside of the spokes should be encircled with the syllable ha, and it should be bound with white thread.

original: plag sha dang rgya skyegs dang lcags gsum gyis sbyar te /
analyzed: plag sha dang rgya skyegs dang lcags gsum gyis sbyar te /
translated: It is prepared with lac, lac dye, and the three metals.

original: tsandan gyis byugs pa'i srad bu dkar pos phyogs gcig tu bcings la /
analyzed: tsandan gyis byugs pa'i srad bu dkar pos phyogs gcig tu bcings la /
translated: It is wrapped in a white thread anointed with sandalwood,🔽and placed in a box.

original: za ma tog gi nang du bzhag ste bskyed pa'i rim pas spyan ma'i rnam pa bskyed la /
analyzed: za ma tog gi nang du bzhag ste bskyed pa'i rim pas spyan ma'i rnam pa bskyed la /
translated: Having generated the form of Buddhalocana through the creation stage,🔽having made offerings of white flowers, etc. to the center of the maṇḍala,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su kha dog dkar po me tog la sogs pas mchod pa de las langs te de'i dpung pa g-yas pa la bcing bar bya'o zhes bya bas zhi ba bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su kha dog dkar po me tog la sogs pas mchod pa de las langs te de'i dpung pa g-yas pa la bcing bar bya'o zhes bya bas zhi ba bskyed pa yin no //
translated: one should arise from that and bind it to the right shoulder.

original: de bzhin du de'i zhag tu shi ba'i mi ro blangs la ba yu rnam pa lngas sbyang zhing sku khrus kyi cho gas bkrus la /
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i zhag tu shi ba'i mi ro blangs la ba yu rnam pa lngas sbyang zhing sku khrus kyi cho gas bkrus la /
translated: In that way, having taken the corpse of a person who died on that day, one should purify it with the five cow products, and bathe it with the ritual of bathing the body.

original: sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rdo rje skyil mo krung gis bzhag la gos dang rgyan la sogs pa dang ldan pa dris byugs la legs par bdug par byas la /
analyzed: sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rdo rje skyil mo krung gis bzhag la gos dang rgyan la sogs pa dang ldan pa dris byugs la legs par bdug par byas la /
translated: Having placed it in the center of the maṇḍala of the body, with the vajra posture, having it wear clothes, ornaments, and so forth, having anointed it with perfume, and having well fumigated it,

original: spyan ma'i sngags kyis mgo bo la sogs par reg cing nam mkha'i phyogs la gnas pa'i yi ge gsum gyi rnam pa can srid pa bar ma do kha dog dkar po bsams la /
analyzed: spyan ma'i sngags kyis mgo bo la sogs par reg cing nam mkha'i phyogs la gnas pa'i yi ge gsum gyi rnam pa can srid pa bar ma do kha dog dkar po bsams la /
translated: Contemplate the three-syllable form abiding in the space quarter, the white color of the intermediate existence.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las rnam par snang mdzad chen po sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid de'i snying gar bcug la mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod la nam mkha'i dbyings la bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas spyan ma'i tshogs kyis bdud rtsi'i bum pa'i chu rgyun gyis dbang bskur
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las rnam par snang mdzad chen po sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid de'i snying gar bcug la mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod la nam mkha'i dbyings la bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas spyan ma'i tshogs kyis bdud rtsi'i bum pa'i chu rgyun gyis dbang bskur
translated: From that completely transform into Great Vairocana, the nature of the three beings. Place that at the heart and make offerings with the five offerings. The assembly of Locanā buddhas abiding in the realm of space confer empowerment with a stream of elixir from the vase of the buddhas.

original: zhing de'i drung du gru bzhi pa khru nyi shu'i tshad dang ldan pa 'o mas gang ba'i rdzing bu'i 'gram du zhi ba'i sbyin sreg byas la sbyin sreg gi mthar de las blangs pa'o mas gang ba'i bum pa brgya rtsa brgyad kyis bkrus la sangs rgyas spyan ma'i
analyzed: zhing de'i drung du gru bzhi pa khru nyi shu'i tshad dang ldan pa 'o mas gang ba'i rdzing bu'i 'gram du zhi ba'i sbyin sreg byas la sbyin sreg gi mthar de las blangs pa'o mas gang ba'i bum pa brgya rtsa brgyad kyis bkrus la sangs rgyas spyan ma'i
translated: In front of that, on the bank of a pond filled with milk and measuring twenty cubits on each side, perform a fire puja for peace. At the conclusion of the fire puja, wash with one hundred and eight vases filled with milk taken from that.

original: sngags kyis reg cing bkra shis kyi tshigs @74a * //
analyzed: sngags kyis reg cing bkra shis kyi tshigs @74a * //
translated: He touched it with his spell and recited the verse of auspiciousness.

original: su bcad pa brjod la dge slong gi dge 'dun la bzhes pa drang zhing de'i tshe ro de 'tsho bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: su bcad pa brjod la dge slong gi dge 'dun la bzhes pa drang zhing de'i tshe ro de 'tsho bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: He invited the community of monks to partake of it, and at that time the corpse came back to life.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shi ba slong bar byed pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shi ba slong bar byed pa zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus it is called the spell that revives the dead.

original: de nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te dmigs pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni bgegs thams cad 'joms par byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te dmigs pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni bgegs thams cad 'joms par byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid bstan to //
translated: Then, beginning with the words “Then the Blessed One, having entered into concentration on the destruction of all obstacles,” up to “the object,” it shows that he entered into concentration on the destruction of all obstacles.

original: dngos po ni bgegs rnams so zhes bya ba la dge ba'i phyogs bcom par byad pa'i phyir 'byung zhing mthu dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: dngos po ni bgegs rnams so zhes bya ba la dge ba'i phyogs bcom par byad pa'i phyir 'byung zhing mthu dang ldan pas so //
translated: “The thing” refers to the obstacles. Because they arise and are powerful in order to destroy the side of virtue.

original: btsun mo mchog ltar zhes pa ni ji ltar rgyal po'i btsun mo thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa de bzhin du gzungs sngags rnams kyi 'di yang gtso bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: btsun mo mchog ltar zhes pa ni ji ltar rgyal po'i btsun mo thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa de bzhin du gzungs sngags rnams kyi 'di yang gtso bor gyur pa'o //
translated: “Like the chief queen” means just as she becomes the chief of all the king’s queens, so this dhāraṇī becomes the chief of all the spells.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyi bshad pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyi bshad pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The explanation of the mantra beginning with “Oṃ” is easy to understand.

original: de rnams kyis mi phyed pa zhes pa ni ngo bo gcig gis lus gang la yod pa de /
analyzed: de rnams kyis mi phyed pa zhes pa ni ngo bo gcig gis lus gang la yod pa de /
translated: “By them, indivisible” means that the body in which there is a single nature

original: sgrub pa po ni m'a ma k'i'i rnal 'byor pa rnams so //
analyzed: sgrub pa po ni m'a ma k'i'i rnal 'byor pa rnams so //
translated: is the adept, the practitioners of Māmakī.

original: sngags thos pas dga' nas spyan gyi autpala gdangs par gyur to //
analyzed: sngags thos pas dga' nas spyan gyi autpala gdangs par gyur to //
translated: Having heard the mantra, she was delighted and opened her eyes, her utpala eyes.

original: phrin las bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: phrin las bshad par bya ste /
translated: The activity is to be explained.

original: bdud la sogs pa zhes pa ni dus ma yin pa'i 'chi ba las srung bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: bdud la sogs pa zhes pa ni dus ma yin pa'i 'chi ba las srung bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: “Māra and so on” means that she protects from untimely death.

original: de bzhin du bgegs dang log 'dren zhes pa ni 'jig rten skyong ba rnams kyi 'jigs pa des gzir ba ni mnan pa rnams kyis bgegs 'joms par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bgegs dang log 'dren zhes pa ni 'jig rten skyong ba rnams kyi 'jigs pa des gzir ba ni mnan pa rnams kyis bgegs 'joms par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Similarly, “obstructors and misleaders” means that those oppressed by the fear of the world guardians are destroyed by the obstructors.

original: m'a ma k'i ni mi bskyod pa'i rigs 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rigs can yang yin te /
analyzed: m'a ma k'i ni mi bskyod pa'i rigs 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rigs can yang yin te /
translated: Māmakī is not only of the Akṣobhya family, but also of the Ratnasaṃbhava family.

original: gnyis ka'i rigs kyi thun mong yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i rigs kyi thun mong yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that she is common to both families.

original: 'dir rig pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'dir rig pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: Here, the knowledge has been explained previously.

original: 'dir man ngag ni m'a ma k'i'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas dus ma yin pa'i 'chi ba'i 'jigs pas gdung ba 'am 'jig rten skyong ba la sogs pa zil gyis gnon pa'i bsgrub bya mdun du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du gnas pa'i sdig pa sbyang bar
analyzed: 'dir man ngag ni m'a ma k'i'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas dus ma yin pa'i 'chi ba'i 'jigs pas gdung ba 'am 'jig rten skyong ba la sogs pa zil gyis gnon pa'i bsgrub bya mdun du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du gnas pa'i sdig pa sbyang bar
translated: Here, the instruction is that one who possesses the yoga of Mamaki, tormented by the fear of untimely death, or the object of achievement who is to be overcome by the guardians of the world, and so on, should purify the sin that resides on the sun maṇḍala in front,

original: byas la snga ma bzhin du m'a ma k'i'i tshogs kyis dbang bskur la mi bskyod pa'i gzugs su bskyed cing /
analyzed: byas la snga ma bzhin du m'a ma k'i'i tshogs kyis dbang bskur la mi bskyod pa'i gzugs su bskyed cing /
translated: and, as before, confer initiation with the host of Mamakis, and generate the form of Akṣobhya.

original: sngags bris pa'i srung ba'i 'khor lo dpung pa g-yas pa la bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngags bris pa'i srung ba'i 'khor lo dpung pa g-yas pa la bcing bar bya'o //
translated: The protection wheel inscribed with the mantra should be bound on the right arm.

original: de'i tshe ji ltar bshad pa'i las 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar bshad pa'i las 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the rite as explained will be accomplished.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Then, etc. teaches that he entered into the meditative stabilization of the prosperity maṇḍala.

original: aom zhes bya ba la @74b sogs pa'i sngags kyi don ni go sla'o //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la @74b sogs pa'i sngags kyi don ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the mantra beginning with Oṃ is easy to understand.

original: padma'i rigs la lhag par mos pas rnams so zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags thob pas de'i sgrub ba po'o //
analyzed: padma'i rigs la lhag par mos pas rnams so zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags thob pas de'i sgrub ba po'o //
translated: The etc. includes one who is devoted to the Lotus family.

original: dga' zhing rang gi bdag po la bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dga' zhing rang gi bdag po la bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: He should be delighted and show it to his master.

original: ched du brjod pa la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni ngag la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: ched du brjod pa la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni ngag la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyas pa'o //
translated: Exclamations of joy, etc., is the expansion of the definition of speech.

original: lus rgyas pa ni stobs yin no //
analyzed: lus rgyas pa ni stobs yin no //
translated: The expansion of the body is strength.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says:

original: bya ba rnams la spro ba'o zhes pa ni bya ba byed pa la nus pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba rnams la spro ba'o zhes pa ni bya ba byed pa la nus pa'o //
translated: enthusiasm for activities is the ability to perform activities.

original: nor dang 'bru la sogs pa ni phyi'i rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: nor dang 'bru la sogs pa ni phyi'i rgyas pa'o //
translated: Wealth, grain, etc., is the external expansion.

original: de dag thams cad ni gsum po yang ngo //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni gsum po yang ngo //
translated: All of these are the three.

original: rdo rje gsum zhas bya ba la sogs pas dpe'i sgo nas sgrub pa po de'i ngo bo nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum zhas bya ba la sogs pas dpe'i sgo nas sgrub pa po de'i ngo bo nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: By the three vajras, etc., it is taught that the practitioner will attain the nature of those [vajras] by way of the examples.

original: bton pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas re zhig sgrub pa po ni bzhag na rtog pa las gsungs pa'i bzlas pa'i chogs 'grub par 'gyur na las thams cad kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bton pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas re zhig sgrub pa po ni bzhag na rtog pa las gsungs pa'i bzlas pa'i chogs 'grub par 'gyur na las thams cad kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Just by reciting and so forth, first the adept is established, and if the rite of repetition taught in the [Vajra]śekhara is accomplished, all activities will be accomplished, it is taught.

original: 'dir spyar ba ni re zhig dang po rnal 'byor pas gos dkar mo'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bsgrub bya mdun du bsgoms la rang gi snying ga nas spros pa'i gos dkar mo'i tshogs phyung nas dbang bskur zhing /
analyzed: 'dir spyar ba ni re zhig dang po rnal 'byor pas gos dkar mo'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bsgrub bya mdun du bsgoms la rang gi snying ga nas spros pa'i gos dkar mo'i tshogs phyung nas dbang bskur zhing /
translated: Here, the application is as follows: First, the yogi/nī endowed with the yoga of Pāṇḍaravāsinī visualizes the object of practice in front on a moon maṇḍala, and a host of Pāṇḍaravāsinīs emanated from his/her heart is sent forth, bestowing empowerment,

original: 'od dpag tu med pa'i gzugs su bskyed la /
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa'i gzugs su bskyed la /
translated: and generating the form of Amitābha.

original: de'i dpung pa la sngags bris pa'i srung pa'i 'khor lo bcing bar byas na de'i tshe nor dang 'bru la sogs pa rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i dpung pa la sngags bris pa'i srung pa'i 'khor lo bcing bar byas na de'i tshe nor dang 'bru la sogs pa rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the protection wheel inscribed with the mantra is bound on his/her shoulder, at that time wealth, grain, and so forth will increase.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas dbang gi ting nge 'dzin du snyoms par zhugs pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas dbang gi ting nge 'dzin du snyoms par zhugs pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Then and so forth teaches the meditative absorption of power.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyi don ni go sla'o//
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyi don ni go sla'o//
translated: The meaning of the mantra “Oṃ” and so forth is easy to understand.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bya ba byed pas sangs rgyas kun ni don yod par grub pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bya ba byed pas sangs rgyas kun ni don yod par grub pa'o //
translated: “All the buddhas” are Amoghasiddhi, because he performs the activities of all the buddhas.

original: de la lhag par mos pa rnams so zhes pa ni don yod grub pa'i dngos grub don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: de la lhag par mos pa rnams so zhes pa ni don yod grub pa'i dngos grub don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: “Those who have faith in him” are those who seek the powers of Amoghasiddhi.

original: mgu bar gyur pa ni sngags dang de'i mthu thos pas nang gi bdag nyid rab tu dga' bar gyur pa'o//
analyzed: mgu bar gyur pa ni sngags dang de'i mthu thos pas nang gi bdag nyid rab tu dga' bar gyur pa'o//
translated: “Delighted” means that, having heard the mantra and its power, they are inwardly very pleased.

original: skyes bu gtso bo zhes pa ni bram ze dang rgyal rigs dang dmangs rigs dang rje'u rigs kyi khyim bdag rnams so //
analyzed: skyes bu gtso bo zhes pa ni bram ze dang rgyal rigs dang dmangs rigs dang rje'u rigs kyi khyim bdag rnams so //
translated: “The chief men” are the brahmins, kṣatriyas, vaiśyas, and śūdra householders.

original: snying sra ba rnams so zhes pa ni gdul bar bya dka' ba chom rkun la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snying sra ba rnams so zhes pa ni gdul bar bya dka' ba chom rkun la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The hard-hearted” are those who are difficult to tame, such as thieves and so on.

original: rgyal po rnams so zhes pa ni sa bdag rnams so //
analyzed: rgyal po rnams so zhes pa ni sa bdag rnams so //
translated: “The kings” are the lords of the land.

original: de rnams dang ji srid gzhan @75a * //
analyzed: de rnams dang ji srid gzhan @75a * //
translated: “Those and others” refers to the rest.

original: rnams kyang 'jig rten tha mal pa zhes pa ni tshod dpon dang tshod pa dang mtho ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: rnams kyang 'jig rten tha mal pa zhes pa ni tshod dpon dang tshod pa dang mtho ba'i rigs so //
translated: “The ordinary people of the world” are the merchants, the traders, and the higher castes.

original: rnam pa thams cad du ni lus ngag yid kyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du ni lus ngag yid kyis so //
translated: In every way means by body, speech, and mind.

original: bran bzhin du ni 'bangs bzhin no //
analyzed: bran bzhin du ni 'bangs bzhin no //
translated: Like a servant means like a slave.

original: dbang du 'gyur zhing zhes pa ni sgrub pa po'i zhal blta ba dang de'i bka' yang nyan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang du 'gyur zhing zhes pa ni sgrub pa po'i zhal blta ba dang de'i bka' yang nyan par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be under one's control means that the practitioner will be seen and will listen to his commands.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir thams cad sgrub pa po'i dbang du gyur pas sngar bshad pa'i bsgrub bya dbang du gyur bas so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir thams cad sgrub pa po'i dbang du gyur pas sngar bshad pa'i bsgrub bya dbang du gyur bas so //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, since all are under the control of the practitioner, the previously explained object of practice is under control.

original: g-yo med pa ste zhes pa ni bya ba gzhan med pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo med pa ste zhes pa ni bya ba gzhan med pa'o //
translated: Without deceit means without other activities.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa ni rnal 'byor pa la rag lus pa gzungs sngags 'dis byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa ni rnal 'byor pa la rag lus pa gzungs sngags 'dis byed pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, the one who is under the control of another is made dependent on the yogin by this dhāraṇī mantra.

original: 'dir sbyor ba ni sgrol ma'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa pos sngon gyi bsnyen pas de'i sngags 'bum phrag gcig bzlas shing de nyid kyis mngon par bzlas pa'i chus mig la nye bar reg cing gang mthong ba dang gang gis mthong ba de nyid dbang du
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba ni sgrol ma'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa pos sngon gyi bsnyen pas de'i sngags 'bum phrag gcig bzlas shing de nyid kyis mngon par bzlas pa'i chus mig la nye bar reg cing gang mthong ba dang gang gis mthong ba de nyid dbang du
translated: Here, the procedure is that the adept who is endowed with the yoga of Tara, having recited her mantra one hundred thousand times in a preliminary retreat, touches his eyes with water incanted with that mantra, and whoever he sees and by whom he is seen is brought under his control.

original: 'gyur ro // de bzhin du lam du 'gro bar 'dod pas gos kyi mthar lan bdun bzlas shing bcings la mthong ba tsam gyis sgra mi g-yo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de bzhin du lam du 'gro bar 'dod pas gos kyi mthar lan bdun bzlas shing bcings la mthong ba tsam gyis sgra mi g-yo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, one who wishes to go on a journey should tie a knot in his garment, incanting it seven times, and by merely seeing it, he will not be robbed.

original: sbyor ba gzhan yang dpal sgrol ma 'byung ba'i rgyud las rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba gzhan yang dpal sgrol ma 'byung ba'i rgyud las rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
translated: And another procedure should be followed from the Tara-utpatti-tantra.

original: 'od zer dkar po'i tshogs zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi 'brel ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'od zer dkar po'i tshogs zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi 'brel ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The mass of white light is connected with Vairocana.

original: rigs dang rigs can dbyer med pas ting nge 'dzin dang yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rigs dang rigs can dbyer med pas ting nge 'dzin dang yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: And the samadhi is called that because of the inseparability of the family and the one who has the family.

original: rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa'i gshin rje gshed po dbyer med pas de'i sngags la yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa'i gshin rje gshed po dbyer med pas de'i sngags la yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Since he is indivisible from the Yamari who is like a vajra, his mantra is called that.

original: na ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas sku rdo rje la sogs pa dang po rjes su dran par byas te /
analyzed: na ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas sku rdo rje la sogs pa dang po rjes su dran par byas te /
translated: With namaḥ and so forth, one should recollect the first [mantra] of Body-Vajra and so forth,

original: khro bo thams cad de las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khro bo thams cad de las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the wrathful ones arise from that.

original: de'i phyir sngags 'don pa'i dus su ni khro bo thams cad kyi sngags bzlas pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngags 'don pa'i dus su ni khro bo thams cad kyi sngags bzlas pa'i dus su'o //
translated: Therefore, at the time of reciting the mantra, it is the time of reciting the mantra of all the wrathful ones.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags kyi don bshad pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags kyi don bshad pa ni go sla'o //
translated: Oṃ and so forth explain the meaning of the mantra, which is easy to understand.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das zhal gsum phyag drug pa yin na yang /
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das zhal gsum phyag drug pa yin na yang /
translated: Here, although the Bhagavān has three faces and six arms,

original: zhal bzhi pa phyag bzhi pa lhag pa'am nyung ba nye bar blang ba ni mos pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: zhal bzhi pa phyag bzhi pa lhag pa'am nyung ba nye bar blang ba ni mos pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: the four faces and four arms are taken as either additional or fewer, due to the variety of inclinations.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das zhabs gnyis pa yin na yang zhabs drug tu bstan te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das zhabs gnyis pa yin na yang zhabs drug tu bstan te /
translated: For that very reason, although the Bhagavān has two feet, he is shown with six feet.
