original: rgyud gzhan las zhal drug pa dang phyag drug pa dang zhabs drug pa gsungs pas so //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan las zhal drug pa dang phyag drug pa dang zhabs drug pa gsungs pas so //
translated: Since the six-faced, six-armed, and six-footed [form] are taught in other tantras.

original: de gsungs pa yang gdul bya'i 'dod pa'i dbye bas @75b so ;
analyzed: de gsungs pa yang gdul bya'i 'dod pa'i dbye bas @75b so ;
translated: And that teaching is also due to the variety of desires of those to be tamed.

original: / ma h'a bighn'ana ni gshin rje'o //
analyzed: / ma h'a bighn'ana ni gshin rje'o //
translated: Mahābhairava is Yama.

original: a'a karsha ya zhes bya ba 'dis dgug pa la sngags kyi mthu bstan to //
analyzed: a'a karsha ya zhes bya ba 'dis dgug pa la sngags kyi mthu bstan to //
translated: By akarsaya he shows the power of the mantra to summon.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas brgya byin la sogs pa 'jig rten skyong ba rnams sngags thos pas 'jig ba dang rdo rje 'chang chen po rjes su dran pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas brgya byin la sogs pa 'jig rten skyong ba rnams sngags thos pas 'jig ba dang rdo rje 'chang chen po rjes su dran pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Then, etc. shows that the world guardians such as Indra, etc. are frightened by hearing the mantra and are taught to be mindful of Great Vajradhara.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi sbyor ba dang ldan pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi sbyor ba dang ldan pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
translated: By endowed with the yoga of Vairocana, etc. he teaches this:

original: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i skyes pa'am bud med mngon par dgug par 'dod par 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pas de'i ro langs kyi chogs ma nyams pa'i thod pa blangs la sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rgya skyegs kyi khu bas de'i gzugs de la bris te de
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i skyes pa'am bud med mngon par dgug par 'dod par 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pas de'i ro langs kyi chogs ma nyams pa'i thod pa blangs la sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rgya skyegs kyi khu bas de'i gzugs de la bris te de
translated: The yogī who wishes to summon a man or woman as desired should take the skull of a vetāla that has not been damaged, and draw the form of that person with lac juice consecrated with the mantra.

original: dag la che ge mo a'a karsha ya zhes bya ba snying gar bris la ram las skyes pa'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du h'um las skyes pa'i sna tshogs rdo rjes mtshan pa'i rkang pa g-yon pas de dag la mnan zhing lcags kyu de nyid kyis snying
analyzed: dag la che ge mo a'a karsha ya zhes bya ba snying gar bris la ram las skyes pa'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du h'um las skyes pa'i sna tshogs rdo rjes mtshan pa'i rkang pa g-yon pas de dag la mnan zhing lcags kyu de nyid kyis snying
translated: He should write at the heart of those [figures] the name of the person to be summoned, such as 'So-and-so, be summoned!' He should step on them with his left foot marked with a crossed vajra arisen from a sun maṇḍala arisen from raṃ, and with that hook

original: gar brdeg la skyabs med pa gzhan dbang du gyur pa bud med dang skyes pa rnams dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: gar brdeg la skyabs med pa gzhan dbang du gyur pa bud med dang skyes pa rnams dgug par bya'o //
translated: he should strike at the heart. He should summon women and men who are powerless and under the control of others.

original: zhag bdun zhes bya ba 'dis dus kyi nges pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhag bdun zhes bya ba 'dis dus kyi nges pa bstan to //
translated: Seven days indicates the time limit.

original: dgos pa ni 'di yin te sngon du bsnyen pa byas pa dam bca' ba bstan pa'i sgrub pa pos gal te zhag bdun sbyor ba 'di bslabs na de'i tshe sngar bshad pa'i skyes pa 'am bud med rnams dgug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dgos pa ni 'di yin te sngon du bsnyen pa byas pa dam bca' ba bstan pa'i sgrub pa pos gal te zhag bdun sbyor ba 'di bslabs na de'i tshe sngar bshad pa'i skyes pa 'am bud med rnams dgug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The purpose is this: the practitioner who has previously performed the familiarization and has explained the vow, if he trains in this yoga for seven days, then at that time the previously explained men or women will be summoned.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas don yod grub pa'i rigs can gyi bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas don yod grub pa'i rigs can gyi bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa nyid bstan to //
translated: Then, etc. explains the very entry into the concentration of Amrtakundalin of the Amoghasiddhi family.

original: de las byung ba'i sngags kyi bdag nyid kyi khro bo zhes pa ni bdud rtsi 'khyil pa don yod grub pa'i rigs yin pas so /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i sngags kyi bdag nyid kyi khro bo zhes pa ni bdud rtsi 'khyil pa don yod grub pa'i rigs yin pas so /
translated: The wrathful one who arises from that and has the nature of the mantra is Amrtakundalin, because he is of the Amoghasiddhi family.

original: na ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa don bshad zin pa'o zhes pa ni nges pa'i tshig sngar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: na ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa don bshad zin pa'o zhes pa ni nges pa'i tshig sngar bshad pa'o //
translated: The meaning of namaḥ, etc. has been explained, i.e. the etymology has been explained above.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyi don bshad pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyi don bshad pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the mantra Oṃ, etc. is easy to understand.

original: ma h'a ga na dzi bi t'ant'a ka ra ya zhes bya ba ni bgegs kyi bdag po'i srog 'phrog ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma h'a ga na dzi bi t'ant'a ka ra ya zhes bya ba ni bgegs kyi bdag po'i srog 'phrog ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Mahāgaṇajīvitāntakāya means the one who seizes the life of the lord of obstacles.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i bgegs kyi bdag po ni gdan yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i bgegs kyi bdag po ni gdan yin no //
translated: For that very reason, the Blessed One is the seat of the lord of obstacles, the noble Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: sv'ah'a zhes bya ba las gong du ni sv'a h'a sngon du'o //
analyzed: sv'ah'a zhes bya ba las gong du ni sv'a h'a sngon du'o //
translated: Svaha means previously.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas don yod grub pa'i rnal 'byor pas sngags 'bum phrag gcig bzla zhing 'chad par @76a * //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas don yod grub pa'i rnal 'byor pas sngags 'bum phrag gcig bzla zhing 'chad par @76a * //
translated: Then, etc. teaches the mantra recitation and the abandonment rite by the yoga of Amoghasiddhi, with the recitation of one hundred thousand mantras and the previously explained yoga.

original: 'gyur ba'i sbyor bas spong ba'i cho ga bstan to //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i sbyor bas spong ba'i cho ga bstan to //
translated: The rite of abandonment is taught.

original: rim pa ni 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ske tshe dang rdzas drag po khu ba chen po dang ldan pas dur khrod kyi gos la gzhu'i dbyi bas can rlung gi dkyil 'khor bris la phyogs gnyis su rdo rjes mtshan pa byas te /
analyzed: rim pa ni 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ske tshe dang rdzas drag po khu ba chen po dang ldan pas dur khrod kyi gos la gzhu'i dbyi bas can rlung gi dkyil 'khor bris la phyogs gnyis su rdo rjes mtshan pa byas te /
translated: By this process, etc. means that on a charnel ground cloth, with mustard seed and the fierce substance of great semen, one draws a wind maṇḍala with a bow-string, and on both sides one makes it marked with a vajra.

original: de'i dbus su che ge mo au tsa ta ya hri zhes bya ba bris la bsgrub bya'i rnam par shes pa dgug cing de la gzhug ste /
analyzed: de'i dbus su che ge mo au tsa ta ya hri zhes bya ba bris la bsgrub bya'i rnam par shes pa dgug cing de la gzhug ste /
translated: Having written in the center of that “so and so ucchāṭaya hṛ” and having summoned the consciousness of the victim and caused it to enter there,

original: bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags brjod cing sor brgyad pa mi'i rje ngar gyi khong stong la 'jug na de nyid dur khrod kyis sa ru brkos nas spas na de'i tshe zhag bdun gyis dgra gnas las spo bar 'gyur ro//
analyzed: bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags brjod cing sor brgyad pa mi'i rje ngar gyi khong stong la 'jug na de nyid dur khrod kyis sa ru brkos nas spas na de'i tshe zhag bdun gyis dgra gnas las spo bar 'gyur ro//
translated: if one recites the mantra of Amṛtakuṇḍali and buries it in a charnel ground, in the hollow of a human shin bone, eight fingerbreadths long, then in seven days the enemy will be removed from his place.

original: dgra'i sgo ru brkos nas spas na de ma thag tu gnas las spo bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dgra'i sgo ru brkos nas spas na de ma thag tu gnas las spo bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: If one buries it at the door of the enemy’s house, he will be removed from his place immediately.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: de kho na nyid kyi rin po che zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'am zung du 'jug pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi rin po che zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'am zung du 'jug pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The jewel of reality is the nature of clear light or union.

original: de nyid rtog ni mtshan gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid rtog ni mtshan gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The one who realizes that is called that.

original: sangs rgyas ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi nang na 'od zer ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par gang la yod pa de ni sangs rgyas 'od zer te rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi nang na 'od zer ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par gang la yod pa de ni sangs rgyas 'od zer te rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: Buddha is the one who has the light rays of the Tathagatas, who has the samadhi of the sky-treasury, and who fulfills all wishes.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la zhugs nas 'di skad bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la zhugs nas 'di skad bka' stsal to //
translated: Having entered into the samadhi of that nature, he spoke thus.

original: gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i khro bo chen po zhes pa ni srin po la sogs pa las rgyal bas khro bo'i rgyal po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i khro bo chen po zhes pa ni srin po la sogs pa las rgyal bas khro bo'i rgyal po zhes bya'o //
translated: The great wrathful one who cannot be overcome is called the king of wrathful ones because he is victorious over rakshasas and so forth.

original: sngags kyi bdag nyid ces bya ba 'dis sngags dang lha rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba dbyer med par bstan to //
analyzed: sngags kyi bdag nyid ces bya ba 'dis sngags dang lha rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba dbyer med par bstan to //
translated: By the nature of mantra he shows the inseparability of the mantra and the deity that is expressed and the expression.

original: na ma zhes bya ba la sngags kyi don bshad pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: na ma zhes bya ba la sngags kyi don bshad pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the mantra namaḥ is easy to understand.

original: raksha sa ti bhyo pi mo tsa ya hri zhes bya ba 'dis gdug pa rnams gsod par byed pa'i bdag nyid bstan pa dang / nad pa rnams sos pas shi bar byed pa yang 'di yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: raksha sa ti bhyo pi mo tsa ya hri zhes bya ba 'dis gdug pa rnams gsod par byed pa'i bdag nyid bstan pa dang / nad pa rnams sos pas shi bar byed pa yang 'di yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: By rakṣa satva bhyo pi mocaya hri, he teaches the nature of killing the wicked, and that he is the one who cures the sick and causes death.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags dran pa dang thos pa de'i sgrub pa pos de bsten pa dang de la brtson pa'i phyir dga' ba dang rin chen 'byung ldan la skyabs su 'gro ba nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags dran pa dang thos pa de'i sgrub pa pos de bsten pa dang de la brtson pa'i phyir dga' ba dang rin chen 'byung ldan la skyabs su 'gro ba nyid bstan to //
translated: Then, etc. shows that the practitioner of that mantra, who remembers and hears it, goes for refuge to Ratnasaṃbhava, because he serves him and strives in him.

original: sha za'o zhes pa ni sha za ba'i 'byung po'i rigs so //
analyzed: sha za'o zhes pa ni sha za ba'i 'byung po'i rigs so //
translated: Piśāca is a type of flesh-eating spirit.

original: nye bar mtshon pa yin te gnod sbyin dang srin po dang 'byung po dang yi dags dang smyo byed dang brjod byed dang / mkha' 'gro dang mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa yang gzung @76b ngo ;
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa yin te gnod sbyin dang srin po dang 'byung po dang yi dags dang smyo byed dang brjod byed dang / mkha' 'gro dang mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa yang gzung @76b ngo ;
translated: It is a metonym, also referring to yakṣas, rākṣasas, bhūtas, pretas, unmādas, apasmāras, and ḍākas and ḍākinīs, etc.

original: / seng ge la sogs pa zhes pa ni nags tshal la spyod pa'i srog chags drag po'o //
analyzed: / seng ge la sogs pa zhes pa ni nags tshal la spyod pa'i srog chags drag po'o //
translated: By lion, etc., he refers to fierce animals that roam the forest.

original: phyir rgol ba zhes pa ni pha rol rgol ba'i dgra rnams te /
analyzed: phyir rgol ba zhes pa ni pha rol rgol ba'i dgra rnams te /
translated: The adversaries are the enemies who are adversaries on the other side.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lha drag po dang khyab 'jug dang dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lha drag po dang khyab 'jug dang dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The worldly gods are Rudra, Visnu, Vasudhara, and so on.

original: gnod bar byed pa zhes pa ni rnam par 'tshe bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnod bar byed pa zhes pa ni rnam par 'tshe bar byed pa'o //
translated: The afflictors are those who afflict.

original: me dang sprul zhes pa la sogs pa ni srog chags drag pos khyab pa'i nags tshal la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: me dang sprul zhes pa la sogs pa ni srog chags drag pos khyab pa'i nags tshal la sogs pa la'o //
translated: The fierce beings and so on are the forests and so on that are pervaded by fierce beings.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i zhes pa ni thugs rdo rje nye bar sdug par byed pas so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i zhes pa ni thugs rdo rje nye bar sdug par byed pas so //
translated: The great Vajradhara is the one who is the vajra of mind, because he is the one who is the vajra of mind.

original: des gsod pas na zhes pa ni des spros pa ste rdo rje 'chang las bskyed pa'i rin chen 'byung ldan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des gsod pas na zhes pa ni des spros pa ste rdo rje 'chang las bskyed pa'i rin chen 'byung ldan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because he kills with that means that he emanates from him, Vajradhara, and is called Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi ting nge 'dzin la dmigs pa zhes pa ni shes rab mthar byed la bka' sbyin par bya'o zhes dgongs pa ni man ngag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi ting nge 'dzin la dmigs pa zhes pa ni shes rab mthar byed la bka' sbyin par bya'o zhes dgongs pa ni man ngag ces bya ba'o //
translated: The observation of the samadhi of Ratnasaṃbhava is the instruction that Prajñāntaka should be given the command.

original: srung ba la sogs pa'i las ni srin po la sogs pa'i las bsrung ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: srung ba la sogs pa'i las ni srin po la sogs pa'i las bsrung ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: The rite arisen from the sadhana is the rite taught in the sadhana of Acala.

original: rtog pa las byung ba'i cho ga zhes pa ni gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i las kyi rtog pa las gsungs pa'i cho gas so //
analyzed: rtog pa las byung ba'i cho ga zhes pa ni gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i las kyi rtog pa las gsungs pa'i cho gas so //

original: de la 'dir cho ga ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpal rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rnal 'byor pas yi ge h'um gnyis yongs su gyur pa las lag pa gnyis la nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gnyis bsgoms te mdun du srin po la sogs pa'i
analyzed: de la 'dir cho ga ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpal rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rnal 'byor pas yi ge h'um gnyis yongs su gyur pa las lag pa gnyis la nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gnyis bsgoms te mdun du srin po la sogs pa'i
translated: The rite arisen from the tantra is the rite taught in the tantra of Acala.🔽The rite arisen from the sadhana is the rite taught in the sadhana of Acala.🔽The rite arisen from the kalpa is the rite taught in the kalpa of Acalas activities.🔽The rite arisen from the tantra is the rite taught in the tantra of Acala.🔽The rite arisen from the sadhana is the rite taught in the sadhana of Acala.🔽The rite arisen from the kalpa is the rite taught in the kalpa of Acalas activities.

analyzed: gdon gyis bzung ba'i bsgrub bya bzhag nas de 'od zer spros pas bsgrub bya'i lus las srin po la sogs pa bkug cing lag pa gnyis kyis nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su son par byas la de'i 'bar bas bsregs shing thal bar gyur par bsam par bya'o

original: // de'i tshe bsgrub bya srin po la sogs pas bkrol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // de'i tshe bsgrub bya srin po la sogs pas bkrol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the victim will be released by the rākṣasas and so on.

original: kha cig na re shes rab mthar byed kyi sngags kyis zangs gri byin gyis brlabs la sha za la sogs pas bzung ba'i bsgrub bya'i grib ma sngags brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas de gcod la /
analyzed: kha cig na re shes rab mthar byed kyi sngags kyis zangs gri byin gyis brlabs la sha za la sogs pas bzung ba'i bsgrub bya'i grib ma sngags brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas de gcod la /
translated: Some say that one should consecrate a copper knife with the mantra of Prajñānta, and that the shadow of the victim seized by the piśācas and so on is cut by that, preceded by the recitation of the mantra.

original: sha za la sogs pa yang gcod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sha za la sogs pa yang gcod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The piśācas and so on are also cut.

original: de'i sa gzhi'i rdul dang yungs kar dang bcas pas bsregs la /
analyzed: de'i sa gzhi'i rdul dang yungs kar dang bcas pas bsregs la /
translated: One should burn the victim's shadow together with the dust and mustard seeds of that ground.

original: las thams cad da'i gtor ma'i rim pa'i cho gas shes rab mthar byed kyi sngags bris pa'i srung ba'i 'khor lo gsungs pas bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: las thams cad da'i gtor ma'i rim pa'i cho gas shes rab mthar byed kyi sngags bris pa'i srung ba'i 'khor lo gsungs pas bcing bar bya'o //
translated: One should bind with the protection wheel written with the mantra of Prajñānta, as stated in the rite of the procedure of the bali offering for all actions.

original: de'i tshe bsgrub bya sos par @77a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe bsgrub bya sos par @77a * //
translated: At that time, the victim will recover.

original: 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshe dpag tu med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshe dpag tu med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid bstan te /
translated: Then, and so on, teaches the very state of meditative concentration of Amitāyus.

original: de las 'byung ba'i khro bo rta ma mgrin zhes pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa ste sprul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las 'byung ba'i khro bo rta ma mgrin zhes pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa ste sprul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The wrathful one arising from that, Hayagriva, is Amitabha, because he is an emanation.

original: sngags kyi bdag nyid du zhes pa ni sku dang sngags de'i bdag nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: sngags kyi bdag nyid du zhes pa ni sku dang sngags de'i bdag nyid yin pas so //
translated: The phrase in the nature of the mantra means that he is in the nature of the body and the mantra.

original: na ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don bshad pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po gsum po'i phyag 'tshal ba'i don ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: na ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don bshad pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po gsum po'i phyag 'tshal ba'i don ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The explanation of the meaning of namaḥ, etc. is that it means homage to the three great Vajradharas.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyi don bshad pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyi don bshad pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the mantra beginning with oṃ is easy to understand.

original: ha ya gr'i pa ya phat ces bya ba la sogs pas phat gyi mtha' can gyi tshig bcu ni phyogs bcu la gnas pa'i bgegs bskrad pa'i don to //
analyzed: ha ya gr'i pa ya phat ces bya ba la sogs pas phat gyi mtha' can gyi tshig bcu ni phyogs bcu la gnas pa'i bgegs bskrad pa'i don to //
translated: The ten words ending with phaṭ, beginning with hayagrīva phaṭ, have the meaning of expelling the obstructors abiding in the ten directions.

original: yi ge h'um gsum ni lus la sogs pa 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge h'um gsum ni lus la sogs pa 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The three hūṃ syllables are for the destruction of the body, etc.

original: dbugs dbyung ba de nyid la zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbugs dbyung ba de nyid la zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The exhalation is for the sake of peace.

original: dngos grub thams cad rab ster ba //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad rab ster ba //
translated: Granting all powers,

original: zhes pa ni zhi ba'i phrin las 'grub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni zhi ba'i phrin las 'grub par byed pa'o //
translated: This is the accomplishment of the activity of pacification.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas thos pa dang dran pa'i sgo nas 'od dpag tu med pa'i sgrub pa po rnams mgu bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas thos pa dang dran pa'i sgo nas 'od dpag tu med pa'i sgrub pa po rnams mgu bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Then, etc. shows that the practitioners of Amitābha are pleased by means of hearing and remembering.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pas ha la ha la dang / ka la ku ta la sogs pa'i dug gi khyad par sngags 'dis zhi bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to ;
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pas ha la ha la dang / ka la ku ta la sogs pa'i dug gi khyad par sngags 'dis zhi bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to ;
translated: By means of the sky realm, etc., it shows that the particular poisons such as halahala and kalakuta are pacified by this mantra.

original: /'dir man ngag 'di yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas padma mthar byed kyi rnal 'byor pas sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi bsgrub bya bsgoms la /
analyzed: /'dir man ngag 'di yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas padma mthar byed kyi rnal 'byor pas sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi bsgrub bya bsgoms la /
translated: Here, this is the instruction, etc. shows that the practitioner of Padmanateśvara should meditate on the one to be subdued as having the nature of the three beings.

original: de'i snying ga'i padmar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bdud rtsi'i sa bon yi ge ham bkod la de'i 'od zer gyis ma lus pa'i lus khyab cing lag pa g-yas pa'i mthil la bkod pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du yi ge ham 'od zer gyi
analyzed: de'i snying ga'i padmar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bdud rtsi'i sa bon yi ge ham bkod la de'i 'od zer gyis ma lus pa'i lus khyab cing lag pa g-yas pa'i mthil la bkod pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du yi ge ham 'od zer gyi
translated: Having arranged the nectar syllable haṃ on a moon disc in the lotus at his heart, light rays from that pervade the entire body, and on the moon disc arranged on the palm of the right hand, the syllable haṃ emits light rays

original: 'khor lo spro bar byed pa bkod la /
analyzed: 'khor lo spro bar byed pa bkod la /
translated: that form a wheel.

original: sor mo rnams la rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du khri la sogs pa bdud rtsi'i sa bon lnga bkod cing de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis dug 'og tu song pas lus kyang bdud rtsis gang ba bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sor mo rnams la rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du khri la sogs pa bdud rtsi'i sa bon lnga bkod cing de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis dug 'og tu song pas lus kyang bdud rtsis gang ba bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Having arranged the five nectar syllables kṣa and so on on the fingers in order, light rays from those pervade the poison, and the body is filled with nectar.

original: gzhan dag na re lag pa g-yon pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du aom bkod la sngags kyis bzlas pa'i chu blangs nas de btung bas dug zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re lag pa g-yon pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du aom bkod la sngags kyis bzlas pa'i chu blangs nas de btung bas dug zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Others say that one should arrange oṃ on a moon disc in the left hand, take water with the mantra, and drink it, whereby the poison is pacified.

original: yang na rta mgrin dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas bsgrub bya'i @77b mgo bo la sogs par ku ru ku le'i sngags bkod la de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis nang nas dug bkug cing 'og tu son par bsgoms te /
analyzed: yang na rta mgrin dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas bsgrub bya'i @77b mgo bo la sogs par ku ru ku le'i sngags bkod la de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis nang nas dug bkug cing 'og tu son par bsgoms te /
translated: Or, the yogin who possesses Hayagriva should arrange the mantra of Kurukulla on the head, etc., of the person to be benefited, and meditate on a mass of light rays arising from that, drawing out the poison from within and causing it to descend below.

original: rta mgrin gyi sngags kyis gnas der reg pas dug zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rta mgrin gyi sngags kyis gnas der reg pas dug zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By touching that place with the mantra of Hayagriva, the poison will be pacified.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: ku ru ku lee sv'a h'a'i mtha' //
analyzed: ku ru ku lee sv'a h'a'i mtha' //
translated: At the end of Kuru-kulle svaha,

original: rig pa thog mar aom dang ldan //
analyzed: rig pa thog mar aom dang ldan //
translated: The awareness is endowed with Om at the beginning.🔽It is arranged on the head, mouth, throat,

original: mgo bo kha dang lkog ma dang // snying dang gsang ba rkang par dgod //🔽ces 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mgo bo kha dang lkog ma dang // snying dang gsang ba rkang par dgod // ces 'byung ba'o //
translated: heart, genitals, and feet.

original: don yod grub pa'i dngos grub ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i las thams cad kyi dngos grub po //
analyzed: don yod grub pa'i dngos grub ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i las thams cad kyi dngos grub po //
translated: The power of Amoghasiddhi is the power of all actions such as pacification, etc.

original: dag tso bo yin pas don yod grub pa la yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: dag tso bo yin pas don yod grub pa la yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Because he is the lord of purification, Amoghasiddhi is also called that.

original: don yod dam tshig ces bya ba la sogs pas don yod grub pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: don yod dam tshig ces bya ba la sogs pas don yod grub pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The phrase the pledge of Amoghasiddhi and so forth teaches that he is absorbed in the samadhi of Amoghasiddhi.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags kyi don bshad pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags kyi don bshad pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The phrase Om and so forth explains the meaning of the mantra, which is easy to understand.

original: 'dir sarba bighn'a ni khyab 'jug dang / drag po dang dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir sarba bighn'a ni khyab 'jug dang / drag po dang dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, all vighnas refers to Vishnu, Shiva, Skanda, and so forth.

original: sarba dbyi ni pha rol gyis brjod pa'i gzungs sngags so //
analyzed: sarba dbyi ni pha rol gyis brjod pa'i gzungs sngags so //
translated: The phrase all dvis refers to the mantras of the enemy.

original: sarba mantra ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i snying po dang nye ba'i snying po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sarba mantra ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i snying po dang nye ba'i snying po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase all mantras refers to the essence mantras, the near essence mantras, and so forth for pacifying and so forth.

original: sarba m'u la karma ni gzhan gyis bstan pa las phran tshegs so //
analyzed: sarba m'u la karma ni gzhan gyis bstan pa las phran tshegs so //
translated: The phrase all mulas refers to the minor [rites] from the teachings of others.

original: ke tre tse sha di zhes pa ni sbyar nas byas pa'am sdig pa'i dug go //
analyzed: ke tre tse sha di zhes pa ni sbyar nas byas pa'am sdig pa'i dug go //
translated: The phrase ketu tsesha means made by combining or the poison of evil.

original: sarba gra han ni za byed kyi gdon nam brjod byed kyi gdon nam bya'i gdon la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sarba gra han ni za byed kyi gdon nam brjod byed kyi gdon nam bya'i gdon la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase all grahas refers to the grahas that eat, the grahas that speak, the grahas that fly, and so forth.

original: bgegs mchog rnams ni bdud kyi gtso bo ste brgyan byin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bgegs mchog rnams ni bdud kyi gtso bo ste brgyan byin la sogs pa'o //
translated: The chief of the obstructors is the chief of the demons, namely, Bhairava.

original: brgya rtsa brgyad ces bya bas sbyor ba'i dus su brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pas 'grub ste /
analyzed: brgya rtsa brgyad ces bya bas sbyor ba'i dus su brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pas 'grub ste /
translated: By one hundred and eight is meant that one accomplishes the mantra by reciting it one hundred and eight times at the time of the application.

original: bsnyen pa'i dus su 'bum phrag gcig bzlas pas sngags 'grub po //
analyzed: bsnyen pa'i dus su 'bum phrag gcig bzlas pas sngags 'grub po //
translated: At the time of the approach, by reciting it one hundred thousand times, one accomplishes the mantra.

original: sngags kyi don yongs su shes las lha rnams la spong ba'o zhes pa ni dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: sngags kyi don yongs su shes las lha rnams la spong ba'o zhes pa ni dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the mantra is the abandonment of the deity by one who knows the meaning of the mantra. The idea is as follows:

original: brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i dbye bas sngags ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i dbye bas sngags ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The mantra is twofold, by the division of the expressed and the expresser.

original: de la rjod par byed pa tsam gyis sngags ni dngos grub ster bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la rjod par byed pa tsam gyis sngags ni dngos grub ster bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Among them, the mantra that is merely the expresser does not bestow the accomplishment,

original: rang bzhin rtogs par mi 'gyur pas kha skad bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin rtogs par mi 'gyur pas kha skad bzhin no //
translated: because one does not understand its nature, like a foreign language.

original: sngags kyi brjod par bya ba yongs su shes na de yis lha'i de kho na nyid rtogs pas sngags rnams dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngags kyi brjod par bya ba yongs su shes na de yis lha'i de kho na nyid rtogs pas sngags rnams dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one knows the expressed meaning of the mantra, then one understands the reality of the deity, and the mantras bestow the accomplishment.

original: 'dir ni cho ga 'di yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khrul 'khor gyi sbyor bas gsod pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir ni cho ga 'di yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khrul 'khor gyi sbyor bas gsod pa bstan to //
translated: Here, this is the rite, etc. teaches killing by the application of a machine.

original: 'dir nyid phyed dang @78a * //
analyzed: 'dir nyid phyed dang @78a * //
translated: Here, midnight

original: mtshan phyed ni drag shul gyi las kyi dus su'o //
analyzed: mtshan phyed ni drag shul gyi las kyi dus su'o //
translated: is the time for violent rites.

original: thod pa gsum gyi sgyed pu byas la ro langs kyi cho gas sam rang gis byas pas so //
analyzed: thod pa gsum gyi sgyed pu byas la ro langs kyi cho gas sam rang gis byas pas so //
translated: Having made a tripod of three skulls, by the rite of the zombie or by one's own doing,

original: skyed pus ni dur khrod la sogs pa'i rten byas nas so //
analyzed: skyed pus ni dur khrod la sogs pa'i rten byas nas so //
translated: the tripod is made from a charnel ground, etc.

original: de'i steng du gzugs brnyan bzhag la zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i kha sbyar bzhag nas so //
analyzed: de'i steng du gzugs brnyan bzhag la zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i kha sbyar bzhag nas so //
translated: Having placed the effigy on top of that, etc. means having placed the joined pair as previously explained.

original: dur khrod kyi mes zhes bya ba ni ro phyed bsregs pa'i mes so //
analyzed: dur khrod kyi mes zhes bya ba ni ro phyed bsregs pa'i mes so //
translated: The charnel ground fire is the fire of a half-burned corpse.

original: 'phral du 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes pas sbyor ba'i mthu bstan to //
analyzed: 'phral du 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes pas sbyor ba'i mthu bstan to //
translated: One will die instantly teaches the power of the application.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas char 'bebs pa'i cho ga mdzad pa stobs po che'i ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par zhugs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas char 'bebs pa'i cho ga mdzad pa stobs po che'i ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par zhugs pa bstan to //
translated: Then, etc. teaches the rite of bringing rain, the samādhi and union of Mahābala.

original: dbyer med pas stobs po che'i sngags kyang stobs po che zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbyer med pas stobs po che'i sngags kyang stobs po che zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they are inseparable, the mantra of Maheśvara is also called Maheśvara.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyi don bshad pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyi don bshad pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the mantra beginning with Oṃ is easy to understand.

original: thog ni glog go //
analyzed: thog ni glog go //
translated: Lightning means lightning.

original: de bzhin du sgra gang la yod pa zhes bya ba 'dis sprin gyi 'brug sgra rang 'dra ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra gang la yod pa zhes bya ba 'dis sprin gyi 'brug sgra rang 'dra ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: Similarly, the sound that exists in that indicates the thunder of clouds as being of the same nature.

original: brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas las kyi dus su bzlas pa'i grangs bstan to //
analyzed: brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas las kyi dus su bzlas pa'i grangs bstan to //
translated: Recite one hundred and eight times and so on teaches the number of recitations at the time of the rite.

original: sngon gyi bsnyen pa ni 'brum phrag gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi bsnyen pa ni 'brum phrag gcig kho na'o //
translated: The preliminary service is only one hundred thousand.

original: char chad pa zhes pa ni bza' ba la sogs pa'i nyes pas char mi 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: char chad pa zhes pa ni bza' ba la sogs pa'i nyes pas char mi 'bab pa'o //
translated: Rain has stopped means rain does not fall due to faults such as eating.

original: de zhi bar byas nas char gyi rgyun ni char gyi tshogs so //
analyzed: de zhi bar byas nas char gyi rgyun ni char gyi tshogs so //
translated: Having pacified that, the stream of rain is the collection of rain.

original: klu ni 'jog po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: klu ni 'jog po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Nāgas are Ananta and so on.

original: 'bebs pa ni 'bab par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'bebs pa ni 'bab par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: Descending means falling.

original: 'dir rim pa 'di yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas char 'bebs pa'i cho ga bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir rim pa 'di yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas char 'bebs pa'i cho ga bstan te /
translated: This is the procedure... and so on teaches the ritual for bringing rain.

original: mngon spyod kyi rdzas ni lan tshva dang ske tshe dang dug dang long tshang gi khu ba'o //
analyzed: mngon spyod kyi rdzas ni lan tshva dang ske tshe dang dug dang long tshang gi khu ba'o //
translated: The substances for the rite of assault are salt, black mustard seed, poison, and the juice of the thorn apple.

original: de rnams kyis padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris la 'dab ma re re la klu chen po brgyad bris la klu de rnams kyi snying ga dang mgo bor h'um nam h'um zhes bya ba rdo rje gdan bzhi'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i sngags spel la sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris la 'dab ma re re la klu chen po brgyad bris la klu de rnams kyi snying ga dang mgo bor h'um nam h'um zhes bya ba rdo rje gdan bzhi'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i sngags spel la sbyar ba'o //
translated: Having drawn an eight-petaled lotus with those, one should draw the eight great nāgas on each petal, and one should apply the mantra of the four vajra seats, “hūṃ phaṭ” at the hearts and heads of those nāgas.

original: lte ba'i dbus su ni padma'i ze'u 'bru la'o //
analyzed: lte ba'i dbus su ni padma'i ze'u 'bru la'o //
translated: In the center of the hub, on the lotus filament.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pas yi ge gsum dang bcas pas badzra dha ro aadny'a pa ya ti zhes bya ba la sogs pa bkod nas so //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pas yi ge gsum dang bcas pas badzra dha ro aadny'a pa ya ti zhes bya ba la sogs pa bkod nas so //
translated: Having arranged the three syllables “oṃ” and so forth, “vajra dhāra ādhipaya” and so forth.

original: yang 'khor lo gnyis pa de bzhin du ni de dang 'dra ba'i 'khrul 'khor gnyis pa bris nas so //
analyzed: yang 'khor lo gnyis pa de bzhin du ni de dang 'dra ba'i 'khrul 'khor gnyis pa bris nas so //
translated: Again, the second wheel is like that, having drawn a second machine like that.

original: kha sbyar byas te zhes pa ni 'khrul 'khor gnyis sbyar nas so //
analyzed: kha sbyar byas te zhes pa ni 'khrul 'khor gnyis sbyar nas so //
translated: Having joined the two, having joined the two machines.

original: dgug pa sngon du 'gro ba zhes pa ni stobs po che'i sngags brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas de dgug pa'o //
analyzed: dgug pa sngon du 'gro ba zhes pa ni stobs po che'i sngags brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas de dgug pa'o //
translated: The phrase preceded by the summoning means that one summons them by reciting the mantra of Mahakala, preceded by the summoning.

original: gzugs brnyan @78b ni bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan gyi'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan @78b ni bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan gyi'o //
translated: The image is of the one to be summoned.

original: snying gar gzhug go zhes pa ni snying ga'i nang du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: snying gar gzhug go zhes pa ni snying ga'i nang du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should place it in the heart, that is, inside the heart.

original: gzugs brnyan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas klu'i gzugs brnyan bya ba'i thabs bstan te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas klu'i gzugs brnyan bya ba'i thabs bstan te /
translated: The phrase image and so forth teaches the method of making the image of a naga.

original: chu bo'i ngos gnyis kyi zhes pa ni 'gram gnyis kyi'o //
analyzed: chu bo'i ngos gnyis kyi zhes pa ni 'gram gnyis kyi'o //
translated: The two banks of a river are its two shores.

original: sa ni de'i 'brel ba dang ldan pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: sa ni de'i 'brel ba dang ldan pa'i sa'o //
translated: The earth is the earth connected with that.

original: bdud rtsi lnga dang ldan pa ni de dang 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga dang ldan pa ni de dang 'dres pa'o //
translated: It is mixed with the five ambrosias, that is, mixed with them.

original: de bzhin du sngar bshad pa'i mngon spyod kyi rdzas ni lan tshva la sogs pa dang 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngar bshad pa'i mngon spyod kyi rdzas ni lan tshva la sogs pa dang 'dres pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the substances for the rite of assault explained earlier are mixed with salt and so forth.

original: ngur khrod kyi me ni dur khrod kyi me'i 'o bas la'o //
analyzed: ngur khrod kyi me ni dur khrod kyi me'i 'o bas la'o //
translated: The charnel ground fire is the fire of a charnel ground.

original: gdung pa ni gdung par bya'o //
analyzed: gdung pa ni gdung par bya'o //
translated: One should burn it.

original: de ltar byas na klu ni 'jog po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas na klu ni 'jog po la sogs pa'o //
translated: In this way, the nagas are Ananta and so forth.

original: char 'bebs par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni char chen po 'bab par 'gyur ro //🔽kun du nges par sgrogs pa'o zhes pa ni nam mkha' ma lus khyad pa'o / rdo rje'i sgra ni mi phyed pa'i ha ta dgod pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms
analyzed: char 'bebs par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni char chen po 'bab par 'gyur ro // kun du nges par sgrogs pa'o zhes pa ni nam mkha' ma lus khyad pa'o / rdo rje'i sgra ni mi phyed pa'i ha ta dgod pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms
translated: It rains means that a great rain falls.

original: par zhugs pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: par zhugs pa nyid bstan to //
translated: It is proclaimed everywhere means that it pervades the entire sky. The vajra sound is the placement of the syllable hūṃ, which is indivisible. One who has that is called vajra sound. By this, it is taught that he is absorbed in the samādhi of Kāmarāja.

original: mthu chen po dang ldan pa'i bgegs rnams so zhes bya ba 'dis ni mig 'phrul dang ldan pa khyab 'jug dang drag po la sogs pa phyogs skyong ba rnams so //
analyzed: mthu chen po dang ldan pa'i bgegs rnams so zhes bya ba 'dis ni mig 'phrul dang ldan pa khyab 'jug dang drag po la sogs pa phyogs skyong ba rnams so //
translated: The great powerful obstructors are those with magical powers, such as Viṣṇu, Rudra, and so on, the guardians of the directions.

original: de 'ching bar byed pas na 'gugs par byed pa ste bcings pa'i don bstan to //
analyzed: de 'ching bar byed pas na 'gugs par byed pa ste bcings pa'i don bstan to //
translated: Since he binds them, he is the fetcher, which teaches the meaning of bound.

original: de nyid gtso bo yin pas na zhes pa la thun mong yin pa'i las byed pas so //
analyzed: de nyid gtso bo yin pas na zhes pa la thun mong yin pa'i las byed pas so //
translated: Since he is the principal one, he is the common agent of the action.

original: sngags kyi bdag nyid can zhes pa ni brjod par bya ba dang brjod par byed par dbyer med pas khro bo ni sngags kyi bdag nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi bdag nyid can zhes pa ni brjod par bya ba dang brjod par byed par dbyer med pas khro bo ni sngags kyi bdag nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The phrase having the nature of mantra means that the wrathful one is called having the nature of mantra because of the inseparability of the expressed and the expresser.

original: na ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyi don bshad pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: na ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyi don bshad pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the mantra beginning with namaḥ is easy to understand.

original: ming btus pa zhes pa ni sngags kyi brda'o //
analyzed: ming btus pa zhes pa ni sngags kyi brda'o //
translated: The collection of names refers to the symbolic mantra.

original: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje gtsug tor gyi rgyud tshad ma nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje gtsug tor gyi rgyud tshad ma nyid du bstan to //
translated: That and so on teach the validity of the Vajra-Uṣṇīṣa Tantra.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags bzlas pa dang thos pa tsam gyis gdug pa rnams 'jigs pa dang bcas pa dang / rdo rje 'chang chen po rjes su dran par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags bzlas pa dang thos pa tsam gyis gdug pa rnams 'jigs pa dang bcas pa dang / rdo rje 'chang chen po rjes su dran par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Then and so on teach that by merely reciting and hearing the mantra, the wicked will be frightened and will remember Mahāvajradhara.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang yang rung ba'i rdzas kyi sa la sogs pas bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan bris la de'i snying ga'i phyogs su ming spel nas /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang yang rung ba'i rdzas kyi sa la sogs pas bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan bris la de'i snying ga'i phyogs su ming spel nas /
translated: Vajrasattva and so on teach that one should draw the image of the victim on the ground with any available substance, and insert the name in between the two parts of the mantra at the heart center.

original: rgyal po la sogs pa'i bsgrub par shes pa bkug la der bcug ste rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du byas pa sngon @79a * //
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pa'i bsgrub par shes pa bkug la der bcug ste rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du byas pa sngon @79a * //
translated: Having summoned the consciousness of the king and so on to be established, having inserted it there, and having actualized the meditative concentration of Great Vajradhara, one should make offerings to the consciousness.🔽

original: du 'gro bas 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i sngags lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pas rdo rje lcags kyu bkod pa'i rkang pa g-yas pas de mnan zhing ji srid rgyal po la sogs pa de srid 'gugs par bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: du 'gro bas 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i sngags lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pas rdo rje lcags kyu bkod pa'i rkang pa g-yas pas de mnan zhing ji srid rgyal po la sogs pa de srid 'gugs par bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having summoned the king and so forth, one should place him there, and having previously made manifest the meditative concentration of Great Vajradhara, one should recite the mantra of the king of desires one hundred and eight times, and with the right foot placed on the vajra hook, one should press him down and recite as long as the king and so forth are summoned.

original: ye shes kyi phreng ba'i chu zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: ye shes kyi phreng ba'i chu zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: By the water of the garland of wisdom and so forth, it is taught that one should enter into the meditative concentration of Akshobhya.

original: sngags kyi bdag nyid can zhes pa ni khro bo'i sku dang sngags dag dbyer med pas so //
analyzed: sngags kyi bdag nyid can zhes pa ni khro bo'i sku dang sngags dag dbyer med pas so //
translated: The phrase having the nature of the mantra means that the wrathful body and the mantra are inseparable.

original: na ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags kyi don bshad pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: na ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags kyi don bshad pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the mantra beginning with namaḥ is easy to understand.

original: sv'a h'a ra ldan zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags kyi brda bstan to //
analyzed: sv'a h'a ra ldan zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags kyi brda bstan to //
translated: By endowed with svāhā and so forth, the symbolic meaning of the mantra is taught.

original: mgo med ces pa ni aom zhes bya ba mgo bo dang bral pas so //
analyzed: mgo med ces pa ni aom zhes bya ba mgo bo dang bral pas so //
translated: The headless is the head of the syllable OṀ, which is devoid of head.

original: bgegs rnams long bar byed pa'o zhes pa ni 'jigs pa chen pos mig long bskyed par byed pas so //
analyzed: bgegs rnams long bar byed pa'o zhes pa ni 'jigs pa chen pos mig long bskyed par byed pas so //
translated: The blind of the obstacles is the generation of blindness by great fear.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: All afflictions are passion, etc.

original: yang na thams cad ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa ni nad la sogs pa de mi bzod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //🔽de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags brjod pa dang thos pas dbang phyag chen po la sogs pa rnams kyang 'jigs pa dang ldan pa dang rdo rje 'chang chen po la skyabs su 'gro ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: yang na thams cad ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa ni nad la sogs pa de mi bzod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so // de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags brjod pa dang thos pas dbang phyag chen po la sogs pa rnams kyang 'jigs pa dang ldan pa dang rdo rje 'chang chen po la skyabs su 'gro ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: Or, all is the afflictions of the worldly, and their intolerance is the Tathāgatas.🔽Then, etc. shows that by the utterance and hearing of the mantra, even the great lords such as Maheśvara are frightened and go for refuge to Great Vajradhara.

original: 'di yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngags bris pa'i 'khrul 'khor gyi dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa yang 'gugs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'di yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngags bris pa'i 'khrul 'khor gyi dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa yang 'gugs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: By this, etc. shows that even the great lords such as Maheśvara are summoned by the wheel of the written mantra.

original: sngon du bsnyen pa sngags 'bum phrag gcig bzla zhing yang gro ga la sogs pa gi wang dang tsandan dang gur gum dang ga pur dang gla rtsi la sogs pa de med na tha mal pa'i rdzas kyis dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan ming dang🔽spel bar byas la /
analyzed: sngon du bsnyen pa sngags 'bum phrag gcig bzla zhing yang gro ga la sogs pa gi wang dang tsandan dang gur gum dang ga pur dang gla rtsi la sogs pa de med na tha mal pa'i rdzas kyis dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan ming dang spel bar byas la /
translated: Then, on birch bark or the like, with realgar, sandalwood, saffron, camphor, musk, and so on, or if those are not available, with ordinary substances, one should write the name and form of Maheśvara and so on,🔽and with a second such device, one should join them together.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i 'khrul 'khor gnyis pas kha sbyar la snga ma bzhin du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du dgod pa rdo rje lcags kyus mtshan pa'i g-yon brkyang pa'i rkang pas mnan cing mtshams gsum du brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pa byas pas dbang phyug chen po
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i 'khrul 'khor gnyis pas kha sbyar la snga ma bzhin du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du dgod pa rdo rje lcags kyus mtshan pa'i g-yon brkyang pa'i rkang pas mnan cing mtshams gsum du brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pa byas pas dbang phyug chen po
translated: As before, one should place them on a sun maṇḍala, trample on them with one’s left leg extended, and recite the mantra one hundred and eight times at the three junctions of the day.

original: la sogs pa 'gugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa 'gugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Maheśvara and so on will be summoned.

original: rdo rje 'chang gi bka' zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang gi bka' lung ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang gi bka' zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang gi bka' lung ngo //
translated: “The command of Vajradhara” is the command of Vajradhara.

original: de nyid mi phyed pas na zhes pa ni bgegs thams cad kyis mi 'da' bas so //
analyzed: de nyid mi phyed pas na zhes pa ni bgegs thams cad kyis mi 'da' bas so //
translated: “Because it is indivisible” means that it is not transgressed by any obstructors.

original: de'i ming can zhes pa ni de'i ming can ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de'i ming can zhes pa ni de'i ming can ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The phrase having that name means having the name of that samādhi.

original: @79b rdo rje 'dzin pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas mtha' med pa'i sngags kyi brda bstan te sv'a h'a med pas so //
analyzed: @79b rdo rje 'dzin pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas mtha' med pa'i sngags kyi brda bstan te sv'a h'a med pas so //
translated: The phrase all vajra holders and so forth teaches the mantra sign without the svāhā.

original: de'i don na ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags kyi bshad pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de'i don na ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags kyi bshad pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The phrase the meaning of that is this and so forth explains the mantra easily.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyor ba bstan te /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyor ba bstan te /
translated: The phrase Vajrasattva and so forth teaches the yoga.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs bsgom la ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka nas 'od zer gyi tshogs spro zhing de nyid lcags kyu'i rnam par yongs su
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs bsgom la ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka nas 'od zer gyi tshogs spro zhing de nyid lcags kyu'i rnam par yongs su
translated: One who possesses the yoga of Great Vajradhara should meditate on the assembly of Tathāgatas such as Vairocana, who are the nature of the three beings, and from the heart of the gnosis being, should emanate a mass of light rays, which transform into hooks.

original: gyur nas bsgrub bya'i ye shes sems dpa'i 'od zer gyi sbyor bas bkug la gnon mdzes kyi rgyal pos rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du drangs pa zhags pa dang lcags kyu dag gis mgul pa bcings shing spyi bor btab la /
analyzed: gyur nas bsgrub bya'i ye shes sems dpa'i 'od zer gyi sbyor bas bkug la gnon mdzes kyi rgyal pos rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du drangs pa zhags pa dang lcags kyu dag gis mgul pa bcings shing spyi bor btab la /
translated: Having become that, one should summon the gnosis being of the one to be accomplished by the yoga of light rays, and having drawn him up with the king of subjugators above the maṇḍala of wind, one should bind his neck with the noose and hook and place him on one’s crown.

original: mdun du phyin nas rang gi ye shes sems dpa'i snying gar 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: mdun du phyin nas rang gi ye shes sems dpa'i snying gar 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Having brought him in front, one should cause him to enter the heart of one’s gnosis being.

original: de'i tshe nge bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nus pa 'gugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe nge bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nus pa 'gugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, one will summon the power of all the tathāgatas.

original: de yang le'u bcu pa las thabs bzhi'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: de yang le'u bcu pa las thabs bzhi'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: Moreover, in the tenth chapter, the stages of the four methods are taught.

original: rim pa 'di nyid kyis lha la sogs pa rnams kyi yang bu mo 'gugs par 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rim pa 'di nyid kyis lha la sogs pa rnams kyi yang bu mo 'gugs par 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
translated: By this very stage, one should summon the daughters of gods and so on.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bu bo zhes bya ba 'di nye bar mtshon pa tsam zhes bstan to ;
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bu bo zhes bya ba 'di nye bar mtshon pa tsam zhes bstan to ;
translated: In order to demonstrate that, “daughter” is taught as merely an illustration.

original: / nang gi bdag nyid la gzhol ba zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi rdzas la mi ltos pa la 'jug pa'i //
analyzed: / nang gi bdag nyid la gzhol ba zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi rdzas la mi ltos pa la 'jug pa'i //
translated: “Turning inward” means engaging without regard for external substances.

original: de nas zhes bya ba nas sku dgug pa'i zhes pa'i bar du ni sangs rgyas dgug pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas sku dgug pa'i zhes pa'i bar du ni sangs rgyas dgug pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid bstan to //
translated: From “Then” up to “the body is summoned” teaches the samādhi called “summoning the buddhas.”

original: dang po rdo rje 'chad chen po la sogs pa'i sku dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba rang gi snying gnas zhags pa dang lcags kyu'i rnam pa'i 'od zer rnams bsgrub ba bya'i lus la sogs pa la 'jug na de'i tshe lus kyang 'gugs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan
analyzed: dang po rdo rje 'chad chen po la sogs pa'i sku dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba rang gi snying gnas zhags pa dang lcags kyu'i rnam pa'i 'od zer rnams bsgrub ba bya'i lus la sogs pa la 'jug na de'i tshe lus kyang 'gugs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan
translated: The body of the great Vajradhara, and so on, is visualized in front. If the light rays in the form of nooses and hooks from one’s heart enter the body, and so on, of the victim, then at that time the body is summoned.

original: to // 'dir bsgrub par dka' ba ni tshangs pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i lha dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang sgrub ba po la mi gzigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: to // 'dir bsgrub par dka' ba ni tshangs pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i lha dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang sgrub ba po la mi gzigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, “difficult to accomplish” means that even the worldly gods such as Brahmā and the transcendent tathāgatas do not look upon the practitioner.

original: ston pa zhes bya ba nas khugs par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni sngar bshad ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rdo rje 'chang gi sems dgug pa bstan to //
analyzed: ston pa zhes bya ba nas khugs par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni sngar bshad ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rdo rje 'chang gi sems dgug pa bstan to //
translated: “The teacher” up to “is summoned” teaches the summoning of the mind of Vajradhara by the previously explained samādhi.

original: 'khor lo zhes bya ba nas dgug ste @80a * //🔽zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi sku bsgoms la rang gi snying ga las spros pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs 'khor lo dang padma dang rin po che dang ral gri'i rnam🔽pa yongs su gyur pa bsgrub bya'i snying gar bcug pas dgug par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'khor lo zhes bya ba nas dgug ste @80a * // zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi sku bsgoms la rang gi snying ga las spros pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs 'khor lo dang padma dang rin po che dang ral gri'i rnam pa yongs su gyur pa bsgrub bya'i snying gar bcug pas dgug par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The passage from wheel up to summoned teaches that a yogin of Vairochana and so forth should meditate on his own body in the proper order and that he should summon the victim by placing at his heart a mass of light rays emanated from his heart, which have transformed into a wheel, lotus, jewel, or sword, depending on the deity.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' chen po'i rnal 'byor pas zhes bya ba nas nges par 'gugs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du rdo rje 'chang gi ting nge 'dzin mngon du byas la /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' chen po'i rnal 'byor pas zhes bya ba nas nges par 'gugs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du rdo rje 'chang gi ting nge 'dzin mngon du byas la /
translated: The passage from a yogin of great Vajrasattva up to will definitely be summoned teaches that a yogin of Vajradhara should actualize the samadhi of Vajradhara and that he should summon the victim by placing at his heart a vajra marked with the syllable hūṃ, which is emanated from his heart.

original: yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i steng du rgyal po'i btsun mo bzhag par bsams la rang gi snying ga las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs rdo rje lcags kyu'i rnam pa can de'i snying gar bcug pas dgug par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i steng du rgyal po'i btsun mo bzhag par bsams la rang gi snying ga las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs rdo rje lcags kyu'i rnam pa can de'i snying gar bcug pas dgug par bsam par bya'o //
translated: Having imagined that the queen of the king is placed on the variegated vajra which is the transformation of the letter hūṃ, one should imagine that a mass of light rays in the form of vajra hooks, arisen from one’s heart, is inserted into her heart, and she is summoned.

original: de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad ces pa nas dgug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnam pa yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du gnas pa brgya byin gyi chung ma rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis khyer ba
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad ces pa nas dgug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnam pa yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du gnas pa brgya byin gyi chung ma rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis khyer ba
translated: Similarly, up to “having imagined that Śakra’s wife is placed on a moon disk on a transformation from the form of Vairocana,” the wind maṇḍala carries her away,

original: bdud rtsi 'khyil pas drangs par bsgoms te /
analyzed: bdud rtsi 'khyil pas drangs par bsgoms te /
translated: and she is drawn by Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: mdun du phyin pa bsam par bya'o zhes rnam par snang mdzad kyi sbyor bas dgug par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mdun du phyin pa bsam par bya'o zhes rnam par snang mdzad kyi sbyor bas dgug par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Having imagined that she arrives in front, one should summon her with the application of Vairocana.

original: lan grangs lnga bcu brjod nas zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyis rnam pa gnyis su byas nas brgyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan grangs lnga bcu brjod nas zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyis rnam pa gnyis su byas nas brgyar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having recited fifty times means that by means of the nature of method and wisdom, one makes two forms, and so it becomes one hundred.

original: brgya bzlas pa ni brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pa yin no //
analyzed: brgya bzlas pa ni brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pa yin no //
translated: Reciting one hundred times means reciting one hundred and eight times.

analyzed: rdo rje dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba nas dgug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas 'dod pa'i rgyal po yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje lcags kyu la gnas pa'i lha'i bu mo bsams te rdo rje lcags kyu'i sbyor ba de
translated: From the vajra maṇḍala up to should summon means that the practitioner of Akṣobhya, having transformed into Kāmeśvara, should imagine a celestial maiden standing on a vajra hook, and by the yoga of the vajra hook,

analyzed: nyid kyis dgug par bsam par bya'o //
translated: he should imagine summoning her.

original: de'i tshe 'gugs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'gugs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: At that time, she will be summoned, it is taught.

original: rdo rje khro bo zhes bya ba nas dgug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni thugs rdo rje 'chang gi ting nge 'dzin mngon du 'gyur ba sngon du 'gro bas rang gi sting gnas sngar bshad pa'i kha dog dang / dbyings dang ldan pa'i gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po spros la /
analyzed: rdo rje khro bo zhes bya ba nas dgug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni thugs rdo rje 'chang gi ting nge 'dzin mngon du 'gyur ba sngon du 'gro bas rang gi sting gnas sngar bshad pa'i kha dog dang / dbyings dang ldan pa'i gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po spros la /
translated: From the vajra wrathful one up to summon is taught that having previously actualized the concentration of Vajradhara, one emanates Sumbharāja with the color and abode as previously explained,

analyzed: des zhags pa dang lcags kyu dag gis lha ma yin gyi bu mo bcings nas snying gar brdegs la rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis drangs @80b par bsams na de'i 'gugs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: and that one should imagine that he binds the asura maiden with a noose and iron hook, strikes her heart, and draws her with a wind mandala, whereby she is summoned.

analyzed: btsag gam zhes bya ba nas nges par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni btsag ni rdo rje lcags kyu lta bu'i rnam pa byas nas zla ba gzas zin pa'i dus su snyoms bar zhugs pa'i tshe phyag rgya'i chos 'byung gi nang du bcug la ji srid zla
translated: From the copper up to it will definitely occur is taught that having made the copper like a vajra hook, at the time of the lunar eclipse, one should insert the consort into the dharma source of the seal, and as long as the moon is in the eclipse, one should recite the mantra.

original: ba btang ba de srid du bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: ba btang ba de srid du bzla bar bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra until the smoke ceases.

original: de'i 'og tu de las langs la bsgrub bya'i ming bris te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de las langs la bsgrub bya'i ming bris te /
translated: Then, having arisen from that, one should write the name of the one to be summoned,

analyzed: srung ba'i 'khor los bsrung zhing mngon par 'dod pa gang yin pa de dgug par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: and having protected with the protection wheel, one should summon whatever is desired.

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba nas nye bar sdud pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni re zhig dang po bskyed pa'i rim pas 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i bdag nyid bsgoms la rang gi snying gnas nas gshin rje mthar byed spro zhing de yongs su gyur ba las
translated: With regard to the passage beginning with “all aspects” up to “gathering,” one should first meditate on the self-nature of Mañjuvajra through the creation stage, and from one’s heart one should emanate Yamāntaka. From that completely transformed

analyzed: me'i dkyil 'khor de la zla ba'i 'od la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa'i gnod sbyin ma bzhag ste rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis khyer ba gshin rje mthar byed de nyid kyis drangs pa bsam par byed na de'i tshe 'gugs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: into a fire maṇḍala, one should place the desired yakṣiṇī such as Candrottara on that, and if one imagines that Yamāntaka, carried by the wind maṇḍala, is drawing her, at that time she will be summoned.

original: phyag rgya chen po gnyis kyi dbye bas so zhes bya ba la sogs pas dgug pa la sogs pa sngar bshad pa gang yin pa de rnams rnam pa gnyis kyi phyag rgya chen po'i sku dmigs pa dang // rnam pa gnyis kyis bzlas pa byas nas dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po gnyis kyi dbye bas so zhes bya ba la sogs pas dgug pa la sogs pa sngar bshad pa gang yin pa de rnams rnam pa gnyis kyi phyag rgya chen po'i sku dmigs pa dang // rnam pa gnyis kyis bzlas pa byas nas dgug par bya'o //
translated: By the division of the two Mahāmudrās means that whatever was previously explained, such as summoning, is done by visualizing the body of the two Mahāmudrās, and by reciting the two Mahāmudrās.

original: 'dir sngags kyi sku dang / ye shes kyi sku ste rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'dir sngags kyi sku dang / ye shes kyi sku ste rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Here, there are two types of mantra body and jñāna body.

analyzed: ngag gi bzlas pa dang rdo rje bzlas pa zhes bya ba ni bzlas pa gnyis so //
translated: There are two types of recitation: recitation of speech and vajra recitation.

original: de yang rim pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor pa la ltos nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rim pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor pa la ltos nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, this should be explained in terms of the yogi/nī of the two stages.

original: de spong bas gang sgrub par byed pa de 'jig pa ni dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de spong bas gang sgrub par byed pa de 'jig pa ni dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: By abandoning that, if one practices that, it is said that destruction will not attain siddhi.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba nas dmigs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du las kyi tshogs sngar bshad pa gang yin pa de rnams bya ba'i dus su skad cig ma re re do rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dmigs par bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba nas dmigs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du las kyi tshogs sngar bshad pa gang yin pa de rnams bya ba'i dus su skad cig ma re re do rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dmigs par bya ste /
translated: The phrase one should visualize Vajrasattva refers to the fact that at the time of performing the previously explained collection of rites, one should visualize Vajrasattva in every instant.

original: de ni thams cad kyi mchog yin pas so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni thams cad kyi mchog yin pas so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught because he is the best of all.

original: lnga po rnams kyi rten du gyur pa'i phyir zhes pa ni de rnams skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lnga po rnams kyi rten du gyur pa'i phyir zhes pa ni de rnams skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase because they are the basis of the five means that they are the producers of those.

original: yang dang yang du bskul bar bya zhing zhes pa ni skad cig ma re re bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang du bskul bar bya zhing zhes pa ni skad cig ma re re bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The phrase one should repeatedly urge means that one should cultivate them in every instant.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pa ni gtan tshigs so //🔽gang gi phyir de bzhin @81a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pa ni gtan tshigs so // gang gi phyir de bzhin @81a * //
translated: Why? means for what reason?

original: gshegs pa thams cad kyi nang na rtag pa ste rang bzhin gyi rtag pa chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir re //
analyzed: gshegs pa thams cad kyi nang na rtag pa ste rang bzhin gyi rtag pa chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir re //
translated: Because he is the permanent one among all the Tathagatas, that is, he is permanent by nature, because he is the nature of the Dharma body.

original: gsal bar byed pa ni spro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa ni spro bar byed pa'o //
translated: Illumination means to emit.

original: las thams cad ces pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: las thams cad ces pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa la'o //
translated: All actions means pacification and so forth.

original: gnas skabs thams cad du dmigs par bya'o zhes pa ni spyod lam bzhi la de nyid bsten par bya ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad du dmigs par bya'o zhes pa ni spyod lam bzhi la de nyid bsten par bya ba'i rigs so //
translated: One should visualize in all circumstances means that one should rely on that very [visualization] in the four modes of behavior.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sbyor ba thams cad bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: sbyor ba thams cad bcom ldan 'das //
translated: All practices are the Blessed One,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
translated: Vajrasattva, the Tathagata.

original: khams gsum pa ni ma lus 'di //
analyzed: khams gsum pa ni ma lus 'di //
translated: This entire three-realm world

original: de ni longs spyod thams cad yin //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ni longs spyod thams cad yin // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: is all enjoyment.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das don yod grub pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das don yod grub pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Then, etc. shows that the Blessed One entered into the samadhi of Amoghasiddhi.

original: nam mkha' ltar thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o zhes pa ni chos kyi sku la ngo bo nyid rtogs pas thog ma dang tha ma dang skye ba dang 'jig pa med de /
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o zhes pa ni chos kyi sku la ngo bo nyid rtogs pas thog ma dang tha ma dang skye ba dang 'jig pa med de /
translated: Space-like beginning and endlessness means that in the dharmakaya, by realizing the essence, there is no beginning, end, arising, or perishing.

original: skye dang gnas dang 'jig pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: skye dang gnas dang 'jig pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: As it is said: Free from the faults of arising, abiding, and perishing.

original: sna tshogs rdo rje zhes pa ni sna tshogs rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa'i las kyi mtshan nyid gang la yod pa de la dbyer med pa'i ting nge 'dzin de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje zhes pa ni sna tshogs rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa'i las kyi mtshan nyid gang la yod pa de la dbyer med pa'i ting nge 'dzin de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The samādhi is called “indivisible” because of the indivisibility of the consecration of the variegated vajra.

original: gnas skabs kyi khyad par la zhes pa ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid la bzhugs nas so //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi khyad par la zhes pa ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid la bzhugs nas so //
translated: The state of abiding in the one-pointed mind is the state of abiding in the one-pointed mind.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das don yod grub pa'i rang bzhin gyi ral pa gcig ma'i sngags bstan to //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das don yod grub pa'i rang bzhin gyi ral pa gcig ma'i sngags bstan to //
translated: The mantra of the one-tufted, which is the nature of the Bhagavān Amoghasiddhi, is taught by “the one-tufted” and so forth.

original: ral pa gcig gang la yod pa de ni thor tshugs gcig ma ste /
analyzed: ral pa gcig gang la yod pa de ni thor tshugs gcig ma ste /
translated: The one who has one tuft is the one-tufted.

original: phyi rol gyi mkha' 'gro ma rnams bskrad pa'i don du sprul pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi mkha' 'gro ma rnams bskrad pa'i don du sprul pa'o //
translated: The emanation is for the purpose of driving away the external ḍākinīs.

original: sngags kyi bdag nyid can zhes pa ni brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i dbyer med pas so //
analyzed: sngags kyi bdag nyid can zhes pa ni brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i dbyer med pas so //
translated: The mantra nature is because of the indivisibility of the expressed and the expresser.

original: dam tshig chen po gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i zhes pa ni de'i rigs las byung ba dang srin po la sogs pa las rgyal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i zhes pa ni de'i rigs las byung ba dang srin po la sogs pa las rgyal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase the great vow-holder who cannot be overcome by others means that he is victorious over the types of rakshasas and so forth.

original: de'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams mo zhes pa ni dam tshig gi rigs kyi 'khor rnams so //
analyzed: de'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams mo zhes pa ni dam tshig gi rigs kyi 'khor rnams so //
translated: The phrase his mandala means the retinue of the vow-holder's family.

original: de rnams kyi gtso bo ste zhes pa ni khro bo'i rgyal po btsun mo yin pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gtso bo ste zhes pa ni khro bo'i rgyal po btsun mo yin pas so //
translated: The phrase the chief of those means that he is the king of wrathful ones, the queen.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngags kyi don ni go sla'o //🔽rig pa 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gis gang gi tshe rig pa 'di gsungs pa de'i tshe klu'i rgyal po 'jog po la sogs pa dang gzugs @81b bzang ma la sogs pa'i klu mo rnams 'gugs par 'gyur ro zhes rig
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngags kyi don ni go sla'o // rig pa 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gis gang gi tshe rig pa 'di gsungs pa de'i tshe klu'i rgyal po 'jog po la sogs pa dang gzugs @81b bzang ma la sogs pa'i klu mo rnams 'gugs par 'gyur ro zhes rig
translated: The meaning of the mantra beginning with Om is easy to understand.

original: pa'i mthu bstan to //
analyzed: pa'i mthu bstan to //
translated: The phrase this knowledge and so forth indicates the power of knowledge. When the Blessed One Vajradhara spoke this knowledge, at that time the naga kings Takshaka and so forth, and the naga women such as Subhadra, were summoned.

original: de la 'dir chog 'di yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas klu dang klu mo rnams dgug pa'i sbyor ba bstan to //
analyzed: de la 'dir chog 'di yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas klu dang klu mo rnams dgug pa'i sbyor ba bstan to //
translated: The phrase here is the method and so forth indicates the method for summoning the nagas and naga women.

original: skyes pa'i thod pa la zhes pa ni ro langs kyi chogs blangs pa la'o //
analyzed: skyes pa'i thod pa la zhes pa ni ro langs kyi chogs blangs pa la'o //
translated: The skull of a man is the skull of a corpse.

original: btsag ces pa ni dgongs pas bshad pas rang 'byung gi me tog gis so //
analyzed: btsag ces pa ni dgongs pas bshad pas rang 'byung gi me tog gis so //
translated: The red dye is the naturally occurring flower, because it is explained by the intention.

original: ji skad du /🔽sna dung mtshal chen dang ldan pa //
analyzed: ji skad du / sna dung mtshal chen dang ldan pa //
translated: As it is said:🔽The nose conch and great lac

original: sme sha can ma skal med gang //
analyzed: sme sha can ma skal med gang //
translated: are the unfortunate outcasts.

original: de la zla ba re las 'byung //
analyzed: de la zla ba re las 'byung //
translated: The moon arises from them every month.

original: khrag ni me tog ces su bshad //🔽ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: khrag ni me tog ces su bshad // ces 'byung ngo //
translated: Blood is explained as the flower.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni zla gam dang 'dra ba ba dan gyis mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni zla gam dang 'dra ba ba dan gyis mtshan pa'o //
translated: The mandala of wind is like a half-moon, marked with a banner.

original: nor rgyas la sogs pa'i klu'i gzugs brnyan gang yang rung ba'i gzugs zhes pa ni sgrub pa po'i dgongs pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nor rgyas la sogs pa'i klu'i gzugs brnyan gang yang rung ba'i gzugs zhes pa ni sgrub pa po'i dgongs pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The form of any image of the nāgas such as Vāsuki and so on is the form of the practitioner, by the power of intention.

original: ming dang spel ba dang bcas pa ni dgug pa'i sa bon dang bcas pas ming dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: ming dang spel ba dang bcas pa ni dgug pa'i sa bon dang bcas pas ming dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The name is the name together with the seed of summoning.

original: sngags bzlas brjod byas nas zhes pa ni che ge mo klu a'a karsha ya hri zhes bya ba dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sngags bzlas brjod byas nas zhes pa ni che ge mo klu a'a karsha ya hri zhes bya ba dang ldan pa /
translated: Having recited the mantra, so-and-so, I summon the nāgas, hṛdaya, it is endowed with that.

original: ral ba gcig ma'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas shing klu dang klu mo rnams dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ral ba gcig ma'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas shing klu dang klu mo rnams dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: One should recite the mantra of Ekavīra one hundred and eight times. All nāgas and nāginīs are brought under one's control.
