original: cho ga zhes bya ba la sogs pas klu mo dgug pa yang bud med kyi thod pa la thams cad de ltar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: cho ga zhes bya ba la sogs pas klu mo dgug pa yang bud med kyi thod pa la thams cad de ltar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The summoning of nāginīs is taught by the rite, etc. One should do everything in the same way in the skull of a woman.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas thams cad bsdus so //
translated: Therefore, etc.  sums up everything.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'od dpag tu med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'od dpag tu med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The statement then, etc. teaches the very state of meditative concentration on Amitābha.

original: nam mkha'i dam tshig ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dam tshig ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The pledge of space is the thought of enlightenment.

original: de'i rang bzhin 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: Its nature is Amitābha.

original: 'od dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas smin ma bsdu ba dang bcas pa'i 'jigs pas khro gnyer ma'i gzugs bstan to //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas smin ma bsdu ba dang bcas pa'i 'jigs pas khro gnyer ma'i gzugs bstan to //
translated: The form of Bhṛkuṭī, with a frown of fear, is taught by Amitābha, etc.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags kyi don bshad pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags kyi don bshad pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the mantra is easy to understand in Oṃ, etc.

original: rkun ma la sogs pas byas pa zhes pa ni glang po la sogs pas byas pa'i 'jigs pa brgyad dam bcu'o //
analyzed: rkun ma la sogs pas byas pa zhes pa ni glang po la sogs pas byas pa'i 'jigs pa brgyad dam bcu'o //
translated: The eight or ten dangers are those created by thieves, etc., and those created by elephants, etc.

original: 'jigs pa ni de 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa ni de 'jigs pa'o //
translated: Fear is the fear of those.

original: dgra ni pha rol gyi dpung ngo //
analyzed: dgra ni pha rol gyi dpung ngo //
translated: Enemy is the army of the opponent.

original: 'jigs par mdzad pa ni rmongs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs par mdzad pa ni rmongs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Terrifying is causing bewilderment.

original: 'jigs pa'i gzugs can zhes pa ni gdul dka' gdul bar bya ba'i phyir mngon du 'jigs pa'i gzugs can no //
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i gzugs can zhes pa ni gdul dka' gdul bar bya ba'i phyir mngon du 'jigs pa'i gzugs can no //
translated: Having a terrifying form is having a terrifying form in order to subdue those difficult to subdue.

original: bka' bsgo ba zhes pa ni bcom ldan @82a * //
analyzed: bka' bsgo ba zhes pa ni bcom ldan @82a * //
translated: Command is the command of the Blessed One.

original: 'das rdo rje 'chang bka' bsgo bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'das rdo rje 'chang bka' bsgo bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: Vajradhara is the Blessed One.

original: glog ltar g-yo ba'i gzugs can zhes pa ni thog bzhin du snang bas so //
analyzed: glog ltar g-yo ba'i gzugs can zhes pa ni thog bzhin du snang bas so //
translated: Having a form that moves like lightning is like a flash of lightning.

original: de bas na bgegs rnams bcom pa'i phyir 'brug ltar sgra sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na bgegs rnams bcom pa'i phyir 'brug ltar sgra sgrogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to destroy the obstructors, he roars like thunder.

original: dri ma dan pa ma lus pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma rnams so ;
analyzed: dri ma dan pa ma lus pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma rnams so ;
translated: All stains are the stains of passion, etc.

original: / de dang bral ba ni de med pas shel te dri ma dag pa'i gos bzhin no //
analyzed: / de dang bral ba ni de med pas shel te dri ma dag pa'i gos bzhin no //
translated: Being free from them is being without them, like a crystal cloth.

original: 'dod chags rnam par dag pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag tu med pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: 'dod chags rnam par dag pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag tu med pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: The nature of passion is the nature of the Bhagavat Amitābha.

original: gang gi mgo la yod pa zhes pa 'dis khro gnyer ma 'od dpag tu med pa'i rigs dang ldan par bstan to//
analyzed: gang gi mgo la yod pa zhes pa 'dis khro gnyer ma 'od dpag tu med pa'i rigs dang ldan par bstan to//
translated: The one who is on his head—this shows that Bhṛkuṭī is of the family of Amitābha.

original: sngar bshad pa'i 'jigs pa dang bral bas bha sha na ya zhes bya ba la sogs pa kun kyang bod pa'i tshig yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das ma'i bod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i 'jigs pa dang bral bas bha sha na ya zhes bya ba la sogs pa kun kyang bod pa'i tshig yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das ma'i bod pa'i tshig go //
translated: Since she is free from the fear explained above, she is called Bhāṣaṇā, and so on. All of these are Tibetan words.

original: rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas khro gnyer ma'i sngags thos pas rig pa 'dzin pa'i bu mo chags pa'i mes bsreg par 'gyur pa'i snying dang ldan pas sgrub pa po rnyed pa'i phyir 'od dpag tu med pa dran par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas khro gnyer ma'i sngags thos pas rig pa 'dzin pa'i bu mo chags pa'i mes bsreg par 'gyur pa'i snying dang ldan pas sgrub pa po rnyed pa'i phyir 'od dpag tu med pa dran par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: By the words “knowledge” and so on, it is taught that the practitioner, having a heart that is burned by the fire of passion for the daughter of a knowledge-holder, will remember Amitābha in order to obtain the practitioner.

original: sngags kyi mthu bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: sngags kyi mthu bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to show the power of the mantra,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ni mdzes pa la sogs pas lus brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ni mdzes pa la sogs pas lus brgyan pa'o //
translated: The adornment of the body is the beauty, etc. of the body endowed with the qualities of form, etc.

original: rna rgyan 'chang zhing g-yo bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rna rgyan 'chang zhing g-yo bar 'gyur //
translated: Wearing earrings, he moves about.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means adorned with all ornaments.

original: mchog gi khyad par gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ma thag tu bshad pa'i rig pa dang rtog pa las gsungs pa'i cho gas kyang dgug par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mchog gi khyad par gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ma thag tu bshad pa'i rig pa dang rtog pa las gsungs pa'i cho gas kyang dgug par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: By the special supreme, etc. he teaches that one should summon by the rite taught in the Vidyā and Tantra just explained.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyor ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyor ba bstan to //
translated: By here etc. he teaches the application.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa tsam gyis las kyi rgyal ba mchog bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa tsam gyis las kyi rgyal ba mchog bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The literal meaning is that he teaches the Karma-Uttara-Tantra merely by the stage of generation.

original: 'gog pa zhes bya ba nas dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni 'jig pa la sogs pa'i yi ge gsum yan lag ma nyams par bzlas nas sngar bshad pa'i sngags rnams kyis zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'gog pa zhes bya ba nas dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni 'jig pa la sogs pa'i yi ge gsum yan lag ma nyams par bzlas nas sngar bshad pa'i sngags rnams kyis zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The passage from cessation up to explained with an intention teaches that by reciting the three syllables om, a, and hum without any loss of limbs, one will accomplish the activities of pacification and so forth with the previously explained mantras.

original: de kho na nyid la 'jug pas 'bad rtsol med pas sngags 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid la 'jug pas 'bad rtsol med pas sngags 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Since one enters into reality, the mantras are accomplished without effort.

original: sngags kyi rang bzhin yongs su shes pas so //
analyzed: sngags kyi rang bzhin yongs su shes pas so //
translated: This is because the nature of the mantras is fully understood.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ring por mi thogs pas ni myur du @82b zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ring por mi thogs pas ni myur du @82b zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that they are accomplished quickly, without delay.

original: dgongs pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas lkog ma la sogs pa'i gnas bzhi la me la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgoms te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas lkog ma la sogs pa'i gnas bzhi la me la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgoms te /
translated: The intention is that one who possesses the yoga of Great Vajradhara meditates on the maṇḍalas of fire and so forth in the four places of the throat and so forth.

original: de rnams re re la 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pas yi ge gsum bzla zhing de'i 'og tu g-yon ba dang g-yas pa dang gnyi ga dang dal bus dman par rgyu bas dmar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer spro zhing sna'i rtse mor thun phyed phyed kyi
analyzed: de rnams re re la 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pas yi ge gsum bzla zhing de'i 'og tu g-yon ba dang g-yas pa dang gnyi ga dang dal bus dman par rgyu bas dmar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer spro zhing sna'i rtse mor thun phyed phyed kyi
translated: After that, by the movement of the winds on the left, right, and both sides, and slowly and weakly, one should emit red and so on light rays, and hold them at the tip of the nose for half a period.

original: dus su 'dzin pas dbang po la sogs pas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus su 'dzin pas dbang po la sogs pas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, one will accomplish the faculties and so on.

original: dgongs pa las bshad pa ni 'gal ba'i sgra'i sgo nas de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pa las bshad pa ni 'gal ba'i sgra'i sgo nas de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
translated: The explanation from the intention is by teaching reality through contradictory words.

original: sngags la mchog tu gzhol ba zhes bya ba nas dben pa'i gnas dag tu zhes pa'i bar du ni las dang po pas sngar bshad pa'i khro bo'i sngags 'bum bzlas pas ri bo las sogs pa dben par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sngags la mchog tu gzhol ba zhes bya ba nas dben pa'i gnas dag tu zhes pa'i bar du ni las dang po pas sngar bshad pa'i khro bo'i sngags 'bum bzlas pas ri bo las sogs pa dben par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The passage from devoted to the mantra up to in solitary places teaches that a beginner, by previously reciting the wrathful mantra a hundred thousand times as explained, will accomplish solitary places such as mountains.

original: mngon spyod ces bya ba la sogs pas gsod pa'i las kyi yul bstan to //
analyzed: mngon spyod ces bya ba la sogs pas gsod pa'i las kyi yul bstan to //
translated: The passage from killing up to and so on teaches the object of the killing rite.

original: bla ma la smod pa zhes pa ni dbang bskur ba'i bla ma la smod pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma la smod pa zhes pa ni dbang bskur ba'i bla ma la smod pa'o //
translated: The one who reviles the guru is one who reviles the guru who confers initiation.

original: rdo rje slob dpon smod pa ni chos bstan pa smod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon smod pa ni chos bstan pa smod par byed pa'o //
translated: The one who reviles the vajra master is one who reviles the one who teaches the Dharma.

original: rdo rje theg pa spong ba ni de'i bstan bcos smad par byas pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje theg pa spong ba ni de'i bstan bcos smad par byas pa'o //
translated: The one who rejects the Vajrayana is one who reviles the treatises of that [Vajrayana].

original: de dag ni dmu rgod kyi rigs can nyan thos pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ni dmu rgod kyi rigs can nyan thos pa rnams so //
translated: These are the types of people who are wild, and who are Sravakas.

original: sdig pa byed pa gzhan dag ni ma gsod pa la sogs pa'i mtshams med pa'i las byed pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa byed pa gzhan dag ni ma gsod pa la sogs pa'i mtshams med pa'i las byed pa'o //
translated: The one who commits sins is one who commits the sins of immediate retribution, such as killing one's mother.

original: gsad par bya ba zhes pa ni nges par gzung ba dang bcas pa'i tshig ste gsad par bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gsad par bya ba zhes pa ni nges par gzung ba dang bcas pa'i tshig ste gsad par bya ba kho na'o //
translated: The one who is to be killed is a word with a definite object, meaning only one who is to be killed.

original: yang na bsgrad pa ni rang gi gnas nas dgar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na bsgrad pa ni rang gi gnas nas dgar bar bya'o //
translated: Or, to be killed means to be expelled from one's place.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas las 'di byed pas na zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub rnal 'byor pas thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas las 'di byed pas na zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub rnal 'byor pas thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, etc. shows that by performing this rite, the yogi will attain the Great Seal of the stage of union, which is the power of the Great Seal.

original: pha rol 'tshe bas ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes rtog par mi bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol 'tshe bas ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes rtog par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not think, “How can it be accomplished by harming others?”

original: gang gi phyir bsam pa'i khyad par las ldang ba'i dge ba 'am mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu'i khyad par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsam pa'i khyad par las ldang ba'i dge ba 'am mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu'i khyad par sgrub par byed do //
translated: Because the special result of virtuous or nonvirtuous karma arises from the special intention.

original: de la snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i bsam pas mtshams med par byed pa dmyal ba las gdon pa'i phyir sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas gal te 'tshe bar byed pa dang mi bskyod pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing la gzhag par byed na de'i
analyzed: de la snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i bsam pas mtshams med par byed pa dmyal ba las gdon pa'i phyir sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas gal te 'tshe bar byed pa dang mi bskyod pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing la gzhag par byed na de'i
translated: There, one who has the intention endowed with great compassion, in order to liberate from hell those who commit the heinous acts, if one harms them with the stages of mantra and mudrā, and if one causes them to be placed in the buddha-fields of Akṣobhya and so on,

original: tshe bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs 'byung bar @83a * //
analyzed: tshe bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs 'byung bar @83a * //
translated: at that time the accumulations of merit and wisdom arise.

original: 'gyur pas sdig par ji ltar 'gyur zhes shin tu phal cher thal bas chog go //
analyzed: 'gyur pas sdig par ji ltar 'gyur zhes shin tu phal cher thal bas chog go //
translated: Therefore, how could it be a sin? It is sufficient to say that it is mostly the case.

original: gsad par bya ba de rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni 'tshe bar byed pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gsad par bya ba de rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni 'tshe bar byed pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: “Those to be killed” are those who harm.

original: kha sbyar dbye ba ni snying ga'i padma dbye ba'o //
analyzed: kha sbyar dbye ba ni snying ga'i padma dbye ba'o //
translated: “Opening the embrace” is opening the heart lotus.

original: phyogs bcu zhes bya ba la sogs pas gdug pa'i bdag nyid kyi sems can gyi khams bsgom pas gsod par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: phyogs bcu zhes bya ba la sogs pas gdug pa'i bdag nyid kyi sems can gyi khams bsgom pas gsod par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: With the ten directions and so forth, it is taught that one should kill the realm of sentient beings with a malicious nature by meditation.

original: sbyor ba bstan pa zhes bya ba nas gsal bar bya zhes bya ba'i bar du ni bdud rtsi ldas dgra'i gzugs brnyan byas la de'i snying gar ming spel te mngon spyod kyi rdzas kyi bskul zhing nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i sna tshogs rdo rjes mtshan pa'i
analyzed: sbyor ba bstan pa zhes bya ba nas gsal bar bya zhes bya ba'i bar du ni bdud rtsi ldas dgra'i gzugs brnyan byas la de'i snying gar ming spel te mngon spyod kyi rdzas kyi bskul zhing nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i sna tshogs rdo rjes mtshan pa'i
translated: From the teaching of the ritual up to one should clarify is as follows: Having made an effigy of the enemy with the five nectars, one should insert the name in the heart, and with the substances of violent action, one should summon the effigy, which is marked with a crossed vajra on a sun maṇḍala.

original: rkang pa g-yas pas mnan zhing sngon gyi bsnyen pa byas pa'i gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i khro bo'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas na bsgrub bya 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkang pa g-yas pas mnan zhing sngon gyi bsnyen pa byas pa'i gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i khro bo'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas na bsgrub bya 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having stepped on it with one's right foot, if one recites the mantra of the wrathful one such as Yamāntaka, which was previously recited during familiarization, one hundred and eight times, the victim will die.

original: 'dir thugs rdo rje'i rnal 'byor ba bdud rtsi ldas byugs pa'i gos dang ldan pa las bya ba dang rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pa chu dron gyis gsher pa'i gos gon pa dang 'od dpag tu med pa'i rnal 'byor pa bshad gcis gsher ba'i gos gon
analyzed: 'dir thugs rdo rje'i rnal 'byor ba bdud rtsi ldas byugs pa'i gos dang ldan pa las bya ba dang rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pa chu dron gyis gsher pa'i gos gon pa dang 'od dpag tu med pa'i rnal 'byor pa bshad gcis gsher ba'i gos gon
translated: Here, the yoga of mind-vajra should be performed by one wearing clothes moistened with the five nectars, the yoga of Vairochana by one wearing clothes moistened with warm water, the yoga of Amitabha by one wearing clothes moistened with urine,

original: pa dang rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rnal 'byor pa thal ba'i chus gsher ba'i gos gon pa dang / don yod grub pa'i rnal 'byor pa yang bshang gcis gsher ba'i gos gon pa dang / rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnal 'byor pa yang thal ba'i chus gsher ba'i gos gon pas las bya'o //
analyzed: pa dang rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rnal 'byor pa thal ba'i chus gsher ba'i gos gon pa dang / don yod grub pa'i rnal 'byor pa yang bshang gcis gsher ba'i gos gon pa dang / rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnal 'byor pa yang thal ba'i chus gsher ba'i gos gon pas las bya'o //
translated: the yoga of Ratnasambhava by one wearing clothes moistened with ash water, the yoga of Amoghasiddhi by one wearing clothes moistened with excrement, and the yoga of Great Vajradhara by one wearing clothes moistened with ash water.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa de rnams kyis gshin rje gshed la sogs pa khro bo'i nga rgyal la dmigs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa de rnams kyis gshin rje gshed la sogs pa khro bo'i nga rgyal la dmigs te /
translated: Thus, those yogis should visualize the pride of wrathful deities such as Yamantaka,

original: snga ma bzhin du gzugs brnyan mnan zhing gdug pa rnams gsad par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du gzugs brnyan mnan zhing gdug pa rnams gsad par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: and as before, they should suppress the image and kill the evildoers.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i nam mkha' yang zhes pa ni gal te gdug pa yin na de'i tshe de yang gsod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i nam mkha' yang zhes pa ni gal te gdug pa yin na de'i tshe de yang gsod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if space is not material, if it is a poison, then it too will be killed.

original: gzugs can lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes pa ni de nyid phul du byung ba ste khyad par dang ldan pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs can lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes pa ni de nyid phul du byung ba ste khyad par dang ldan pa'i tshig go //
translated: What need is there to mention material things? This is the best, the most excellent, the most special word.

original: bsam gtan gyi che ba nyid ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu gsal bar byas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi che ba nyid ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu gsal bar byas so //
translated: The greatness of the meditative concentration is clarified by the power of meditative concentration.

original: tshangs ma mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'jig rten gyi ma mo bdun no //
analyzed: tshangs ma mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'jig rten gyi ma mo bdun no //
translated: The seven worldly mothers are called Brahma, and so on.

original: de rnams kyi khang pa ni lha khang ste ma mo ni drag po'i las la mthun pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi khang pa ni lha khang ste ma mo ni drag po'i las la mthun pas so //
translated: Their house is a temple, because the mothers are in accord with fierce actions.

original: dur khrod ni thams cad sdud @83b par byed pas na mthun pa'o //
analyzed: dur khrod ni thams cad sdud @83b par byed pas na mthun pa'o //
translated: The charnel ground is in accord with the cemetery, because it collects everything.

original: khong stong ni skye bos dben pa yin pas rigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: khong stong ni skye bos dben pa yin pas rigs pa kho na'o //
translated: The hollow is reasonable, because it is devoid of people.

original: bzhi mdo ni rab tu grags pa yin pas so //
analyzed: bzhi mdo ni rab tu grags pa yin pas so //
translated: The crossroads is well known.

original: de bzhin du mtshan ma gcig kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan ma gcig kyang de bzhin no //
translated: In the same way, one sign is also like that.

original: gnas de rnams la brten te drag po'i las bya'o //
analyzed: gnas de rnams la brten te drag po'i las bya'o //
translated: Based on those places, fierce actions are performed.

original: rje ngar gyi phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid bstan to //
analyzed: rje ngar gyi phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid bstan to //
translated: The passage beginning with “the side of the knee” teaches that.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te dur khrod kyi ras la mngon spyod kyi rdzas kyis sna tshogs rdo rje bris la de'i lte bar bsgrub bya'i ming phat gnyis kyis spel ba bris la /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te dur khrod kyi ras la mngon spyod kyi rdzas kyis sna tshogs rdo rje bris la de'i lte bar bsgrub bya'i ming phat gnyis kyis spel ba bris la /
translated: The idea is this: On a charnel ground cloth, draw a vajra cross with substances for fierce action. In its center, write the name of the victim, alternating with two phaṭs.

original: sna tshogs rdo rje phyi rol yi ge phat kyis bskor zhing 'khor lo de sor brgyad pa'i mi'i rje ngar gyi khong stong la bcug nas bsgrub bya'i rkang pa'i rdul gyi 'dam gyis bskus la gshin rje gshed la sogs pa gang yang rung pa'i khro bo'i sngags brgya
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje phyi rol yi ge phat kyis bskor zhing 'khor lo de sor brgyad pa'i mi'i rje ngar gyi khong stong la bcug nas bsgrub bya'i rkang pa'i rdul gyi 'dam gyis bskus la gshin rje gshed la sogs pa gang yang rung pa'i khro bo'i sngags brgya
translated: Surround the vajra cross with phaṭ syllables on the outside. Place that wheel in the hollow of the knee of an effigy made of the eight substances of a human being. Smear it with mud made of the victim’s foot dust.

original: rtsa brgyad bzlas pas dgra bo'i sgo ru brkos nas spas na de'i zhag bdun nam zla ba phyed kyis dgra 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rtsa brgyad bzlas pas dgra bo'i sgo ru brkos nas spas na de'i zhag bdun nam zla ba phyed kyis dgra 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Recite the mantra of any wrathful deity, such as Yamāntaka, 108 times. If you dig it into the threshold of the enemy’s door and bury it, the enemy will die within seven days or a half month.

original: sems can shes rab ldan pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems can thams cad la bsam pa thams cad rdzogs par byed pa chags pa dang sngags pa med pa /
analyzed: sems can shes rab ldan pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems can thams cad la bsam pa thams cad rdzogs par byed pa chags pa dang sngags pa med pa /
translated: By endowed with wisdom and so forth, it is taught that all sentient beings will have all their wishes fulfilled, without attachment or mantra.

original: sangs rgyas gal te slob dpon la smod par byed pa yin na de yang 'jig par 'gyur ba'am gnas las spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gal te slob dpon la smod par byed pa yin na de yang 'jig par 'gyur ba'am gnas las spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: If the Buddha were to criticize the master, he would also be destroyed or expelled from his place.

original: thod pa zhes bya ba nas sdud par byed pa'i tshig gi bar du ni ma nyams pa'i thod pa 'am grog la sogs pa la mngon spyod kyi rdzas kyis khro bo'i sngags ming dang bcas par bsgrub bya'i ming bris te /
analyzed: thod pa zhes bya ba nas sdud par byed pa'i tshig gi bar du ni ma nyams pa'i thod pa 'am grog la sogs pa la mngon spyod kyi rdzas kyis khro bo'i sngags ming dang bcas par bsgrub bya'i ming bris te /
translated: From skull up to compiling words, it is taught that if one writes the name of the target with wrathful substances in an undamaged skull or on birch bark, and writes the wrathful mantra with the name,

original: khro bo'i tshig gis gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i sngags bzla zhing dgra bo'i sgo ru brkos nas sbas na de'i tshe gnas las spo ba 'am 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: khro bo'i tshig gis gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i sngags bzla zhing dgra bo'i sgo ru brkos nas sbas na de'i tshe gnas las spo ba 'am 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: and recites the mantra of Yamântaka and so forth with wrathful words, and buries it at the door of the enemy, then at that time they will be expelled from their place or will die.

original: de nas zhes bya ba nas rnam par 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas rnam par 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni /
translated: Then, from “Then, having meditated on the king of Uṣṇīṣa” up to “he will be destroyed,”

original: gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po bsgoms pas phur bus gdab pa'i sgo nas mngon spyod bstan to //
analyzed: gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po bsgoms pas phur bus gdab pa'i sgo nas mngon spyod bstan to //
translated: the rite of violence is taught by means of the rite of stabbing with a kīla.

original: ji lta ba ji ltar zhes pa ni drag shul la sogs pas so //
analyzed: ji lta ba ji ltar zhes pa ni drag shul la sogs pas so //
translated: “ As it is” and “as it is” refer to violence and so forth.

original: gdug pa'i dngos por gyur cing bdag nyid ngan par son pa'o //
analyzed: gdug pa'i dngos por gyur cing bdag nyid ngan par son pa'o //
translated: “ Wicked things” means having become evil.

original: de lta de ltar zhes pa ni rnam pa de dang des so //
analyzed: de lta de ltar zhes pa ni rnam pa de dang des so //
translated: “ As it is” means in that way.

original: dgag par bya ba zhes pa ni gsod par bya ba nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: dgag par bya ba zhes pa ni gsod par bya ba nyid thob pa'o //
translated: “ To be stopped” means having attained the state of being killed.

original: bsgrub par @84a * //
analyzed: bsgrub par @84a * //
translated: “ To be accomplished”

original: bya ba zhes pa ni dkon mchog gsum la gnod par byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba zhes pa ni dkon mchog gsum la gnod par byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: means the one who harms the Three Jewels and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi ni bsgrub bya rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ni bsgrub bya rnams kyi'o //
translated: “ Their” refers to the ones to be accomplished.

original: lus la sogs pa mi g-yo bar byas pa zhes pa ni lus dang ngag dang sems phur bus 'debs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa mi g-yo bar byas pa zhes pa ni lus dang ngag dang sems phur bus 'debs par byed pa'o //
translated: “ Having made the body and so forth unmoving” means the body, speech, and mind are stabbed with a kīla.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi phyed pa'i ngo bor gyur pa zhes pa ni pha rol gyi 'khrul 'khor dang sngags la sogs pas grol bar ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi phyed pa'i ngo bor gyur pa zhes pa ni pha rol gyi 'khrul 'khor dang sngags la sogs pas grol bar ma gyur pa'o //
translated: Therefore, having become of indivisible nature means that one does not become liberated by the opponent's machine, mantra, etc.

original: de skad ces bya ba la sogs pas mchog dang 'bring dang tha ma'i bsgrub bya'i lus la sogs pa phur bus gdab par byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
analyzed: de skad ces bya ba la sogs pas mchog dang 'bring dang tha ma'i bsgrub bya'i lus la sogs pa phur bus gdab par byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
translated: Thus, etc. shows the samadhi of nailing down the body, etc. of the supreme, middling, and lowest siddhas.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngags kyi don bshad pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngags kyi don bshad pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the mantra Om, etc. is easy to understand.

original: phur bu'i sngags 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: phur bu'i sngags 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: By this mantra of the kīla, etc.,

original: sngags thos pas mthu che ba'i brgya byin la sogs pa 'jigs pa dang brgyal ba dang rdo rje 'chang la skyabs su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sngags thos pas mthu che ba'i brgya byin la sogs pa 'jigs pa dang brgyal ba dang rdo rje 'chang la skyabs su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: it is taught that by hearing the mantra, Indra, etc. of great power will be frightened, faint, and go for refuge to Vajradhara.

original: 'dir cho ga zhes bya ba la sogs pas phur bus gdab pa'i sbyor ba ni don gsal pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir cho ga zhes bya ba la sogs pas phur bus gdab pa'i sbyor ba ni don gsal pa'o //
translated: Here, by rite, etc., the application of nailing down is clear.

original: seng ldeng gi snying po la sogs pa gang rung ba zhes pa ni seng ldeng dang shing sha pa dang aa ga ru dang sha mi dang lcang ma ste 'bras bu med pa'i shing lnga drag shul can gyi las dang mthun pa gzung bar bya'o //🔽bsam gtan zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsgom pa'i dus su rnal 'byor gyi phyogs gcig tu gyur pa bgegs bskrad pa'i cho ga bstan to //
analyzed: seng ldeng gi snying po la sogs pa gang rung ba zhes pa ni seng ldeng dang shing sha pa dang aa ga ru dang sha mi dang lcang ma ste 'bras bu med pa'i shing lnga drag shul can gyi las dang mthun pa gzung bar bya'o // bsam gtan zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsgom pa'i dus su rnal 'byor gyi phyogs gcig tu gyur pa bgegs bskrad pa'i cho ga bstan to //
translated: The phrase and so forth indicates that one should take any of the five trees that are suitable for wrathful rites: khadira, śirīṣa, agaru, śamī, and cane.

original: 'od 'phro ba zhes bya ba nas 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni re zhig dang rnal 'byor pas zhe sdang rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du byas la reg bya rdo rje ma'i chos 'byung gi nang du sna tshogs rdo rje dang padma dang nyi
analyzed: 'od 'phro ba zhes bya ba nas 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni re zhig dang rnal 'byor pas zhe sdang rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du byas la reg bya rdo rje ma'i chos 'byung gi nang du sna tshogs rdo rje dang padma dang nyi
translated: The

original: ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du khro bo thams cad 'jug pa sngon du 'gro bas rdo rje'i lam nas yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa las drag po'i rdo rje las skyes pa zhal gsum phyag drug pa spyan gsum pa rigs kyi klu brgyad kyis rgyan byas la
analyzed: ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du khro bo thams cad 'jug pa sngon du 'gro bas rdo rje'i lam nas yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa las drag po'i rdo rje las skyes pa zhal gsum phyag drug pa spyan gsum pa rigs kyi klu brgyad kyis rgyan byas la
translated: Having previously caused all the wrathful ones to enter into the mandala of the mother, from the path of the vajra, the syllable hūṃ completely transforms into Rudra Vajra born from the vajra, with three faces, six arms, and three eyes, adorned by the eight nāga clans.

original: kha dog sngon po dang / dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal mnga' ba /
analyzed: kha dog sngon po dang / dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal mnga' ba /
translated: He has a blue, white, and red face.

original: mig yo ba g-yas brkyang ba la gnas pa rdo rje dang dril bu rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis bsnams pa /
analyzed: mig yo ba g-yas brkyang ba la gnas pa rdo rje dang dril bu rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis bsnams pa /
translated: He has squinting eyes, stands with his right leg straight, and holds a vajra and a bell in his two principal hands.

original: zhags pa dang lcags kyu dang ral gri dang tho ba bsnams pa zhe sdang rdo rje'i cod pa na can smin ma kham pa ha ha hi hi'i sgra sgrogs pa gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po bsgoms la /
analyzed: zhags pa dang lcags kyu dang ral gri dang tho ba bsnams pa zhe sdang rdo rje'i cod pa na can smin ma kham pa ha ha hi hi'i sgra sgrogs pa gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po bsgoms la /
translated: He holds a noose, a goad, a sword, and a hammer. He has the crown of Hatred Vajra, his eyebrows are knit, and he utters the sound of ha ha hi hi.

original: @84b rdo rje dang padma'i nang nas phyi rol du byung ba'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas nas bka' nyan par bsams te /
analyzed: @84b rdo rje dang padma'i nang nas phyi rol du byung ba'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas nas bka' nyan par bsams te /
translated: Having meditated on Sumbharāja, he emerges from the vajra and lotus, and stands on a sun maṇḍala, thinking, “I will obey the command.”

original: snga ma bzhin du reg bya rdo rje ma'i chos 'byung gi nang na /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du reg bya rdo rje ma'i chos 'byung gi nang na /
translated: As before, in the center of the source of phenomena of Sparshavajrā,

original: gshin rje gshed po la sogs pa khro bo bcu sngar bshad pa'i dbyibs dang kha dog dang phyag mtshan 'dzin pa bsams la rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du phyogs dang mtshams rnams su dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed po la sogs pa khro bo bcu sngar bshad pa'i dbyibs dang kha dog dang phyag mtshan 'dzin pa bsams la rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du phyogs dang mtshams rnams su dgod par bya'o //
translated: one should imagine the ten wrathful ones such as Yamantaka, with the shape, color, and hand implements as previously explained, and one should arrange them in the directions and subdirections in the proper sequence.

original: khro bo de rnams kyang steng zhal gsum pa smad phur bu rtse gcig pa bdud rtsi 'khyil ba dang 'dra bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: khro bo de rnams kyang steng zhal gsum pa smad phur bu rtse gcig pa bdud rtsi 'khyil ba dang 'dra bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that those wrathful ones have three faces above and one single-pointed dagger below, like Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: de'i 'og tu dbus kyi gtso bo'i ngo bo'i bdag nyid kyis gnod mdzes la sngags 'dis bka' sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dbus kyi gtso bo'i ngo bo'i bdag nyid kyis gnod mdzes la sngags 'dis bka' sbyin par bya ste /
translated: After that, one should give the command to Sumbha, who is the nature of the central principal, with this mantra:

original: aom sumbha ni sumbha h'um h'um phat /🔽aom gri hna gri hna h'um h'um phat /🔽aom gri hn'a pa ya gri hn'a pa ya h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: aom sumbha ni sumbha h'um h'um phat / aom gri hna gri hna h'um h'um phat / aom gri hn'a pa ya gri hn'a pa ya h'um h'um phat /
translated: oṃ sumbha niḥ sumbha hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ🔽oṃ gṛhṇa gṛhṇa hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ🔽oṃ gṛhṇāpaya gṛhṇāpaya hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ

original: aom a'a na ya ho bha ga b'an badzra h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: aom a'a na ya ho bha ga b'an badzra h'um h'um phat /
translated: oṃ ānayaho bhagavān vajra hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ

original: ces bya ba 'dis phyogs bcu la gnas pa'i brgya byin la sogs pa dgug par bya ba'i phyir bka' sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis phyogs bcu la gnas pa'i brgya byin la sogs pa dgug par bya ba'i phyir bka' sbyin par bya'o //
translated: With this, one should give the order to summon Indra and the others who dwell in the ten directions.

original: de thos ma thag tu gnod mdzes kyi rgyal pos zhags pa dang lcags kyus phyogs bcur spros te /
analyzed: de thos ma thag tu gnod mdzes kyi rgyal pos zhags pa dang lcags kyus phyogs bcur spros te /
translated: As soon as they hear it, one should imagine that the king of the Acalas emanates lassos and hooks in the ten directions,

original: lha'i dbang po la sogs pa 'jig rten skyong ba rnams mgul nas bcings la spyi bor brdegs la /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po la sogs pa 'jig rten skyong ba rnams mgul nas bcings la spyi bor brdegs la /
translated: and that he binds the necks of the Lokapalas, such as the lord of the gods, and strikes them on the head,

original: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs su 'god par byed par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs su 'god par byed par bsam par bya'o //
translated: and that he places them in the east and the other directions.

original: de nas gnod mdzes kyi rgyal pos rdo rje phur bu de rnams mgo bo nas brtsams te rkang pa'i dkyil gyi bar du gdab par byed par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gnod mdzes kyi rgyal pos rdo rje phur bu de rnams mgo bo nas brtsams te rkang pa'i dkyil gyi bar du gdab par byed par bsam par bya'o //
translated: Then one should imagine that the king of the Acalas plants those vajra stakes, beginning from the head and ending at the soles of the feet.

original: aom gha gha zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyis phur bus gdab pa dang brdung ba byas te /
analyzed: aom gha gha zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyis phur bus gdab pa dang brdung ba byas te /
translated: With the mantra Om ghaha and so forth, one should imagine that the stakes are driven in and pounded,

original: sa 'og bdun gyi bar du son par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: sa 'og bdun gyi bar du son par bsam par bya'o //
translated: and that they reach down to the seventh underworld.

original: khro bo'i rgyal po'i lus las byung ba'i 'bar ba'i tshogs kyis kyang de'i 'khor mtha' yas pa bsregs shing thal bar gyur par bsam par bya'o zhes bstan par bya'o //🔽rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas ldad bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni zhes sdang rdo rje'i rnal 'byor pas m'a ma k'i'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes kyi phyag rgya mdun du bsgoms la rjes su chags pa la
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po'i lus las byung ba'i 'bar ba'i tshogs kyis kyang de'i 'khor mtha' yas pa bsregs shing thal bar gyur par bsam par bya'o zhes bstan par bya'o // rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas ldad bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni zhes sdang rdo rje'i rnal 'byor pas m'a ma k'i'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes kyi phyag rgya mdun du bsgoms la rjes su chags pa la
translated: And the mass of blazing fire that emerges from the body of the King of Wrath burns his retinue to ashes.

original: sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas 'khyud par byas te /
analyzed: sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas 'khyud par byas te /
translated: Beginning from “the union of the vajra and lotus” up to “will be split” explains that the practitioner of Hatred Vajra, having visualized a wisdom-consort who is by nature Māmakī in front, should embrace her with prior passion and so forth.

original: phyag rgya'i chos 'byung gi nang na nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dang me'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du rang gi snying gnas byung ba'i 'od zer gyi lcags kyus @85a * //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i chos 'byung gi nang na nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dang me'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du rang gi snying gnas byung ba'i 'od zer gyi lcags kyus @85a * //
translated: Having entered the dharma-cakra of the consort, on top of the sun maṇḍala and fire maṇḍala in the dharma-cakra of the consort, the hook of light rays that emerges from one’s heart

original: bsgrub bya ba kug la 'jug ste /
analyzed: bsgrub bya ba kug la 'jug ste /
translated: summons the victim and causes him to enter.

original: rdo rje dang padma snyoms par zhugs par bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma snyoms par zhugs par bya ste /
translated: One should enter into union with the vajra and lotus.

original: rtse lnga pa'i rdo rje'i rnam pa'i gsang ba'i rdo rjes mgo bo nas rkang pa'i mtha'i bar du phur bus gdab par bsgoms nas de'i tshe lus phur bus gdab bar gnas nas spo ba'am 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtse lnga pa'i rdo rje'i rnam pa'i gsang ba'i rdo rjes mgo bo nas rkang pa'i mtha'i bar du phur bus gdab par bsgoms nas de'i tshe lus phur bus gdab bar gnas nas spo ba'am 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Imagining the secret vajra in the form of a five-pronged vajra, he should drive it in from the head to the soles of the feet. At that time, the body will be driven in by the vajra, or he will be transferred or die.

original: de bzhin du thams cad byas la 'on kyang lce la gsang ba'i rdo rje de la brdegs na ngag rengs pa 'am lkugs par 'gyur pa'am 'chi bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad byas la 'on kyang lce la gsang ba'i rdo rje de la brdegs na ngag rengs pa 'am lkugs par 'gyur pa'am 'chi bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Similarly, he should do everything, but if he strikes the tongue with that secret vajra, the speech will be paralyzed or he will die.

original: de bzhin du thams cad byas pa las bsgrub bya'i snying ga'i padma 'bar ba'i gsang ba'i rdo rjes brdegs la de'i tshe smyo pa 'am 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad byas pa las bsgrub bya'i snying ga'i padma 'bar ba'i gsang ba'i rdo rjes brdegs la de'i tshe smyo pa 'am 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, he should do everything, but if he strikes the blazing lotus of the heart of the victim with the secret vajra, at that time he will become insane or die.

original: 'dir rdo rje dang padma snyoms par zhugs pa'i dus su rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du aom tshindha tshindha zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngags gsum brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir rdo rje dang padma snyoms par zhugs pa'i dus su rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du aom tshindha tshindha zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngags gsum brjod par bya'o //
translated: Here, at the time of the union of the vajra and lotus, he should recite the three mantras, Oṃ cinte cinte, etc., in the proper order.

original: 'dir ye shes gsum ni snang ba la sogs pa skyed par byed pa ni 'byung bar byed pa'i padma zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: 'dir ye shes gsum ni snang ba la sogs pa skyed par byed pa ni 'byung bar byed pa'i padma zhes bya ste ;
translated: Here, the three intuitions are the lotus of the creative cause, which generates the appearances, etc.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: sgyu ma dag ni thams cad las //
analyzed: sgyu ma dag ni thams cad las //
translated: Among all the illusions,

original: bud med sgyu ma khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: bud med sgyu ma khyad par 'phags //
translated: the illusion of a woman is the most exalted.

original: ye shes gsum gyi dbye ba ni //
analyzed: ye shes gsum gyi dbye ba ni //
translated: The division of the three intuitions

original: gsal bar 'di las mtshon par 'gyur //🔽zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: gsal bar 'di las mtshon par 'gyur // zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: is clearly indicated in this [tantra].

original: bsgrub bya'i dag gi spros pa'o zhes pa ni bsgrub bya'i dag mkhas pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i dag gi spros pa'o zhes pa ni bsgrub bya'i dag mkhas pa nyid do //
translated: The purity of the object of purification is the purity of the object of purification.

original: nam mkha' las byung ba zhes pa ni lte ba'i nam mkha' las sgra 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' las byung ba zhes pa ni lte ba'i nam mkha' las sgra 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Arisen from space means that the sound arises from the space of the navel.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ni sems so zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin sems te de'i ngo bo yin pa dang dri ma rnams glo bur ba yin pas so //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ni sems so zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin sems te de'i ngo bo yin pa dang dri ma rnams glo bur ba yin pas so //
translated: The nature of that is mind means that the mind, which is the nature of clearlight transparency, is its nature, and that the stains are adventitious.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i de ma thag tu bshad pa'i sngags rnams dang de'i sgo nas byas pa'i las kyi tshogs thob pas byang chub sems dpa' rmad du gyur pas ji ltar ched du brjod pa de skad bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i de ma thag tu bshad pa'i sngags rnams dang de'i sgo nas byas pa'i las kyi tshogs thob pas byang chub sems dpa' rmad du gyur pas ji ltar ched du brjod pa de skad bstan to //
translated: Then, the Bodhisattvas, having attained the mantras and the collection of rites performed by means of them, which were just explained with the words “then” and so forth, were amazed, and so it was taught that they uttered this exclamation.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa //
translated: Abiding in the stage of completion,

original: zhes pa ni sngags kyi theg pa chen po'i snying por gyur pa de kho na nyid sgom par byed pa byams pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngags kyi theg pa chen po'i snying por gyur pa de kho na nyid sgom par byed pa byams pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: means that Maitreya and so forth meditate on reality, which is the essence of the Mantra Great Vehicle.

original: theg pa gsar la gnas pa zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams so //
analyzed: theg pa gsar la gnas pa zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams so //
translated: Abiding in the new vehicle means the yogis of the stage of generation.

original: de rnams kyi mchog go zhes pa ni rdzogs pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mchog go zhes pa ni rdzogs pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: Among them, he is the best means that he meditates on the stage of completion.

original: de bas na de kho na nyid thob pa'i phyir sems can gyi don byed par nus pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de kho na nyid thob pa'i phyir sems can gyi don byed par nus pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because he has attained reality, he is able to perform the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de dag thos pa dang rtogs pas dga' ba @85b dang mgu bar ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag thos pa dang rtogs pas dga' ba @85b dang mgu bar ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: They, having heard and understood, will be endowed with joy and delight.

original: rang gi rjes su myong ba'i gsung //
analyzed: rang gi rjes su myong ba'i gsung //
translated: His speech is experienced by oneself.

original: zhes pa ni chos thos pas so so rang rig pa'i mngon gsum gyis myong ba'i dga' ba'i khyad par gang yin pa de nyid rdo rje 'chang gis legs bar smra bas /
analyzed: zhes pa ni chos thos pas so so rang rig pa'i mngon gsum gyis myong ba'i dga' ba'i khyad par gang yin pa de nyid rdo rje 'chang gis legs bar smra bas /
translated: This is the special joy experienced by the individual intuition of the reality of the Vajradhara who has heard the Dharma.

original: phyi rol du byung ba'i bstod pa'i tshig gi tshogs ni gsung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du byung ba'i bstod pa'i tshig gi tshogs ni gsung zhes bya'o //
translated: The collection of words of praise that have come forth externally is called the Speech.

original: sngags kyi gnas te zhes pa ni spyan ma la sogs pa'i phreng ba'i sngags rnams so //
analyzed: sngags kyi gnas te zhes pa ni spyan ma la sogs pa'i phreng ba'i sngags rnams so //
translated: The abode of the mantras is the mantra strings of Locana and so forth.

original: sngags rnams kyi rab tu sbyor ba'i bye brag ces pa ni srung ba'i 'khor lo dang 'khrul 'khor la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sngags rnams kyi rab tu sbyor ba'i bye brag ces pa ni srung ba'i 'khor lo dang 'khrul 'khor la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The varieties of application of the mantras are the characteristics of the protection wheel, the magic wheel, and so forth.

original: sbyor ba de nyid bsam gtan gyis rdzogs par byas pa'o zhes pa ni rdo rje lcags kyus mtshan pa'i rkang pa g-yon pas mnan zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sbyor ba de nyid bsam gtan gyis rdzogs par byas pa'o zhes pa ni rdo rje lcags kyus mtshan pa'i rkang pa g-yon pas mnan zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: That application is perfected by meditation is the characteristic of standing on the left foot marked with the vajra hook, and so forth.

original: gdug pa rnams tshar gcod pa'o zhes pa ni phreng pa'i sngags rnams so //
analyzed: gdug pa rnams tshar gcod pa'o zhes pa ni phreng pa'i sngags rnams so //
translated: The subduing of the wicked is the mantra strings.

original: mngon spyod kyi sgo nas bla ma smod par byed pa la sogs pa gsod pa'o //
analyzed: mngon spyod kyi sgo nas bla ma smod par byed pa la sogs pa gsod pa'o //
translated: The killing is the reviling of the guru by means of the rite of assault, and so on.

original: de bzhin du las kyi tshogs la nus pa dang ldan pa'i zhes pa ni mu stegs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la phur bus gdab pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du las kyi tshogs la nus pa dang ldan pa'i zhes pa ni mu stegs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la phur bus gdab pa'o //
translated: Similarly, those who are capable of the aggregate of rites are the tirthika yogins, who are to be struck down by the kīla.

original: skye bo tha mal pa zhes pa ni rgyal po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo tha mal pa zhes pa ni rgyal po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ordinary people are kings and so on.

original: phyogs skyong ba rnams ni brgya byin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs skyong ba rnams ni brgya byin la sogs pa'o //
translated: The guardians of the directions are Indra and so on.

original: bsam gtan gyis so sor gsungs pa zhes pa ni rdo rje dang padma yang dag par sbyor bas bsgrub bya'i lus dang dag dang sems phur bus gdab pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis so sor gsungs pa zhes pa ni rdo rje dang padma yang dag par sbyor bas bsgrub bya'i lus dang dag dang sems phur bus gdab pa'o //
translated: The individual statements of the contemplatives are the body, speech, and mind of the victim to be struck down by the kīla, accomplished by the union of the vajra and the lotus.

original: de ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes pa ni ston pa po la bstod pa dang / nye bar bsdu ba yang rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: de ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes pa ni ston pa po la bstod pa dang / nye bar bsdu ba yang rab tu bstan to //
translated: This is the wonder, the praise of the teacher and the teaching of the summary.

original: sgrub pa po rnam pa gnyis dang zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis bsgom par byed pa dang nye bar mtshon pa'o zhes bya ba ste rdzogs pa'i rim pas kyang gsod pa'i las sngar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa po rnam pa gnyis dang zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis bsgom par byed pa dang nye bar mtshon pa'o zhes bya ba ste rdzogs pa'i rim pas kyang gsod pa'i las sngar bshad pa'o //
translated: The two kinds of adepts indicates the two stages, and are taught indicates the meditation on the two stages. The rite of killing by the perfection stage has been explained above.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen pos rab tu bstan pa'o zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i phyir yid ces pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen pos rab tu bstan pa'o zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i phyir yid ces pa nyid bstan to //
translated: The mind is taught because it is taught by the Bhagavat, the Great Vajradhara.

original: de bzhin du sgrub pa po ni rnal 'byor ba rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgrub pa po ni rnal 'byor ba rnams so //
translated: Similarly, the adepts are the yogis.

original: de rnams kyi 'dod pa'i don ster ba'o zhes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'dod pa'i don ster ba'o zhes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The granting of the desired aim is the accomplishment of pacification, etc.

original: sbrul la sogs pa ni sngar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sbrul la sogs pa ni sngar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The snakes, etc. have the characteristics explained above.

original: de rnams kyi don la sogs pa yongs su shes pa ni sogs pa'i sgras btu ba dang de kho na nyid yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi don la sogs pa yongs su shes pa ni sogs pa'i sgras btu ba dang de kho na nyid yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the aim, etc. is the knowledge of the reality of the collection of the snakes, etc.

original: btus nas bstan pa'o zhes pa ni dpal rdo rje phreng ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i rgyud las bsdus @86a * //
analyzed: btus nas bstan pa'o zhes pa ni dpal rdo rje phreng ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i rgyud las bsdus @86a * //
translated: The teaching of the collection is the collection of the glorious Vajra-garland, etc., explanatory tantras.

original: te bstan pa'o //🔽de yan chad kyis sdud pa pos bdag nyid kyi che ba dang le'u'i brjod par bya ba'i don man ngag dang bcas par bstan to //🔽sku gsung thugs gcig tu gyur pas kyang zhes pa ni don dam par dngos po thams cad rnam par dpyad na tha dad par mi dmigs te ;🔽gang zhig rang gi rgyud la gnas pa de nyid gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa yin no //🔽'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i bye brag la dmigs te glo bur gyi dri ma ldog pa'i don du tshar gcod pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa pos bsgrub bya la tshar gcod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: te bstan pa'o // de yan chad kyis sdud pa pos bdag nyid kyi che ba dang le'u'i brjod par bya ba'i don man ngag dang bcas par bstan to // sku gsung thugs gcig tu gyur pas kyang zhes pa ni don dam par dngos po thams cad rnam par dpyad na tha dad par mi dmigs te ; gang zhig rang gi rgyud la gnas pa de nyid gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa yin no // 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i bye brag la dmigs te glo bur gyi dri ma ldog pa'i don du tshar gcod pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa pos bsgrub bya la tshar gcod par byed pa'o //
translated: 1.1🔽Up to this point, the compiler has taught his own greatness and the meaning of the topics of the chapter along with the intimate instructions.🔽🔽Since the body, voice, and mind become one, in the ultimate sense, all things are not observed to be different when analyzed.🔽🔽That which exists in one’s continuum exists in the continuum of others.🔽🔽However, observing the difference between the object of attainment and the means of attainment, in order to reverse the temporary taints, “the one to be slain” is the object of attainment of the practitioner.🔽

original: de yang nye bar mtshon pa'i tshig yin te zhi ba la sogs pas kyang rjes su gzung bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de yang nye bar mtshon pa'i tshig yin te zhi ba la sogs pas kyang rjes su gzung bar mdzad pa'o //

original: a'a li k'a li zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ltar gyur pa sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sngags thams cad bsdus bar byed pa'i yi ge gsum gyis spel pa'i sngags kyis zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs grub pa rdzogs pas mdzes pa ting nge🔽'dzin gang yin pa de bstan to //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ltar gyur pa sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sngags thams cad bsdus bar byed pa'i yi ge gsum gyis spel pa'i sngags kyis zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs grub pa rdzogs pas mdzes pa ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de bstan to //
translated: The three syllables that include all the mantras of the nature of the body, etc., which are thus transformed, are ā li kā li, etc. The samadhi that is beautified by the perfection of the collection of pacifying, etc., activities by the mantra that is augmented by the three syllables is taught.

original: de ston par byed pa'i zhes pa ni de ltar gyur pa'i gsal bar byed pa'i sgra'i tshogs gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i zhes pa ni de ltar gyur pa'i gsal bar byed pa'i sgra'i tshogs gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The collection of words that teach that is so called because it is the collection of words that illuminate that which is thus transformed.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i sgra'i sgo nas de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i sgra'i sgo nas de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
translated: The intentional explanation is because reality is taught by means of contradictory words.

original: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa'i 'grel pa'i t'i k'a las le'u bcu bzhi pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
analyzed: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa'i 'grel pa'i t'i k'a las le'u bcu bzhi pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
translated: This completes the extensive explanation of chapter fourteen of the commentary that elucidates the lamp.

original: // / bshad pa dang ma bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u bco lnga pa'i bshad pa brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: // / bshad pa dang ma bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u bco lnga pa'i bshad pa brtsam par bya ste /
translated: The explanation of the fifteenth chapter will now be begun with the words the explained and the unexplained, etc.

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te bshad pa ni le'u bcu gsum pa dang bcu bzhi pa las bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te bshad pa ni le'u bcu gsum pa dang bcu bzhi pa las bshad pa'o //
translated: The intention is as follows: The explanation is in the thirteenth and fourteenth chapters.

original: ma bshad pa ni le'u bco lnga pa dang bcu drug pa dang bcu bdun pa las 'chad par 'gyur pa'i las kyi tshogs de rnams sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin med pas 'grub par mi 'gyur pas na le'u bco lnga pa bstan to //
analyzed: ma bshad pa ni le'u bco lnga pa dang bcu drug pa dang bcu bdun pa las 'chad par 'gyur pa'i las kyi tshogs de rnams sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin med pas 'grub par mi 'gyur pas na le'u bco lnga pa bstan to //
translated: The unexplained is the collection of karma that will be explained in the fifteenth, sixteenth, and seventeenth chapters. Since those are not accomplished without the illusion-like meditative stabilization, the fifteenth chapter is explained.

original: stong pa bzhi'i bdag nyed can no zhes pa ni stong pa dang / shin tu stong pa dang / stong pa chen po dang / thams cad stong pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa bzhi'i bdag nyed can no zhes pa ni stong pa dang / shin tu stong pa dang / stong pa chen po dang / thams cad stong pa'o //
translated: The nature of the four empty states is the empty state, the very empty state, the great empty state, and the all-empty state.

original: yang na snang ba dang / snang ba mched pa dang / snang ba nye bar thob pa dang / 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: yang na snang ba dang / snang ba mched pa dang / snang ba nye bar thob pa dang / 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, [the four empty states are] appearance, increase of appearance, near attainment of appearance, and clear light.

original: yang na padma'i nang na rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: yang na padma'i nang na rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: Alternatively, [the four empty states are] the four nāḍīs in the lotus.

original: bdag nyid ni dbus kyi rtsa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid ni dbus kyi rtsa ste /
translated: The self is the central nāḍī.

original: 'dod pa'i gdugs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i gdugs so //
translated: The parasol of desire.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: @86b bha ga'i dbus na nam mkha' gang //
analyzed: @86b bha ga'i dbus na nam mkha' gang //
translated: Space in the middle of the bhaga

original: nam mkha' lnga yis brgyan pa ste //
analyzed: nam mkha' lnga yis brgyan pa ste //
translated: is adorned by fivefold space.

original: lte ba ge sar dang ldan pa'i //
analyzed: lte ba ge sar dang ldan pa'i //
translated: With a stamen and a pistil,

original: 'dab ma brgyad kyis rnam par mdzes //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dab ma brgyad kyis rnam par mdzes // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: it is beautiful with eight petals.

original: rnam par mi 'jig pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku'i ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: rnam par mi 'jig pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku'i ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: It is indestructible, because it is the essence of the Dharma Body.

original: dbang bskur ba thams cad cas ba ni slob dpon dang gsang ba dang shes rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba thams cad cas ba ni slob dpon dang gsang ba dang shes rab ces bya'o //
translated: All consecrations are the master consecration, the secret consecration, and the wisdom consecration.

original: de rnams kyi yang dbang bskur ba zhes pa ni shes rab ye shes te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi yang dbang bskur ba zhes pa ni shes rab ye shes te /
translated: The consecration of those is the wisdom-knowledge consecration.

original: bzhi pa yang ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa yang ni de bzhin no //
translated: The fourth is also like that.

original: zhes bya ba mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the definition.

original: de'i ngo bo yin pas rdo rje 'chang ni thams cad dbang bskur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo yin pas rdo rje 'chang ni thams cad dbang bskur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is the essence of that, Vajradhara is called the consecration of all.

original: sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbye bas rigs thams cad ni rigs pa rgya'am lnga 'am gsum mo //
analyzed: sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbye bas rigs thams cad ni rigs pa rgya'am lnga 'am gsum mo //
translated: All lineages are the five lineages or three lineages, because of the divisions of the inclinations of sentient beings.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rigs ni rnam pa brgyar bshad pa //
analyzed: rigs ni rnam pa brgyar bshad pa //
translated: The lineages are explained as one hundred kinds,

original: mdor bsdus pas na rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pas na rnam pa lnga //
translated: but in brief, they are five kinds.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
translated: By the divisions of body, speech, and mind,

original: phyi nas rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phyi nas rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: they are later divided into three kinds.

original: de'i bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das ni de rnams sprul par mdzad pas so ;
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das ni de rnams sprul par mdzad pas so ;
translated: The Lord, whose nature is that, creates those emanations.

original: / de bas na mkhyen pa'i sgra sprul lo pa'i don to //
analyzed: / de bas na mkhyen pa'i sgra sprul lo pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the word “knowledge” means “emanation.”

original: mi phyed pa'i gsung ngo zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i gsung ngo zhes pa ni /
translated: “Unbroken speech” means

original: phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsung ngo //
analyzed: phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsung ngo //
translated: speech characterized by union with the consort.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa zhes pa ni shin tu gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa zhes pa ni shin tu gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
translated: “Non-intentional explanation” means teaching the reality that is very clear.

original: spros pa med pa'i spyod pa ni ji snyed pa'i spyod pa'i sgo nas phyag rgya dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i spyod pa ni ji snyed pa'i spyod pa'i sgo nas phyag rgya dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: “Practice without conceptual elaboration” is characterized by union with the consort through the door of practice of all things.

original: sme sha can zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sme sha can zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “The outcaste woman” and so on.

original: rtog pa'i rnal 'byor yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i bar du ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi bskyod pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad dang 'od dpag tu med pa'i rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis skye bos dben pa'i sa phyogs su ba'i lci ba la sogs pas byugs pa la //
analyzed: rtog pa'i rnal 'byor yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i bar du ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi bskyod pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad dang 'od dpag tu med pa'i rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis skye bos dben pa'i sa phyogs su ba'i lci ba la sogs pas byugs pa la //
translated: Up to this point, yogins of Akṣobhya, Vairocana, and Amitābha, respectively, should anoint the ground in a place free of people with cow dung and so on.🔽They should draw a wheel with the nature of the support and the supported or meditate on it mentally.

original: rten dang brten pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'khor lo bris pa'am yid kyis bsgoms la de'i dbus su rang gi rigs dang mthun pa'i legs par bslabs pa gzugs bzang ba legs par brgyan pa sme sha can dang brus mkhan dang gar mkhan gyi bu mo lo bcu gnyis pa
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'khor lo bris pa'am yid kyis bsgoms la de'i dbus su rang gi rigs dang mthun pa'i legs par bslabs pa gzugs bzang ba legs par brgyan pa sme sha can dang brus mkhan dang gar mkhan gyi bu mo lo bcu gnyis pa
translated: In the center of that, one should invite a girl of one’s own caste, well trained, beautiful, well adorned, not a caṇḍāla, not a dancer, not a prostitute, twelve years old,

original: dang nyi shu pa dang bcu drug lon pa /
analyzed: dang nyi shu pa dang bcu drug lon pa /
translated: twenty years old, or sixteen years old.

original: autpala sngon po dang dmar po dang kha dog dkar ba /
analyzed: autpala sngon po dang dmar po dang kha dog dkar ba /
translated: She should be blue, red, or white in color.

original: rigs lngas khyab pa slar bzhag cing rjes su chags pa dang mchod pa sngon du 'gro bas so sor sdud pa'i rim pas nye bar spyod pa byas @87a * //
analyzed: rigs lngas khyab pa slar bzhag cing rjes su chags pa dang mchod pa sngon du 'gro bas so sor sdud pa'i rim pas nye bar spyod pa byas @87a * //
translated: Having again established pervasion by the five clans, and having first aroused passion and worship, one should abide by means of the process of individual withdrawal, having performed the enjoyment.

original: te gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub pa'i rnal 'byor ba dag gis kyang gti mug gi rigs dang zhes sdang gi rigs las bsdus pas khrus mkhan dang sme sha can gyi bu mo dag bsgrubs nas gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: te gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub pa'i rnal 'byor ba dag gis kyang gti mug gi rigs dang zhes sdang gi rigs las bsdus pas khrus mkhan dang sme sha can gyi bu mo dag bsgrubs nas gnas par bya'o //
translated: And likewise, the practitioners of Ratnasaṃbhava and Amoghasiddhi should also abide, having accomplished the bath attendant and the outcaste girl, respectively, by means of the pervasion of the clan of delusion and the clan of hatred.

original: de ltar zhugs pa'i sgrub pa pos zhes pa ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pa la rtsol ba byas pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhugs pa'i sgrub pa pos zhes pa ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pa la rtsol ba byas pa'o //
translated: The practitioner who has thus entered, who has exerted himself in the practice of unelaborate conduct,

original: 'od dpag tu med ba'i rang bzhin zhes pa ni gang zhig 'od dpag tu med pa'i ting nges 'dzin bsgom pa de ni de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i gzung gis bstan to //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med ba'i rang bzhin zhes pa ni gang zhig 'od dpag tu med pa'i ting nges 'dzin bsgom pa de ni de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i gzung gis bstan to //
translated: is taught to become like the one who cultivates the meditative absorption of Amitābha, the one who has the nature of Amitābha.

original: nye bar mtshon pa yin pas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa yin pas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the yogins of Akṣobhya, etc. will be like that.

original: sa bcu la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni sa bcu'i dbang phyug gi bdag po'o //
analyzed: sa bcu la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni sa bcu'i dbang phyug gi bdag po'o //
translated: The meaning of will abide in the ten stages is that they will be masters of the ten stages.

original: dag gi dbang phyug de 'dzin pa'o zhes pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: dag gi dbang phyug de 'dzin pa'o zhes pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: The meaning of will hold the sovereignty of those is that it shows the benefits of the yoga of Amitābha.

original: thugs kyi dbang phyug dang sku'i dbang phyug kyang mi bskyod pa dang rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pa dag la rtogs par bya ba dang / de bzhin du nam mkha' mdzod nyid dang las thams cad byed pa nyid rin po che dang don yod grub pa'i rnal 'byor pa dag la bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi dbang phyug dang sku'i dbang phyug kyang mi bskyod pa dang rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pa dag la rtogs par bya ba dang / de bzhin du nam mkha' mdzod nyid dang las thams cad byed pa nyid rin po che dang don yod grub pa'i rnal 'byor pa dag la bshad par bya'o //
translated: The sovereignty of mind and the sovereignty of body should be understood for the yogins of Akṣobhya and Vairocana, and similarly, the state of being a treasure and the state of performing all actions should be explained for the yogins of Ratnasaṃbhava and Amoghasiddhi.

original: de yang de'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i gzhung gis bstan to //
analyzed: de yang de'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i gzhung gis bstan to //
translated: And that is taught by the text by possessing that yoga, they will be like that.

original: dbang phyug dam pa dang ldan pa //
analyzed: dbang phyug dam pa dang ldan pa //
translated: He is endowed with the best of powers.

original: zhes pa ni sku'i dbang phyug la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sku'i dbang phyug la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This means that he is endowed with the power of body, etc.

original: sems can thams cad ni rang gi sde pa dang gzhan gyi sde pa'i nang na mchog yin pas na sems can thams cad las khyad par du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad ni rang gi sde pa dang gzhan gyi sde pa'i nang na mchog yin pas na sems can thams cad las khyad par du gyur pa'o //
translated: Since he is the best of all sentient beings, both in his own group and in other groups, he is superior to all sentient beings.

original: 'khor los sgyur bar gyur pa zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i bdag por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur bar gyur pa zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i bdag por 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes a universal monarch means that he becomes the lord of the mandala circle.

original: rtog pa'i rnal 'byor pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa sgom par byed pas so //🔽de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i phyag rgya'i dbye ba bstan pa'i 'og tu /
analyzed: rtog pa'i rnal 'byor pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa sgom par byed pas so // de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i phyag rgya'i dbye ba bstan pa'i 'og tu /
translated: Because he is a yogi of imagination means that he is a meditator on the stage of generation.🔽Thus, etc.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa rnams la yang bstan par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa rnams la yang bstan par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Having taught the classification of the seal for the yogi of the stage of generation, he teaches that it should also be taught for those who abide in the stage of completion.

original: rigs bzhi po zhes bya ba nas ring por mi thogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor bas bram @87b ze la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i bu mo blangs la snyoms par zhugs pa'i rim pas snang ba la sogs
analyzed: rigs bzhi po zhes bya ba nas ring por mi thogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor bas bram @87b ze la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i bu mo blangs la snyoms par zhugs pa'i rim pas snang ba la sogs
translated: From “the four clans” up to “will not be delayed” teaches that a yogin of the stage of completion should take a girl of any clan, such as a brahmin, and through the process of union, experience the three exalted wisdoms of appearance and so forth,

original: pa'i ye shes gsum rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung ba'i 'od gsal ba phye dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas myong zhing /
analyzed: pa'i ye shes gsum rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung ba'i 'od gsal ba phye dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas myong zhing /
translated: the clear light that arises from causes and conditions, through the process of manifest enlightenment of the outer and inner natures,

original: de las byung ba'i mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bdag nyid kyi zung du 'jug pa'i rdo rje'i sku dmigs nas gnas par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bdag nyid kyi zung du 'jug pa'i rdo rje'i sku dmigs nas gnas par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: and from that, should abide in the observation of the vajra body of union, which is the nature of non-abiding nirvana.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir rigs bzhin po rnams las gang yang rung ba zhes pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa la rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir rigs bzhin po rnams las gang yang rung ba zhes pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa la rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to teach just that, “from any of the four clans” means that because one who abides in the stage of completion is without conceptualization, it is not necessary to take a girl of a particular clan.

original: blangs nas zhes bya ba ni lhan cig spyod pa bzhin du blangs nas so //
analyzed: blangs nas zhes bya ba ni lhan cig spyod pa bzhin du blangs nas so //
translated: Having taken it up, means having taken it up like a co-wife.

original: de rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i zhes pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pas lha'i sku thob pa'o //
analyzed: de rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i zhes pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pas lha'i sku thob pa'o //
translated: Endowed with that realization, means having attained the deity's body by means of the completion stage.

original: rdo rje 'chang ste zhes pa ni thams cad kyi 'bras bur gyur pas so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang ste zhes pa ni thams cad kyi 'bras bur gyur pas so //
translated: Vajradhara, means that it is the result of all.

original: de rdzogs par byed pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de rdzogs par byed pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: That which perfects it, means that which generates the samādhi of union.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas rdzogs par byas te zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas rdzogs par byas te zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis kyis so //
translated: Having perfected it by means of the stage of manifest enlightenment, means by means of the two stages.

original: de'i thabs ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi rgya'o //
analyzed: de'i thabs ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi rgya'o //
translated: The method of that, means the seal of the spiritual power of the great seal.

original: dmar thag chad cing 'das par gyur te zhes pa ni dgongs ka ste de'i tshe nyi ma nub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmar thag chad cing 'das par gyur te zhes pa ni dgongs ka ste de'i tshe nyi ma nub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When the red thread is cut and one passes away, means at dusk, because at that time the sun sets.

original: des na mtshan mo byung ba'i dus su tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i chogs dkyil 'khor gyi dbus na gnas pa'i bla mas mchod pa rnam pa lnga la sogs pas de kho na nyid thob pa'i don du gsol ba 'debs pa sngon du 'gro bas mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: des na mtshan mo byung ba'i dus su tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i chogs dkyil 'khor gyi dbus na gnas pa'i bla mas mchod pa rnam pa lnga la sogs pas de kho na nyid thob pa'i don du gsol ba 'debs pa sngon du 'gro bas mchod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, at the time of night, having made offerings with the five offerings, etc. to the guru who is in the center of the mandala of the ganacakra, one should make supplications for the sake of attaining reality.🔽Then, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mchod pa'i 'og tu mtshan phyed kyi dus su dang par gyur pa'i bla mas ji lta ba bzhin du gsang ba'i 'og tu shes rab kyi dbang bskur ba thob nas rang rigs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mchod pa'i 'og tu mtshan phyed kyi dus su dang par gyur pa'i bla mas ji lta ba bzhin du gsang ba'i 'og tu shes rab kyi dbang bskur ba thob nas rang rigs pa bstan to //
translated: After the offerings, at midnight, the guru who has become the first, having obtained the secret empowerment in the proper way, teaches the reality of one's own lineage.

original: bde ba byung bas dbang bskur thob pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba byung bas dbang bskur thob pa'o //
translated: The arising of bliss is the attainment of empowerment.

original: ro de nyid kyi nam langs nas skya rengs 'char ba'i dus su ni nyi ma'i kha los sgyur ba bla na med pa 'char ba'i dus su ni mtshan mo'i cha 'das pa'o //
analyzed: ro de nyid kyi nam langs nas skya rengs 'char ba'i dus su ni nyi ma'i kha los sgyur ba bla na med pa 'char ba'i dus su ni mtshan mo'i cha 'das pa'o //
translated: At dawn, when the sun rises, the time of the arising of the unsurpassed sun of the guru, the night has passed.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir nyi ma 'char ba'i ston du zhes pa ni dang po ni nyi ma'i kha los sgyur ba skya rengs 'char ba dar phyi nas nyi ma 'char ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir nyi ma 'char ba'i ston du zhes pa ni dang po ni nyi ma'i kha los sgyur ba skya rengs 'char ba dar phyi nas nyi ma 'char ba'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, the “time of the rising sun” is the first time of the rising sun, the dawn, and the later time of the rising sun, the sun.

original: de'i dus su mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'i man ngag gis dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //🔽phyi'i mngon par byang chub pa'i @88a * //
analyzed: de'i dus su mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'i man ngag gis dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro // phyi'i mngon par byang chub pa'i @88a * //
translated: At that time, one should attain power through the esoteric instructions of the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: rim pa zhes pa ni phyi'i dus la ltos pas de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi man ngag go //
analyzed: rim pa zhes pa ni phyi'i dus la ltos pas de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi man ngag go //
translated: The “external stage of manifest enlightenment” is the esoteric instruction characterized by the realization of reality, which depends on external time.
