original: nang gi bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas nang gi bdag nyid kyi mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: nang gi bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas nang gi bdag nyid kyi mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: In order to teach the internal, he says “the internal stage of manifest enlightenment” and so on.

original: thabs kyi ye shes zhes pa ni snang ba mched pa'i ye shes te 'dod chags kyi ming can no //
analyzed: thabs kyi ye shes zhes pa ni snang ba mched pa'i ye shes te 'dod chags kyi ming can no //
translated: The “wisdom of the method” is the wisdom of the appearance of the increase of passion.

original: snyoms par zhugs pas mtshon pas na snyoms par zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pas mtshon pas na snyoms par zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The “characterized by the meditative stabilization” is characterized by the meditative stabilization that is illustrated by the meditative stabilization.

original: byung bar gyur nas zhes pa ni de bskyed nas so //
analyzed: byung bar gyur nas zhes pa ni de bskyed nas so //
translated: Having arisen means having generated that.

original: nub cing ni 'das nas so //
analyzed: nub cing ni 'das nas so //
translated: Having set means having passed away.

original: shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas zhes pa ni snang ba'i ye shes kyi phyi nas 'byung zhing thim pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas zhes pa ni snang ba'i ye shes kyi phyi nas 'byung zhing thim pa'o //
translated: Having become the nature of wisdom means that the light of wisdom arises from the outside and dissolves.

original: de nas 'od gsal ba sngon du 'gro bas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nas 'od gsal ba sngon du 'gro bas zhes pa ni /
translated: Then, preceded by clear light means

original: 'od gsal ba las sngon du snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes 'byung ba ni myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba las sngon du snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes 'byung ba ni myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: that the wisdom of attaining the light arises from clear light and is experienced.

original: ma rig pa ste zhes pa ni snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ma rig pa ste zhes pa ni snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Ignorance means the wisdom of attaining the light.

original: des song bar gyur pa'i dus su zhes pa ni de'i bag chags kyi lhag ma med pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: des song bar gyur pa'i dus su zhes pa ni de'i bag chags kyi lhag ma med pa'i tshe'o //
translated: At the time of its passing away means when its residual impression is absent.

original: stong pa dang shin tu stong pa dang stong pa chen po ni snang ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gsum mo //
analyzed: stong pa dang shin tu stong pa dang stong pa chen po ni snang ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gsum mo //
translated: The empty, the very empty, and the great empty are the three natures of light and so on.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyis zhes pa ni nye bar len pa dang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyur gyur ba ste gcig rgyu dang gzhan dag kyang lhan cig byed pa yin bas so //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyis zhes pa ni nye bar len pa dang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyur gyur ba ste gcig rgyu dang gzhan dag kyang lhan cig byed pa yin bas so //
translated: By causes and conditions means by the substantial cause and the cooperative conditions, because one is the substantial cause and the others are the cooperative conditions.

original: de rnams kyi 'od gsal ba ni 'bras bur gyur pa'i de kho na nyid mngon du byed pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'od gsal ba ni 'bras bur gyur pa'i de kho na nyid mngon du byed pas so //
translated: Their luminosity is the reality that is the effect, because it is the manifestation of that.

original: phyag rgya chen po 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rdo rje'i sku 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rdo rje'i sku 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The accomplishment of the great seal means the arising of the vajra body by means of the concentration of union.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: skye rangs shar ba'i dus su ni //
analyzed: skye rangs shar ba'i dus su ni //
translated: At the time of the arising of birth,

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting 'dzin gyis //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting 'dzin gyis //
translated: by means of the vajra-like concentration,

original: byang chub shing drung bzhugs nas ni //
analyzed: byang chub shing drung bzhugs nas ni //
translated: having sat under the Bodhi tree,

original: des ni bdud rnams 'dzoms par mdzad //
analyzed: des ni bdud rnams 'dzoms par mdzad //
translated: he crushed the demons.🔽The emptiness, the great emptiness,🔽the third, the great emptiness,

original: stong pa shin tu stong pa dang / gsum pa stong pa chen po dang // bzhi pa thams cad stong pa ni //
analyzed: stong pa shin tu stong pa dang / gsum pa stong pa chen po dang // bzhi pa thams cad stong pa ni //
translated: and the fourth, the emptiness of everything,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag go //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag go //
translated: are the distinctions of cause and effect.

original: zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: Thus it is.

original: mtshan mo snang ba'i cha ste nyi ma'i zer 'gyed snang ba mched pa yin //
analyzed: mtshan mo snang ba'i cha ste nyi ma'i zer 'gyed snang ba mched pa yin //
translated: The night is the aspect of appearance, the sun's rays being the light of the appearance.

original: mtshams ni snang ba thob pa rang gi rang bzhin rnams dang rtag tu bcas //
analyzed: mtshams ni snang ba thob pa rang gi rang bzhin rnams dang rtag tu bcas //
translated: The twilight is the attainment of appearance, always limited by its own nature.

original: mtshan min mtshams med nyin med gang zhig rang bzhin gyis dag pa //
analyzed: mtshan min mtshams med nyin med gang zhig rang bzhin gyis dag pa //
translated: The day is that which is not night, not twilight, and not day, which is pure by nature.

original: de ni byang chub skad cig bla ma mchog bshad @88b rnal 'byor ba nyid yul //
analyzed: de ni byang chub skad cig bla ma mchog bshad @88b rnal 'byor ba nyid yul //
translated: That is the moment of enlightenment, the object of the yogi who is taught by the supreme guru.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is.

original: de ltar phyi nang gi mngon par byang chub kyi rim pas 'od gsal ba myong zhing de las byung ba'i rdo rje'i sku spro bar bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar phyi nang gi mngon par byang chub kyi rim pas 'od gsal ba myong zhing de las byung ba'i rdo rje'i sku spro bar bstan to //
translated: Thus, by the outer and inner stages of manifest enlightenment, one experiences clear light, and the emanation of the vajra body which arises from that is taught.

original: mtshan rnams thams cad kyis brgyan pa //
analyzed: mtshan rnams thams cad kyis brgyan pa //
translated: Adorned with all the marks

original: zhes pa ni mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: means adorned with the major and minor marks.

original: stobs bcu ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: stobs bcu ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ten powers are the power to know what is correct and what is incorrect, and so forth.

original: mi 'jigs pa ni bzhi ste de bzhin du la sogs pa'i sgras dbang po dang stobs dang byang chub kyi yan lag dang lam gyi yan lag la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan de dang ldan pa ni ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa ni bzhi ste de bzhin du la sogs pa'i sgras dbang po dang stobs dang byang chub kyi yan lag dang lam gyi yan lag la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan de dang ldan pa ni ldan pa'o //
translated: The four fearlessnesses are as follows: and so on means that he is endowed with the qualities of a Buddha, such as the faculties, the powers, the limbs of enlightenment, and the limbs of the path.

original: de'i khyad par ni phyag rgya chen po rdzogs pa ste rdo rje sems dpa'i sku'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni phyag rgya chen po rdzogs pa ste rdo rje sems dpa'i sku'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: His special quality is that he is perfected in the great seal, which is the nature of the body of Vajrasattva.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas de kho na nyid thob pa'i phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas de kho na nyid thob pa'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: Thus, etc. shows the benefit of attaining reality.

original: khams gsum zhes pa ni 'jig rten gsum pa'i sangs rgyas nyid thob pas na mngon par 'dod pa'i don gyis 'bras bu ster ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum zhes pa ni 'jig rten gsum pa'i sangs rgyas nyid thob pas na mngon par 'dod pa'i don gyis 'bras bu ster ba'o //
translated: The three realms is the attainment of Buddhahood in the three worlds, and so it is the result, which is given by the desired aim.

original: de bzhin du rab tu grags pa'i mtshan rnams ni thun mong ma yin pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rab tu grags pa'i mtshan rnams ni thun mong ma yin pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Similarly, he is endowed with the uncommon foundations of mindfulness, etc., which are the well-known names.

original: dpag tshad brgya zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang gi snang ba mtha' yas ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa dang / de bzhin du kun rdzob dang don dam par dbyer med pa'i ngo bo zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis 'gro ba'i don zhib la sogs pa 'di byed do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dpag tshad brgya zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang gi snang ba mtha' yas ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa dang / de bzhin du kun rdzob dang don dam par dbyer med pa'i ngo bo zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis 'gro ba'i don zhib la sogs pa 'di byed do zhes bstan to //
translated: And likewise, in the same way, with the samādhi of the essence of the union of the relative and ultimate indivisibly, one should do the benefit of migrating beings teaches that.

original: bshad ma thag pa zhes pa la sogs pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin mi 'da' ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa zhes pa la sogs pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin mi 'da' ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: The line the one who is just explained and so forth teaches that the samādhi of the completion stage is not transgressed.

original: sgrub pa po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gang zhig rnal 'byor pa dbang po dang // yul nye bar spyod pa'i sgo nas so sor sdud pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis 'od gsal bar nye bar mtshon pas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid de kho na nyid zhi ba ni spros pa thams cad dang
analyzed: sgrub pa po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gang zhig rnal 'byor pa dbang po dang // yul nye bar spyod pa'i sgo nas so sor sdud pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis 'od gsal bar nye bar mtshon pas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid de kho na nyid zhi ba ni spros pa thams cad dang
translated: The peace of reality is free from all elaborations.

original: bral ba / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa gtsor gyur pas na dge ba blang bar bya bas na de kho na nyid ma 'khrul pas na mi slu ba /
analyzed: bral ba / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa gtsor gyur pas na dge ba blang bar bya bas na de kho na nyid ma 'khrul pas na mi slu ba /
translated: Since the benefit of others is primary, it is virtuous. Since it is not mistaken about reality, it is nondeceptive.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub kyi gtso bor gyur pas na phul du byung ba thob bar 'gyur ro zhes sdud pa pos bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub kyi gtso bor gyur pas na phul du byung ba thob bar 'gyur ro zhes sdud pa pos bstan to //
translated: Since it is the principal mundane and supramundane attainment, it is excellent. Thus the compiler has taught.

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bden @89a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bden @89a * //
translated: The meaning of the words of the root text is as follows.

original: ba gnyis kyi dbyer med par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rdo rje 'chang gis gsungs so zhes nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
analyzed: ba gnyis kyi dbyer med par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rdo rje 'chang gis gsungs so zhes nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
translated: The I is the one who is the nature of the two, the vajra and the bell, and is Vajradhara.

original: dgongs pa bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i sgra'i sbyor bas de kho na nyid bstan to //
analyzed: dgongs pa bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i sgra'i sbyor bas de kho na nyid bstan to //
translated: The explains is the explanation of the intention.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa phran chogs kyi dngos grub bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa phran chogs kyi dngos grub bshad par bya ste /
translated: The thus and so forth explains the siddhi of the Arapacana.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas gshin rjes gshed kyi ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas gshin rjes gshed kyi ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The then and so forth teaches the very state of being in the samadhi of Yamantaka.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gdug pa skrag par byed pa gshen rje gshed kyi sngags brjod pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gdug pa skrag par byed pa gshen rje gshed kyi sngags brjod pa bstan to //
translated: The tathagata and so forth teaches the recitation of the mantra of Yamantaka, the one who frightens the wicked.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngags kyi don bshad pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngags kyi don bshad pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The om and so forth is the explanation of the meaning of the mantra, which is easy to understand.

original: gshin rje gshed kyi sngags spel ba ni sbyor ba ste bstan par bya ba zhes pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed kyi sngags spel ba ni sbyor ba ste bstan par bya ba zhes pa'i sgra'o //
translated: The increase of the Yamantaka mantra is the application, which is the word to be taught.

original: de nas don 'di yin te bstan par bya bas nas dgra thams cad gsod par gyis shig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nas don 'di yin te bstan par bya bas nas dgra thams cad gsod par gyis shig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Then, this is the meaning: since it is to be taught, one should kill all enemies.

original: gzhan dag gis ni h'um gi sngags spel ba zhes bstan te /🔽h'um phat mtha' yis gsod pa'i //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni h'um gi sngags spel ba zhes bstan te / h'um phat mtha' yis gsod pa'i //
translated: Others teach the expansion of the mantra hūṃ.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is explained that “the end of hūṃ phaṭ kills,”

original: sdong bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ba /
analyzed: sdong bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ba /
translated: The one called “trunk” and so on teaches🔽that one should focus on the aspects of Caṇḍa­mahā­roṣaṇa and so on, and with the fire of the thorns, the fire of the hearth is triangular.

original: shin rje mthar byed la sogs pa'i rnam pa la dmigs te tsher ma las byung ba'i me dang ldan pa'i gru gsum gyi me'i thabs tu sngags brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba dug dang khrag dang lan tshva dang ske tshe dang / 'bru mar dang 'dres nas bu mo 'am pha rol gyi dbur gang yang rung ba la dmigs nas mtshan phyed dam nyin phyed kyi dus su bsregs nas /
analyzed: shin rje mthar byed la sogs pa'i rnam pa la dmigs te tsher ma las byung ba'i me dang ldan pa'i gru gsum gyi me'i thabs tu sngags brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba dug dang khrag dang lan tshva dang ske tshe dang / 'bru mar dang 'dres nas bu mo 'am pha rol gyi dbur gang yang rung ba la dmigs nas mtshan phyed dam nyin phyed kyi dus su bsregs nas /
translated: Having recited the mantra beforehand, mixed with poison, blood, salt, black mustard seed, and oil, one should focus on a girl or the head of an enemy, and burn it at midnight or noon.

original: de zhag gsum gyis rengs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de zhag gsum gyis rengs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that in three days they will be paralyzed.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that,

original: bu mo dag dang 'brel pa'i longs spyod kyi rgyur zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bu mo dag dang 'brel pa'i longs spyod kyi rgyur zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase “for the sake of enjoyment with women” means

original: bu mo'i lus la longs spyod pa'i phyir dang de'i pha'i sbyor ba la longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bu mo'i lus la longs spyod pa'i phyir dang de'i pha'i sbyor ba la longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: for the sake of enjoying the body of a woman and for the sake of enjoying the union with her.

original: de'i phyir sgrub pa po gzhan las zhes pa ni de ma gtogs pa gzhan la 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgrub pa po gzhan las zhes pa ni de ma gtogs pa gzhan la 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the phrase “not from another” means that he will not go to another, that is, to someone other than her.

original: de 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi ji srid byis ba dang lang tsho dang rgan pa'i gnas skabs su yang de med pas dga' bar mi 'gyur gyi de la chags par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi ji srid byis ba dang lang tsho dang rgan pa'i gnas skabs su yang de med pas dga' bar mi 'gyur gyi de la chags par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Not only that, but as long as he is in the states of childhood, youth, and old age, he will not be satisfied without her, but will be attached to her.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis gal te sbyor ba 'di mi brtsi na /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis gal te sbyor ba 'di mi brtsi na /
translated: The phrase “the yoga of Vairocana” and so on refers to the thirty-two yogas of Body Vajra and so on. If one does not value this practice,

original: @89b de'i tshe de rnams kyi las de rtsom pa don med pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: @89b de'i tshe de rnams kyi las de rtsom pa don med pa zhes bstan to //
translated: then the action of those is said to be pointless.

original: sbyor ba gzhan bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs par 'byung po'i zhag la dur khrod kyi gos la dur khrod kyi sol bas kha sbyor gyi nang du brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pas gshin rje mthar byed kyi gzugs bris la de'i snying gar ming spel te sngags
analyzed: sbyor ba gzhan bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs par 'byung po'i zhag la dur khrod kyi gos la dur khrod kyi sol bas kha sbyor gyi nang du brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pas gshin rje mthar byed kyi gzugs bris la de'i snying gar ming spel te sngags
translated: In order to teach other methods, “one should draw Yama’s form on a charnel ground cloth with charnel ground char, and repeat the mantra one hundred and eight times inside a bound amulet.

original: brjod pa sngon du 'gro bar che ge mo la ai dam da pa ya phri sv'a h'a zhes pa'i sngags spel ba byas pa brjod cing brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pa'i rnal 'byor pa sgrub pa pos pha rol rnams la mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ster bar 'gyur
analyzed: brjod pa sngon du 'gro bar che ge mo la ai dam da pa ya phri sv'a h'a zhes pa'i sngags spel ba byas pa brjod cing brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pa'i rnal 'byor pa sgrub pa pos pha rol rnams la mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ster bar 'gyur
translated: The yogi practitioner, having repeated the mantra one hundred and eight times, should say the mantra with the name of the target inserted, preceded by the mantra, “May such and such be given the desired result.”

original: ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ro zhes bstan to //
translated: This teaches that he will give the desired result to others.

original: sngags 'di nyid ces bya ba la sogs par dur khrod kyi gos la sol pas dgra bo'i gzugs brnyan bris la de'i snying gar ming spel zhing nyin phyed dam mtshan phyed kyi dus su 'byung bo'i zhag la /
analyzed: sngags 'di nyid ces bya ba la sogs par dur khrod kyi gos la sol pas dgra bo'i gzugs brnyan bris la de'i snying gar ming spel zhing nyin phyed dam mtshan phyed kyi dus su 'byung bo'i zhag la /
translated: In order to teach the method of killing, “with this very mantra” and so on is said. One should draw the enemy’s form on a charnel ground cloth with char, and insert the name in the heart. At midnight or noon, on an evil spirit day,

original: khro bo'i rnam pa dang khro bo'i bsam pas /
analyzed: khro bo'i rnam pa dang khro bo'i bsam pas /
translated: With the form of a wrathful one, with the intention of a wrathful one,

original: mtshon cha rno ba'i bsam pas gsol bas mgo ngo nas brtsams te /
analyzed: mtshon cha rno ba'i bsam pas gsol bas mgo ngo nas brtsams te /
translated: with the intention of a sharp weapon, he should supplicate, beginning from the head,

original: rkang pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi bar du dbus su reg btab nas /
analyzed: rkang pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi bar du dbus su reg btab nas /
translated: and striking the center of the feet,

original: dgra po 'gags par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dgra po 'gags par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: the enemy will be stopped.

original: tho ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas dgra bo'i rkang ba'i rdul dang gtsang po'i 'gram gnyis kyi sas bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan byas la /
analyzed: tho ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas dgra bo'i rkang ba'i rdul dang gtsang po'i 'gram gnyis kyi sas bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan byas la /
translated: With a hammer, etc., one should make an effigy of the victim with the dust of his feet and earth from both banks of a river,

original: sngar bshad pa'i dus su gshin rje gshed kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas khros nas yi ge phat bzlas pas de'i mgo bor tho ba phab na de'i tshe mngon gsum du de'i mgo bor tho /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i dus su gshin rje gshed kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas khros nas yi ge phat bzlas pas de'i mgo bor tho ba phab na de'i tshe mngon gsum du de'i mgo bor tho /
translated: and at the previously explained time, endowed with the yoga of Yamāri, angry, one should recite the syllable phaṭ. When one strikes the head with a hammer,

original: phab pa gang gis srog dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: phab pa gang gis srog dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: at that time, one should understand that the head is struck with a hammer, by which he will be separated from his life.

original: yang na bsam gtan gyis kyang 'di dag thams cad bya'o zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyis kyang rnam par byas te /
analyzed: yang na bsam gtan gyis kyang 'di dag thams cad bya'o zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyis kyang rnam par byas te /
translated: Or else, all of these should be done by means of concentration.

original: gang gis phyi rol gyi zas la ltos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis phyi rol gyi zas la ltos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By which one does not rely on external substances.

original: h'um zhes bya ba la sogs pas thugs rdo rje yongs su gyur pa las bdag nyid gnod mdzes kyi rgyal por bsams la /
analyzed: h'um zhes bya ba la sogs pas thugs rdo rje yongs su gyur pa las bdag nyid gnod mdzes kyi rgyal por bsams la /
translated: By hūṃ and so forth, having transformed into Cittavajra, one should imagine oneself as Sumbharāja.

original: rang gi lag par yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa las drag po'i rdo rje yi ge h'um gyis 'bar ba'i phreng ba dang ldan pa bsams la /
analyzed: rang gi lag par yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa las drag po'i rdo rje yi ge h'um gyis 'bar ba'i phreng ba dang ldan pa bsams la /
translated: On one’s hand, having transformed the syllable hūṃ, one should imagine a fierce vajra with the syllable hūṃ, endowed with a garland of flames.

original: snga ma bzhin du bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan mgo bor phab par bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis phyi'i rdzas la ltos pa med pa nyid du bstan to //🔽rdo rje rgyud ces bya ba la sogs pa nas gdon mi za'o zhes pa'i bar du ni dur @90a * //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan mgo bor phab par bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis phyi'i rdzas la ltos pa med pa nyid du bstan to // rdo rje rgyud ces bya ba la sogs pa nas gdon mi za'o zhes pa'i bar du ni dur @90a * //
translated: As before, one should place the effigy of the victim on one’s head. By this, one should show the lack of reliance on external substances.

original: khrod kyi gos la sogs pa la khams kyi rdzas kyis skyes pa'am bung med gang yang rung ba'i gzugs brnyan bris la /
analyzed: khrod kyi gos la sogs pa la khams kyi rdzas kyis skyes pa'am bung med gang yang rung ba'i gzugs brnyan bris la /
translated: In the Vajra Tantra and so forth up to “one should not doubt” one should draw the effigy of any man or woman on a shroud and so forth with the substance of the elements.

original: yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa las dgra sta rno ba rang gi lag pa na yod par bsams te /
analyzed: yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa las dgra sta rno ba rang gi lag pa na yod par bsams te /
translated: Having transformed the syllable hūṃ, one should imagine a sharp axe in one’s hand.

original: des bsgrub bya'i ske ba yi ge phat brjod pas bcad la de'i tshe dgra bo'i ske ba gcod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des bsgrub bya'i ske ba yi ge phat brjod pas bcad la de'i tshe dgra bo'i ske ba gcod par 'gyur ro //
translated: By uttering the syllable PHAṬ, which is the instrument of the act of killing, one cuts off the life of the victim. At that time, one cuts off the life of the enemy.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bsgrub par bya ba nyid du shes pa dang zhes smos te rgyal po bya ba 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bsgrub par bya ba nyid du shes pa dang zhes smos te rgyal po bya ba 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For that very reason, it is said, “one who is known to be the victim,” and the rite of the king will not be accomplished.

original: 'dir yang dang yid kyi bdag nyid can zhes pa ni shin tu mdzes pa'i lus dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dang yid kyi bdag nyid can zhes pa ni shin tu mdzes pa'i lus dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Here, “one who is endowed with a very beautiful body” is one who is of the nature of the mind.

original: mchog dang 'bring dang tha ma zhes pa ni bram ze dang rgyal rigs dang rje rigs dang dmangs rigs so //
analyzed: mchog dang 'bring dang tha ma zhes pa ni bram ze dang rgyal rigs dang rje rigs dang dmangs rigs so //
translated: “The best, the middling, and the lowest” are the brahmin, the kṣatriya, the vaiśya, and the śūdra.

original: de rnams la mi rigs pas phan 'dogs par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams la mi rigs pas phan 'dogs par mi byed pa'o //
translated: One should not assist them with improper means.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shin tu pag med pa la gnas pa ni drag po'i las byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shin tu pag med pa la gnas pa ni drag po'i las byed pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, “one who is situated in great fear” is one who performs violent rites.

original: sbyor ba 'dis ni dgra sta'i sbyor bas lnga pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes gdon mi za'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba 'dis ni dgra sta'i sbyor bas lnga pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes gdon mi za'o //
translated: By this application, it is certain that the fifth will be by the application of the enemy.

original: bdud rtsi thab sbyor zhes bya ba la sogs pas shin tu char 'bab pa'i dus su bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas grong ngam grong khyer la sogs pa'i nam mkha'i phyogs su yi ge h'um las skyes pa kha dog ser po sna tshogs rdo
analyzed: bdud rtsi thab sbyor zhes bya ba la sogs pas shin tu char 'bab pa'i dus su bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas grong ngam grong khyer la sogs pa'i nam mkha'i phyogs su yi ge h'um las skyes pa kha dog ser po sna tshogs rdo
translated: The chapter on Amrita-Agni and so forth explains that during a time of heavy rain, by abiding in the samadhi of Amrita-Kundali, one visualizes a yellow Hum in the sky above the village, town, and so forth, from which emerges a yellow Akshobhya.

original: rje bsams la de'i dbus su yi ge h'um las byung ba'i 'bar ba'i rdo rje bsams la /
analyzed: rje bsams la de'i dbus su yi ge h'um las byung ba'i 'bar ba'i rdo rje bsams la /
translated: The section beginning with “the elixir-producing” teaches that when it is raining too much, one should visualize a yellow vajra cross arisen from the syllable hūṃ in the sky in the direction of the village or city, and in its center a blazing vajra arisen from the syllable hūṃ.

original: de las byung ba'i 'bar ba'i tshogs kyis char skams par 'gyur par bsgoms na char rengs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i 'bar ba'i tshogs kyis char skams par 'gyur par bsgoms na char rengs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: One should meditate that the mass of flames that arise from that dry up the rain.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dkyil 'khor chen po bri ba'i dus su rlung dang char dang thog la sogs pa nam mkha' las 'byung ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi 'og nas kyang chud dang sprul la sogs pa 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dkyil 'khor chen po bri ba'i dus su rlung dang char dang thog la sogs pa nam mkha' las 'byung ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi 'og nas kyang chud dang sprul la sogs pa 'byung ba dang /
translated: The section beginning with “the great maṇḍala of the vajra realm” teaches that when drawing the great maṇḍala, if wind, rain, lightning, and so on occur in the sky, and if water, snakes, and so on occur from below the maṇḍala,

original: sogs pa'i sgras sa 'gul ba dang sha za la sogs pa 'byung bas so zhes gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras sa 'gul ba dang sha za la sogs pa 'byung bas so zhes gzung ngo //
translated: and so on refers to earthquakes, vetālas, and so on.

original: gzhan gyis rab tu sbyar ba zhes pa ni tshogs kyi bdag po la sogs pa mu stegs pas skyon byas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rab tu sbyar ba zhes pa ni tshogs kyi bdag po la sogs pa mu stegs pas skyon byas pa'o //
translated: “Applied by others” refers to the faults created by tīrthikas such as Gaṇapati.

original: gang gi tshe 'byung bar 'gyur na de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag tu med pa yongs su gyur pa las zhal gsum phyag drug pa spyan gsum pa g-yon brkyang pa la gnas pa 'phags pa rta mgrin du @90b bdag nyid bsams la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'byung bar 'gyur na de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag tu med pa yongs su gyur pa las zhal gsum phyag drug pa spyan gsum pa g-yon brkyang pa la gnas pa 'phags pa rta mgrin du @90b bdag nyid bsams la /
translated: When that occurs, at that time, one should imagine oneself as Noble Hayagrīva, arisen from the transformation of the Bhagavān Amitābha, with three faces, six arms, three eyes, and standing with the left leg straight.

original: de'i phyag mtshan las byung ba'i 'bar ba'i tshogs kyis phyogs bcu la gnas pa'i bgegs kyi tshogs bsreg cing thal bar gyur par bsam par byed na de'i tshe rlung la sogs pa zhi bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyag mtshan las byung ba'i 'bar ba'i tshogs kyis phyogs bcu la gnas pa'i bgegs kyi tshogs bsreg cing thal bar gyur par bsam par byed na de'i tshe rlung la sogs pa zhi bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: When one imagines that the hosts of obstructors dwelling in the ten directions are burned and reduced to ashes by the mass of flames arising from his hand implements, at that time the wind and so on will be pacified.

original: gal te rang bzhin de ltar mi phyed na zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ma bsgoms pas dkyil 'khor bri ba'i bdag nyid can gyi rnal 'byor ma'i bya ba 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin de ltar mi phyed na zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ma bsgoms pas dkyil 'khor bri ba'i bdag nyid can gyi rnal 'byor ma'i bya ba 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not meditate in that way, then the activity of the yoginī whose nature is to draw the maṇḍala will not be accomplished.

original: 'dir yang drag po'i las la rang gi sde pa dang gzhan gyis nge pa'i bgegs gsong bar byed pa'i yi ge phat kyis sa bon gsod pa ni dgra bo 'tshe ba'i dus su sbyor bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir yang drag po'i las la rang gi sde pa dang gzhan gyis nge pa'i bgegs gsong bar byed pa'i yi ge phat kyis sa bon gsod pa ni dgra bo 'tshe ba'i dus su sbyor bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Here, too, the seed syllable of the obstructor, who is either one’s own faction or another’s faction, is killed by the syllable phaṭ in the rite of violence. One should apply this at the time of harming the enemy.

original: da ni zhes pa la sogs pas spros pa dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor pas lha'i khang pa sum brtsegs la gnas te /
analyzed: da ni zhes pa la sogs pas spros pa dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor pas lha'i khang pa sum brtsegs la gnas te /
translated: Now, beginning with “and now,” the yoga with elaboration, abiding in the three-storied celestial mansion,

original: bdag la bying yis brlabs pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa gang yang rung ba ye shes kyi sku dmigs te /
analyzed: bdag la bying yis brlabs pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa gang yang rung ba ye shes kyi sku dmigs te /
translated: visualizes the jñānasattva, any one of Vairocana, and so on, who is empowered by oneself.

original: phyogs ba zhi la gzugs bzang ba shin tu legs par brgyan pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya bzhi bzhag nas de dang lhan cig 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nye bar spyod pa dang snyoms par zhugs pa dang / so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan gyi rim pas bde ba chen po myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: phyogs ba zhi la gzugs bzang ba shin tu legs par brgyan pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya bzhi bzhag nas de dang lhan cig 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nye bar spyod pa dang snyoms par zhugs pa dang / so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan gyi rim pas bde ba chen po myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Having placed the four pledge seals, which are beautiful women with excellent bodies and ornaments, one should enjoy the five sense objects with them, and enter into union with them, and by the stages of withdrawal and meditative stabilization, one will experience great bliss.

original: ye shes kyi rim pas bskyed pa zhes pa ni bdag la byin gyis brlabs pa'i rim pas spros pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rim pas bskyed pa zhes pa ni bdag la byin gyis brlabs pa'i rim pas spros pa'o //
translated: “By the stage of exalted wisdom” means the emanation by the stage of self-consecration.

original: de'i sbyor ba ni zhes pa ni mdor bsten pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba ni zhes pa ni mdor bsten pa'o //
translated: “Its yoga” is the brief explanation.

original: skad cig gis dmigs pa zhes pa ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig gis dmigs pa zhes pa ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: “Instantaneous observation” is the extensive explanation.

original: des na snang ba nye bar thob ba la sogs pa'i rim pa bkag go //
analyzed: des na snang ba nye bar thob ba la sogs pa'i rim pa bkag go //
translated: Therefore, the stages of attaining the light and so forth are refuted.

original: gdan rnam pa bzhi'i dbus su zhes pa ni lha mo bzhi'i gdan gyi dbus su'o //
analyzed: gdan rnam pa bzhi'i dbus su zhes pa ni lha mo bzhi'i gdan gyi dbus su'o //
translated: “In the middle of the four seats” is in the middle of the seats of the four goddesses.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
translated: “The body of Great Vajradhara” is merely an illustration.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams kyi yang sku bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams kyi yang sku bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the body of Vairochana and so forth.

original: lha'i de kho na nyid shes pas so zhes pa ni bdag nyid dang lhan cig lha mo bzhi ye shes lnga'i ngo bo shes pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i de kho na nyid shes pas so zhes pa ni bdag nyid dang lhan cig lha mo bzhi ye shes lnga'i ngo bo shes pa'o //
translated: By knowing the reality of the deity means knowing the four goddesses together with oneself as the essence of the five wisdoms.

original: spyan ma la sogs pa'i gnas rnams su zhes pa ni shar phyogs la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: spyan ma la sogs pa'i gnas rnams su zhes pa ni shar phyogs la sogs pa la'o //
translated: In the places of Lochana and so forth means in the east and so forth.

original: rna par dag pa'i rim pa des phyi'i mngon par zhen pa spong pa dang / so so'i skye bo bzhin du spyod pa'ang bkag par byas pa @91a * //
analyzed: rna par dag pa'i rim pa des phyi'i mngon par zhen pa spong pa dang / so so'i skye bo bzhin du spyod pa'ang bkag par byas pa @91a * //
translated: By that process of purification, external clinging is abandoned, and even conduct like that of ordinary beings is prohibited.

original: yin no // sngags dang phyag rgya legs par slob pa zhes pa ni sngags gtso bor gyur pa'i phyag rgya ni sngags kyi phyag rgya ste sngags kyi theg pa'o //
analyzed: yin no // sngags dang phyag rgya legs par slob pa zhes pa ni sngags gtso bor gyur pa'i phyag rgya ni sngags kyi phyag rgya ste sngags kyi theg pa'o //
translated: Proper training in mantra and mudra means the mudra that is primary in mantra is the mantra mudra, which is the mantra vehicle.

original: de la legs par bslab pa ni thos pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis mthar phyin pa dang pha rol la nye bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: de la legs par bslab pa ni thos pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis mthar phyin pa dang pha rol la nye bar ston pa'o //
translated: Proper training in that is bringing it to completion through the process of hearing and so forth and teaching it to others.

original: spyan ma la sogs pa'i dngos po yongs su brtags pa zhes pa ni rigs kyi yum bzhi po'i gzugs su bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: spyan ma la sogs pa'i dngos po yongs su brtags pa zhes pa ni rigs kyi yum bzhi po'i gzugs su bsgom pa'o //
translated: The phrase “the examination of the entities of Locanā, etc.” means that one should visualize the four goddesses of the Buddha families.

original: bud med bzhi ni bzhi kho na'o //
analyzed: bud med bzhi ni bzhi kho na'o //
translated: The four women are just four.

original: nyin mtshan ni rtag tu'o //
analyzed: nyin mtshan ni rtag tu'o //
translated: The day and night are always.

original: rgyan rnams thams cad kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas lhan cig skyes pa dang / cha lugs kyi yon tan rnams kyis brgyan pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: rgyan rnams thams cad kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas lhan cig skyes pa dang / cha lugs kyi yon tan rnams kyis brgyan pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The phrase “adorned with all ornaments,” etc. indicates that they are adorned with the qualities of innate nature and dress.

original: rang gi snying ga'i padma zhes pa ni rang gi sems so //
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i padma zhes pa ni rang gi sems so //
translated: The phrase “in one’s own heart lotus” means in one’s own mind.

original: kha'i padma ni zhal gyi padma'o //
analyzed: kha'i padma ni zhal gyi padma'o //
translated: The “mouth lotus” is the lotus of the mouth.

original: rgyas pa ni de lta bas dga' ba bskyed par byas la de'i 'og tu 'khor lo lnga'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de nyid sems tsam yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa ni de lta bas dga' ba bskyed par byas la de'i 'og tu 'khor lo lnga'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de nyid sems tsam yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bsam par bya'o //
translated: Having expanded it, one should generate joy. Then one should think that “whatever is the nature of the five wheels is just mind only, and nothing else.”

original: 'od zer lnga ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas dbang po dang yul nye bar spyod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi so sor sdud pa'i rim pas bde ba chen po de dang lhan cig tu myang bar bya'o zhes bstan te //
analyzed: 'od zer lnga ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas dbang po dang yul nye bar spyod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi so sor sdud pa'i rim pas bde ba chen po de dang lhan cig tu myang bar bya'o zhes bstan te //
translated: The five lights and so forth teach that one should experience that great bliss together with the stage of withdrawal, which has the characteristic of the enjoyment of the objects by the sense organs.

original: de ltar spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs par de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs par de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, the conduct and so forth teach that one becomes equal to the five tathagatas, Vairochana and so forth.

original: phyag rgya gcig dang yang lhan cig spyod pa zhes pa ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya gcig dang yang lhan cig spyod pa zhes pa ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i'o //
translated: The conduct together with the single mudra is that of the yogi who possesses unelaborate conduct.

original: dgongs pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor bas bram ze la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i phyag rgya blangs te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor bas bram ze la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i phyag rgya blangs te /
translated: The intention is that the yogi of Great Vajradhara and so forth takes any mudra, such as a Brahmin woman, and through the yoga of the four mudras, he should practice the conduct of the five elixirs and so forth.

original: bdag nyid dang des rnam par snang mdzad dang spyan ma la sogs pa'i rnam pa bskyed la yul nas yul du 'gro bar ji ltar rnyed pa'i kha zas can nags tshal la sogs pa skye bos dben pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i sgo nas ye shes gsum rnam
analyzed: bdag nyid dang des rnam par snang mdzad dang spyan ma la sogs pa'i rnam pa bskyed la yul nas yul du 'gro bar ji ltar rnyed pa'i kha zas can nags tshal la sogs pa skye bos dben pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i sgo nas ye shes gsum rnam
translated: One should generate the form of Vairocana and Locanā, and so on, and with the food that one finds, one should go from place to place, and in a solitary forest, and so on, one should enter into meditative concentration.🔽

original: par dag pa'i ngo bo 'od gsal ba la slob par byed de de'i tshe rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: par dag pa'i ngo bo 'od gsal ba la slob par byed de de'i tshe rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Having generated the nature of oneself and the forms of Vairochana, Locana, and so on, one should practice the clear light, which is the nature of the three exalted wisdoms purified, by means of entering into meditative equipoise in a place isolated from people, such as a forest, and eating whatever food is obtained. At that time, one becomes like Great Vajradhara.

original: thams mal pa'i bdag nyid rang bzhin yongs su spangs nas zhes pa ni ye shes kyi rim pas bsgrub pa'i sngags kyi sku'o //
analyzed: thams mal pa'i bdag nyid rang bzhin yongs su spangs nas zhes pa ni ye shes kyi rim pas bsgrub pa'i sngags kyi sku'o //
translated: Having abandoned the nature of an ordinary person, is the mantra body accomplished by the stages of exalted wisdom.

original: de'i 'og tu ni rgyu de las so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni rgyu de las so //
translated: After that, from that cause,

original: bdag po ni @91b khams gsum gyi bdag po'i //
analyzed: bdag po ni @91b khams gsum gyi bdag po'i //
translated: the lord of the three realms,

original: phyag rgya dang bcas par dngos grub thob pas na zhes pa ni de yang de bzhin du grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya dang bcas par dngos grub thob pas na zhes pa ni de yang de bzhin du grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: having attained power together with the consort, is the attainment of power.

original: nam mkha' mdzod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob bas sems can gyi don mdzad pa bstan to //
analyzed: nam mkha' mdzod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob bas sems can gyi don mdzad pa bstan to //
translated: The line the sky treasury and so forth teaches the performance of the welfare of sentient beings by those who have attained the power of the great seal.

original: de ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: This is the conduct without elaboration.

original: da ni spros ba med pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i ji snyed pa'i zas legs par sbyangs nas spyod pas gnas pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni spros ba med pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i ji snyed pa'i zas legs par sbyangs nas spyod pas gnas pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, in order to teach the conduct of the yogi/nī who possesses the conduct without elaboration, the conduct of the yogi/nī who has purified the food of the relative world, the text says:

original: thun mong du gyur pa ni rab tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong du gyur pa ni rab tu grags pa'o //
translated: Common means well known.

original: ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa zhes pa ni de kho na nyid thob pa la zhim dang mi zhim gyi rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa zhes pa ni de kho na nyid thob pa la zhim dang mi zhim gyi rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Cow dung and so forth means that because there is no conceptualization of taste and untaste in the attainment of reality, there is no preference for one thing over another.

original: sha ni ji rnyed pa dang zhes pa ni kha na ma tho ba med pa rnyed pa smod pa'am ma smad pa'o //
analyzed: sha ni ji rnyed pa dang zhes pa ni kha na ma tho ba med pa rnyed pa smod pa'am ma smad pa'o //
translated: Meat, whatever is obtained means that one should not disparage what is obtained without fault, whether it is disparaged or not.

original: gzhan dag gang ci'ang rung ba zhes pa ni btung ba la sogs ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gang ci'ang rung ba zhes pa ni btung ba la sogs ba'o //
translated: Whatever else is suitable means drink and so forth.

original: bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa de dag sbyangs pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis sbyangs la snying ga dang lag ba dang lkog ma sbyangs nas ji ltar so so'i skye bos ma mthong ba de srid bza' bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa de dag sbyangs pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis sbyangs la snying ga dang lag ba dang lkog ma sbyangs nas ji ltar so so'i skye bos ma mthong ba de srid bza' bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: One should eat those things to eat and drink, etc. after purifying them by the process of purification, etc., purifying the heart, hands, and throat, until one is not seen by ordinary people.

original: 'og nas bshad pa la ltos pa yin no zhes pa ni ri lu la sogs pa'i grub pa rnams kyang rdo rje 'chang nyid kyis gsungs so zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'og nas bshad pa la ltos pa yin no zhes pa ni ri lu la sogs pa'i grub pa rnams kyang rdo rje 'chang nyid kyis gsungs so zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The words in dependence on what is explained below are to be applied to the statements by Vajradhara himself of the accomplishments of the pill, etc.

original: bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas //
analyzed: bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas //
translated: The words explained and so on indicate

original: nyin zhag de la skyes pa'i bu chung gi tshan bus la ma lhung ba kham phor kha sbyar la bzhag cing gshin rje gshed kyi sngags kyis brgya rtsa brgyad bzla zhing yi ge gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs nas lcags gsum gyis bskor ba'i ri lu khar bcug na
analyzed: nyin zhag de la skyes pa'i bu chung gi tshan bus la ma lhung ba kham phor kha sbyar la bzhag cing gshin rje gshed kyi sngags kyis brgya rtsa brgyad bzla zhing yi ge gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs nas lcags gsum gyis bskor ba'i ri lu khar bcug na
translated: that one should place in a joined pair of bowls a newborn baby's feces that has not fallen on the ground, and recite the mantra of Yamantaka one hundred and eight times over it, and consecrate it with the three syllables, and place the pill in one's mouth surrounded by the three metals.

original: rig pa 'dzin pa rnams kyis kyang mthong bar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa rnams kyis kyang mthong bar mi 'gyur na /
translated: If one does that, one will not be seen even by the knowledge-bearers, let alone by ordinary people.

original: mi rnams kyis smos kyang cing gos ti mi snang ba'i sbyor ba bstan pa dang / de bzhin du khyi la sogs pa'i mngal gyi ri lu thod pa kha sbyar la bzhag cing /
analyzed: mi rnams kyis smos kyang cing gos ti mi snang ba'i sbyor ba bstan pa dang / de bzhin du khyi la sogs pa'i mngal gyi ri lu thod pa kha sbyar la bzhag cing /
translated: People will not see him, even if they look for him.🔽Similarly, one should place a pill in the womb of a dog, etc.,

original: snga ma bzhin du mngon par bzlas la khar bcug ste 'grub pa la sogs pas mthong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du mngon par bzlas la khar bcug ste 'grub pa la sogs pas mthong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: and, as before, incant it and place it in his mouth.

original: de ni mi snang ba'i sbyor ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de ni mi snang ba'i sbyor ba kho na'o //
translated: This is the procedure for invisibility.

original: bshang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdud rtsi lnga'i ri lu lcags gsum gyis bskor ba byas la zla ba gzas zin pa'i dus su phyag rgya'i bha gar bcug la snyoms par @92a * //
analyzed: bshang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdud rtsi lnga'i ri lu lcags gsum gyis bskor ba byas la zla ba gzas zin pa'i dus su phyag rgya'i bha gar bcug la snyoms par @92a * //
translated: The pill of the five ambrosias, wrapped in the three metals, is placed in the bhaga of a consort at the time of an eclipse of the moon, and one should unite with her.🔽 When the moon is released from the eclipse, one should take it out, and, having ascertained the signs of smoke, etc., place it in one's mouth.

original: zhugs pa sngon du 'gro ba zla ba gzas grol bar gyur na de nas bton te du ba la sogs pa'i rtags nye bar mtshon zhing khar bcug na sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang mthong bar mi 'gyur ro zhe bstan to //
analyzed: zhugs pa sngon du 'gro ba zla ba gzas grol bar gyur na de nas bton te du ba la sogs pa'i rtags nye bar mtshon zhing khar bcug na sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang mthong bar mi 'gyur ro zhe bstan to //
translated: Even the buddhas will not see one.

original: de yang mi snang ba'i sbyor ba kho na'o //🔽de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas snga ma bzhin du mi snang ba nyid bstan te /
analyzed: de yang mi snang ba'i sbyor ba kho na'o // de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas snga ma bzhin du mi snang ba nyid bstan te /
translated: Moreover, it is only the practice of invisibility.

original: 'on kyang sha chen 'dir gtso bor yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sha chen 'dir gtso bor yin no //
translated: Thus, etc. teaches invisibility as before, but here the great flesh is primary.

original: ba lang sha zhes ba la sogs pas snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya ste mi snang ba nyid kho na bstan to //
analyzed: ba lang sha zhes ba la sogs pas snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya ste mi snang ba nyid kho na bstan to //
translated: The rest should be explained as before, beginning with cow flesh, etc. Invisibility alone is taught.

original: srog chags zhes bya ba nas gsungs so zhes pa'i bar du ni bshang ba las 'byung ba'i srog chags kyi ri lu dang ga pur tsandan gyi ri lu dang / gi wang aa ga ru nag po'i ri lu dang bdud rtsi lnga'i ri lu dang ga bur dad gur gum gyis sbyar ba'i bdud rtsi lda'i ri lu ste rigs lnga'i dbye bas sbyangs la lcags gsum gyis bskor ba byas te khar bcug la /
analyzed: srog chags zhes bya ba nas gsungs so zhes pa'i bar du ni bshang ba las 'byung ba'i srog chags kyi ri lu dang ga pur tsandan gyi ri lu dang / gi wang aa ga ru nag po'i ri lu dang bdud rtsi lnga'i ri lu dang ga bur dad gur gum gyis sbyar ba'i bdud rtsi lda'i ri lu ste rigs lnga'i dbye bas sbyangs la lcags gsum gyis bskor ba byas te khar bcug la /
translated: The pill of the creature born from excrement, the pill of camphor and sandalwood, the pill of guggulu and black agarwood, the pill of the five nectars, and the pill of nectar mixed with camphor and saffron, these are the five families. Having refined them, encircle them with the three metals and place them in the mouth.

original: de'i tshe stobs mi nyams pa dang lha la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang mi mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa bstan to //
analyzed: de'i tshe stobs mi nyams pa dang lha la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang mi mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa bstan to //
translated: At that time, one’s power will not diminish, and one will not be seen by gods and so forth.

original: de ni mi snang ba'i sbyar ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de ni mi snang ba'i sbyar ba kho na'o //
translated: This is just the application of invisibility.

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sog pas 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub kyi sgo nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sog pas 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub kyi sgo nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: “ Then” and so forth teaches that one will attain supramundane powers through mundane powers.

original: dkyil 'khor pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i zhi ba la sogs pa bsgrub pa'i don du zhi ba'i don du zhi ba'am drag po'i ngo bo'i sku bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor bas zhi ba la sog pa sgrub par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad
analyzed: dkyil 'khor pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i zhi ba la sogs pa bsgrub pa'i don du zhi ba'i don du zhi ba'am drag po'i ngo bo'i sku bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor bas zhi ba la sog pa sgrub par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad
translated: “ The maṇḍala deities” and so forth explains that the practitioner of the yoga of meditating on the body of the peaceful or wrathful nature for the sake of accomplishing the previously explained pacification and so forth is not only pacifying and so forth,

original: kyang de'i phyag de'i phyag rgya chen pos zhi ba'i ngo bo rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku'i dbang phyug la sogs pa dang / stobs chen po la sogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: kyang de'i phyag de'i phyag rgya chen pos zhi ba'i ngo bo rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku'i dbang phyug la sogs pa dang / stobs chen po la sogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: but also by that mudrā of his, he will become the lord of the body of Great Vajradhara of the nature of peace and so forth, and will possess great strength and so forth.

original: gzhan yang skad cig ma gcig gis zhes bya ba la sog pas mkha' spyod dad sa spyod dang phyogs spyod kyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan yang skad cig ma gcig gis zhes bya ba la sog pas mkha' spyod dad sa spyod dang phyogs spyod kyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Moreover, by the words “in a single instant” and so on, it is taught that one will attain the powers of the sky-goers, the earth-goers, and the quarter-goers.

original: phyag rgya'i tshogs dpag tu med pa zhe pa ni lha'i bzhon pa la gnas pa dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i rang bzhin spyan ma la sogs pa de dang lhan cig spyod pas na dpal ldan no //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i tshogs dpag tu med pa zhe pa ni lha'i bzhon pa la gnas pa dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i rang bzhin spyan ma la sogs pa de dang lhan cig spyod pas na dpal ldan no //
translated: “ The glorious one with the infinite host of consorts” means that he is glorious because he enjoys the consorts such as Locanā, who are of the nature of the pledge seal, and who are mounted on the divine vehicles.

original: stobs bcu zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du bstan to //🔽@92b ji ltar dga' bar 'gro ba'i phyir //
analyzed: stobs bcu zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du bstan to // @92b ji ltar dga' bar 'gro ba'i phyir //
translated: “ Endowed with the ten powers” and so on teaches that he is endowed with the qualities of a Buddha.

original: zhes pa ni thogs pa med pa'i 'gro ba dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni thogs pa med pa'i 'gro ba dang ldan pas so //
translated: “ Because he goes wherever he wishes” means that he has unobstructed movement.

original: rgyal chen ris bzhi zhes bya la sogs pas lha'i rigs drug dang ldan pa'i 'dod pa'i khams la bde ba la sogs pa lha'i btsun mo ji srid dang de bzhin du ram pa ti la mchog la sogs dang lha'i smad 'tshong ma dang lha'i long spyod dang mtshungs
analyzed: rgyal chen ris bzhi zhes bya la sogs pas lha'i rigs drug dang ldan pa'i 'dod pa'i khams la bde ba la sogs pa lha'i btsun mo ji srid dang de bzhin du ram pa ti la mchog la sogs dang lha'i smad 'tshong ma dang lha'i long spyod dang mtshungs
translated: The six types of gods of the desire realm, such as the Four Great Kings, have divine queens such as Pleasure, and likewise, the demigods have supreme goddesses such as Rampa, and the gods have divine prostitutes and divine enjoyments.

original: pa gling bzhi'i bdag po 'khor los sgyur ba rnams kyi bu mo dang / de bzhin du dmigs dang rnam par 'jig pa la sogs pa lha ma yin gyi bu mo dang / 'jog po dang dung skyong dang rigs ldan dang padma dang padma chen po la sogs pa'i klu rnams kyi bu mo stobs kyis mnan nas nye bar spyod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: pa gling bzhi'i bdag po 'khor los sgyur ba rnams kyi bu mo dang / de bzhin du dmigs dang rnam par 'jig pa la sogs pa lha ma yin gyi bu mo dang / 'jog po dang dung skyong dang rigs ldan dang padma dang padma chen po la sogs pa'i klu rnams kyi bu mo stobs kyis mnan nas nye bar spyod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The daughters of the universal monarchs who rule the four continents are equal to these. Likewise, the daughters of the demigods such as Focus and Destruction and the daughters of the nagas such as Takshaka, Shankhapala, Kulika, Padma and Mahapadma are overpowered by his strength and he enjoys them.

original: gzugs kyi khams pa sgom chen 'dod chags dang bral bar gnas pa gal te de la bud med yod na zhes bya ba 'di //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams pa sgom chen 'dod chags dang bral bar gnas pa gal te de la bud med yod na zhes bya ba 'di //
translated: The great meditators of the form realm who abide free of attachment have women if they desire them.

original: srid na zhe phul du gyur ba'i tshig tu bstan to //
analyzed: srid na zhe phul du gyur ba'i tshig tu bstan to //
translated: If it exists, it is taught as the most excellent word.

original: tha mal pa'i lus zhes pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i lus zhes pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: The ordinary body is the nature of the five appropriated aggregates.

original: de ting nge 'dzin khyad par can gang gis mi snang bar byas pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ting nge 'dzin khyad par can gang gis mi snang bar byas pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is the name of the special meditative stabilization by which it is made invisible.🔽Then, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rin po che lta bu'i gang zag byang chub sems dpa' sngar bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par thos pa dang bsam pa dang / bsgom pas 'khrul pa las byung ba'i the tshom dang bral bar 'gyur ba nang na myong ba'i man ngag gi tshig bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa'i sgo nas bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rin po che lta bu'i gang zag byang chub sems dpa' sngar bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par thos pa dang bsam pa dang / bsgom pas 'khrul pa las byung ba'i the tshom dang bral bar 'gyur ba nang na myong ba'i man ngag gi tshig bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa'i sgo nas bstan to //
translated: The person who is like a jewel, the bodhisattva, is freed from doubt arising from error with regard to the special meditative stabilization explained above, through listening, reflection, and meditation.

original: sngags gcig pu zhes pa ni gshin rje mthar byed kyi sngags gcig pu las kyi rab 'byam bsgrub pa ni phur bus gdab pa dang / gnas spong pa dang rengs pa dang mngon spyod la sog pa bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sngags gcig pu zhes pa ni gshin rje mthar byed kyi sngags gcig pu las kyi rab 'byam bsgrub pa ni phur bus gdab pa dang / gnas spong pa dang rengs pa dang mngon spyod la sog pa bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The single mantra is the single mantra of Yamantaka. The accomplishment of the entire range of activities is the accomplishment of the activities of stabbing with the kila, transference of consciousness, immobilization, and assault.

original: de bzhin du bud med dang lhan cig tu rol pas kyang zhe pa ni spros pa dang bcas pa dang spros pa med pa dag gis spyod pa'i gsang ba lnga'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i rim pas phyag rgya bzhi dang lhan cig spyod pa'am rgya gcig dang spyod pas
analyzed: de bzhin du bud med dang lhan cig tu rol pas kyang zhe pa ni spros pa dang bcas pa dang spros pa med pa dag gis spyod pa'i gsang ba lnga'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i rim pas phyag rgya bzhi dang lhan cig spyod pa'am rgya gcig dang spyod pas
translated: Similarly, enjoyment with a woman is the enjoyment of the five secrets of the conduct of those with and without elaboration by means of the stages of the great mandala of the four seals or the single seal.

original: 'dod chas rol pa la so pa'i rgya che bas 'jig rten pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa gang yin pa'o //🔽de bzhin du bdud rtsi lnga dang sgron ma lnga ni dam @93a * //
analyzed: 'dod chas rol pa la so pa'i rgya che bas 'jig rten pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa gang yin pa'o // de bzhin du bdud rtsi lnga dang sgron ma lnga ni dam @93a * //
translated: The extensive enjoyment of the five desires is the accomplishment of the mundane and supramundane feats.

original: tshig dang lcags kyu rnams so //
analyzed: tshig dang lcags kyu rnams so //
translated: Similarly, the five nectars and the five lamps are the pledges and hooks.

original: des byas pa'i ri lu rnams kyis dngos grub kyi phun sum tshogs pa ste mkha' la spyod pa dang mi snang ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: des byas pa'i ri lu rnams kyis dngos grub kyi phun sum tshogs pa ste mkha' la spyod pa dang mi snang ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The pills made from that are the perfection of siddhi, which is characterized by traveling through space and invisibility.

original: chos stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis dag pa ste /
analyzed: chos stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis dag pa ste /
translated: The nature of phenomena is emptiness and so forth, which is pure

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from wrongdoing.

original: de bzhin du gang yang rung ba'i phyag rgya chen po zhes pa ni lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi nang na gang yang rung ba'i dmigs pa la brten nas rdo rje 'chang nyid du 'gyur ba dang de la yang ma chags pa zhes bya ba gang gsung pa
analyzed: de bzhin du gang yang rung ba'i phyag rgya chen po zhes pa ni lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi nang na gang yang rung ba'i dmigs pa la brten nas rdo rje 'chang nyid du 'gyur ba dang de la yang ma chags pa zhes bya ba gang gsung pa
translated: Similarly, it is said that “any mahāmudrā” is Vajradhara, based on the visualization of any of the thirty-two deities, and “nonattachment” to that.

original: de dag thams cad ni ngo mtshar ba ste rmad du gyur pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan to //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni ngo mtshar ba ste rmad du gyur pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan to //
translated: All of that is amazing and marvelous, taught by the Bhagavān.

original: sngar ma thos ma bshad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sngar ma thos ma bshad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that “previously unheard and not explained” is the meaning.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i sgra'i sog nas de kho nas de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i sgra'i sog nas de kho nas de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
translated: “Explained with an intention” is that reality is taught by the words that are contradictory.

original: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang bskur thob nas rgyas btab ba bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang bskur thob nas rgyas btab ba bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, beginning with “now”, having obtained the consecration of the irreversible, one should teach the seal.

original: gdug pa thams cad 'dul bas na zhes pa ni mtshams med pa lnga la sog pa byed pa 'dul bar mdzad pas so //
analyzed: gdug pa thams cad 'dul bas na zhes pa ni mtshams med pa lnga la sog pa byed pa 'dul bar mdzad pas so //
translated: “Because of subduing all the wicked” means because of subduing the perpetrators of the five inexpiable sins and so forth.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sog pa'i rigs lnga'i //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sog pa'i rigs lnga'i //
translated: “Vairochana and so forth” means the five families of the Tathagatas and so forth.

original: 'byin pas ni skyed par byed pa ste rdor je 'chang chen po'i rigs las rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de rnams me stag lta bur 'byung bas so //
analyzed: 'byin pas ni skyed par byed pa ste rdor je 'chang chen po'i rigs las rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de rnams me stag lta bur 'byung bas so //
translated: “Emanating” means producing, because those Vairochana and so forth arise like sparks from the family of Great Vajradhara.

original: 'jig rten pa ni zhi ba la sog pa'o /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ni zhi ba la sog pa'o /
translated: “Mundane” means pacification and so forth.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'jig rten las 'das pa mkha' spyod la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'jig rten las 'das pa mkha' spyod la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word “and so forth” includes supramundane, such as the sky-farers and so forth.

original: skyes par mdzad pa na zhes pa ni de sbrul par mdzad pas so //
analyzed: skyes par mdzad pa na zhes pa ni de sbrul par mdzad pas so //
translated: “Having produced” means having emanated them.

original: gzhan yang ni de bzhin yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang ni de bzhin yang ngo //
translated: “And so forth” means also like that.

original: drug pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas zhes pa ni lnga po bsdu bar mdzad pas so //
analyzed: drug pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas zhes pa ni lnga po bsdu bar mdzad pas so //
translated: The phrase having become the essence of the sixth means that he has gathered the other five.

original: de ltar spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid can gyis bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gi che ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid can gyis bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gi che ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, by his very nature of emanation and reabsorption, the Lord Vajradhara is shown to be great.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa gsum po'i bdag nyid kyi bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal to zhes bstan no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa gsum po'i bdag nyid kyi bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal to zhes bstan no //
translated: The phrase the Buddha, etc., indicates that the Lord, who is the essence of Akshobhya, etc., has spoken.

original: sems dpa'i rdo rje zhes zhes bya ba la sogs pa mi bskyod pa'i rigs can m'a ma k'i dang lag na rdo rje dang nam mkha'i snying po dang sgra rdo rje ma dang shes rab mthar byed rnams la mi bskyod pas @93b rgyas gdab par bya'o zhes bstan
analyzed: sems dpa'i rdo rje zhes zhes bya ba la sogs pa mi bskyod pa'i rigs can m'a ma k'i dang lag na rdo rje dang nam mkha'i snying po dang sgra rdo rje ma dang shes rab mthar byed rnams la mi bskyod pas @93b rgyas gdab par bya'o zhes bstan
translated: The phrase the Bodhisattva Vajra, etc., indicates that Akshobhya should seal Mamaki, Vajrapani, Akashagarbha, Ratna Vajra, and Prajnaparamita.

original: to // rnam par sang mdzad do zhes bya ba nas nye bar bsal bar bya'o zhes pa'i par du ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs can spyan ma dang sa'i snying po dang byams pa dang / gzugs rdo rje ma dang gshin rje mthar byed rnams la rnam par snang mdzad kyis rgyas gdab par bya'o zhes bstan to /
analyzed: to // rnam par sang mdzad do zhes bya ba nas nye bar bsal bar bya'o zhes pa'i par du ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs can spyan ma dang sa'i snying po dang byams pa dang / gzugs rdo rje ma dang gshin rje mthar byed rnams la rnam par snang mdzad kyis rgyas gdab par bya'o zhes bstan to /
translated: From “Vairocana” up to “should be purified” teaches that Locanā, Kṣitigarbha, Maitreya, Rūpavajrā, and Yamāntaka, who belong to the Vairocana family, should be sealed by Vairocana.

original: m'a ma k'i zhes bya ba nas dkon mchog dpal gyi dbang bskur bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni m'a ma k'i la sogs pa la rin chen 'byung ldan gyis rgyas gdab bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: m'a ma k'i zhes bya ba nas dkon mchog dpal gyi dbang bskur bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni m'a ma k'i la sogs pa la rin chen 'byung ldan gyis rgyas gdab bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: From “Māmakī” up to “should be consecrated with Ratnasaṃbhava” teaches that Māmakī and so on should be sealed by Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: m'a ma k'i la sog pa gnyis ka'i rigs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: m'a ma k'i la sog pa gnyis ka'i rigs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the two, Māmakī and so on, belong to the family of both.

original: rigs pa'i rgyal mo ni gos dkar mo ste zhes pa ni ngag gi spros pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa'i rgyal mo ni gos dkar mo ste zhes pa ni ngag gi spros pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The queen of reasoning is Pāṇḍaravāsinī, because she is the basis of all the elaborations of speech.

original: 'brel bas 'brel pa gang yin pa zhe pa ni re zhig 'od dpag tu med pa dang gos dkar mo 'brel to //
analyzed: 'brel bas 'brel pa gang yin pa zhe pa ni re zhig 'od dpag tu med pa dang gos dkar mo 'brel to //
translated: The one who is related to the related one is the one who is related to Amitābha and Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: de'i 'brel bas kyang padma'i rigs can rnams la de skad ces bya'o //🔽de'i phyir padma'i rigs zhes pa ni gos dkar mo dang sbyang ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug dang 'jam dpal dang dri rdo rje dang padma mthar byed rnams la 'od dpag tu med pas rgyas gdab pa bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i 'brel bas kyang padma'i rigs can rnams la de skad ces bya'o // de'i phyir padma'i rigs zhes pa ni gos dkar mo dang sbyang ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug dang 'jam dpal dang dri rdo rje dang padma mthar byed rnams la 'od dpag tu med pas rgyas gdab pa bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: By the relation of that one, those belonging to the Lotus Family are called that one.🔽 Therefore, Lotus Family indicates that Pāṇḍaravāsinī, Vimalacandraprabhā, Mañjuśrī, Gandhavajra, and Padmanarteśvara should be sealed with Amitābha.

original: las kyi rigs rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas don yod grub pa'i rigs can sgrol ma dang sgrib pa rnam par sel ba dang kun du bzang po dang ro rdor je ma dang bdud rtsi 'khyil pa rnams la don yod grub pas rgyas gdab par bstan to
analyzed: las kyi rigs rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas don yod grub pa'i rigs can sgrol ma dang sgrib pa rnam par sel ba dang kun du bzang po dang ro rdor je ma dang bdud rtsi 'khyil pa rnams la don yod grub pas rgyas gdab par bstan to
translated: By the Action Family and so forth, it indicates that Tārā, Nīvaraṇaviṣkambhin, Samantabhadra, Rasavajra, and Amṛtakuṇḍalin, who belong to the Amoghasiddhi Family, should be sealed with Amoghasiddhi.

original: // rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa la zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang don yod grub pa rnams kyi mi bskyod pa ste rigs kyi bdag po rgyas gdab pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: // rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa la zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang don yod grub pa rnams kyi mi bskyod pa ste rigs kyi bdag po rgyas gdab pa zhes bstan to //
translated: Vairochana, etc. means that Vairochana, Ratnasambhava, Amitabha, and Amoghasiddhi are the lords of the families of Akshobhya, and they are the seals.

original: mi bskyod pa la rdo rje 'chang gis rgyas gdab pa dang rdo rje sems dpa' la mi bskyod pas rgyas gdab par bya'o zhes man ngag go //🔽rdo rje ro langs ma la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje ro langs ma dang gzhan gyis mi thub ma dang khro gnyer ma dang sna tshogs rdo rje ma dang rin chen sna tshogs ma dang sna tshogs padma dang las sna tshogs /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la rdo rje 'chang gis rgyas gdab pa dang rdo rje sems dpa' la mi bskyod pas rgyas gdab par bya'o zhes man ngag go // rdo rje ro langs ma la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje ro langs ma dang gzhan gyis mi thub ma dang khro gnyer ma dang sna tshogs rdo rje ma dang rin chen sna tshogs ma dang sna tshogs padma dang las sna tshogs /
translated: The instruction is that Akshobhya should be sealed by Vajradhara, and Vajrasattva should be sealed by Akshobhya.

original: sa 'dzin ma dang nam mkha' sgyur ma ste khro bo'i rgyal po'i btsun mo rnams la gshin rje mthar @94a * //
analyzed: sa 'dzin ma dang nam mkha' sgyur ma ste khro bo'i rgyal po'i btsun mo rnams la gshin rje mthar @94a * //
translated: The Vajavedis, etc. means that Vajravetali, Aparajita, Bhairava, Vishvavajra, Vishvaratna, Vishvapadma, Vishvakarma, Vishvabhuja, Vishvaga, and Vishvavajrini are the queens of the kings of wrath.

original: byad kyis rgyas gdab par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: byad kyis rgyas gdab par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: One should seal with the mudra.

original: gal te de rnams la rang rang gi rigs kyi bdag po dang rjes su mthun pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pas rgyas gdab pa thob par 'gyur na de bzhin du yang gshin rje mthar byed kyis rgyas gdab pa la nus pa yod do zhes bcom ldan
analyzed: gal te de rnams la rang rang gi rigs kyi bdag po dang rjes su mthun pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pas rgyas gdab pa thob par 'gyur na de bzhin du yang gshin rje mthar byed kyis rgyas gdab pa la nus pa yod do zhes bcom ldan
translated: If they attain the seal of Vairochana and so forth, who are in accordance with the lords of their respective families, then in the same way, it is said that the seal of Yamantaka is also possible.

original: 'das kyis gsungs so //🔽de rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyi bor bzhugs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gang yin pa de rnams rang rang gi phyag rgya dang bcas par snyoms par zhugs pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyi rdzas kyis rgyun gyis rten du gyur ba
analyzed: 'das kyis gsungs so // de rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyi bor bzhugs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gang yin pa de rnams rang rang gi phyag rgya dang bcas par snyoms par zhugs pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyi rdzas kyis rgyun gyis rten du gyur ba
translated: The Bhagavān has said this.

original: rgyas gdab par bya ba dbang bskur bar bya ba bsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rgyas gdab par bya ba dbang bskur bar bya ba bsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: By those, and so forth, it is taught that the tathāgatas who reside on the crown, together with their respective mudras, should be imagined as the substance of bodhicitta that arises from union, and that they are the basis for the stream of the seal, which is the consecration.

original: rgyas gdab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyas gdab pa'i sgo nas rang gi phyag rga chen po mnyes par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rgyas gdab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyas gdab pa'i sgo nas rang gi phyag rga chen po mnyes par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase seals and so forth teaches that by the method of sealing, one's own great seal will be pleased.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽By sealing, one becomes a deity,

original: rgyas btab pas na lhar grub dang // rigs la'ang byin gyis rlob pa ste //
analyzed: rgyas btab pas na lhar grub dang // rigs la'ang byin gyis rlob pa ste //
translated: and one also blesses the clan.

original: rigs 'chol ba yi sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: rigs 'chol ba yi sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the method of the mixed clan,

original: dngos grub med cing bsgrub ba'ang med //🔽ces 'byung ngo //🔽slob pa rnams la phan pa ste //
analyzed: dngos grub med cing bsgrub ba'ang med // ces 'byung ngo // slob pa rnams la phan pa ste //
translated: there is no power and no practice.

original: zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rang gi lha rje su dran par bye dpa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rang gi lha rje su dran par bye dpa'o //
translated: The phrase benefiting the trainees means that the yogis of the stage of generation should remember their deity as their lord.

original: phyag rgya chen po ste zhes pa ni rang rang gi phyag rgya chen po'i sku'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po ste zhes pa ni rang rang gi phyag rgya chen po'i sku'o //
translated: The phrase the great seal means the body of the great seal of each one.

original: de skyod par byed pa zhes pa ni rdzogs par byed pa ste des ni lha grub pa'i bdag nyid kyis rgyas gdab pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de skyod par byed pa zhes pa ni rdzogs par byed pa ste des ni lha grub pa'i bdag nyid kyis rgyas gdab pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase causing it to move means to complete it. This teaches that the seal is by the nature of the accomplishment of the deity.

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas dkyil 'khor bri bar bya ba'i phyir snod la gdab pa'i cho ga bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas dkyil 'khor bri bar bya ba'i phyir snod la gdab pa'i cho ga bstan par bya ste /
translated: The verse beginning He teaches the rite of sprinkling the site in order to draw the maṇḍala.

original: bgegs thams cad ces pa ni brgya byin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bgegs thams cad ces pa ni brgya byin la sogs pa'o //
translated: All obstructors are Indra and so on.

original: de rtsam nye bar zhi bar mdzad pas zhes pa ni ldog par mdzad pas na ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de rtsam nye bar zhi bar mdzad pas zhes pa ni ldog par mdzad pas na ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since he pacifies them, that is, makes them desist, he is called the teacher.

original: gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga sbyor bar bye dpas na chos kun gyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga sbyor bar bye dpas na chos kun gyi dbang phyug go //
translated: Since he is the one who joins the five aggregates, such as form, he is the lord of all phenomena.

original: khams gsum gyis phyag bcal bar bya ste nyan thos la sog pa gang yin pa de rnams rjes su ston par mdzad pa gtso bo yin pas na bdag po'o //
analyzed: khams gsum gyis phyag bcal bar bya ste nyan thos la sog pa gang yin pa de rnams rjes su ston par mdzad pa gtso bo yin pas na bdag po'o //
translated: Since he is the principal one who instructs those who are śrāvakas and so on, he is the master.

original: rdo rje gsum zhes pa ni sku rdo 'chang la sogs pa'o //
