analyzed: rdo rje gsum zhes pa ni sku rdo 'chang la sogs pa'o //
translated: The three vajras are the vajra body and so on.

original: de rnams spro ba dang sdu bar mdzad pas rdo rje gsum gyi mi phye pa'i ngo bo'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de rnams spro ba dang sdu bar mdzad pas rdo rje gsum gyi mi phye pa'i ngo bo'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: Since he emanates and gathers them, he is the essence of the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: @94b 'das pa la sogs pa yongs su mkhyen pa'i cho ga zhes pa ni snod la bab pa 'das pa la sogs pa yongs su mkhyen pa'i rgyu yin pas so //
analyzed: @94b 'das pa la sogs pa yongs su mkhyen pa'i cho ga zhes pa ni snod la bab pa 'das pa la sogs pa yongs su mkhyen pa'i rgyu yin pas so //
translated: The “procedure for knowing the past, etc.” is the cause for knowing the past, etc. of the one who is ready for the vessel.

original: bka' stsal pa'o zhes pa ni sdud pa po'i tshig go //
analyzed: bka' stsal pa'o zhes pa ni sdud pa po'i tshig go //
translated: “He said” is the words of the compiler.

original: ri bo dang 'dra bas na ri ste zhes pa ni shin tu mtho ba nam mkhar sleb pa khang pa brtsegs ma chen po ni khang pa bzang po sum brtsegs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ri bo dang 'dra bas na ri ste zhes pa ni shin tu mtho ba nam mkhar sleb pa khang pa brtsegs ma chen po ni khang pa bzang po sum brtsegs la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Mountain” is like a mountain, that is, it is very high, reaching the sky. The “great mansion” is a three-storied house, etc.

original: steng gis phyogs zhe pa ni bya tshang gis nye bar mtshon pa'i khang thos rnams la'o /
analyzed: steng gis phyogs zhe pa ni bya tshang gis nye bar mtshon pa'i khang thos rnams la'o /
translated: “In the upper direction” is in the houses that are illustrated by the bird’s nest.

original: gnas gzhan dang zhes pa ni ma mo'i khang pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: gnas gzhan dang zhes pa ni ma mo'i khang pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: “In other places” is in the houses of the mātṛkās, etc.

original: de rnams kyi khyad par ni skye bo'i 'du 'dzi dang bral pa rnams te zhes pa ni shin tu dben pa la'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi khyad par ni skye bo'i 'du 'dzi dang bral pa rnams te zhes pa ni shin tu dben pa la'o //
translated: “Their distinction” is “free from the hustle and bustle of people,” that is, very secluded.

original: skyed mos tshal la sog pa zhes pa ni rdzing bu'i 'gram dang chu 'gram dang dur khrod dang khrong stong dang / rtags gcig dang shing gcig dang sum mdo dang bzhi mdo la sogs pa dngos grub kyi gnas rnams la'o //
analyzed: skyed mos tshal la sog pa zhes pa ni rdzing bu'i 'gram dang chu 'gram dang dur khrod dang khrong stong dang / rtags gcig dang shing gcig dang sum mdo dang bzhi mdo la sogs pa dngos grub kyi gnas rnams la'o //
translated: The pleasure grove and so on refers to the banks of ponds and rivers, charnel grounds, empty houses, solitary trees, crossroads, and so on, which are places of attainment.

original: gnas gzhan gang yang rung pa zhes pa ni ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas la'o //
analyzed: gnas gzhan gang yang rung pa zhes pa ni ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas la'o //
translated: A place that is suitable is any place that is desired.

original: yid dang rjes su mthun pa zhes pa ni yid du 'ong ba la'o //
analyzed: yid dang rjes su mthun pa zhes pa ni yid du 'ong ba la'o //
translated: It is agreeable in that it is pleasing.

original: sgrub pa pos zhes pa ni rdo rje slob dpon gyis so //🔽phyag rgya chen po rna pa gnyis //
analyzed: sgrub pa pos zhes pa ni rdo rje slob dpon gyis so // phyag rgya chen po rna pa gnyis //
translated: The adept is the vajra master.

original: zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis kyi sngags kyis sku'i mtshan nyid dang ye shes kyi sku'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis kyi sngags kyis sku'i mtshan nyid dang ye shes kyi sku'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The two great seals are the characteristics of the body and the characteristics of the gnosis body, which are the two stages.

original: de la dmigs par bya'o zhes pa ni bskyed par bya ba dang spros bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs par bya'o zhes pa ni bskyed par bya ba dang spros bar bya ba ste /
translated: One should visualize them, that is, generate and emanate them.

original: dbang po dman pa dang rno ba'i dbye bas dmigs par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po dman pa dang rno ba'i dbye bas dmigs par bya'o //
translated: One should visualize them according to the division of dull and sharp faculties.

original: de'i 'og tu rnams pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor bas ngag gi bzlas pa dang / rdo rje bzlas pa gnyis kyi dbye bas bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnams pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor bas ngag gi bzlas pa dang / rdo rje bzlas pa gnyis kyi dbye bas bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, the practitioner of the two-part yoga should do repetition by way of the division into two: verbal repetition and vajra repetition.

original: ci'i phyir bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bya zhe na /
translated: Why should one do it?

original: smras pa rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang rang gi phyag rgya chen po dmigs pa dang / rang rang gi sngags bzlas pas bskul pa thugs rdo rje la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i las ster bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: smras pa rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang rang gi phyag rgya chen po dmigs pa dang / rang rang gi sngags bzlas pas bskul pa thugs rdo rje la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i las ster bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: It is said that by the visualization of one’s own great seal and by the repetition of one’s own mantra, Vajra Mind and so forth will grant various kinds of activity.

original: don de la mi slu ba nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das 'dod dpag tu med pa'i pa'i gsung gi bden pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: don de la mi slu ba nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das 'dod dpag tu med pa'i pa'i gsung gi bden pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: In order to realize the nondeceptiveness of that meaning, the Bhagavān teaches the truth of the immeasurable desire of the speech.

original: da ltar zhes bya ba nas rab tu 'grub par nye bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du rim pa gnyis bsgoms pa'i mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas dang po sbyor ba'i rim @95a * //
analyzed: da ltar zhes bya ba nas rab tu 'grub par nye bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du rim pa gnyis bsgoms pa'i mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas dang po sbyor ba'i rim @95a * //
translated: “ Now” up to “will be very near to being accomplished” is the Akṣobhya yogi/nī who meditates on the two stages,

original: pas snod ni rdo rje chos su byas la rnal 'byor chen po'i rim gyis mgo po la sogs pa la yi ge gsum dgod cing de rnams la rna par snang mdzad dang spyad ma la sogs pa'i tshogs 'jug la de nas 'chad par 'gyur pa'i 'bab pa'i cho
analyzed: pas snod ni rdo rje chos su byas la rnal 'byor chen po'i rim gyis mgo po la sogs pa la yi ge gsum dgod cing de rnams la rna par snang mdzad dang spyad ma la sogs pa'i tshogs 'jug la de nas 'chad par 'gyur pa'i 'bab pa'i cho
translated: Having made the vessel a vajra-dharma, one should arrange the three syllables on the head, etc., by the process of the great yoga, and one should cause the assembly of Vairochana, Locana, etc., to enter them.🔽Then one should perform the rite of descent, which will be explained.

original: ga bya'o // de ltar gyur nas rnal 'byor pa rab tu nye bar 'gyur ba ni 'jig rten pa las grags par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin zhes bstan to /
analyzed: ga bya'o // de ltar gyur nas rnal 'byor pa rab tu nye bar 'gyur ba ni 'jig rten pa las grags par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin zhes bstan to /
translated: Having become thus, the yogi becomes very close, famous in the world, not otherwise.

original: 'gyur ba ni sa la khru gcig gam khru gnyis la sogs pa 'phar ba'o /
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni sa la khru gcig gam khru gnyis la sogs pa 'phar ba'o /
translated: Change means rising one cubit or two cubits, etc., on the ground.

original: g-yo ba ni yan lag dang nying lag thams cad g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba ni yan lag dang nying lag thams cad g-yo ba'o //
translated: Move means all the major and minor limbs move.

original: 'khor ba ni phyogs bcu ru 'khor lo bzhin du yong su 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba ni phyogs bcu ru 'khor lo bzhin du yong su 'khor lo'o //
translated: Circle means to circle around like a wheel in the ten directions.

original: de ltar rnam pa gsum gyi dbang yid ni bsgul ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gsum gyi dbang yid ni bsgul ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the mind is shaken by the three kinds of power.

original: de rnams kyi rang na gang yang rung ba bsgul ba zhes bya ste de'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang na gang yang rung ba bsgul ba zhes bya ste de'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among those, any one is called shaking, because it is a branch of that.

original: de bzhin du snod de nyid la rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa mi 'jug na tha mal pa'i lus po'i nga rgyal med pas dri ma med cing rlung med pa dpa' rlabs med pa'i rgya mtshe dang 'dra ba //
analyzed: de bzhin du snod de nyid la rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa mi 'jug na tha mal pa'i lus po'i nga rgyal med pas dri ma med cing rlung med pa dpa' rlabs med pa'i rgya mtshe dang 'dra ba //
translated: Similarly, if Vajradhara and so forth do not enter that very vessel, then since there is no pride of an ordinary body, it is stainless and free of wind, like an ocean without waves.

original: nye bar zhi ba la 'jug phar gnas pa gang yin pa de ni reng pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba la 'jug phar gnas pa gang yin pa de ni reng pa'o //
translated: That which abides in the state of entering into complete peace is called stiffness.

original: shing ltar ni shing las byas pa'i gzung brnyan dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: shing ltar ni shing las byas pa'i gzung brnyan dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Like a log means like an image made of wood.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' la sog pa snod kyi lus la zhugs nas rengs pa dang rdung dang ba spu ldan pa dang skad 'gyur ba dang 'dra ba dang kha dog log pa dang mchi ma 'dzags pa dang thim par 'gyur ba skyes
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' la sog pa snod kyi lus la zhugs nas rengs pa dang rdung dang ba spu ldan pa dang skad 'gyur ba dang 'dra ba dang kha dog log pa dang mchi ma 'dzags pa dang thim par 'gyur ba skyes
translated: Similarly, when Bhagavān Vajrasattva and so forth enter the vessel body, stiffness, paralysis, horripilation, voice change, and so forth arise, like a change in color, tears flowing, and dissolving.

original: pa gang yin pa de ni lha chen po'o //
analyzed: pa gang yin pa de ni lha chen po'o //
translated: That which is born is the great god.

original: de'i 'og tu rdo rje slob dpon gyis bris pa'i snod kyis 'das pa la sog pa ston pa gang yin pa de ni 'phags pa'i lam mo /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rdo rje slob dpon gyis bris pa'i snod kyis 'das pa la sog pa ston pa gang yin pa de ni 'phags pa'i lam mo /
translated: Then, the vajra master should show the one who is to be initiated the vessel which was drawn by him, and that is the noble path.

original: dbab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags kyi sku grub pa dang yun ring du dka' thub spyod pa'i sgrub pa pos bya ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bstan no //🔽snod kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba nas smad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du lo bcu gnyis lon pa khye'u dang bu mo grong gi chos kyis ma myong ba mtshan nyid thams cad na ldan pa blangs te sngar bshad pa'i rnam pa bzhi'i 'bab pa dang
analyzed: dbab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags kyi sku grub pa dang yun ring du dka' thub spyod pa'i sgrub pa pos bya ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bstan no // snod kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba nas smad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du lo bcu gnyis lon pa khye'u dang bu mo grong gi chos kyis ma myong ba mtshan nyid thams cad na ldan pa blangs te sngar bshad pa'i rnam pa bzhi'i 'bab pa dang
translated: By descent and so forth, it is taught that the rite is to be performed by the adept who has accomplished the mantra body and who has practiced austerities for a long time, and not by anyone else.

original: sar bshad pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pas rdo rjes chos kyi @95b gzugs su bskyed la dbab par bya'o //
analyzed: sar bshad pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pas rdo rjes chos kyi @95b gzugs su bskyed la dbab par bya'o //
translated: Having taken a boy or girl who is twelve years old, who has not experienced the worldly dharma, who is endowed with all the characteristics, as explained above, by the descent of the four kinds, and by the generation stage explained above, one should generate the form of the deity with the vajra and perform the descent.

original: gzhan du na mchog la sogs pa'i dbye bas phye ba'i sems can gyi khams kyi rnal 'byor pa ni bzhad gang du 'gyur zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan du na mchog la sogs pa'i dbye bas phye ba'i sems can gyi khams kyi rnal 'byor pa ni bzhad gang du 'gyur zhes bstan to //
translated: Otherwise, the yogi/nī of the realm of sentient beings, divided by the divisions of supreme and so forth, would be laughable.

original: thugs las byung ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' thugs las byung ba'o //
analyzed: thugs las byung ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' thugs las byung ba'o //
translated: Arisen from the mind means arisen from the mind of Vajrasattva.

original: gsang ba yin pas zhes pa ni dbye ba la sogs pa'i tshul brten pa la mi brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsang ba yin pas zhes pa ni dbye ba la sogs pa'i tshul brten pa la mi brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is secret means it is not based on the mode of division, and so forth.

original: yi ge ni h'um la sogs pa zhes pa ni h'um a'a: h'a dzheem zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yi ge ni h'um la sogs pa zhes pa ni h'um a'a: h'a dzheem zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The syllables are hūṃ and so forth means hūṃ, āḥ, ha, jheṃ.

original: bzhi'o zhes pa ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa gsum gyi rang bzhin dang las thams cad pa yin pas so //
analyzed: bzhi'o zhes pa ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa gsum gyi rang bzhin dang las thams cad pa yin pas so //
translated: Four means it is the nature of the three, such as the vajra body, and it is all activities.

original: dbab pa'i gzhir gyur pas so zhes pa ni dbab pa'i cho ga'i rgyu yin pas so //
analyzed: dbab pa'i gzhir gyur pas so zhes pa ni dbab pa'i cho ga'i rgyu yin pas so //
translated: It is the basis of descent means it is the cause of the rite of descent.

original: rim pa 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pas nam mkha'i khams dang 'dra ba stong ba'i lus dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ngo bo rdo rje 'chang gi sku yag 'bab par 'gyur ro zhes 'bab pa'i cho ga la mthu bstan pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rim pa 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pas nam mkha'i khams dang 'dra ba stong ba'i lus dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ngo bo rdo rje 'chang gi sku yag 'bab par 'gyur ro zhes 'bab pa'i cho ga la mthu bstan pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: By this process and so forth teaches the power of the rite of descent, saying that the body, which is empty like the element of space, and the nature of non-conceptuality, the body of Vajradhara, will descend.

original: dgos pa bstan pa zhes bya ba nas 'bebs par byed pa'o zhes pa'i bar du nyi ge h'um la sogs pa gsum thugs rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yi ge dzheem ni 'gul ba la sog pa bhi po byed pa dang de bzhin du sngags 'di
analyzed: dgos pa bstan pa zhes bya ba nas 'bebs par byed pa'o zhes pa'i bar du nyi ge h'um la sogs pa gsum thugs rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yi ge dzheem ni 'gul ba la sog pa bhi po byed pa dang de bzhin du sngags 'di
translated: From The teaching of the purpose up to the one who causes to descend, the three syllables such as HŪṀ and so forth, which are the nature of Cittavajradhara and so forth, the syllable JHEṀ is the one who causes shaking and so forth, and similarly, by this very mantra

original: nyid kyis yan dag par bskul ba'i snod rnams nam mkha' la 'phur bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du yi ge dzheem gis 'gul ba la sogs byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: nyid kyis yan dag par bskul ba'i snod rnams nam mkha' la 'phur bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du yi ge dzheem gis 'gul ba la sogs byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: the vessels that are thoroughly impelled fly in the sky. In the same way, the syllable JHEṀ causes shaking and so forth, and

original: yi ge h'um la sog pa bzhi pos kyang byed do zhes bstan no//
analyzed: yi ge h'um la sog pa bzhi pos kyang byed do zhes bstan no//
translated: in the same way, the four syllables such as HŪṀ also cause that.

original: 'dir mdo bsdus pa zhes bya ba nas go cha la sogs pas bsrung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni snod la dbab pa'i cho ga'i bsgom pa'i go rims bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir mdo bsdus pa zhes bya ba nas go cha la sogs pas bsrung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni snod la dbab pa'i cho ga'i bsgom pa'i go rims bstan to //
translated: Here, from “the concise sūtra” up to “one should protect oneself with armor and so forth” teaches the sequence of meditation for the rite of descent into the vessel.

original: de yang go sla ste 'grel ba mkhan gyis bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang go sla ste 'grel ba mkhan gyis bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is easy to understand, because it is explained by the commentator.

original: rnag gi bya ba zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor bri ba'o //
analyzed: rnag gi bya ba zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor bri ba'o //
translated: “ One’s own rite” is the drawing of the maṇḍala.

original: gzhan gyi bya ba zhes pa ni de bstan pa'i 'das pa la sogs pa yongs su shes nas sems can gyi don grub pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bya ba zhes pa ni de bstan pa'i 'das pa la sogs pa yongs su shes nas sems can gyi don grub pa'o //
translated: “ The rite of others” is the accomplishment of the benefit of sentient beings, having understood the past and so forth of the one to whom it is taught.

original: nges par byas nas zhes pa ni rnam par bzhag nas so //
analyzed: nges par byas nas zhes pa ni rnam par bzhag nas so //
translated: “ Having ascertained” means having arranged.

original: gdug pa 'dul ba la zhugs pa'i zhes pa ni drag po'i las kyis gdug pa 'dul bar byed pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i'o //
analyzed: gdug pa 'dul ba la zhugs pa'i zhes pa ni drag po'i las kyis gdug pa 'dul bar byed pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i'o //
translated: “ One who has entered the subjugation of the wicked” is the practitioner who subjugates the wicked by means of wrathful activity.

original: sgrub pa bstan pa zhes pa ni nan tan bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa bstan pa zhes pa ni nan tan bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “ The teaching of the practice” is for the sake of teaching the practice.

original: sku gsung thugs ni snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum @96a * //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs ni snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum @96a * //
translated: “ Body, speech, and mind” are the three intuitions of appearance and so forth.

original: mo ; ; de la gnas ni gzhir gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mo ; ; de la gnas ni gzhir gyur pa'o //
translated: “ Their abode” is the basis.

original: 'od gsal ba ni thams cad stong ba'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba ni thams cad stong ba'o //
translated: The luminous is the emptiness of everything.

original: de yongs su dag pas ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: de yongs su dag pas ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: By its purification, one becomes Great Vajradhara.

original: 'di skad bka' stsal pa ni drag po'i las 'chad par 'gyur ba bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skad bka' stsal pa ni drag po'i las 'chad par 'gyur ba bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: The statement thus have I heard is the statement of the teaching of the fierce action.

original: zhing dang tshong zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas bar du'o zhes pa'i bar du rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i zhing dang tshong la sogs pa la 'brel bas kyang lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi ngo bo mi bskyod pa'i sku la dmigs nas bsgom na de'i tshe gdug🔽pa rnams gsad par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhing dang tshong zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas bar du'o zhes pa'i bar du rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i zhing dang tshong la sogs pa la 'brel bas kyang lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi ngo bo mi bskyod pa'i sku la dmigs nas bsgom na de'i tshe gdug pa rnams gsad par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The statement the field, the market, and so on up to in the middle teaches that if one meditates by observing the body of Akshobhya, the nature of the thirty-two deities, in connection with various fields, markets, and so on, then at that time one should kill the wicked.

original: dgra bo'i gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba nas sngags bton to zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mngon spyod kyi rdzas kyis dgra'i gzugs brnyan byas la dur khrod kyi gos la de'i ming bris nas de'i snying gar bcug ste gcer bu skra grol ba khro bo'i sngags brjod pa
analyzed: dgra bo'i gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba nas sngags bton to zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mngon spyod kyi rdzas kyis dgra'i gzugs brnyan byas la dur khrod kyi gos la de'i ming bris nas de'i snying gar bcug ste gcer bu skra grol ba khro bo'i sngags brjod pa
translated: The statement the image of the enemy up to reciting the mantra teaches that one should make an image of the enemy with the substances of killing, write their name on a charnel ground cloth, place it in their heart, and with an angry mind, naked, hair loose, reciting the mantra of the wrathful one,

original: de'i gzugs can lho phyogs su kha bltas pa g-yas brkyang ba rdo rje lcags kyus mtshan pa'i rkang pa g-yon pa sa mnan zhing ji srid dgra bo 'chi ba de srid bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i gzugs can lho phyogs su kha bltas pa g-yas brkyang ba rdo rje lcags kyus mtshan pa'i rkang pa g-yon pa sa mnan zhing ji srid dgra bo 'chi ba de srid bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: One should visualize the form of the enemy facing south, right leg extended, left foot pressing on the ground, marked with a vajra hook, until the enemy dies.

original: bsregs pa'i zhes bya ba nas nges par 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni dur khrod kyi thal ba dang 'bru mar dang bcas pas dgra bo'i gzugs brnyan byas la zhe sdang rdo rje ting nge 'dzin gyis snga ma bzhin du mnan zhing gsad par bya'o🔽zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bsregs pa'i zhes bya ba nas nges par 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni dur khrod kyi thal ba dang 'bru mar dang bcas pas dgra bo'i gzugs brnyan byas la zhe sdang rdo rje ting nge 'dzin gyis snga ma bzhin du mnan zhing gsad par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The passage from burned up to will certainly die teaches that one should make an effigy of the enemy with charnel ground ash and oil, and, as before, should suppress and kill it with the concentration of Angry Vajra.

original: ro bsregs pa'i thal ba zhes bya ba nas las kyi che ba'i bdag nyid bstan par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni dur khrod de'i thal bas gru gsum me'i dkyil 'khor bris la tsher ma can gyi me spar zhing sha la sogs pa las byas pa'i dgra'i gzugs
analyzed: ro bsregs pa'i thal ba zhes bya ba nas las kyi che ba'i bdag nyid bstan par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni dur khrod de'i thal bas gru gsum me'i dkyil 'khor bris la tsher ma can gyi me spar zhing sha la sogs pa las byas pa'i dgra'i gzugs
translated: The passage from charnel ground ash up to the greatness of the rite should be taught teaches that one should draw a triangular fire maṇḍala with the ash of that charnel ground, light a fire with sticks, and make an effigy of the enemy from flesh and so forth.

original: brnyan gri gug gis gcod cing bcad nas bsregs na 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: brnyan gri gug gis gcod cing bcad nas bsregs na 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: If one burns the effigy with a knife, having cut it up, one will die.

original: sha chen zhes bya ba la sogs pas sha chen po las byas pa'i gzugs brnyan bsregs na thams cad kyi phul du byung ba'i drag po'i las yin no zhes bstan to //🔽dgra'i zhes bya ba nas gsungs so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sme sha can la sogs pa'i bshang ba dang gci bas dgra po'i gzugs brnyan byas la snga ma bzhin du gru gsum gyi me thab la bsregs par byas na 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to
analyzed: sha chen zhes bya ba la sogs pas sha chen po las byas pa'i gzugs brnyan bsregs na thams cad kyi phul du byung ba'i drag po'i las yin no zhes bstan to // dgra'i zhes bya ba nas gsungs so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sme sha can la sogs pa'i bshang ba dang gci bas dgra po'i gzugs brnyan byas la snga ma bzhin du gru gsum gyi me thab la bsregs par byas na 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to
translated: By great flesh, etc., it is taught that if one burns the effigy made of great flesh, it is the most excellent fierce rite of all.🔽 By enemy, etc., up to said, it is taught that if one makes an effigy of the enemy with the feces and urine of an outcaste, etc., and burns it in the fire pit of a triangle as before, he will die.🔽 By river, etc., up to said, it is taught that if one takes the water of a river flowing into the western ocean on both banks, and with that makes an effigy of the enemy, and with poison and wood ash makes a knife, and with that cuts up the effigy, and burns it in a fire pit of a triangle, he will die.

original: // chu bo 'bab ba zhes @96b bya ba nas bskyed pa'i rim pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis gsungs pa yin no zhes pa'i bar du ni nub kyi rgya mtsho la rgyu ba'i chu bo 'gram gnyis kyis blangs la des dgra bo'i gzugs brnyan byas te dug dang shing
analyzed: // chu bo 'bab ba zhes @96b bya ba nas bskyed pa'i rim pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis gsungs pa yin no zhes pa'i bar du ni nub kyi rgya mtsho la rgyu ba'i chu bo 'gram gnyis kyis blangs la des dgra bo'i gzugs brnyan byas te dug dang shing
translated: By fire, etc., up to said, it is taught that if one makes an effigy of the enemy with the ashes of a cremation ground, and with a knife of poison and wood ash cuts it up, and burns it in a fire pit of a triangle, he will die.

original: ma da na'i tsher ma dang sbrul la sogs pa'i gra mas bkang bar byas te /
analyzed: ma da na'i tsher ma dang sbrul la sogs pa'i gra mas bkang bar byas te /
translated: Filled with the thorns of madana, snakes, and so on,

original: bsreg pa dang mngon spyod kyi rdzas kyis byas pa'i gzugs brnyan la yang de bzhin du byas nas bsregs pas dgra 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bsreg pa dang mngon spyod kyi rdzas kyis byas pa'i gzugs brnyan la yang de bzhin du byas nas bsregs pas dgra 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: and also having made an effigy with the substances of burning and killing, by burning, the enemy will die.

original: 'dir dkon mchog gsum la gnod pa byed pa rnams dgag par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis drag po'i las kyi yul bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir dkon mchog gsum la gnod pa byed pa rnams dgag par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis drag po'i las kyi yul bstan to //
translated: Here, by this statement, “in order to prevent those who harm the Three Jewels,” the object of the violent action is taught.

original: gzhan du ji lta ji bzhin du mngon spyod kyi las byed na sdig pa chen po bskyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du ji lta ji bzhin du mngon spyod kyi las byed na sdig pa chen po bskyed par 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, if one performs the killing action just as it is, one will generate great evil,

original: snying rje med pas 'grub par mi 'gyur zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: snying rje med pas 'grub par mi 'gyur zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: because it is said that “without compassion, one will not succeed.”

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa //
translated: Those abiding in the stage of completion

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa rnams so //
translated: are those abiding in the stage of vajra repetition and so on.

original: gsod pa'i las zhes pa ni rnam par 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: gsod pa'i las zhes pa ni rnam par 'tshe ba'o //
translated: The action of killing is violence.

original: le'u dgu pa las gsungs pa'i tshul du zhes pa ni de las gsungs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: le'u dgu pa las gsungs pa'i tshul du zhes pa ni de las gsungs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the manner stated in the ninth chapter means that it should be realized by the samādhi stated there.

analyzed: dper na dgongs pa'i chos gcig pu zhes pa nas nges pa'i don zhes bya ba'i bar du bshad pa'i rgyud kyi tshigs su bcad pas bstan to // so la khus zhes bya ba nas bsgrub bya'i rims dang tsha ba bskyed par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni ske tshe la sogs pa'i rdzas kyis byas pa'i gzugs brnyan byas la dur khyod kyi sol chus gsher ba'i gos gon pa'i rnal 'byor pa che ge mo r'aksha

analyzed: du sngags spel zhing srin po rnams kyis gzung ba dang de bzhin du ske tshe dang bshang gcis gzugs brnyan byas la bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyi sngags kyis che ge mo zha ru gre na to zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod la bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i rnal 'byor dang
translated: Likewise, one should make an effigy with mustard seed and excrement, and with the mantra of Amrtakundalin, one should recite the mantra “So-and-so is seized by grahas.”

original: ldan pas snga ma bzhin du mnan zhing dgra bo rnams rim gyis gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //🔽de la zhes bya ba la sogs @97a * //
analyzed: ldan pas snga ma bzhin du mnan zhing dgra bo rnams rim gyis gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to // de la zhes bya ba la sogs @97a * //
translated: Endowed with the yoga of Amrtakundalin, one should suppress as before, and the enemies will be seized by grahas in sequence.

original: pas drag po'i las la bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags bstan to //
analyzed: pas drag po'i las la bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags bstan to //
translated: The verse beginning with “there” teaches the mantra of Amrtakundalin for wrathful action.

original: sngags kyi don yang sngar bshad pa ste go sla'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi don yang sngar bshad pa ste go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the mantra is explained above, and is easy to understand.

original: sbyin sreg ces bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i sbyin sreg dang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis phrin las grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sbyin sreg ces bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i sbyin sreg dang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis phrin las grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The verse beginning with “oblation” teaches that the rite of Amrtakundalin is accomplished by the previously explained oblation and the samadhi that will be explained, by the samadhi of Amrtakundalin.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba nas 'ug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa'i gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas gdug pa'i sems can mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba nas 'ug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa'i gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas gdug pa'i sems can mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa
translated: Having the yoga of any of the Yama killers, with a fierce being, with bared fangs,

original: khro gnyer dang ldan pa dgra sta dang thob lag na thogs pas khams gsum la gnas pa'i sems can thams cad dang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams la bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dgra sta des bcad cing tho bas phye mar btags par bsam par
analyzed: khro gnyer dang ldan pa dgra sta dang thob lag na thogs pas khams gsum la gnas pa'i sems can thams cad dang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams la bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dgra sta des bcad cing tho bas phye mar btags par bsam par
translated: wrathful frowns, and holding an axe and a club in the hands, all sentient beings abiding in the three realms and all tathagatas abiding in the worlds of the ten directions are cut by that axe and pulverized by the hammer.

original: byed pa de'i tshe sdig pa bsags pa'i bsgrub bya gcer bu skra grol zhing lus til mar gyis byugs pa skyabs med pa me'i dkyil 'khor grub gsum la gnas pa 'jigs pas gdung ba bsgom te nam mkha'i khams na rnams pa sna tshogs pa'i mtshon pa'i mtshon cha
analyzed: byed pa de'i tshe sdig pa bsags pa'i bsgrub bya gcer bu skra grol zhing lus til mar gyis byugs pa skyabs med pa me'i dkyil 'khor grub gsum la gnas pa 'jigs pas gdung ba bsgom te nam mkha'i khams na rnams pa sna tshogs pa'i mtshon pa'i mtshon cha
translated: At that time, one should meditate on the victim who has accumulated evil, naked, with loose hair, his body smeared with oil, without refuge, in the middle of a blazing fire, tormented by fear, and imagine that in the realm of space there are various kinds of weapons,

original: 'dzin pa / gzugs 'jigs pa'i srin po dang kang ka dang khva dang bya rgod dang 'ug pa mchu rno ba dang / shin tu rgyags pa'i khyi dang / spyad ki dang dred der la pa'i tshogs kyis 'jigs pa rdo rje ltar mche ba rno ba rnam par bsams la de dag thams cad kyis skrag par bya ba dum bu bu dum bur za ba srog dang bral ba bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'dzin pa / gzugs 'jigs pa'i srin po dang kang ka dang khva dang bya rgod dang 'ug pa mchu rno ba dang / shin tu rgyags pa'i khyi dang / spyad ki dang dred der la pa'i tshogs kyis 'jigs pa rdo rje ltar mche ba rno ba rnam par bsams la de dag thams cad kyis skrag par bya ba dum bu bu dum bur za ba srog dang bral ba bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: held by terrifying demons, and crows, ravens, vultures, and owls with sharp beaks, and very fat dogs, jackals, and bears, and a host of hyenas, and imagine that all of them are terrifying, with fangs sharp as vajras, and that the one who is frightened is devoured piece by piece, and one should meditate on him as being deprived of life.

original: sbrul nag ces bya ba nas sdig pa la sogs pa'i cho ga 'di nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gang yang rung ba'i khams kyi rdzas kyis gdengs ka lnga pa lce gnyis pa 'jigs par byed pa sbrul nag po bris la de'i snying gar bkod
analyzed: sbrul nag ces bya ba nas sdig pa la sogs pa'i cho ga 'di nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gang yang rung ba'i khams kyi rdzas kyis gdengs ka lnga pa lce gnyis pa 'jigs par byed pa sbrul nag po bris la de'i snying gar bkod
translated: From a black snake up to this very rite of the snake, one should draw a black snake with five hoods and two tongues, terrifying, with any substance of the elements, and place the syllable HRIM in its heart.

original: pa'i yi ge hrim gi 'od zer gyis brtan pa dang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i dug bkug la kha'i nang du bkod pa'i yi ge kham gi nang du 'jug cing de'i tshe srog dang ldan pa bzhin du 'gul bar 'gyur ba aa mu kam ba sha ya zhes
analyzed: pa'i yi ge hrim gi 'od zer gyis brtan pa dang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i dug bkug la kha'i nang du bkod pa'i yi ge kham gi nang du 'jug cing de'i tshe srog dang ldan pa bzhin du 'gul bar 'gyur ba aa mu kam ba sha ya zhes
translated: The light rays of that HRIM summon the poison of the animate and inanimate, and so forth, and they enter into the syllable KHAM placed in the snake's mouth. At that time, the snake moves as if it were alive.

original: bya ba des bskul zhing des zos pa'i bsgrub bya 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba des bskul zhing des zos pa'i bsgrub bya 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: With the incantation AMUKAM BHASHA YA, one should incite it, and the victim who is eaten by it will die.

original: de bzhin du sdig pa la sogs pa @97b yang bskul bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdig pa la sogs pa @97b yang bskul bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, one should also incite the snake, and so forth.

original: de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i zhes bya ba nas las gzhan la ltos pas so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni khams gsum gyi nang na gnas pa'i nad ji srid dang dug gi bung dang bcas pa'i sbrul gyi 'bar ba dang 'jigs pa rnams dang khams gnod pa las
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i zhes bya ba nas las gzhan la ltos pas so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni khams gsum gyi nang na gnas pa'i nad ji srid dang dug gi bung dang bcas pa'i sbrul gyi 'bar ba dang 'jigs pa rnams dang khams gnod pa las
translated: Likewise, from the ten directions up to “because it depends on another action,” the diseases that exist in the three realms, the blazing of snakes with the poison of the hood, and the terrors, and the changes in the body and so forth that arise from the harm of the elements,

original: 'byung ba'i lus la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba de srid yid kyis bsdus te kha dog nag po 'byung po'i gzugs kyis bsgrub bya'i lus la sogs par 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i lus la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba de srid yid kyis bsdus te kha dog nag po 'byung po'i gzugs kyis bsgrub bya'i lus la sogs par 'jug par bya'o //
translated: to that extent, one should gather them with the mind and enter them into the body and so forth of the victim in the form of a black bhūta.

original: de'i tshe de 'jug pa'i mthus gdul bar dka' ba 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i tshe de 'jug pa'i mthus gdul bar dka' ba 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: At that time, by the power of their entry, the one to be subdued will die. This is what is taught.

original: bskul ba'i las gzhan la zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i drag po'i las rnams so //
analyzed: bskul ba'i las gzhan la zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i drag po'i las rnams so //
translated: “Another action of urging” refers to the fierce actions explained previously.

original: de la ltos pas mchog ni phul du byung ba yin pa ste gnod pa thams cad bsdu ba'i ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: de la ltos pas mchog ni phul du byung ba yin pa ste gnod pa thams cad bsdu ba'i ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: “Supreme” means excellent, because it is the essence of the gathering of all harms.

original: de lta bu zhes bya ba nas bka' bzhin du zhes pa'i bar du ni gshin rje gshed bsgoms pas bsgrub bya'i brang la tho bas brdeg par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu zhes bya ba nas bka' bzhin du zhes pa'i bar du ni gshin rje gshed bsgoms pas bsgrub bya'i brang la tho bas brdeg par bya'o //
translated: The passage from in that way up to in accordance with the command teaches that one should strike the heart of the victim with a hammer by means of the meditation on Yamantaka.

original: de'i tshe 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: At that time, he will die.

original: bsgrub par bya ba de nyid la zhes bya ba nas 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni thag mdung la sogs pas kyang gsad par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba de nyid la zhes bya ba nas 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni thag mdung la sogs pas kyang gsad par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The passage from that very victim up to he will die teaches that one should kill him with a spear, etc.

original: bsrung bar zhes bya ba nas rdo rje 'chang chen pos gsungs pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni gdug pa'i bsgrub bya de nyid la pha rol gyis byas pa'i bsrung ba'i 'khor lo dang de rnams kyis bzlas par bya ba'i sngags dang de rnams kyis brtan pa'i yi dam
analyzed: bsrung bar zhes bya ba nas rdo rje 'chang chen pos gsungs pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni gdug pa'i bsgrub bya de nyid la pha rol gyis byas pa'i bsrung ba'i 'khor lo dang de rnams kyis bzlas par bya ba'i sngags dang de rnams kyis brtan pa'i yi dam
translated: The passage from protection up to spoken by Great Vajradhara teaches that the protection wheel made by others for that very victim, the mantras to be recited by them, and the tutelary deity

original: gyi lha dang phreng ba'i sngags la sogs pa gzhan dag gang yin pa de rnams khro bo'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas sngar bshad pa'i cho gas phur bus gdab par bstan par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: gyi lha dang phreng ba'i sngags la sogs pa gzhan dag gang yin pa de rnams khro bo'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas sngar bshad pa'i cho gas phur bus gdab par bstan par bya'o zhes so //
translated: Those others, such as the deity of the rosary and the mantra of the rosary, should be taught to be struck with the dagger by one endowed with the yoga of wrath, by the rite explained previously.

original: gsod pa'i yul zhes bya ba nas mi 'gyur ro zhes bya pa'i bar du ni bsam gtan gyi rim pas gsad par bya ba dang / skye ba bzhi'i dbye bas phye ba'i sngar bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis srog med par byas nas de rnams kyi rnam par shes pa dri ma med pa rlung med pa'i phyogs su mar me gsal ba dang 'dra bar bsam te /
analyzed: gsod pa'i yul zhes bya ba nas mi 'gyur ro zhes bya pa'i bar du ni bsam gtan gyi rim pas gsad par bya ba dang / skye ba bzhi'i dbye bas phye ba'i sngar bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis srog med par byas nas de rnams kyi rnam par shes pa dri ma med pa rlung med pa'i phyogs su mar me gsal ba dang 'dra bar bsam te /
translated: As for the object of killing, up to “it is not so,” one should kill by the process of meditative concentration, and having made the previously explained meditative concentration, distinguished by the fourfold classification of birth, lifeless, one should imagine their stainless consciousness like a clear lamp in a place without wind.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las yi ge h'um las 'byung ba'i rdo rje las bskyed pa'i mi bskyod pa'i gzugs bskyed la /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las yi ge h'um las 'byung ba'i rdo rje las bskyed pa'i mi bskyod pa'i gzugs bskyed la /
translated: From its complete transformation, one should generate the form of Akṣobhya generated from the vajra born from the syllable hūṃ.

original: rang gi snying ga las 'jug cing de nas spros te mngon par @98a * //
analyzed: rang gi snying ga las 'jug cing de nas spros te mngon par @98a * //
translated: One should enter from one’s heart, and then emanate, and manifest the form of Akṣobhya.

original: dga' ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du seng ge'i khri la bzhugs shing chos ston pa de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su bskor ba bsam par bya'o zhes gsod pa'i sgo nas rnam par dag nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: dga' ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du seng ge'i khri la bzhugs shing chos ston pa de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su bskor ba bsam par bya'o zhes gsod pa'i sgo nas rnam par dag nyid du bstan to //
translated: One should imagine oneself as the Tathāgata, seated on a lion throne in the buddha-field of Abhirati, teaching the Dharma, surrounded by the Tathāgatas.

original: de nyid ces bya ba nas sdud par byed pa'i tshig go zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rtsibs brgyad pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lo'i nang du yi ge ra 'bar ba'i mgo bo nas rkang ba'i mthil gyi bar dang rkang ba'i mthil nas kyang rang gi snying
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba nas sdud par byed pa'i tshig go zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rtsibs brgyad pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lo'i nang du yi ge ra 'bar ba'i mgo bo nas rkang ba'i mthil gyi bar dang rkang ba'i mthil nas kyang rang gi snying
translated: In the center of the eight-spoked wheel of the Dharma Sphere, one should imagine the syllable raṃ blazing, from the top of the head to the soles of the feet, and from the soles of the feet to the heart.

original: ga'i bar du mi snang bar bya'o zhes ril por 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang de bzhin du dang po khams gsum po ram yig 'bar bas mi snang bar byas nas phyi nas bdag kyang de bzhin du bya'o zhes rjes su 'jig pa'i ting nge 'dzin bya'o //
analyzed: ga'i bar du mi snang bar bya'o zhes ril por 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang de bzhin du dang po khams gsum po ram yig 'bar bas mi snang bar byas nas phyi nas bdag kyang de bzhin du bya'o zhes rjes su 'jig pa'i ting nge 'dzin bya'o //
translated: One should practice the samādhi of total apprehension, and likewise, first one should make the three realms invisible with the blazing syllable raṃ, and then one should do the same to oneself. This is the samādhi of subsequent destruction.

original: ting nge 'dzin de dag gis rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa lus la sogs pa mi snang bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i gsod pa'i las yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de dag gis rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa lus la sogs pa mi snang bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i gsod pa'i las yin te /
translated: That is the rite of killing by the perfect yogī, by those meditative concentrations, which is the invisibility of the body, etc. in one’s own and others’ continuums,

original: tha mal ba'i phung po la sogs pa ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mal ba'i phung po la sogs pa ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the ordinary aggregates, etc. are not observed.

original: zhe sdang rdo rje dang de'i bdag nyid du zhugs pa rdo rje 'chang ni rdo rje khro bo yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang rdo rje dang de'i bdag nyid du zhugs pa rdo rje 'chang ni rdo rje khro bo yin no //
translated: Vajra Wrath is Vajradhara, who has entered into the state of being of Hatred Vajra and his nature.

original: de nas zhes bya ba nas gsungs so zhes bya ba'i bar du thog ma nas ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis 'gro ba gdul bar bya ba'i phyir sngar bshad pa'i zhi ba la sogs pa bstan to zhes bya
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas gsungs so zhes bya ba'i bar du thog ma nas ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis 'gro ba gdul bar bya ba'i phyir sngar bshad pa'i zhi ba la sogs pa bstan to zhes bya
translated: Then, from the beginning, the Tathāgatas have taught the previously explained pacification, etc. for the sake of guiding transmigrators, in regard to things whose nature is not produced, up to: “Thus it is said.”

original: ba ngo mtshar ba ste sangs rgyas kyi rol mo rnam pa sna tshogs pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ba ngo mtshar ba ste sangs rgyas kyi rol mo rnam pa sna tshogs pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: This is amazing, and it is taught that it is the various displays of the Buddhas.

original: 'dir yid bzhin nor bu dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni gdug pa rnams tshar bcad pa'i don du mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ster bar mdzad pas so //
analyzed: 'dir yid bzhin nor bu dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni gdug pa rnams tshar bcad pa'i don du mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ster bar mdzad pas so //
translated: Here, “like a wish-fulfilling gem” means that it grants the desired result in order to destroy the wicked.

original: chos bdag med pa zhes bya ba nas de'i mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni rdo rgyus sam so ba la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi khyad par gyis sa phyogs su gdengs ka gnyis pa'am gdengs ka gcig pa 'jigs pa chen po'i dus kyi du ba
analyzed: chos bdag med pa zhes bya ba nas de'i mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni rdo rgyus sam so ba la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi khyad par gyis sa phyogs su gdengs ka gnyis pa'am gdengs ka gcig pa 'jigs pa chen po'i dus kyi du ba
translated: The passage from “the selflessness of phenomena” up to “skilled in its characteristics” means that one draws a black snake with two fangs or one fang in a place on the ground with a special substance, such as a drill or a saw, like the smoke of the great terrifying time.

original: ltar sngo ba mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa'i sprul nag po bris nas de'i khar yi ge kham bkod cing de yongs su gyur ba las ka la ku ta dang ha la ha la'i dug kha la gnas pa bsgoms te /
analyzed: ltar sngo ba mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa'i sprul nag po bris nas de'i khar yi ge kham bkod cing de yongs su gyur ba las ka la ku ta dang ha la ha la'i dug kha la gnas pa bsgoms te /
translated: One writes the syllable kṣaṃ in its mouth and meditates on the poison of kala-kūṭa and hala-hala residing in its mouth, which arises from the transformation of that.

original: snying ga la bkod pa'i yi ge hri'i 'od zer gyis nor rgyas kyi bu la sogs pa rigs kyi klu brgyad kyi rnam par shes pa bkug cing de la 'jug ste yang rim pa de @98b nyid kyis brtan pa dang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i dug bkug cing
analyzed: snying ga la bkod pa'i yi ge hri'i 'od zer gyis nor rgyas kyi bu la sogs pa rigs kyi klu brgyad kyi rnam par shes pa bkug cing de la 'jug ste yang rim pa de @98b nyid kyis brtan pa dang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i dug bkug cing
translated: Again, in that very order, the poisons of the animate and inanimate worlds are summoned and

original: de la 'jug pas /
analyzed: de la 'jug pas /
translated: enter it.

original: sbrul g-yo bar 'gyur bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: sbrul g-yo bar 'gyur bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that the snake moves.

original: de'i tshe g-yo bar 'gyur ba des che ge mo ba sha ya zhes bskul ba des zos par 'gyur pas dgra rnams 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i tshe g-yo bar 'gyur ba des che ge mo ba sha ya zhes bskul ba des zos par 'gyur pas dgra rnams 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: At that time, by the movement of that [snake], [the snake] is urged with “so-and-so bhasaya,” and by that [the snake] eats [the poison], and the enemies die.

original: de bzhin du bris pa'i sbal pa la sogs pa mngon par byas la snga ma bzhin du bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du bris pa'i sbal pa la sogs pa mngon par byas la snga ma bzhin du bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: In that way, one should perform as before, visualizing the drawn snake, and so on.

original: de la zhes bya ba nas rdo rje 'chang chen po'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dug 'pho ba bstan to //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba nas rdo rje 'chang chen po'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dug 'pho ba bstan to //
translated: There, from “at that time” up to “Mahāvajradhara,” the transference of poison is explained.

original: de'i sbyor ba 'di yin te rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas lta ba'i dug la sogs pa'i spyi bor kha dog dkar po yi ge aom bkod la /
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba 'di yin te rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas lta ba'i dug la sogs pa'i spyi bor kha dog dkar po yi ge aom bkod la /
translated: The procedure for this is as follows: A yogin of Vairocana and so on should visualize the letter Oṃ, white in color, on the head of the one who has been bitten by a poisonous snake and so on.

original: de'i 'od zer gyis dug thur du drangs la rkang pa'i dkyil la phyin pa bsgoms te /
analyzed: de'i 'od zer gyis dug thur du drangs la rkang pa'i dkyil la phyin pa bsgoms te /
translated: By the light rays of that [Oṃ], the poison is drawn downward and reaches the soles of the feet.

original: de nas bsgrub bya'i snying gar yi ge kham gi steng du yi ge hrim gi 'od zer gyis bkug la yi ge kham de nyid la ril po'i tshul du 'jug cing yi ge lam yongs su 'gyur pa'i dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor gyis bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bsgrub bya'i snying gar yi ge kham gi steng du yi ge hrim gi 'od zer gyis bkug la yi ge kham de nyid la ril po'i tshul du 'jug cing yi ge lam yongs su 'gyur pa'i dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor gyis bskor bar bya'o //
translated: Then, at the heart of the one to be benefited, on top of the letter KṢa, one should summon with the light rays of the letter HṚI, and that KṢa itself completely enters [the HṚI], and the great earth maṇḍala, which is the transformation of the letter LAṂ, surrounds it.

original: de'i tshe bsgrub bya la dug 'pho bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i tshe bsgrub bya la dug 'pho bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: At that time, the poison of the one to be benefited will be transferred.

original: de la zhes bya ba nas de skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba'i bar du bsgrub bya'i rkang pa'i dkyil du yi ge h'um zla ba'i kha dog dang 'dra ba bkod la de'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis khong stong gi cha bshad ba'i sgor @99a * //🔽phyin par bsgoms la /🔽de las lte ba'i phyogs su phyin pa dang de las snying ga dang de las mgrin par phyin par dug bsams te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba nas de skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba'i bar du bsgrub bya'i rkang pa'i dkyil du yi ge h'um zla ba'i kha dog dang 'dra ba bkod la de'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis khong stong gi cha bshad ba'i sgor @99a * // phyin par bsgoms la / de las lte ba'i phyogs su phyin pa dang de las snying ga dang de las mgrin par phyin par dug bsams te /
translated: In the middle of the feet of the one to be benefited, one should arrange the syllable hūṃ, which is like the color of the moon, and one should imagine that a mass of light rays from that fills the hollow parts of the body, and that the poison is expelled through the openings of the body.

original: kha dog nag po de kha'i sgo nas skyug pa bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: kha dog nag po de kha'i sgo nas skyug pa bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that it goes from there to the navel region, and from there to the heart, and from there to the throat, and that the poison is expelled through the mouth as a black color.

original: de bzhin du tshangs pa'i sgo nas brtsams te gnas bzhir bsdu ba'i rim pas bshang sgo'i lam nas dug bshal bar gyur bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshangs pa'i sgo nas brtsams te gnas bzhir bsdu ba'i rim pas bshang sgo'i lam nas dug bshal bar gyur bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, beginning with the brahma aperture, one should imagine that the poison is expelled through the path of the anus by the process of gathering into the four places.

original: de'i tshe skyugs pa dang khrus dag gis dug bral bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i tshe skyugs pa dang khrus dag gis dug bral bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: At that time, one should imagine that the poison is removed by vomiting and bathing.

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas phyag na rdo rje bka' bstan pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhes pa'i bar du ni nye ba'i dug rnams sel ba nyid du mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas phyag na rdo rje bka' bstan pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhes pa'i bar du ni nye ba'i dug rnams sel ba nyid du mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The passage from In that case... up to as taught by Vajrapani is the brief teaching on the removal of the proximate poisons.

original: nye ba'i dug ni long tang dang lang ka li dang rtsi gu dang de rnams lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i dug ni long tang dang lang ka li dang rtsi gu dang de rnams lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: The proximate poisons are datura, datura alba, and datura metel, and those that arise together with them.

original: sbyor ba'i dug ces pa ni rdzas sbyar ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dug ces pa ni rdzas sbyar ba las byung ba'o //
translated: The compounded poison is that which arises from the combination of substances.

original: dper na mar dang sbrang rtsi tshad mnyam pa dang zho ma langs pa sbrang rtsi dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dper na mar dang sbrang rtsi tshad mnyam pa dang zho ma langs pa sbrang rtsi dang ldan pa'o //
translated: For example, equal parts of ghee and honey, or unchurned curd with honey.

original: sbal pa'i tshil dang sbrul gyi tshil dang / sbyar ba'i gsha' ma ka'i rtsa bskol ba'i sbyar ba'i dug go //
analyzed: sbal pa'i tshil dang sbrul gyi tshil dang / sbyar ba'i gsha' ma ka'i rtsa bskol ba'i sbyar ba'i dug go //
translated: The compounded poison is the combination of frog fat, snake fat, and the root of the plant called 'good compound' boiled in water.

original: byi la ni sbrul khra bo dang gar da ba ni bong bu'o //
analyzed: byi la ni sbrul khra bo dang gar da ba ni bong bu'o //
translated: The cat is the striped snake, and the donkey is the garuda.

original: sogs pa'i sgras dug gi byi ba dang khyi smyon pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa srog chags rnams so //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras dug gi byi ba dang khyi smyon pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa srog chags rnams so //
translated: The phrase 'and so on' includes other animals such as the poisonous mouse and the mad dog.

original: rims dang dbugs mi bde ba dang smyo byed dang skems byed dang mdze dang rdo rje dang rgan rgon dang mchin pa na ba dang lhog pa la sogs pa dang rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan dang 'dus pa las byung ba lus kyi nad rnams so //
analyzed: rims dang dbugs mi bde ba dang smyo byed dang skems byed dang mdze dang rdo rje dang rgan rgon dang mchin pa na ba dang lhog pa la sogs pa dang rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan dang 'dus pa las byung ba lus kyi nad rnams so //
translated: The diseases of the body are fevers, dyspnea, insanity, consumption, leprosy, gout, old age, liver disease, cholera, and so on, arising from wind, bile, phlegm, and their combination.

original: padma chen po 'dab ma brgyad pa zhes bya ba nas 'od gsal ba yongs su sbyangs pa'i phyir dang zhes pa'i bar du ni nye ba'i dug dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan gyi khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: padma chen po 'dab ma brgyad pa zhes bya ba nas 'od gsal ba yongs su sbyangs pa'i phyir dang zhes pa'i bar du ni nye ba'i dug dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan gyi khyad par bstan to //
translated: The passage from “an eight-petaled great lotus” up to “in order to purify the clear light” teaches a special meditative stabilization for freeing oneself from the poison of the near ones.

analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa'i rnal 'byor pas lag pa g-yas pa la yi ge aa yongs su gyur pa las padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bsgoms la de'i dbus kyi lte ba la kha dog dkar po yi ge aa dgod pa dang 'dab ma rnams la kha dog dkar
translated: A yogin of Amitābha meditates on an eight-petaled lotus arisen from the transformation of the letter A on his right hand. In the center of that lotus he places a white letter A and on the petals he places white letters A.
